(1) Но люди не могут существовать без пр: (1) But people cannot exist without nature, so there were reinforced concrete benches in the park - the wooden ones were instantly broken. (2) Children were running around in the park, there was a puny who amused himself with playing cards, drinking, fighting, "sometimes to death." (3) "They also imaged the girls here ..." (4) Artyomka-soap, with a foamed white head, was the leader of the punks. (5) No matter how much Lyudochka tried to pacify the rags on Artemka's violent head, nothing came of it. (6) His “curls, which from a distance resembled soapy foam, turned out to be sticky horns from the station dining room - they boiled them, threw them in a lump into an empty plate, so they, stuck together, were heavy and lay. (7) And the guy did not come to Lyudochka for the sake of his hair. (8) As soon as her hands became busy with scissors and a comb, Artemka began to grab her in various places. (9) Lyudochka at first dodged Artemka's grasping hands, and when it did not help, she hit him on the head with a typewriter and punched him to the point of bleeding, so I had to pour iodine on the head of the "diligent person." (10) Artemka hooted and began to catch air with a whistle. (11) Since then "he stopped his hooligan harassment", moreover, the punks ordered Lyudochka not to touch.
(1)Образы природы сопровождают людей с с: (1) Images of nature have accompanied people from the most ancient times. (2) The ancient people left us as a legacy of hunting scenes on the walls of caves, on stones in the form of scanty scratches, depicting moose, wild boars, and rounds. (3) Current technology makes it possible to see animals and birds in natural colors and settings. (4) We see episodes of their lives, and a warm feeling appears in the soul. (5) They are somewhere, these animals, they still run, growl, hide or show, like us humans, curiosity ... (6) Wanting to experience this warm feeling, we keep cats, dogs, parrots on city floors, squirrels, fish in the aquarium. (7) Doctors say that stroking a cat or feeding a tit from the palm is healing for the human psyche. (8) A hare I met in the park corrected my mood. (9) And how many cases when a person is connected with life only by a thread of communication with a dog, with ordinary sparrows or crows! (10) A former employee of our editorial office from time to time on the phone reports to me about the life of crows in the yard, that they love to eat, as they unmistakably recognize it among the mass of people. (11) And the old woman in our yard every morning brings crumbs to the sparrows. (12) And I see joy on the face of a woman watching as fussy birds pick up the scattered food. (13) Sometimes it seems to me: the sparrows will not fly to her exit from the entrance, and the old woman will die from the breakage of the last thread connecting her with life. (14) Once we got into a conversation with her, and she confessed that she had never seen in her life how the cranes fly by and cry. (15) I told her how cranes dance in the spring, breaking into pairs, and shout so that their voices merge into one triumphant sound of love. (16) The old woman listened attentively and, saying goodbye, said three words: "How happy you are ..." (17) The Yasnaya Polyana sage said the same thing in his diaries: "Happiness is being with nature, seeing it, talking to it." (According to V.M. Peskov)
\"(1) Российский вратарь клуба НХЛ \"Эдм: "(1) The Russian goalkeeper of the Edmonton Oilers NHL club Nikolai Khabibulin brought his team victory in the match with the current Stanley Cup winner Chicago Black Hawks. \"(1) Председатель Следственного комитет: "(1) Chairman of the Investigative Committee under the Prosecutor's Office of the Russian Federation Alexander Bastrykin ordered to open a criminal case against police officers who did not ensure the safety of participants and visitors of the Tornado rock festival in Miass. (2) This was reported on the agency's website on September 6. (3) Attack on the visitors of the festival was committed on August 29, 2010. (4) About a hundred men armed with rebar and truncheons beat the spectators. (5) 19 people were injured. (6) More than 20 alleged participants in the pogrom were detained, the identities of several dozen people were identified. (7) ) A case of hooliganism was initiated into the attack. (8) The alleged organizer of the pogrom, Robert Nazaryan, was also detained. (9) According to the investigation, on August 28, three guests of the festival had a falling out with the staff of the local barbecue where Nazaryan works. (10) As a result of the conflict, According to investigators, Nazaryan asked a certain acquaintance of the security guard to organize a retaliation. (11) The alleged accomplice is on the alert ke. (12) The case of the attack on the spectators of the rock festival is under the special control of the UPC leadership. (13) Bastrykin instructed the head of the investigative department for the Ural Federal District to speed up the investigation of the incident. "
(1) Песнь вторая начинается с гимна цвет: (1) Canto Two begins with a hymn to the blossoming beauty of Belinda, which in its brilliance surpasses even the radiance of a flaring summer day. (2) The beauty goes for a walk along the Thames, catching the eyes of everyone she meets. (3) In her, everything is perfection itself, but the crown of delight is two dark curls that adorn the marble neck. (4) Belinda's admirer, the Baron, was eager to take away these very luxurious strands - like a love trophy. (5) That morning at dawn, he burned the gloves and garters of his former lovers, and from this sacrificial fire he asked heaven for only one treasure - Belinda's lock. (6) Faithful Ariel, anticipating danger, gathered all the host of good spirits under his control and turned to them with an appeal to protect and take care of the beauty. (7) He reminds sylphs, sylphs, elves and fairies how important and responsible their work is and how many dangers are fraught with every moment. (8) “Whether shame touches innocence, whether porcelain turns out to be cracked, honor suffers, or brocade, suddenly a nymph loses a bracelet or a heart at the ball in the heat of the moment ...” (9) Ariel entrusts every spirit with the care of one item of Belinda's dress - earrings, fan, watch, curls. (10) He himself undertakes to keep an eye on the dog of the beauty named Shock. (11) Fifty sylphs are attached to the skirt - this "silver line" of purity. (12) At the end of the speech, Ariel threatens that the spirit caught in neglect will be imprisoned in a bottle and impaled with pins. (13) The airy invisible retinue loyally closes around Belinda and awaits in fear the vicissitudes of fate.
\"(1) Британская рок-группа Muse выступи: "(1) The British rock band Muse will perform at the Greenfest festival in St. Petersburg with a new program, which will include songs from the band's unreleased disc, the organizers of the event told Lente.ru. (2) The concert will take place on June 21, 2015 on the stage of the Petrovsky stadium. (3) In addition, the band will perform in Moscow at the Park Live festival on July 19. (4) The musicians will sing at the Otkrytie Arena stadium. (5) Muse's seventh studio album has not yet received a title and release date, but the media note that it may be out next summer. (6) The Muse members recorded their last major work, The 2nd Law, in 2012. (7) The rock band Muse was formed in 1994. (8) The band consists of three permanent members - vocalists and guitarists Matthew Bellamy and Chris Wolstenholme, as well as drummer Dominic Howard. (9) The musicians have over 40 international awards, including MTV Europe Music Awards, NME Awards and Grammy Awards ". (10) Muse sold worldwide more than 20 million of their records. (11) Over 20 years of career, the team has released six albums. (12) The songs of the group have been used in films and TV series, for example, in the films Password "Swordfish", "Doctor Who", "Supernatural" and "War of the Worlds Z". Greenfest is an annual festival held in St. Petersburg and other cities of Russia since 2005. (13) The Red Hot Chili Peppers, Metallica, The Prodigy, Linkin Park, Limp Bizkit and The Rasmus have performed at various times on the Greenfest stage. "
(1) Главный редактор «Русской планеты» П: (1) Pavel Pryanikov, editor-in-chief of Russkaya Planet, was dismissed from his post. (2) This is reported on the website of the publication. (3) It is noted that the personnel decision was made by the project owners. (4) At the same time, the reason for the dismissal is not specified. (5) It is assumed that most of the editorial staff will leave Russian Planet after Pryanikov. (6) It is known that the place of Pryanikov will be taken by the website publisher Alexander Isaev, who "supervised" Planet from the side of investors. (7) For the first time it became known about the possible dismissal of Pryanikov on November 28. (8) In March 2014, five journalists resigned from Russian Planet. (9) Correspondents Pavel Nikulin, Maria Klimova, Yegor Skovoroda, Yuliana Lieser, as well as editor Dmitry Tkachev submitted applications for dismissal. (10) Journalists disagreed with the editorial policy. (11) Pavel Nikulin indicated that he left "because of censorship." (12) Russian Planet was launched in the spring of 2013. (13) From the first day the publication was headed by Pavel Pryanikov. (14) Previously, he worked as first deputy editor-in-chief of BFM.ru, editor-in-chief of Svobodnaya Pressa, and also headed the RIA Novosti website. The publication is sponsored by the construction company Morton. (15) According to Vedomosti, the company invested $ 5 million in this project.
(1) Спасаясь от поляков, казак прячется: (1) Fleeing from the Poles, the Cossack hides in a hut, which he stumbles upon in the thicket of the forest. (2) This is the hut of the famous sorcerer Kudimych. (3) And now the old woman Grigorievna from the village came to him with gifts from the nurse of the young hawthorn. (4) Kirsha, buried in the closet, overhears the conversation of the old woman with the sorcerer and learns that the boyar's daughter, as she visited Moscow, where she was married to the Polish master, began to languish. (5) Only the fair-haired young man, whom the servant called Yuri Dmitrievich, jinxed her. (6) This fellow did not take his eyes off her every day, as she listened to mass at the Savior on Bor. (7) And the old woman asks the sorcerer to teach her his "leisure". (8) Kudimych teaches Grigorievna how to bewitch the boyar canvases that disappeared the day before yesterday, and persuades the old woman to publicly point out Fedka Khomyak, in whose barn Kudimych hid them. (9) After the hut was empty, Kirsha went out and went along the path to the Shalonsky's fatherland, where, according to Alexei, he hoped to see Yuri. (10) Behind the outskirts of the village, hearing a noise, he hides in a barn, in which he discovers canvases. (11) Remembering the overheard conversation, he decides to teach the "fake" sorcerer a lesson and hides the canvases near the chapel.
(1)Нежность – самый кроткий, робкий, бож: (1) Tenderness is the most meek, timid, divine face of love. (2) Love-passion - always looking at yourself. (3) She wants to conquer, to seduce, she wants to be liked, she loves herself, puts on her hips, measures, all the time she is afraid to miss the lost. (4) Love-tenderness gives everything, and there is no limit to it. (5) And she will never look back at herself, because "she is not looking for her own." (6) She alone does not seek. (7) But one should not think that the feeling of tenderness belittles a person. (8) On the contrary. (9) Tenderness comes from above, it takes care of the beloved, protects, takes care of him. (10) But only a helpless creature in need of guardianship can be patronized and protected, therefore words of tenderness are diminutive words, going from strong to weak. (11) Tenderness is rare and less common. (12) Modern life is difficult and complex. (13) Modern man and in love seeks first of all to assert his personality. (14) Love is a single combat. - (15) Yeah, love? (16) Well, okay. (17) Roll up their sleeves, straighten their shoulders - well, who will win? (18) Is it tender here? (19) And whom to protect, whom to pity - all good fellows and heroes. (20) But who knows tenderness is marked ... (According to N.A.Teffi)
\"(1) Активиста азербайджанской оппозици: "(1) Jabbar Savalan, an activist of the Azerbaijani opposition Popular Front Party (PNF), was sentenced to 2.5 years in prison, Contact.az reports. (2) The Sumgait City Court found him guilty of illegal possession of drugs under Article 234.1 of the Azerbaijani Criminal Code (3) In his last speech, the oppositionist stated that he chose freedom, not bread. (4) “Now many in Azerbaijan are faced with a choice: freedom or bread. (5) Those who choose bread very soon lose their freedom. (6) I chose freedom despite being thrown into prison. (7) It will not break my will, "Savalan said. (8) After the verdict was announced, Savalan's supporters began shouting" Shame on the court "and" Freedom for Savalan. "(9) Police detained oppositionists, including the leader of the Popular Front Party Abulfaz Gurbanli, and They also took away the camera from the correspondent of Radio Liberty. (10) Savalan was arrested on February 5 in Sumgait, 0.17 grams of opium were seized from him. (11) The prosecutor asked to sentence Savalan to 3 years. (12) According to lawyer Savalan Anar Gasimov, the court's decision was “another example of arbitrariness and the absence of an independent court in Azerbaijan.” (13) According to him, the verdict actually repeated the text of the indictment. (14) The detained leader of the youth branch of the Popular Front Gurbanli stated that Savalan was detained for active participation in the opposition march on January 20 on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of the entry of Soviet army units into Baku in order to suppress the national democratic movement. "
\"(1) Лидер сборной России по хоккею Але: "(1) The leader of the Russian national ice hockey team, Alexander Radulov, will not be able to take part in the 2010 World Championship due to an injury. (1) Прошло два года. (2) Умер отец Христ: (1) Two years have passed. (2) Christian's father died, and Lizaveta's parents went to the grave. (3) The young widow remarried, unable to cope with the huge household alone and unsuccessfully resist the inevitable ruin. (4) Despite her hard work, only a few sheep and one cow were left from the former property. (5) On one of the days full of misfortune, Lizaveta was sitting with work in the meadow and suddenly saw a strange appearance approaching from afar; it was a man in a completely torn dress. (6) He was carrying something heavy over his shoulders in a tightly tied sack. (7) Coming closer, the eccentric ragamuffin greeted the discouraged woman and introduced himself to her as a long-lost Christian who had found untold riches. (8) In confirmation of his words, he untied and shook out a sack filled with ordinary stones, grabbed two flints, struck each other, striking sparks and fervently affirming the fire hidden in their hearts. (9) Lizaveta did not know what to do, out of fear and pity. (10) The madman turned away, went to the forest, where a terrible forest woman was waiting for him, and disappeared from sight. (11) Since then, the unfortunate man did not appear again.
\"(1) Razer запустит в производство игро: "(1) Razer will launch a gaming tablet, codenamed Project Fiona," AnandTech writes, citing Razer's head Min-Liang Tan. (2) The tablet features two handles on the sides keys to control games. (3) The tablet was announced in January 2012 at CES. (4) Then Razer promised that the device will go on sale in the second half of 2012. (5) Almost nothing was known about the fate of Fiona until October 3 - on this day, Ming-Liang Tang posted a picture of a tablet on his Facebook page and wrote that if the picture gets 10 thousand "likes" in seven days, Razer will release the device. (6) As of the time of publication of the note, the tablet was "liked" "more than 11,000 people, and Min-Liang Tang confirmed on Twitter that Razer will begin producing the tablet. (7) When the Fiona goes on sale and how much it will cost, he did not specify. (8) The prototype tablet shown at CES used Intel Cor processor e i7 and was running Windows. (9) The unit had a 10.1-inch screen with a resolution of 1280 by 800 pixels. (10) Each of the grips had a "stick" and four game buttons. (11) Project Fiona isn't the only tablet made for gamers. (12) Devices of this kind are available, for example, from Archos and Wikipad. (13) They both work on Android. (14) Archos has game buttons located on the front panel on the sides of the screen, while Wikipad has a removable gamepad. "
(1) Вилли в ресторане ждет потенциальных: (1) Willie is waiting for potential wives at the restaurant, and Marianne comes to the meeting in advance. (2) Young people pay attention to each other, but do not reveal the true reasons why they came here. (3) Marianne portrays her millionaire as an eccentric old man, and, of course, does not even suggest that the handsome man at the bar he is. (4) The girl thinks that Willie is a poor guy, like herself, so she reluctantly responds to courtship. (5) All her thoughts now are that with the help of a reward from a millionaire, you can hire an excellent lawyer for her father. (6) However, Willie manages to persuade Marianne to meet the next day. (7) Willie is overwhelmed with delight. (8) To win Marianna's love, he is ready for almost anything. (9) Moreover, I agree to give up the inheritance, if necessary. (10) Marianne herself is at a loss. (11) She likes Willie, but what about her debt to her father? (12) If she doesn't help him get out of prison, nobody will help, and in the end, Marianne tells the new fan that she is engaged to another. (13) And life, meanwhile, continues. (14) Natalia (Marianna's stepmother) and Rosa thought of blackmailing Valentino, Ricardo's real father.
(1) Келли и СиСи в загородном клубе набл: (1) Kelly and CC at the country club watching Peter play polo. (2) CC tells her daughter that he is planning a party for Peter and he would like her to be the hostess of the party. (3) “This is great,” Kelly says with a smile and gladly accepts the offer. (4) Joe arrives shortly after CC leaves. (5) Kelly is not happy to see him again and explains that she wants nothing to do with him. (6) Joe says he has to give her something and hands over the letters. (7) “Here you will find the letters that I wrote to you while I was in prison. (8) You must read them. (9) I wrote about the wonderful days we spent together. (10) That was all I could think of, ”he says. (11) Kelly says that she has little interest in reading letters that have lost their value due to the limitation period, and is reluctant to admit that the letters could be useful if the toilet paper suddenly runs out ... (12) Meanwhile, Peter notices his bride in company of Joe Perkins, and quickly goes to her to intervene in the conversation. (13) But he is attacked by a horse, an accident occurs. (14) Kelly, who sees this from afar, screams in horror. (15) Peter is very bad and is put on a stretcher while waiting for an ambulance. (16) Kelly becomes distraught and tells Joe that it is his fault. (17) Later, when Joe drives home in his car, he discovers that someone is hiding in the back seat and is pointing a gun at him.
\"(1) Президент Сбербанка Герман Греф пр: "(1) Sberbank President German Gref offered to become his advisor to the former general director of the Italian bank UniCredit Alessandro Profumo, the newspaper Vedomosti reports. (2) However, the final decision on this issue has not yet been made. (3) The interlocutors of the publication explained Gref's interest in that Profumo has extensive experience in acquiring banks. (4) Sberbank is now planning foreign expansion: in particular, it is negotiating the purchase of the Kazakh BTA Bank. (5) Profumo began his career in 1987 at McKinsey & Co, where he was responsible for projects for financial (6) Later he was Deputy Governor of Credito Italiano Bank, and in 1997, after its merger with UniCredit, became the head of the banking group. (7) In 13 years, UniCredit's assets have grown from 161 billion to 1.34 trillion dollars. (8) Only in 2004-2007, UniCredit spent $ 60 billion on acquisitions in Europe. (9) Now UniCredit has branches in 22 countries, including Russia. (10) During the crisis, UniCredit did without government assistance tva, but attracted outside investors. (11) As a result, the dissatisfaction of the board of directors with Libya becoming the largest shareholder of UniCredit led to the resignation of Profumo. (12) Earlier Gref's advisor was already a well-known financier: member of the Board of Directors of Goldman Sachs, former managing director of McKinsey Rajat Gupta. (13) In 2008, he became an independent director of a state bank. (14) In 2010, American prosecutors suspected him of disclosing insider information, after which he left the council, becoming an adviser to Gref. (15) The bank has now stopped working with Gupta. "
(1) В любви король Людовик начал со свое: (1) In love, King Louis began with his coachman, then felt a "penchant for the huntsman," but he burned with a special passion for de Luigne. (2) The cardinal was afraid that the king would not be called Louis the Zaika, and he "was delighted when the opportunity turned up to call him Louis the Just." (3) Louis sometimes reasoned quite cleverly and even "prevailed" over the cardinal. (4) But most likely, he just gave him this little pleasure. (5) For some time, the king was in love with the queen's maid of honor Madame d'Autfor, which, however, did not prevent him from using the chimney tongs to get a note from this lady's bodice, as he was afraid to touch her breast with his hand. (6) The king's love affairs were generally "strange", for of all the feelings he was most inherent in jealousy. (7) He was terribly jealous of Madame d'Author of d'Aiguillon-Vassa, although she assured him that he was her relative. (8) And only when the connoisseur of genealogy d'Ozier, knowing what was the matter, confirmed the words of the court beauty, the king believed her. (9) Ludovic often talked with Madame d'Autfort "about horses, dogs, birds and other similar objects." (10) And I must say that the king was very fond of hunting. (11) In addition to hunting, he “knew how to make leather trousers, snares, nets, arquebusses, mint coins,” grew early green peas, made window frames, shaved well, and was also a good pastry chef and gardener.
(1) Правоохранительные органы установили: (1) Law enforcement agencies have identified the two victims of the collapse of the entrance to the five-story building in Mezhdurechensk. (2) On Wednesday, June 1, RIA Novosti reports with reference to a source in the Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia in the Kemerovo Region. (3) “This is a man and a woman. (4) The man is a resident of the house, the woman is not registered there. (5) Three more people were hospitalized with various injuries, ”the source said. (6) According to Life, it was previously established that the victims were Zinnur Alkhatshin, born in 1957, and Lydia Shcherbakova, born in 1932. (7) At the same time, it is specified that the identification procedure by relatives has not yet been carried out. (8) Search and rescue operations at the site of the entrance collapse have been completed. (9) “They lasted 12 hours - this is very efficient with such a volume of work,” said Irina Butenko, head of the press service of the Siberian Regional Center of the EMERCOM of Russia. (10) In total, 504 people and 84 units of equipment are taking part in the analysis of the rubble, according to the website of the center. (11) On Tuesday, rescuers found two dead under the rubble. (12) The bodies of an elderly woman and a man were recovered. (13) An entrance to a five-story building in Mezhdurechensk collapsed on May 31. (14) According to updated information, 16 apartments, in which 26 people lived, were damaged. (15) The alleged reason for the incident could be construction and repair work that was carried out in the store on the first floor of the building. (16) On the fact of the incident, a criminal case was initiated under Part 1 of Article 216 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (“Violation of safety rules during construction work”).
\"(1) На проходящем в Мюнхене процессе н: "(1) In the Munich trial of two teenagers who beat to death a train passenger, 50-year-old Dominik Brunner, some eyewitness testimony was presented, according to which Brunner was the first to start a fight, according to Spiegel. (2) Two teenagers Markus S. ( Markus Sch.) And Sebastian L. extorted money from a group of schoolchildren returning home by train on September 12, 2009. (3) Brunner stood up for the children and offered to go with him to the platform. (4) At the bus stop, Brunner called the train driver on the intercom, saying: “You are in trouble here.” (5) After that, he threw his fists at the hooligans and, according to witnesses, punched one of them in the face. (6) According to Spiegel, Dominik Brunner For about a year he took boxing lessons, but Marcus S. and Sebastian L. managed to overcome him, they knocked him to the ground - falling, Brunner hit the platform fence - and continued to kick. (7) Brunner died from his injuries. (8) The incident caused a loud resonance across the country. (9) President of the Federal Republic of Germany Horst Koehler posthumously honored him with one of the highest awards - the Federal Merit Cross I degree - for his civic courage. (10) Marcus S. and Sebastian L. were charged with murder. (11) It is noted that before that they had already been detained more than once for various kinds of offenses. (12) At the time of the crime, both were drunk. "
(1) Едва дитя появилось на свет, Франвал: (1) As soon as a child was born, Franval begins to carry out his nefarious design. (2.) He separates the infant from the mother and gives to the women who are faithful to him. (3) At the age of seven, he hires the daughter of teachers and begins to teach her a wide variety of sciences and trains her body. (4) Eugénie lives according to a routine that Franval has thought out, eats only the dishes he has chosen, communicates only with him. (5) Mothers and grandmothers are rarely allowed to see the girl. (6) Despite the timid protests of the mother, Franwal forbids giving her daughter the basics of religious education. (7) On the contrary, he gradually instills in the girl his own cynical views on religion and morality and in the end completely subjugates her thoughts and will. (8) Fourteen-year-old Eugénie loves only her “friend,” her “brother,” as Franval tells her to call herself, and hates her mother, seeing in her only an obstacle standing between her and her father. (9) And now Franval realizes his nefarious plan - with the full consent of Eugénie, he makes her his mistress. (10) His upbringing system is bearing fruit: Eugénie with "tireless fervor" is devoted to love with his own father. (11) Every night, lovers indulge in criminal passion, but they act so deftly that the beautiful Madame de Franval does not know anything and still tries with all her might to please her husband; Franval treats her worse and worse.
(1) Гавриловна внимательно осмотрела Люд: (1) Gavrilovna carefully examined Lyudochka and her documents, went with her to the city commune, where she registered the girl for a job as a hairdresser's apprentice, and took to her place, setting simple conditions: to help around the house, not to walk for more than eleven years, not to take the guys into the house, do not drink wine, do not smoke tobacco, obey the hostess in everything and honor her like a mother. (2) Instead of paying for the apartment, let them bring a car of firewood from the timber industry. (3) “If you’ll be a student, live, but as a master, go to the hostel, God willing, and you’ll arrange life ... (4) If you grow knobby, I’ll drive you away. (5) I did not have children, I don’t like squeaks ... ”(6) She warned the tenant that she was tossing with her feet and“ howling ”at night during the weather. (7) In general, for Lyudochka Gavrilovna made an exception: for some time now she did not take tenants, and even more so girls. (8) Once, back in Khrushchev's times, two students of a financial technical school lived with her: dyed ones, wearing trousers ... what grew in the garden. (10) In response to Gavrilovna's remark, the girls called her "selfish", and she, not understanding the unknown word, cursed them at their mother and kicked them out. (11) And from that time on, she let only guys into the house, quickly accustomed them to the housework. (12) She even taught two, especially smart ones, to cook and handle the Russian oven. (13) Lyudochka Gavrilovna let her in because she guessed in her the village relatives, not yet spoiled by the city, and she began to be burdened by loneliness in her old age. (14) "If you fall down, there is no one to serve water."
(1) Кристоф встречается с Грацией. (2) К: (1) Christophe meets Grazia. (2) Once, as a very young girl, Grazia took music lessons from Christophe and fell in love with him. (3) The calm, bright love of Grace awakens a reciprocal feeling in Christoph's soul. (4) They become friends, dream of getting married. (5) The son of Grazia is jealous of his mother for the musician and tries with all his might to prevent their happiness. (6) A spoiled, sickly boy feigns seizures and coughing fits and eventually becomes seriously ill and dies. (7) After him, Grazia also dies, believing herself to be responsible for the death of her son. (8) Having lost his beloved, Christophe feels the thread connecting him with this life is torn. (9) And yet it is at this time that he creates his most profound works, including tragic ballads based on Spanish folk songs, among which is "a dark love funeral song, like ominous flashes of flame." (10) Christophe also wants to have time to connect the daughter of a departed beloved with his son Olivier, in which for Christophe a deceased friend seemed to have risen. (11) The young people fell in love with each other, and Christophe tries to arrange their wedding. (12) He has long been unwell, but hides it, not wishing to darken the joyful day for the newlyweds.
\"(1) Бывшего мэра Новочебоксарска Валер: "(1) Former mayor of Novocheboksarsk Valery Andreev was sentenced to six years in a general regime colony, as well as to the payment of compensation to two victims in the amount of 500 thousand and 200 thousand rubles. (2) This was reported on December 1 on the website of the Directorate of the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation for the Republic of Chuvashia (3) Andreev was found guilty of fraud, abuse of authority and taking a bribe. (4) It was established that in 2004 the mayor received 500 thousand rubles from the director of the company, promising to allow the use of the land for the construction of residential buildings. (5) However, the official made his promise. (6) In 2005, Andreev took 200 thousand rubles from the entrepreneur for the provision of land for the construction of a store. (7) In 2007, the mayor received a furniture set from the head of the municipal enterprise for giving permission to mortgage the real estate of the enterprise. (8) Andreev occupied post of mayor of Novocheboksarsk in 2002-2008. (9) Soon after his resignation, several criminal cases were initiated against the former official. ( 10) In addition to the aforementioned episodes, the media mentioned the illegal sale of apartments at lower prices. (11) Investigators believed that as a result, the budget suffered damage in the amount of more than two million rubles. (12) However, as it became known to the newspaper "Komsomolskaya Pravda", the episode with the apartments was considered unproven by the jury. (13) In addition, the jury decided that the former mayor deserves leniency. "
(1) На другой день он пошёл к древнему м: (1) The next day he went to the ancient mausoleum. (2) He regretted that there were no archaeologists, but he also liked this loneliness. (3) And he liked the silence of the desert, because at this time he remembered his parents. (4) But then it disappeared like an interrupted dream: neither forget nor remember. (5) Did he yearn for them? (6) No, why grieve if he did not know them, did not remember. (7) Only sometimes he thought with sadness and strange irritation: "Why was I born in this city, when there are thousands of other cities where people never die from their land?" (8) The boy wanted to go up to the dome, to the interweaving of gray structures frozen in the twilight. (9) And he climbed up deftly, quickly, calmly. (10) He thought: “Maybe go down? Why do I need the summit of Sultan-Sanjar, what I didn’t see there? ”(11)“ It's time to go back, ”he said to himself,“ I’ll crash like a fool. ” (12) Suddenly he heard a slight rustling below, a car approached. (13) A small man came out of it, walking angrily, quickly ... (14) This figure was familiar to the boy almost as if it were the figure of his father. (15) Everything inside the boy ached from the desire to be noticed by the professor, to be noticed not for a second, but for a long time, maybe forever. (16) The boy recoiled from the edge of the dome, he was frightened of this discontent, he suddenly thought that now the professor would not let him go to the archaeologists, that all this was stupidity, that he would no longer see the professor because of his stupid undertaking (17) Then he again heard the professor's voice more clearly: (18) - Just don't break! (19) - Just wait, wait a few more minutes, and everything will be fine, everything will be fine ... (According to V. Amlinsky)
\"(1) Налоговые поступления с прибылей б: "(1) Tax revenues from the profits of British banks will increase this year. (4) In the future, taxes will allow to attract another 2.5 billion pounds from the financial sector. (10) The UK is raising bank taxes in order to cut budget deficits that have regularly set records in recent years. (11) National debt is growing rapidly, which threatens the financial stability of the country in the foreseeable future. (12) The opposition rebuked Osborne and David Cameron's cabinet for half measures. (13) According to Labor, the bonus tax introduced the year before last should be prolonged. (14) Without it, taxes on banks actually decreased. "
\"(1) Харрисону Форду предложили роль в: "(1) Harrison Ford was offered a role in the sequel to Ridley Scott's fantasy film, Blade Runner, according to Twitch Film. (2) The original film was released in 1982. (3) The film was based on Philip Dick's novel Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep? (4) The book and film are set in the future on Earth. (7) Information that a sequel to Blade Runner will be removed appeared in the press in 2011. (9) At the same time it was reported that the new film would not be a remake of the 1982 film. (13) The tape was released in the summer of 2011. (14) In the near future, Ford intends to star in the film adaptation of Orson Scott Card's book Ender's Game. "
(1)Судьбу поколения не случайно сравнива: (1) It is no coincidence that the fate of a generation is compared to a white sheet on which special marks are made with invisible ink, and the paper itself is covered with "watermarks" imperceptible to a cursory glance. (2) Children grow up, run to school, fight and make peace, go to technical circles and dances, fall in love and make plans, not suspecting that Fate brings lines to their common biography every year. (3) The time comes, their hour comes - and suddenly, in a whole generation, unknown forces are discovered that can withstand any trials, endure inhuman loads and defeat any enemy. (4) Life is a path. (5) For one who wants to pass it to please himself, he is dark and unknown, unreliable, like a toy in the hands of a reckless fortune. (6) But for those who see life in serving their Fatherland, this path is filled with a special meaning incomprehensible to others. (7) Russia itself leads it to a common goal. (8) Her living soul will become a faithful adviser in doubts, a reliable companion on long wanderings, a gentle comforter in grief, a hardworking helper in deeds, a courageous companion in struggle and battle. (9) The fate of the great sons of Russia has always been open and clear, because it is vitally connected with the fate of the people, and the biography of each hero always coincides with the biography of his country. (10) By life itself, they are destined to live one fate, to share with the country its joy and sorrow. (11) To win together and, if necessary, without bargaining, give his life for her victory. (12) "I am a patriot, and dirt will not stick to patriots," repeated Nikolai Kuznetsov, the legendary intelligence officer, hero of the Soviet Union, the son of the "dispossessed", who more than drank "from excesses" in party politics. (13) The Russian hero did not recall the grievances inflicted and did not show accounts. (14) He laid down his life to serve his country, defending the country from the Nazis, and his "Exploit of a Scout" will remain with us forever. (15) The Russian land itself gives birth to and temper its defenders, endowing them with special conscience and honor, so that they will face the whole people, carrying through the centuries an example of serving the Motherland. (16) Untrained and untrained boys of the summer of 1941 will perform heroic deeds and perform miracles of heroism not for the sake of a career and awards, not for the sake of bombastic slogans and political doctrines. (17) They will stand to the death for their children's yards, where they played football, for the attics of houses where dovecotes huddled together, for the river bank and summer vacations spent in a pioneer camp, for their school, in which day after day comprehended, "what is good and what is bad", for the girls with whom they kissed in the squares after the prom ... (18) Therefore, they will be stronger than any enemy "dead heads" and become invincible. (19) So the children of the Civil War will become heroes of the Great Patriotic War ... (20) The war will teach them to take responsibility for themselves, not to be afraid of hard work, not to doubt the correctness of the chosen cause - it will make ordinary people a Generation of winners. (According to M.S.Stroganov)
(1) Глава Microsoft Стив Балмер лишился: (1) Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer has lost half of the annual premium due to the company's failures in the smartphone market, Reuters reports, citing a Microsoft report submitted to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). (2) For the last fiscal year ended June 30, 2010, Ballmer received an award of $ 670,000 in total. (3) Ballmer's salary for the year was the same. (4) It is noted that Ballmer's maximum bonus is 200 percent of his salary. (5) The report notes that the failure to pay Ballmer the maximum premium was the unsuccessful launch of Microsoft's Kin smartphones. (6) Recall that Microsoft introduced these smartphones in April 2010. (7) However, at the end of June it became known that Microsoft would curtail the development of Kin. (8) It turned out that less than 10 thousand smartphones were sold in the US in a month and a half since the start of sales, which is a very low figure. (9) Ballmer was also blamed for the fall in the share of the Windows Mobile mobile platform in the smartphone market. (10) Note that Microsoft is the fifth most popular mobile platform in the world, behind Symbian, as well as BlackBerry smartphones, Google Android and iPhone. (11) In the second quarter of 2010, they accounted for 5 percent of sales. (12) At the same time, over the year, their share fell by 9.3 percentage points. (13) However, mobile business aside, the last fiscal year has been a successful one for Microsoft. (14) For example, the company recorded a record revenue figure - having received revenue of $ 62.5 billion.
\"(1) Лидер незарегистрированной партии: "(1) The leader of the unregistered Other Russia party, Eduard Limonov, appealed to the Constitutional Court of the Russian Federation with a complaint about the new law on rallies. (2) This was reported on October 9 by the Interfax agency. (3)" I have a faint hope. (4) The law on rallies is contrary to the Constitution, "Limonov said. (5) In his opinion, among the unconstitutional clauses of the law is a ban on organizing rallies by people who have been brought to administrative responsibility more than two times for violating the rules of election campaigning, police disobedience, hooliganism , blocking traffic or the production of extremist materials. (6) The law on rallies was personally applied against Limonov. (7) He was fined 12 thousand rubles for a share in Triumfalnaya Square on July 31. (8) Federal law "On meetings, rallies, demonstrations , processions and pickets "entered into force on June 9, 2012. (9) The Duma factions of" Fair Russia "and the Communist Party of the Russian Federation almost immediately announced their intention to challenge the law in the Constitutional Court. (10) As a result, only the Social Revolutionaries sent a request to the Constitutional Court. (11) Leader faction Sergei Mironov announced a "division of responsibilities" between the SR and the Communist Party of the Russian Federation. (12) "With the communists, we are already de facto in a long-term alliance. (13) Take, for example, our requests to the Constitutional Court: we are under the law on rallies, they are under the law on the election of governors, "he explained. (14) The court's response to the inquiry has not yet been reported."
(1) Говорят: «нашёл своё счастье», «добы: (1) They say: “I found my happiness”, “I got happiness”, “I achieved happiness” and even “stole someone else's happiness”. (2) Language requires action: it has found, caught, obtained, achieved, snatched away his happiness from fate, every person is the blacksmith of his happiness. (3) A person should strive for happiness. (4) An indomitable, irrepressible, burning desire for happiness ... (5) Happiness is not a thing, and not a way of things, and not a position, and not a monetary state, but a state of mind that arises when a strongly desired is achieved. (6) Happiness is a blessed state, grace. (7) What, however, did the woman on the train tell me about him? (8) Later it was revealed that she is a researcher, an expert in the field of protein chemistry. (9) After pondering my question for a long time, she said: - I cannot give a definition of happiness. (10) Here is a scientist! (11) A scientist is not one who knows everything, but one who knows exactly what he does not know. (12) But maybe so? (13) A person has spiritual aspirations: when they are satisfied, he feels happy. (14) Sounds like the truth? (According to S.L. Soloveichik)
(1) Вадим участвовал в разгроме гитлеров: (1) Vadim took part in the defeat of the Nazis at Korsun and in the August offensive at Yassy. (2) A swift march to Bucharest and then through the Transylvanian Alps to Hungary, the battle for Budapest and bloody battles at Lake Balaton, the capture of Vienna and the liberation of Prague - this is the path that Vadim traveled with his tank across Europe. (3) After the victory over Germany, the tank regiment in which Vadim served was transferred to the Far East. (4) The war with Japan began - the most difficult march through the waterless, sun-burned desert and the Khingan Mountains, battles with samurai gangs in Manchuria and, finally, Port Arthur. (5) On the edge of the mainland, in the city of Russian glory, the Soviet Army completed its victorious path. (6) Two years of war tempered Vadim, taught him to understand people, taught him courage - to be stronger than his fear. (7) They showed him what he, Vadim Belov, is capable of. (8) During the war, he learned a lot of what was necessary not only for the war, but just for life. (9) In the war, he saw his people, recognized their aspirations and character, and realized that it was his own character, his own aspirations. (According to Yu.V. Trifonov)
\"(1) Нападающим сборной Украины по футб: "(1) Moscow clubs have become interested in the striker of the Ukrainian national football team Andrey Voronin. (1) Тем временем в Золотом Городе и сосе: (1) Meanwhile, in the Golden City and neighboring countries, freedom is trampled upon by despotic power, famine and plague are raging there, rivers are poisoned, the people are experiencing innumerable calamities; the legend of Laona and the beautiful horsewoman carrying the hope of liberation is passed from mouth to mouth. (2) Priests and rulers offer prayers to God, each to his own. (3) And here the insidious Iberian Priest appears, planning to forge from Islam his mortal enemy, the Priest, enemies. (4) He persuades the Tyrant and the priests to burn Laon and Laona at a huge fire - this will bring salvation to the kingdom and the autocratic power of the Tyrant. (5) Suddenly, a beautiful stranger appears before the Tyrant. (6) He addresses the despot and his entourage with an ardent speech. (7) The tyrant tries to stab him, but for some inexplicable reason his hand does not obey. (8) The stranger promises to deliver Laon to them that evening, on condition that they send Tsitna unharmed to the land of Liberty, America. (9) The stranger throws off his cloak - this is Laon. (10) Suddenly a powerful horse with a beautiful rider bursts into the throne room. (11) The tyrant and his companions flee in horror before her, but the Iberian Priest shames them, calls on them to seize Tsitna and, in violation of the oath, execute them together with Laon. (12) Tsitna herself ascends to the fire to Laon.
\"(1) Футболист сборной Уругвая Луис Суа: "(1) Uruguayan football player Luis Suarez, who became the protagonist of the quarterfinals of the World Cup with Ghana, called himself the new" hand of God ", reports AFP. (2) In the last minute of extra time, Suarez hand stopped the ball flying into the goal his team was sent off, but in the end the Uruguayans won the penalty shootout. (3) The episode involving Suarez took place with a score of 1: 1. (4) Chief referee Olegario Benckerens from Portugal awarded a penalty to the Uruguayans, but the Ghana forward Asamoah Gyan hit the crossbar. (5) Immediately after that the final whistle sounded. (6) Uruguay won 4-2 on penalties. (7) Commenting on the handball in the last minute of overtime, Suarez said that he did not have there was another choice, as the match was drawing to a close. (8) The Uruguayan declared that the "hand of God" should now be called him. (9) Since 1986 in the football world this phrase has been associated with Argentine Diego Maradona. (10) In match 1 / 4 World Cup finals v. England (2-1) Mar adona scored the first goal of his team with his hand. (11) The ball was scored, and after the game the Argentinian declared that it was "the hand of God". (12) The head coach of the Uruguayan national team, Oscar Tabares, acquitted Suarez, noting that his hand movement was instinctive. (13) Suarez will now miss the 2010 World Cup semi-final against Holland on 6 July in Cape Town. "
(1) In the dark, voices sounded even higher. (2) One of the dead lived on an island within which a fire was enclosed. (3) He loved a girl named Juditta, and she loved him too. (4) Once they went into the mountains and met there a one-eyed old woman - with this eye the old woman saw only the true. (5) The old woman predicted to Juditta that she would die in childbirth. (6) And although the narrator decided not to touch his beloved, so that she lived, she forced him to take control of himself and married him, she was a very earthly woman. (7) When Giuditta gave birth to a child and died and the narrator came out of the hut with a newborn in his arms, he saw his tribe singing a hymn in honor of the symbol of fertility - the phallus, and just at that moment fire burst out of the ground on the mountains, and that's it. stood and waited for him, not trying to be saved, because it was impossible to be saved, and sang a hymn in honor of the fertility of life. (8) At that moment, the narrator understood the meaning of being. (9) Life is important only life in general. (10) She, of course, needs trees, and people, and flowers, but they are not dear to her individually - having manifested itself in them, life easily destroys them.

\"(1) Интернет-энциклопедия \"Википедия\: "(1) The online encyclopedia Wikipedia has collected a record number of donations in its history. (8) A banner with a photograph of Jimmy Wales appeared on every page of Wikipedia. (9) As a result, a large number of parody banners appeared on the Web. (10) Wikipedia was launched in 2001. (11) It is a non-commercial project and all the funds collected during the action will go towards maintaining the technical base of the resource. (12) Wikipedia asks users for financial support every year. (13) So, in 2009, the Wikimedia fund managed to raise $ 8 million. (14) Wikipedia is the fifth most visited site on the Web. \"(1) Премьер-министр РФ Владимир Путин: "(1) The Prime Minister of the Russian Federation Vladimir Putin said that he could not prohibit the showing of the series" School "on Channel One. (2) According to the head of the government, it is necessary to work together to make Russian viewers lose interest in such topics. ( 3) As reported by Interfax, Putin said this at a forum of the United Russia party in Novosibirsk. (4) According to the Prime Minister, the series School is a commercial project. (5) Putin noted that “sharp, tough things attract attention. "(6) At the same time, the head of government admitted that he himself had never seen this television series. (7)" It is necessary that people feel the priorities of the development of the country, society, and not be guided only by ratings, behind which there are corresponding advertising bonuses "- Vladimir Putin emphasized. (8) He noted that this understanding cannot be achieved by directive methods. (9)" This is one of the elements of the general culture of those who make products of this kind, "the prime minister added. (10) "directed by Valeria Guy Germanicus appeared on the evening air of Channel One on January 11, 2010. (11) Various officials and deputies of the State Duma opposed its broadcast. (12) At the same time, Patriarch Kirill of Moscow and All Russia and Minister of Education and Science Andrei Fursenko expressed support for the series. (13) In their opinion, "School" raises sharp questions about the difficult situation in Russian school education. "
(1) «Клянусь Зевсом, выгодно бы я устрои: (1) "I swear by Zeus, it would be profitable for me to get a job if I still had to pay for the dead!" - exclaims the messenger of the gods. (2) And to Charon's reproaches that he is the only one who sailed into the kingdom of the dead for nothing, Menippus calmly objects: no, not for nothing. (3) After all, he drew water from a leaky boat, helped to row, and the only one of all did not cry. (4) But Charon does not calm down. (5) And Menippus suggests, "Then take me back to life!" (6) "So that Eak beat me for this ?!" - Charon is horrified. (7) And to his question, who is this sitting in his boat, Hermes says: he transported a husband infinitely free, who does not reckon with anyone and with nothing! (8) It's Menippus! (9) Protesilaus, the first of the Greeks to die near Troy, begs Pluto to let him go to earth for only one day: even the Lethean waters did not help him forget his beautiful wife. (10) But for the same reason, Eurydice was given to Orpheus, and Alcestis was also released out of mercy to Hercules. (11) And besides, Protesilaus hopes to persuade his wife to leave the world of the living and, together with her husband, descend into the underworld: then Pluto will already have two dead instead of one!
(1) Американского рэпера Басту Раймса об: (1) American rapper Basta Rhimes was accused of deliberately causing harm to human health, the Associated Press reports. (2) He will stand trial for assaulting a gym employee in New York. (3) The musician threw a strawberry protein shaker at him. (4) The conflict took place on August 5 in the evening. (5) Rimes and the employee of the fitness club quarreled and began to argue loudly, after which the rapper threw a half-liter shaker at him and hit him in the back of the head. (6) It is not specified how severely the victim was injured. (7) Eyewitnesses report that the audience member did not allow the musician to bring a cameraman to the training, which led to a dispute. (8) Police who arrived at the scene arrested Rhimes, but released him on bail a few hours later. (9) The rapper's trial is set for November 8th. (10) This is not the first time that Rhimes has been accused of injuring a person. (11) In 2008, he was sentenced to three years probation for assaults on his former driver and admirer. (12) The latter, according to the rapper, spat on his car. (13) Basta Rhimes (Trevor Smith Jr.) is a popular rap performer, producer and actor. (14) He recorded 9 albums in total and was nominated for a Grammy 11 times.
(1) Рэпер Кирилл Толмацкий, известный по: (1) Rapper Kirill Tolmatsky, known under the pseudonym Decl, spoke about how he will spend 50 thousand rubles in compensation, which he will receive from the performer Vasily Vakulenko (Basta). (2) This was announced on Wednesday, December 7, by the National News Service (NSN). (3) “I haven't planned anything yet. (4) I am confident that we will use this to good use. (5) I have several charitable organizations with which I work, ”Decl said. (6) The rapper noted that it was important for him to create a precedent, and the amount of compensation did not matter. (7) “The foreclosure was not the goal, the goal was to acknowledge the fact of insult through the courts,” he explained. (8) Earlier on December 7, the Oktyabrsky District Court of Rostov-on-Don ordered Vakulenko to pay 50 thousand rubles to Tolmatsky for the phrase “Decl is a shaggy schmuck”. (9) The judge decided to refuse the remaining claims of the plaintiff. (10) Tolmatsky's lawyer Roman Lalayan asked to recover a million rubles from Basta for insulting his honor and dignity and to remove the defamatory entry from the performer's Twitter account. (11) On August 27, Decl complained on Twitter about the noise from the Moscow club “Gazgolder” (it is part of the creative association “Gazgolder”, founded by Vakulenko). (12) Basta commented on this by writing on Twitter: "Decl is a shaggy schmuck 2". (13) In January 2015, Vakulenko already called Tolmatsky on the social network. (14) The post "Decl is a shaggy schmuck" was Vasily Vakulenko's reaction to Decl's interview to the Rap.ru website, in which he, in particular, spoke about the Gazgolder.
\"(1) Губернатор Ярославской области Сер: "(1) The Governor of the Yaroslavl Region Sergey Vakhrukov announced a three-day mourning period in the region in connection with the Yak-42 disaster, RIA Novosti reports. (2) Mourning will last from 9 to 11 September. (3) Vakhrukov also added that the families of the victims will be paid compensation: city and regional authorities will allocate 450 thousand rubles each, the airline - 2 million rubles each. (4) The Yak-42, on which the Lokomotiv hockey team flew, crashed near the Yaroslavl Tunoshna airport at about 16:00 7 September. (5) Soon after takeoff, the plane crashed on the banks of the Volga - the tail was on land, and the main part of the fuselage, with passengers and crew, was in the water. (6) There were 45 people on board, including 8 crew members and 37 hockey players and coaches of Lokomotiv. (7) Only two survived - hockey player Alexander Galimov and flight attendant Alexander Sizov. (8) Both are in serious condition. (9) According to the press service of the Ministry of Emergency Situations, as of 9:00 am on September 8 the bodies of all those killed in the plane crash. (1 0) According to the portal of the Yaroslavl region, 150 people were involved in the operation to eliminate the consequences of the disaster. (11) Russian President Dmitry Medvedev is expected to visit the crash site later on September 8. (12) The cause of the plane crash is currently unknown. (13) According to sources of the Interfax agency, two main versions are being considered - a failure of one of the engines and a piloting error. (14) A commission of the Interstate Aviation Committee headed by Leonid Kashirsky will be responsible for the technical investigation of the crash. "
\"(1) В московском ОВД \"Дорогомилово\": "(1) The Moscow Dorogomilovo Department of Internal Affairs has opened a criminal case on hooliganism in connection with the scuffle at the Evropeyskiy shopping center, the record of which was posted on the Internet. (2) Interfax reports this with reference to the press service of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs in Moscow. (3) The head of the StopHam project Dmitry Chugunov confirmed that the case was opened. (4) Earlier he said that the victims were not going to contact the police. (5) The incident at the Evropeyskiy shopping center took place a few days ago. (6) ) Activists of the Nashi movement tried to convince a certain woman to drive the car away from the wrong place. (7) During the action, stickers “I don’t care at all, I park where I want.” (8) The woman entered into a verbal conflict with the activists. (9) Soon an off-road vehicle with young people drove up to the scene of the incident. (10) The result of their appearance was a scuffle. (11) There are no suspects in the case yet. (12) It was reported that the activists were opposed by the wife and son of Deputy Plenipotentiary Envoy Che under the President of the Russian Federation Tamerlan Mingaev. (13) The government of the republic called the incident a provocation. (15) For his part, the plenipotentiary of Chechnya under the President of the Russian Federation, Bekkhan Taymaskhanov, said that he considered the incident settled. "
(1) Пресненский районный суд Москвы санк: (1) The Presnensky District Court of Moscow authorized the arrest of businessman Pavel Sopot, accused of inciting the attack on Novaya Gazeta journalist Igor Domnikov. (2) This is reported by RAPSI. (3) Novaya Gazeta clarifies that Sopot will be in custody for two months, until July 7. (4) The businessman denies his guilt in incitement. (5) He asked the court to choose a preventive measure not related to imprisonment, including bail for any amount. (6) Sopot stressed that earlier he regularly went to interrogations and gave testimony, and now he does not understand why the investigation suspects him that he may escape. (7) Pavel Sopot was detained by officers of the MUR on May 8. (8) According to the investigation, in 2000, the businessman asked the head of the murderer's gang, Eduard Tagiryanov, to beat Domnikov so that he would definitely go to the hospital. (9) On May 12 of the same year, a member of the gang Albert Khuzin struck the journalist 10 blows on the head with a hammer. (10) Domnikov was hospitalized and died two months later without regaining consciousness. (11) Khuzin was sentenced to 25 years in prison on a combination of charges, and Tagiryanov was sentenced to life imprisonment. (12) Other gang members also received lengthy sentences. (13) In 2009, the investigation into the death of Domnikov was resumed. (14) The editorial board of Novaya Gazeta has repeatedly suggested that Sopot and the former vice-governor of the Lipetsk region Dmitry Sorovsky were the customers of the journalist's murder. (15) After the arrest of the businessman, the editorial office of the publication stated that he was just an intermediary between Sorovsky and Tagiryanov.
(1) Жил в горах провинции Канвон старый: (1) An old tiger lived in the mountains of Gangwon Province. (2) Once he met a hare and said: - I'm hungry and now I will eat you! (3) And the hare - he was very cunning - answers: - Dear uncle! (4) Will you come with me? (5) I brought all kinds of delicious food! (6) The tiger went after the hare. (7) They went down into the valley. (8) The hare pulled out eleven round pebbles, smiled and said: - Have you ever eaten such yummy? (9) The tiger looked, curious to him and asks: - And how to eat them? (10) The hare answers: - Why is it easier! (11) Throw them into the fire, and when they turn red, take them out and eat. (12) They are tastier when fried! (13) The hare lit a fire, threw pebbles at it. (14) The tiger looks at how stones are fried, swallows saliva. (15) And the hare says to him: - Dear uncle! (16) I'll run away, I'll bring you mine! (17) To make it tastier. (18) Just look, don't eat alone, wait for me! (19) There are only ten pieces, this is for two!
(1) Чуть позже Генрих покидает Турингию,: (1) A little later, Henry leaves Turingia, his father's home, and goes with his mother to Augsburg, her homeland. (2) They travel with merchants who are also on their way to southern Germany. (3) Henry, destined to become a great poet, listens with trepidation to the stories of his fellow travelers about poets and their power over the souls of all living beings. (4) Merchants introduce him to two legends. (5) One of them speaks of how once, in distant times, one famous poet and singer was threatened with death at the hands of the owners of the ship, greedy for his treasures, on which he sailed on the sea. (6) However, his songs shocked the sea animals so much that they saved his life and returned the treasures taken from him. (7) In another legend, we are talking about the court of the enlightened, patronizing poetry of the king and his daughter, who once left her parental home and hid from her father for a whole year, living in the forest with her beloved. (8) A year later, her beloved, with his songs and playing the lute, so took possession of the heart of her father that he granted them both forgiveness and accepted them and his newborn grandson into his arms. (9) A few days later, the travelers stop at the castle of an old warrior and witness preparations for a new crusade. (10) In his possession, Henry meets a young prisoner Zuleima brought from the East. (11) She languishes far from her homeland and mourns her bleak fate.
(1) Царь Иван Васильевич в преотличнейше: (1) Tsar Ivan Vasilyevich is in the most excellent mood. (2) Well, what is not a reason to turn an everyday meal into a small holiday for your own people? (3) Opening pirovanitsa "for his own pleasure and joy," Grozny orders the stewards to strain overseas, sweet wine from the tsar's reserves for the oprichnina. (4) He himself vigilantly watches how his faithful servants drink, because wine drinking is also a test of loyalty. (5) However, even the daring fighters are not bastards: they drink as expected, drink - they praise the king, sweet wine flows on their lips. (6) Ivan is pleased, but suddenly notices that one of them, from the guardsmen, does not touch the golden ladle with golden wine. (7) Recognizing his pet Kiribeevich as a violator of the palace etiquette, he threateningly scolds him: (8) "It is indecent for you, Kiribeevich, / To abhor the royal joy; / And from the family you are Skuratovs, / And by your family you were fed by Malyutina !." (9) Kiribeevich, crafty and dexterous, like a demon, plays before the tsar, personally for him, a sentimental scene. (10) Because, they say, I don’t drink - I don’t urinate my mustache in a gilded ladle - because I fell in love with a beauty to the point of passion, and she turns away from me, unworthy, as from an infidel, and closes herself with a striped veil. (11) Having learned that the sweetheart of his promoted candidate is just a merchant's daughter, Ivan Vasilyevich laughs: they say, take my yacht ring, buy a pearl necklace and send precious gifts to your Alena Dmitrievna. (12) If you do it, call me to the wedding, well, first bow down to the matchmaker ...
(1) Джим не может не видеть страшной зак: (1) Jim can't help but see the girl's terrible complexion. (2) He tries to help, convinces her that her lameness is not at all conspicuous - no one at school even noticed that she was wearing special shoes. (3) People are not evil at all, he tries to explain to Laura, especially when you get to know them better. (4) Almost all of them do not go well - it is not good to consider themselves worse than everyone else. (5) In his opinion, Laura's main problem is that she got it into her head: only she's bad ... (6) Laura asks about the girl Jim met at school, they said they got engaged ... (7) Upon learning that there was no wedding and Jim had not seen her for a long time, Laura all blossoms. (8) One feels that a timid hope has arisen in her soul. (9) She shows Jim her collection of glass figurines - the ultimate sign of trust. (10) Among the animals, the unicorn stands out - an extinct animal that is unlike anyone else. (11) Jim immediately pays attention to him. (12) Tom, probably, is bored of standing on the same shelf with ordinary animals like glass horses?
\"(1) Новым главным тренером испанского: "(1) The new head coach of the Spanish football club Sevilla will be Jose Miguel Gonzalez, known as Michel. (2) According to the official website of Sevilla. (1) Стояло жаркое лето, столько работы в: (1) It was a hot summer, so much work around! (2) The squirrel worked from morning to evening, tirelessly. (3) She even had no time to have a bite, all she did was drag the cones into her hollow. (4) But there was not so much room left in the hollow, because the whole hollow was littered with supplies from previous years. (5) When the cones completely ceased to fit in the hollow, the squirrel became sad: what to do now? (6) Where to store food? (7) The squirrel went to the woodpecker and began to ask him to expand her hollow. (8) - Well, please, dear woodpecker, hollow out a bigger hollow for me, otherwise I have a small one, nothing fits in it! (9) The woodpecker was kind, therefore he agreed. (10) He climbed into the hollow of the squirrel, looks, but she has a huge hollow! (11) And the food in it is visible and invisible. (12) Enough to feed the entire forest for several years ahead! (13) The woodpecker hollowed out the hollow of the squirrel and said: - Why are you chasing hungry animals away from you? (14) You have enough food for everyone! (15) You would not be greedy, squirrel, look, everything will come back to haunt you! (16) - And you fly out of here, stubborn bird! (17) It's not your business! (18) - the squirrel screamed.
(1) На следующее утро белочка проснулась: (1) The next morning the squirrel woke up from some quiet squeak. (2) Below, under the tree, she saw a little mouse, which fussed and folded some twigs near the tree. (3) The squirrel went down to him and asked what he was doing. (4) - How is it, what am I doing? - the mouse was surprised, - I'm helping you! (5) Your new hollow will need to be insulated, because winter is coming! (6) Here I am carrying twigs! (7) Then the squirrel remembered that last winter this mouse came to her to ask for seeds, and she chased him away. (8) - Why are you helping me, because I did not help you in difficult times? (9) - Yes, that's why I help, because I know how hard it is when trouble came, and there is no one to help, - the mouse answered. (10) Then a woodpecker flew in, smiled at the squirrel and said: - God be with you, we talked here with the forest animals, we are not angry with you anymore. (11) But you, too, remember this lesson, - he said, and hollowed out a small but cozy hollow for the squirrel.
(1) Приобщение к искусству может происхо: (1) The introduction to art can take place in a spacious, purpose-built building, and within four walls, and in the open air. (9) We were seriously engaged in literature, history, languages. (10) Many of us have tried to write ourselves. (11) As if anticipating how short-lived our students would be, we were in a hurry to catch as much as possible. (12) Not only listened to lectures in their courses, but also attended lectures given to senior students. (13) Succeeded in seminars for young prose writers and critics. (14) We tried not to miss theatrical premieres and literary evenings. (15) I don’t know how we managed everything, but we did. (16) I was accepted into their environment by students who were a year older than ours. (17) The company was interesting. (18) I tried to keep up with her, and I succeeded. (According to S. Lvov)
(1) Компания Bamford, которая занимается: (1) Bamford, the luxury watch finisher, has unveiled three Polar Rolex models. (1) В Microsoft сократили количество пре: (1) Microsoft has reduced the number of applicants for the post of the new head of the company to eight people, three of whom are already working in the company. (2) This was reported on November 5 by Reuters, citing anonymous sources. (3) Candidates whose names have leaked to the media include Ford chief Alan Mulally and former Nokia executive Stephen Elope. (4) From top managers of Microsoft, the former head of Skype, Tony Bates, who is responsible for business strategy, and Satya Nadella, who is responsible for Microsoft cloud projects, can apply for the top position in the company. (5) The names of the other candidates are still unknown. (6) Ilop until 2010 was one of the top managers of Microsoft and was involved in the development of the Office product line. (7) It has been named one of the favorites for the Microsoft takeover of Nokia's mobile division, which was announced in early September 2013. (8) Microsoft CEO, who has been with the company since 1980, announced his resignation. (9) A special commission is looking for a new head of the company. (10) Initially, the company considered a list of 40 candidates to succeed the current Microsoft CEO, Steve Ballmer. (11) He announced his retirement at the end of August and will leave Microsoft within 12 months. (12) Ballmer has been with the company since 1980. (13) He took over Microsoft in 2008 after the retirement of its founder, Bill Gates. (14) Gates himself, according to unofficial information, does not intend to return to the leadership position.
(1) Нападающий мадридского «Реала» Кришт: (1) Real Madrid striker Cristiano Ronaldo, who is celebrating his 31st birthday on February 5th, addressed the fans. (2) The video was posted on the player's Twitter page. (3) “I would like to thank you for the messages that you sent me. (4) As you know, today is my birthday. (5) I turned 31, I am very happy. (6) I am currently experiencing the most wonderful period in my career and personal life. (7) So thank you! (8) We are together. (9) Please continue to support me as I continue to work to my maximum potential both on and off the pitch. (10) Thank you all! " - said Ronaldo. (1) Lada 4X4 получит дизайн, соответству: (1) Lada 4X4 will receive a design corresponding to the “new genetics” of AvtoVAZ products. (2) At the same time, the vehicle will retain its practicality and off-road qualities. (3) Steve Mattin, chief designer of the Volga Automobile Plant, told the Lenta.ru correspondent about this. (4) “Within the brand, this car will always have a special, iconic status. (5) And its modernization is one of the most important projects that we are currently working on, ”said Mattin, noting that Lada 4X4 has fans all over the world and is selling well. (6) According to him, the car will receive an X-shaped design, uniting the new model line of the plant. (7) However, the artists will try to keep Lada 4X4 recognizable features of the classic model. (8) “But this will not be a nostalgic project. (9) We are looking for the right combination to integrate it into a family of cars with new genetics, ”emphasized the chief designer of AvtoVAZ. (10) Mattin also noted that in the process of changes the SUV will not turn into an urban crossover: (11) “We know the strengths of this car, what is its uniqueness. (12) She can go anywhere, she is very practical. (13) We do not want to lose these characteristics. " (14) In 2015, AvtoVAZ presented a modification of the Lada 4X4 - Urban. (15) The changes mainly affected the exterior of the car. (16) In addition, the Urban features a new seat and steering wheel design.
(1) Катерина Ивановна вместе с Иваном Фе: (1) Katerina Ivanovna, together with Ivan Fedorovich, are making plans for Dmitry's escape to America. (2) However, the rivalry continues between her and Grushenka, Katerina Ivanovna is not yet sure how she will act at the trial - as the deliverer or destroyer of her ex-fiance. (5) The evidence for and against at first does not add up to a clear picture, but, rather, still in favor of Dmitry. (6) Everyone is amazed at the speech of Ivan Fyodorovich, who, after painful hesitation, informs the court that the hanged Smerdyakov killed him, and in confirmation puts a wad of money received from him. (7) Smerdyakov killed, he says, and I taught. (8) He raves in a fever, accusing everyone, he is taken away by force, but immediately after that, Katerina Ivanovna's hysteria begins. (9) She presents to the court a document of "mathematical" importance - a letter from Dmitry received on the eve of the crime, where he threatens to kill his father and take the money. (1) Мэр Калининграда Александр Ярошук в: (1) Mayor of Kaliningrad Alexander Yaroshuk on the air of the program "Good morning, Yaroshuk!" made a remark to journalists who were guessing at one of the works of the German philosopher Immanuel Kant. (2) This was reported on Thursday, December 8, by kp.ru. (3) “It is necessary to open the Gospel, not Kant! (4) (...) page such and such, verse such and such. (5) We read and discuss, ”said the mayor. (6) According to the publication, one of the presenters tried to object that the audience could take fortune telling on the holy book for blasphemy. (7) “But it's not a bad idea. (8) Can you imagine how much wiser Kaliningraders will become? " - the official reacted, adding that it is necessary to read the Gospel in the morning. (9) Last fall, Yaroshuk, speaking at an operational meeting on housing and communal services problems, predicted a difficult winter for the townspeople and utilities and called on his subordinates to pray. (10) "Winter will be terrible," he said after representatives of the city municipal unitary enterprise "Chistota" spoke about the problems with the equipment, the wear of which has reached 100 percent. (11) Program "Good morning, Yaroshuk!" broadcasts on the radio station "Komsomolskaya Pravda in Kaliningrad" on weekdays from 8 to 9 am. (12) The first release of the program took place on November 10. (13) Divination by books became widespread in the Middle Ages. (14) For this purpose, the "Aeneid" of Virgil was often used, from where the expression "Virgilian lots" later came. (15) The fortuneteller opened a random page and read the first lines that came across, which was considered an accurate prediction of fate.
\"(1) Петербургский совет по сохранению: "(1) The St. Petersburg Council for the Preservation of Cultural Heritage on Thursday, February 3, did not allow draping the Manezh exhibition hall with black cloth, which was planned to be done during the summer exposition of contemporary art. (2) This is reported by the Rosbalt agency. ( 3) The Manege management explained that they are categorically against any manipulation of the facade. (4) The authors of the plan wanted the building to echo the Black Square canvas by Kazimir Malevich, from which, according to them, “all contemporary artists came out”. (5) The building, designed by the architect Quarenghi, was planned to be surrounded by scaffolding, and fabric would be stretched over them. (6) The cost of these works, according to Kommersant, was estimated at a million dollars. (7) Chairman of the Committee on State Control, Use and protection of historical and cultural monuments Vera Dementyeva regarded the project of "packing" the building as an artistic provocation. (8) Having received a refusal, the authors of the idea promised to come up with a more shocking variation nt building decoration. (9) The exhibition, which will be held at the Manege from June 24 to July 16, will be called Geniuses and Masterpieces. (10) The center of the exposition will be the work "Quadromarket", which is a three-dimensional interpretation of the "Black Square". (11) It will also feature works by Yuri Cooper, Oleg Yakhnin, Vyacheslav Mikhailov and other graphic artists, artists and sculptors. (12) The organizers promise that Colombian writer Gabriel García Márquez will attend the opening of the exhibition. "
(1) Я возвращался с охоты и шел по аллее: (1) I was returning from hunting and walking along the alley of the garden. (2) The dog ran ahead of me. (3) Suddenly she reduced her steps and began to sneak, as if sensing game in front of her. (4) I looked along the alley and saw a young sparrow with yellowness near its beak and down on its head. (5) He fell out of the nest (the wind strongly swayed the birch trees of the alley) and sat motionless, helplessly spreading his barely growing wings. (6) My dog ​​was slowly approaching him, when suddenly, having fallen from a nearby tree, an old black-chested sparrow fell like a stone in front of her muzzle - and, all disheveled, distorted, with a desperate and pitiful squeak, jumped once or twice in the direction of the toothy open mouth. (7) He rushed to save, he covered his brainchild with himself ... but his whole little body trembled with horror, his voice went wild and hoarse, he died away, he sacrificed himself! (8) What a huge monster the dog must have seemed to him! (9) And yet he could not sit on his high, safe branch ... (10) A force stronger than his will threw him out of there. (11) My Trezor stopped, backed away ... (12) Apparently, and he recognized this power. (13) I hastened to recall the embarrassed dog - and withdrew, reverent. (14) Yes; do not laugh. (15) I was in awe of that little heroic bird, of her love impulse. (16) Love, I thought, is stronger than death and the fear of death. (17) Only by her, only by love does life hold and move.
\"(1) Южнокорейская организация по туриз: "(1) The South Korean Tourism Organization (KTO) in London will link Korea travel ads to Google search results for searches related to the song 'Gangnam Style.' (2) The Drum reports. (3) KTO will launch an ad campaign through advertising agency Media Agency Group. (5) In addition, the agency will launch a traditional advertising campaign that will talk about national holidays. (7) Contestants must upload a video of their dance to YouTube. ( 8) The winner will be determined in early December. (9) KTO will send him to Seoul for three days and arrange a tour of the Gangnam area (Gangnam in English transcription), after which the song of the rapper PSY was named. South Korean rapper PSY for wrote the song "Gangnam Style" this July. (10) In the song, he parodies the lifestyle of one of the most prestigious areas of Seoul - Gangnam.
