(12) At the time of writing, the music video for "Gangnam Style" has over 895 million views. "
\"(1) Актриса Джиллиан Андерсон получила: "(1) Actress Gillian Anderson won the UK's annual Evening Standard Theater Award for Best Actress, reports The Guardian. (2) She played Blanche Dubois in A Streetcar Named Desire, based on the Tennessee Williams play of the same name. (3) The play is currently staged at London's Young Vic Theater. (4) Critics hailed Gillian Anderson's performance as “piercing and disarming.” (5) Best Actor was Tom Hiddleston for his role in Donmar Warehouse's Coriolanus. (6) This year the London Evening Standard Award for Outstanding Acting and Successful Production was presented for the 60th time. (7) Gillian Anderson is best known for the TV series "The X-Files", where she played FBI agent Dana Scully. (8) For this work, the actress received Golden Globe and Emmy Awards in 1997. (9) A Streetcar Named Desire, a Tennessee Williams play, first published in 1947. (1) Детство братья провели на воле, в им: (1) The brothers spent their childhood in freedom, on the estate of their father, who was himself a cantonist, but served the officer's rank and left the children a hereditary nobility. (2) After the death of their father, the estate was taken from them for debts. (3) Nicholas from the age of nineteen sat in the state chamber, but he missed there terribly and dreamed of buying himself a small estate. (4) Ivan Ivanovich himself never sympathized with his brother's desire to "lock himself up for life in his own estate." (5) Nikolai simply could not think of anything else. (6) He always imagined a future estate, where gooseberries would certainly grow. (7) Nikolai saved money, was malnourished, married without love to an ugly, but rich widow. (8) He kept his wife from hand to mouth, and put her money in his name in the bank. (9) The wife could not bear such a life and soon died, and Nicholas, not in the least repentant, bought himself an estate, ordered twenty gooseberry bushes, planted them and healed as a landowner. (10) When Ivan Ivanovich came to visit his brother, he was unpleasantly amazed at how he sank, aged and flabby. (11) He became a real master, ate a lot, sued neighboring factories and spoke in the tone of a minister like: "education is necessary, but for the people it is premature." (12) Nicholas regaled his brother with gooseberries, and it was evident from him that he was pleased with his fate and himself.
(1) Едва он кладёт трубку, как в дверь р: (1) As soon as he hangs up, a knock is heard at the door. (2) A boy enters with a large funeral wreath, on which it is written: "To the unforgettable untimely burned out at work Zilov Viktor Alexandrovich from inconsolable friends." (3) Zilov is annoyed with such a gloomy joke. (4) He sits down on the couch and begins to imagine how everything could be if he really died. (5) Then the life of the last days passes before his eyes. (6) The first recollection: in the cafe "Forget-me-not", Zilov's favorite pastime, he and his friend Sayapin meet with the chief of work Kushak during their lunch break to celebrate a big event - he got a new apartment. (7) Suddenly his mistress Vera appears. (8) Zilov asks Vera not to advertise their relationship, puts everyone at the table, and the waiter Dima brings the ordered wine and barbecue. (9) Zilov reminds Kushak that a housewarming celebration is scheduled for the evening, and he, somewhat flirting, agrees. (10) Zilov is forced to invite Vera, who really wants it. (11) The boss, who has just escorted his legal spouse to the south, he introduces her as a classmate, and Vera, with her very relaxed behavior, inspires certain hope in Kushak.
(1) В конце апреля Ромашов получает от А: (1) At the end of April, Romashov receives a note from Alexandra Petrovna reminding them of their common name days. (2) Having borrowed money from Lieutenant Colonel Rafalsky, Romashov buys perfume and goes to the Nikolaevs. (3) At a noisy picnic, Romashov sits next to Shurochka and experiences a strange state, similar to a dream. (4) His hand sometimes touches Shurochka's hand, but they do not look at each other. (5) He saw that some great, new, feverish feeling was flowing in her, trembling and asking to come out. (6) After the feast, Romashov wanders into the grove. (7) Shurochka follows and says that today she is in love with him, and the day before she saw him in a dream. (8) Romashov begins to talk about love. (9) She admits that she is worried about his closeness, they have common thoughts, desires, but she must abandon him. (10) Shurochka does not want to be missed and goes back. (11) On the way, she asks Romashov not to visit them again: her husband is besieged with anonymous letters. (12) In mid-May, the corps commander goes around the companies lined up on the parade ground, looks at their training and remains dissatisfied. (13) Only the fifth company, where soldiers are not tortured with shagistika and are not stolen from a common cauldron, deserves praise.

(1) Певец и лидер рок-группы «Машина вре: (1) Andrei Makarevich, the singer and leader of the Mashina Vremeni rock group, did not consider it offensive to say that Russians are disrespectful to nature and have a habit of shitting. (2) On the air of the Moscow speaking radio station, the musician stressed that he did not want to offend anyone with his statement. (3) “I didn't mean anything offensive when I said that. (4) These are just certain features that have developed historically and are historically inherited, "Makarevich explained. (5) In his opinion, when "the tribe is moving all the time, it makes no sense for them to clean up after themselves, since tomorrow they will have a new clean place." (6) At the same time, Doctor of Historical Sciences Lev Domeshek noted on the air of the radio station that nomadic peoples have always had an extremely respectful attitude towards nature and land. (7) Earlier, Makarevich told in an interview how Belarusians differ from Russians. (8) The text was published on March 3 by the site "Budzma Belarusians" ("Let's Be Belarusians"), which is dedicated to the patriotic campaign of the same name. (9) In particular, the musician explained that in relation to nature, Belarusians adhere to the European position, while among Russians this perception has been distorted since the time of the Tatar-Mongol yoke. (10) “There is a difference, of course. (11) At least even in relation to nature. (12) You have a European attitude, ours - spoiled by nomads. (13) Nomads are used to shitting because they do not sit still: they are going on tomorrow. (14) You don't have to worry about cleanliness. (15) I suspect that the Russians have it left from the time of the Tatar yoke, ”he said.
(1) Утром выясняется, что поезд останови: (1) In the morning, it turns out that the train has stopped. (2) They were caught in a drift zone and it is now unknown when the journey will continue. (3) At noon, Poirot is summoned to the compartment of the head of the train. (4) The help of a famous detective is needed - Mr. Ratchett was found stabbed to death in a compartment. (5) Seeing that the passenger did not go out and did not answer the knock, the conductor decided to open the door with his key, but it was locked from the inside and closed with a chain. (6) Entering the compartment, he saw that the window was open and the passenger had been killed by a dozen stabs. (7) After examining the corpse, the doctor concluded that the blows were not delivered by a professional. (8) Some were done with the left hand, others with the right, some were made when Mr. Ratchett was already dead. (9) Due to heavy snowfall, no one could leave the carriage, therefore, the killer is on the train. (10) Poirot talks to the secretary, Mr. McQueen. (11) The young man worked for the victim for about a year. (12) He cannot provide any information about his master, only that recently someone has sent him threatening letters.
(1) Руджьер — сын от тайного брака христ: (1) Ruggier is the son of a Christian knight's secret marriage with a Saracen princess. (2) He is raised in Africa by the wizard and warlock Atlas. (3) Atlas knows that his pet will be baptized, give birth to glorious descendants, but then he will perish, and therefore tries in no way to let his pet go to Christians. (4) He has a castle full of ghosts in the mountains: when a knight drives up to the castle, Atlas shows him the ghost of his beloved, he rushes through the gates to meet her and remains in captivity for a long time, vainly looking for his lady in empty rooms and passages. (5) But Bradamanta has a magic ring, and this enchantment does not work on her. (6) Then Atlas puts Ruggier on his winged horse - a hippogriff, and he takes him to the other end of the world, to another sorceress-warlock - Alcina. (7) She meets him in the guise of a young beauty, and Ruggier falls into temptation: for many months he lives on her miracle island in luxury and bliss, enjoying her love, and only the intervention of a wise fairy who cares about the future family of Este returns him to the path of virtue. (8) The enchantment breaks down, the beautiful Alcina appears in a true image of vice, vile and ugly, and the repentant Ruggier flies back to the west on the same hippogriff. (9) In vain, here again the loving Atlas lies in wait for him and gets in his ghostly castle. (10) And the captive Rugjier rushes through his halls in search of Bradamanta, and nearby the captive Bradamanta rushes through the same halls in search of Rugjier, but they do not see each other.
(1) Предварительные выборы депутатов Мос: (1) The preliminary elections of the Moscow City Duma deputies are held on Sunday, June 8, in the Russian capital. (2) Residents of the city from 8:00 to 20:00 at their registration address, upon presentation of their passport, can vote for the candidate they like. (3) Interfax reports. (4) 1,033 candidates were registered for 45 seats. (5) In total, about 10 percent of the ballots were printed from the number of voters in the capital (more than 700 thousand). (6) There are 500 voting places in the primaries. (7) The first election results will be announced as early as Monday night, June 9. (8) The final results will be announced early next week. (9) 19 current deputies take part in the primaries, including the chairman of the Duma, Vladimir Platonov. (10) Among the candidates are actor Leonid Yarmolnik, director of the traffic jam center Alexander Shumsky, People's Artist of Russia Nadezhda Babkina, director of the Social Assistance and Population Support Fund "Social Inquiry" Maria Gaidar, former First Deputy Mayor of Moscow Oleg Tolkachev and others. (11) More details about the participants can be found on the website moscow2014.rf. (12) Elections to the Moscow City Duma will be held on a single voting day on September 14, 2014. (13) The term of office of the deputies is five years.
(1) Происходят перемены и в жизни Клауса: (1) Klaus Tangen's life is also changing. (2) Klaus's wife, Anna, gradually tells her husband the way to achieve the cherished goal: creating a novel in the Gorky traditions. (3) Klaus decides to give up translations and return to the trade of a bricklayer, providing good earnings - this will allow him to save up money so that he can then start his favorite work. (4) In a moment of despair, an unfamiliar woman comes to the aid of Andreas Dühring. (5) This meeting changes everything in his life. (6) A cynic in disbelief, he unexpectedly discovers the ability and need to love, sacrifice, live. (7) Helga's husband, Eric Faye, is also a member of the Resistance, but the war took away hope for happiness from him: torture in the Gestapo dungeons turned him into a cripple. (8) Eric is doomed and knows this, he is going through his forced loneliness hard, but he endures suffering. (9) Fate took away hope for the future from him, but he managed to remain faithful to the ideals of youth, to preserve what his more successful comrades almost lost. (10) His dying words sound like a testament to the living: “The truly great in human life is always simple. (11) To see and accomplish it, you need only strength, courage and a willingness to sacrifice oneself. "
\"(1) О фронтмене британской группы Moto: "(1) A documentary was made about Lemmy Kilmister, frontman of the British group Motorhead. (2) The film, which tells about the life and work of the legendary musician, is set to premiere in March 2010. (5) Work on the film, called "Lemmy: The Movie", lasted three years - the creators of the picture accompanied the musician on tour USA, Scandinavia and Russia, talked to him on various topics, and also spoke with Lemmy colleagues from other groups, who talked about the importance of the personality of the vocalist Motorhead for modern music. (6) "Lemmy: The Movie" includes excerpts from interviews with Alice Cooper , Ozzy Osbourne, ex-Guns'N Roses guitarist and current Velvet Revolver member Slash, former Nirvana drummer and current Foo Fighters vocalist Dave Grohl, Metallica musicians and many other Lem associates mi. \"(1) В Москве скончался мультипликатор: "(1) Animator Fyodor Khitruk died in Moscow, RIA Novosti reports with reference to the Animated Film Association. (2) He was 95 years old. (3) Among Khitruk's directorial works are three cartoons about Winnie the Pooh (1969, 1971-1972) , "Boniface's Vacation" (1965), "Film, Film, Film!" (1968), "The Island" (1973), "Icarus and the Wise Men" (1976), "Olympioniki" (1982), "The Lion and the Bull" ( 1983). (4) As an animator, he created about 200 characters in 102 films, among them - Ole-Lukkoye, Snow Queen, Little Red Riding Hood. (5) Fedor Savelyevich Khitruk was born in Tver, soon his family moved to Moscow. (6) The future director became interested in animation after he saw Disney works for the first time. (7) For three years in a row he could not enter Soyuzmultfilm - this was only possible in 1938. (8) Khitruk's first directorial work, cartoon "The Story of a Crime" (1962) - so, at a festival in San Francisco, she was awarded the Golden Gate prize. (9) Subsequently, Hit hand have won many awards at international festivals. (10) So, for "Trample" (1964) in Venice, he was awarded the "Bronze Lion". (11) The director was People's Artist of the USSR, laureate of two State Prizes, holder of the Order of Merit for the Fatherland, III degree. (12) In 2006, his contribution to animation was recognized with the Nika Prize. "
(1) Видеохостинг YouTube заблокировал ви: (1) Video hosting YouTube blocked a video by Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott reporting on the work of his government. (2) The Sydney Morning Herald reported this on February 3. (3) The video was blocked following a complaint from a YouTube user who flagged the video as spam. (4) In total, the blockage lasted about eight hours. (5) After the restriction of access to the video was removed, YouTube representatives called the incident a "human error" and apologized to the head of the Australian government. (6) “The video was removed by mistake due to a complaint from one of the users. (7) As soon as we learned about what had happened, we immediately took all measures to restore the video on the site, ”said YouTube. (8) The temporary removal of the video caused a violent reaction in social networks. (9) Twitter users, in particular, suggested that the video was not removed by mistake, but because of Abbott's “lies”, who bragged about fulfilling his election promises. (0) “Lies, lies and more lies. (10) Abbott's video was deemed by YouTube to be unfair advertising, ”wrote one user. (11) Tony Abbott's video, Delivering on Our Promises, was posted on YouTube on February 1st. (12) In the video, Abbott talks about the achievements of his cabinet in the first month of 2014. (13) In particular, the Prime Minister notes the improvement in the situation in the field of control over illegal migration, and also informs about the impending cancellation of the unpopular carbon tax in Australia.
(1) В давние времена лев, который был ко: (1) In ancient times, the lion, who was the king of three thousand forests, took a fox as his wife. (2) Soon a son was born to them, but such that he does not look like a fox, and you cannot call him a lion. (3) He looked like just like a lion, but instead of roaring like a lion, he barked at a fox. (4) When the son began to grow up, the lion father called him to him and said: - My son! (5) You are great and strong in body, but from your fox mother you received a despicable voice. (6) There is no greatness in your voice, and it does not befit my royal offspring. (7) If the animals hear you barking at the fox, they will not reckon with you. (8) Therefore, it is better to completely shut up and do not vote. (9) Then I can grant you a thousand forests. (10) The son remembered the instructions of the lion. (11) But one day it happened that he broke them. (12) Once, when many animals were gathered, the son of the lion really wanted to give a voice. (13) He could not stand it and, forgetting his father's order, barked loudly at the fox. (14) Laughter arose among the beasts when they heard how thinly, such a large and strong beast barked like a fox. (15) And then the lion father said to him: - If you, son, were silent, as I punished you, you would receive a thousand forests. (16) And now I see that you are not worthy of these forests, since you could not calm your talkativeness. (17) So the son of the lion did not receive a thousand forests, and since then people began to say: "Silence is worth a thousand."
\"(1) Сборная Голландии победила Бразили: "(1) The Dutch national team defeated Brazil in the quarter-finals of the World Cup. (2) The Dutch won 2-1. (1) Живущий в Великобритании диссидент и: (1) Vladimir Bukovsky, a dissident and writer living in the UK, rejected charges of producing and possessing child pornography at the Royal Court in Cambridge, RIA Novosti reports. (2) In April 2015, the Crown Prosecution Service brought charges against Bukovsky on 11 counts falling within the scope of three criminal articles. (3) The court hearings were repeatedly postponed due to the state of health of Bukovsky, who underwent heart surgery. (4) Before the court, Bukovsky stated that for many years he had no contact with children at all and the charges against him were unfounded. (5) 72-year-old Vladimir Bukovsky is one of the most famous Soviet dissidents. (6) Was arrested four times. (7) He was accused of anti-Soviet agitation and propaganda. (8) He underwent compulsory treatment in psychiatric hospitals, served his sentence in camps. (9) In 1976 he left the USSR - he was exchanged for the Chilean political prisoner Luis Corvalan. (10) In the 1990s, Russian citizenship was returned to him. (11) In 2014, after an audit, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Russian Federation, however, recognized that Vladimir Bukovsky could not be considered a citizen of the Russian Federation.
(1) Мальчишка разбил стекло. – (2)Кто эт: (1) The boy broke the glass. - (2) Who did it? The teacher asks. (3) The boy is silent. (4) He is not afraid to ski off the most dizzying mountain. (5) He is not afraid to swim across an unfamiliar river full of treacherous funnels. (6) But he is afraid to say: "I broke the glass." (7) What is he afraid of? (8) After flying from the mountain, he can break his neck. (9) When crossing the river, he may drown. (10) The words "I have done this" do not threaten him with death. (11) Why is he afraid to pronounce them? (12) I heard how a very brave man who went through the war once said: "It used to be scary, very scary." (13) He spoke the truth: he used to be afraid. (14) But he knew how to overcome his fear and did what his duty told him to do: he fought. (15) In a peaceful life, of course, it can also be scary. (16) I will tell the truth, and I will be expelled from school for this ... (17) I will tell the truth - they will be fired from my job ... (18) I'd rather not say anything. (19) There are many proverbs in the world that justify silence, and, perhaps, the most expressive: "My hut is on the edge." (20) But there are no huts that would be on the edge: we are all responsible for what is happening around us. (According to F.A. Vigdorova *)
(1) Автоматизированный дом «Всё для счас: (1) The Automated House "Everything for Happiness", owned by the spouses George and Lily Headley, thanks to the built-in mechanisms, performs absolutely all the work for people. (8) Suspecting that something is wrong, parents enter the room when their children are not at home. (9) They see lions eating some prey. (10) The Headleys are worried that their children are carried away by the death scenes. (11) In addition, adults themselves have recently become more irritable. (12) The woman sees the reason for this in the fact that now the house does everything for them.

(1) Ведущая британского телемагазина Gem: (1) Gems TV presenter Charlie Vernon, previously fired by management for showing her middle finger on air, will receive £ 3,250 in compensation. (2) This was reported on December 9 by The Daily Mail. (3) Monetary compensation will be paid to the presenter not for the dismissal (the court confirmed its legality), but for what became the real cause of the incident with the middle finger. (4) As it turns out, the obscene gesture was shown by Vernon after one of the Gems TV operators called her "****** fat whore" and "bitch." (5) Hearing these words through the earpiece during the broadcast, the journalist could not restrain herself and showed an indecent gesture to her colleague who insulted her. (6) “I was shocked and offended. (7) Operators often make fun of us during commercial breaks, but these are usually friendly and innocent jokes. (8) I didn’t expect to be abused so severely, ”said Vernon, commenting on the court’s decision. (9) Prior to her dismissal, Charlie Vernon advertised jewelry on Gems TV. (10) In total, the presenter worked in the TV shop for more than two years. (11) During the consideration of the case, Gems TV representatives assured that Vernon had never actually been on the staff, but worked for the company as a freelancer. (12) In addition, the management of the TV shop tried to prove that two weeks before the incident, the girl was already on the verge of being fired due to a violation of discipline. (13) However, it was later revealed that Vernon was still on the state and the threat of her dismissal did not exist before.
\"(1) В Германии 7 июля был установлен п: "(1) The first monument in the country to the Russian Empress Catherine II was erected in Germany on July 7, ITAR-TASS reports. (2) The monument was erected in the city of Zerbst in eastern Germany. (3) The monument, erected in front of the Zerbst city administration building, represents a bronze statue 4.7 meters high. (4) The author of the project was a member of the Russian Academy of Arts, sculptor Mikhail Pereyaslavets. (5) The monument was cast in 2009 and donated to the city of Zerbst in June 2010. (6) Inauguration of the monument will take place on July 9. (7) The idea of ​​erecting a monument to the Russian empress appeared in 1996. (8) The initiators were the Catherine II International Historical Society and the Russian Noble Society operating in Zerbst. (9) All costs for the installation of the monument were borne by the Russian side (10) Catherine the Great, née Sophia Frederica Augusta, Princess of Anhalt-Zerbst, was born in 1729 in the city of Stettin. (11) The ancestral castle has been preserved in Zerbst ancestors of the princess. (12) At the age of 16, she was married to the Russian Grand Duke and future Emperor Peter III. (13) In 1762, as a result of a coup, she changed her husband on the Russian throne and ruled the Russian Empire until her death in 1796. "
\"(1) Режиссёр Брюс Бересфорд займётся п: "(1) Director Bruce Beresford will direct the biopic Taliesin, which tells the story of the life of American architect Frank Lloyd Wright, reports The Hollywood Reporter. (2) Wright is considered one of the creators of so-called organic architecture. (3) In buildings built on the precepts of this direction, the natural properties of materials are revealed, in addition, the structures ideally fit organically into the surrounding landscape. (4) The mansion of Wright himself, called "Taliesin", was designed according to the same principles. (5) It was in this mansion in 1914 (6) The architect's servant committed the crime. (7) He also set fire to Taliesin. (8) The residential part of the house was almost completely burned down. (9) Later, Wright restored it and named the renovated mansion Taliesin II. (10) Other notable structures designed by Wright are the Solomon Guggenheim Museum in New York and a house called Fallingwater in Pennsylvania. (11) Script to fi Nicholas Meyer ("Sommersby", "Prince of Egypt") wrote about Frank Lloyd Wright. (12) Beresford praised Meyer's work. (13) "It's not about Wright's entire life, it's just a short period. (14) And the writer isn't trying to turn the hero into a saint," the director said. (15) Bruce Beresford himself previously worked on the films "Tender Mercy", "Black Cassock" and "Chauffeur Miss Daisy". (16) The last of these films in 1989 nominated for nine Oscars and won four of them (including the main nomination for Best Picture). "
(1) Однажды Тэсс случайно подслушивает р: (1) One day, Tess accidentally overhears the conversation of her companions - Marion, Ratty and Izz. (2) The girls confess to each other their love for young Mr. Claire, and complain that he does not even want to look at any of them, for he does not take his eyes off Tess Durbeyfield. (3) After that, Tess begins to torment herself with the question - does she have a right to the heart of Angel Clare? (4) However, life decides everything for itself: Claire falls in love with her, and she - with him. (5) Angel specially goes home to inform his parents about his decision to marry a simple peasant woman in order to find in her person not only a faithful wife, but also a reliable assistant in his chosen life field. (6) The young man's father, a stern Anglican priest, does not approve of either the plans or the choice of the younger son, from whom he, like his older brothers, wanted to make a priest. (7) However, he does not intend to oppose him, and Claire returns to the farm with the determination to marry Tess. (8) The girl does not accept his proposal for a long time, but then agrees. (9) At the same time, she always tries to tell him about her past, but the lover does not want to listen to her. (1) Недавно прочитал в интервью городско: (1) I recently read in an interview with a city official: “The St. Petersburg Concert Philharmonic should become a production center, a kind of“ factory of stars ”... (2) A more unfortunate combination of words -“ factory of stars ”- is difficult to imagine in the mouth of the chairman of the Committee on culture. (3) After all, what television shows us under this name is, if it is a factory, then not stars, but rather stamped meteorite dust, which disappears in a split second in the life-giving atmosphere of culture. (4) Our poor country! (5) In addition to other innumerable ailments, she is simply infected with "star fever." (6) And we need a master! (7) It is clear that the education of an actor, singer and musician requires not only incredible work, ability and patience, but also time. (8) No wonder even a very secondary education requires at least three years of study. (9) And for six months, immature young people, even promising ones, can only be trained by teaching a few acting cliches suitable for the demand of an undemanding crowd. (10) If we speak in the words of the great poet, then we "sow the rational, the good, the eternal." (11) Both in the school class and in the beautiful hall on the Fontanka, I see how an inquisitive gleam of understanding and empathy appears in the eyes of high school students when they listen to Dostoevsky, Chekhov, Pushkin, Galich, Okudzhava, as deep thoughts and feelings expressed in a fabulous beautiful Russian language, difficult to translate into other languages, find their way to their minds and hearts. (12) And their remarks after the concert - "cool!" - no less reward than loud applause or tense, conscious silence during performances. (13) You just need to make sure that this "bird" teenage slang melted in their minds into beautiful Russian speech. (14) And what can we say about great classical music, which without words - directly - from time immemorial has influenced the feelings of people! (15) It is a hell of a difficult thing to try to convey to the viewer (especially the young - after all, let’s omit!) great predecessors, for whose creations we are respected and loved all over the world. (16) And show business does not need government assistance. (According to L. Mozgovoy *)
\"(1) Кандидат в президенты Украины, быв: "(1) The presidential candidate of Ukraine, the former head of the Ministry of Defense Anatoly Gritsenko denied information that he is negotiating with President Viktor Yushchenko on the creation of an election alliance. (1) Горнолыжный сезон в Сочи оказался по: (1) The ski season in Sochi was in jeopardy due to unusually warm weather. (1) Директор, подстрекаемый завучем Шейн: (1) The director, instigated by the head teacher Sheina Trakhtenberg-Tinbergen, dismisses Norvegov from his job for sedition. \"(1) Канцлер Германии Ангела Меркель и: "(1) German Chancellor Angela Merkel and Spanish Prime Minister Jose Luis Rodriguez Zapatero inaugurated CeBIT 2010. (1) Проблематикой абсурда пронизано всё: (1) The entire work of Dostoevsky is permeated with the problem of absurdity. (2) His novels vividly depict the attitude of an absurd person. (3) The writer managed to show “all the torture of the absurd world”, but the Russian genius could not find a way out of the absurd deadlock. (4) Appealing to God, Dostoevsky only raises the problem of the absurd, but does not solve it. (5) He tries to give an answer, but "the absurd work, on the contrary, does not give an answer." (6) Absurd creativity is "rebellion, freedom and diversity." (7) The book ends with a sketch about the brightest absurd rebel in the history of mankind. (8) This is Sisyphus, whom "the gods sentenced to lift a huge stone to the top of the mountain, from where this block invariably rolled down." (9) The hero of the myth is punished for his earthly passions and love of life. (10) It is known that "there is no punishment more terrible than useless and hopeless work", but the hero despises the lot that fell to him. (11) His life is filled with a new meaning, in which consciousness conquers fate, turning suffering into joy. (12) The torment experienced by Sisyphus under the weight of a stone is a rebellion against the absurd world.
(1) Иван Вересов с рождения воспитывался: (1) Ivan Veresov was brought up from birth by Major Spitsa, not knowing parental affection, although his father, who lived next door, visited him. (2) Mordenko put him in a drama school, from which Ivan was released as incapable of wordless roles. (3) He also earned his bread by sculpting plaster figures for street vendors. (4) Ivan lived separately from Mordenko, who did not help his son in any way. (5) From the time of expulsion from the Shadurskys' house, Mordenko had only one secret passion: to avenge the prince for a slap in the face, and the princess for contempt. (6) In order to amass capital, he began to lend money for growth; its first pledge was Princess Anna Chechevinskaya, who took off her pectoral cross. (7) Gradually, Mordenko began to buy overdue bills of the wasteful Shadurskys, waiting for the day when he could finally ruin his enemies. (8) Absorbed by this idea, Mordenko became so suspicious that he accused his own son of aiding the robbers who came to kill the usurer. (9) Ivan was arrested, ended up in a society of murderers and bandits and survived in prison only thanks to the intercession of one of them, Ramzi. (10) Released, Ivan had no housing or funds, which is why he was forced to spend the night in a barge. (11) His ways with Masha Povetina soon parted ways, but they were destined to meet again.
(1) Йорику случайно попадается лист бума: (1) Yorick accidentally comes across a sheet of paper with text in Old French from the time of Rabelais and possibly written in his hand. (2) Yorick spends a day on a hard-to-read text and translates it into English. (3) It tells about a certain notary who, having quarreled with his wife, went for a walk on the New Bridge, where his hat was blown off by the wind. (4) When he, complaining about his fate, walked along a dark alley, he heard a voice call the girl and told her to run after the nearest notary. (5) Entering this house, he saw an old nobleman, who said that he was poor and could not pay for the work, but the will itself would be the payment - it would describe the whole story of his life. (6) This is such an extraordinary story that the whole of humanity should become familiar with it, and its publication will bring large incomes to the notary. (7) Yorick had only one sheet, and he could not know what was next. (8) When La Fleur returned, it turned out that there were only three leaves, but the servant wrapped a bouquet in two of them, which he presented to the maid. (9) The owner sends him to the house of Count B ***, but it so happened that the girl gave a bouquet to one of the footmen, the footman to the young seamstress, and the seamstress to the violinist. (10) Both the master and the servant are upset. (11) One - the loss of the manuscript, the other - the frivolity of the beloved.
(1)О несправедливости говорят и пишут с: (1) Injustice has been spoken and written about since ancient times - perhaps since the time when humanity in general learned to speak and write. (2) What is injustice is still not clear. (3) It is very difficult to come to an agreement on this issue, since in this case the dispute is being conducted with a sufficient share of interest. (4) Everyone wants to be treated “justly” and complains about “injustice,” but tries to interpret the situation in such a way that the injustice is immediately apparent. (5) And everyone has enough self-importance to judge "justly" about the attitude towards other people, and does not at all notice that others are indignant at his supposed "justice." (6) Thus the problem is distorted by passions and shrouded in prejudice. (7) Whole generations are stuck in these prejudices, and sometimes you notice how the very word "justice" evokes a sarcastic smile. (8) From previous generations, mankind inherited the belief that people are equal from birth and, therefore, must be treated in the same way. (9) However, the essence of justice consists precisely in the unequal treatment of unequal people. (10) If people were truly equal, life would be extremely simple and justice would be extremely easy to find. (11) It would only be worthwhile to say: to the same people - the same share or to all equally. (12) Then justice could be substantiated arithmetically and created mechanically; and everyone would be happy, because people would become nothing more than identical atoms, a kind of rolling mechanical balls everywhere, which would be similar externally and would have internally the same mental makeup. (13) How naive, how simple, how petty! (14) In fact, people are not equal in body, soul or spirit. (15) They will be born as creatures of different sexes, with different health and strength, with completely different predispositions, gifts, instincts and desires, they belong to a different spiritual level, and with them (by virtue of justice!) (16) This is the basis and the main difficulty of justice: there are an infinite number of people; they are all different; how to make everyone receive according to justice? (17) If people are not the same, then it is necessary to treat them every time according to their living originality - otherwise injustice arises. (18) Thus, justice means precisely inequality: to take care of the child, to help the weak, to condescend to the tired, to look after the sick; show more severity towards the weak-willed, more trust in the honest, more caution towards the chatterbox; honor the hero. (19) Justice is therefore the art of inequality, and it is inherent only in noble souls. (20) She has a heightened sense of reality; stemming from a kind heart and lively observation, it rejects a mechanical approach to people, tries to capture in a person his essence and originality and treat him accordingly. (According to I. Ilyin *)
\"(1) Верховный суд РФ признал законным: "(1) The Supreme Court of the Russian Federation recognized the verdict of the Moscow Regional Court as legal, according to which the former deputy head of the Ruzsky District of the Moscow Region, Maxim Miroshkin, will spend nine years in a colony. (2) On August 5, RIA Novosti reported. (3) The Moscow Regional Court issued a verdict in May 2011, but the defense tried to appeal it. (4) Now the verdict has come into legal force. (5) According to the same court decision, Oleg Novozhilov and Vyacheslav Suslov, Miroshkin's accomplices, received eight and nine years in prison, respectively. (6) It was established that in 2005-2006 Miroshkin and the head of the regional administration's department for land use and subsoil resources Novozhilov extorted bribes from citizens and businessmen applying for land plots for ownership or lease. (7) The money had to be made in the form of "voluntary" donations to the "Foundation for Assistance to the Development of the Ruzsky District "headed by Suslov. (8) Subsequently, the criminals spent the money on personal needs. (9) Suslov, Miroshkin and Novozhilov were arrested in 2008. (1) В этот момент Артём потерял сознание: (1) At that moment, Artyom lost consciousness, saw a tunnel from his nightmare, and the black one waiting there called him the chosen one. (1) Но Гермес предлагает ему перестать ф: (1) But Hermes invites him to stop philosophizing and quickly choose his place among the other dead. (1) Лифтёр отеля интересуется, не желает: (1) The hotel elevator asks if he wants a girl - five dollars for the time, fifteen for the night. (1) В нём, Иване, есть карамазовская жаж: (1) In him, Ivan, there is Karamaz's thirst for life, he loves life contrary to logic, sticky spring leaves are dear to him. (1) Тысячи роботов, не занятые в обслужи: (1) Thousands of robots, not employed in the maintenance of Jason and Martha, have been building some kind of structure for several centuries, the purpose of which is unknown to people. (1) Создатели документальной ленты Heave: (1) The creators of the documentary Heaven Adores You about the American composer and songwriter Elliott Smith said that during the filming they found an unknown musician song, which he wrote at the age of 14 and never released. (5) It features keyboards, guitar and Smith's voice, ”said Moyer. (6) He also added that the track was created by the musician in 1984 with his Texas friends before moving to Portland from Amherst. (7) Most often, Elliott Smith used the guitar in his work, but also played well on the piano, clarinet, bass guitar, harmonica and drums. (8) For some time he performed in the rock band Heatmiser, and in 1995 began a solo career. (9) Smith rose to fame in 1998 when his composition Miss Misery, written for Good Will Hunting, was nominated for an Oscar in the Best Song category. (10) The musician also made a cover of The Beatles' Because for the film American Beauty. (11) For 34 years, Smith managed to release seven albums. (12) He died under unexplained circumstances, there is a version that the musician committed suicide.

(1) Привидениями фру Альвинг называет не: (1) Fru Alving calls ghosts not only "people from the other world" (this is how this concept is translated from Norwegian more correctly). (1) Шаталов растопил печку, сам уселся н: (1) Shatalov lit the stove, sat down on a chair himself and lit a cigarette. (2) The pain in the bones intensified, monotonous, boring ... (3) All the troubles began when he got this damn rheumatic heart disease. (4) It is surprisingly stupid sometimes: a small, ordinary case becomes a watershed of the whole fate. (5) Shatalov - at that time a senior lieutenant, navigator of a hydrographic vessel - launched the reporting documentation and did not get out of the cabin for a week, studying combat training logs, acts on the cancellation of skipper and navigator's property, notes of classes with personnel. (6) From endless "sections", "subsections", "paragraphs" and "notes" already rippled in the eyes and for some reason itched behind the collar. (7) The deadlines for the delivery of the documentation were approaching inexorably, the commander of the ship frowned at the meeting, and there was no end in sight. (8) And suddenly an order to go out to sea: somewhere on the island an automatic beacon deteriorated, and it was necessary to change the burner. (9) The autumn Baltic was stormy, but the navigator was jubilant. (10) He was young. (11) He jumped like a goat from the compass to the map, from the radio direction finder to the echo sounder: after all, no one now could drive him into the cabin and force him to write the acts of the inventory commission - he led the ship through the stormy sea! (12) The island was enclosed in a ring of surf, but the navigator volunteered to go there on a whaleboat. (13) He assured the commander that he had already landed here several times, that he knew the passages in the coastal stones. (14) He never even came close here and did not know any passages. (15) But he was well aware that the deadline for submitting the documentation would be extended if it was possible to establish a lighthouse without waiting for the storm wind to weaken. (16) No, it was not a completely desperate adventure. (17) Shatalov was a good sailor and felt the whaleboat's tiller not only with his palm, but with his whole being. (18) It's just that fate changed ... (19) He lost his bearings among the waves, breakers, curtains of splashes ... (20) I remember forever the slippery shine of a stone exposed for a moment under the very side of the whaleboat, the impact, the crackle of breaking oars, twisted mouths on the sailors' faces and the roar of the wind ... (According to V. Konetsky)
\"(1) Кирсти Стэнвэй, работавшая в качес: "(1) Kirsty Stanway, who worked as a make-up artist on a number of television and movies, simulated the injuries from the beatings allegedly inflicted on her by her husband. (1) Помню себя в молодом ещё, городском: (1) I remember myself in my still young, urban life: there is no greater joy than coming home and living there for a day or another. (2) But our old house is far from a palace. (3) Short, tight. (4) A small wooden blockhouse, erected at the beginning of the last century on the near Don farm Ryumino-Krasnoyarsk. (5) After the Great Patriotic War, Kalach-na-Donu lay in ruins and ashes; then the Germans destroyed it, then ours, seizing and freeing. (7) After the war, little by little, houses began to be brought to the Kalachevo ashes, dismantling them on the empty farmsteads. (8) So our house came. (9) We bought it: a black, smoked log house with a reed roof. (10) They sold the house very cheaply, and even with installments. (11) It was a salvation for us. (12) Where does the money come from? (13) Then they said that Aunt Nyura began to cry as she crossed the threshold of our new home. (14) They say she was frightened: painfully unprepossessing. (15) Now I know that there was another reason for crying. (16) Aunt Nyura at that time was forty years old, Uncle Petya was a little older, my mother was supporting me at forty; except for adults - children: Slava - in the seventh grade, I was going to the first grade, Kolya - in the cradle. (17) Six of us. (18) And here he is, finally, his own house, his own roof over his head. (19) After long and long years of difficult wanderings. (According to B. Ekimov)
(1) Над сценой возникают две богини. (2): (1) Two goddesses appear above the stage. (2) These are Iris, the messenger of Hera, and Lissa, the daughter of the Night, the deity of madness. (1) Фонд героев имени Карнеги (Carnegie: (1) The Carnegie Hero Fund awarded medals to 20 individuals. (2) The annual ceremony took place on April 7 in Pittsburgh, USA, the Associated Press reported. (3) As stated in a press release on the website dedicated to the laureates, this year the Foundation awarded one of the medals posthumously. (4) In 2007, Carmen Digrigorio, a former New Jersey police officer, rescued Chateauroux Jenkins-Thomas, who was attacked by her lover. (5) Christopher Robinson tried to shove the girl into the trunk of the car, but Digrigorio intervened in time and managed to escape. (6) After this, Robinson chased Digrigorio in a car, hit him and fled. (7) Doctors failed to save the former police officer. (8) He died in hospital two days after the incident. (9) Robinson was soon arrested and sentenced to 30 years in prison for attempted kidnapping and murder. (10) In addition to Digrigorio, 19 more people from the USA and Canada were awarded medals this year. (11) These include a truck driver, university student, delivery worker, police officer, and others who risked their lives to save others. (12) The Carnegie Heroes Fund was founded in 1904 by the famous English industrialist and philanthropist Andrew Carnegie. (13) This year, along with the medal, the laureates were given a check for 5 thousand dollars. (14) In total, during the existence of the fund, 9432 people were awarded medals.
\"(1) Глава Чечни Рамзан Кадыров заявил,: "(1) The head of Chechnya, Ramzan Kadyrov, said that shooting at weddings is prohibited in his republic. (2) In an interview with the program Vesti on Saturday with Sergei Brilev on October 6, quoted by Interfax, the politician said that earlier in Chechnya, shooting was often fired during the movement of wedding columns, while most of the shooters were employees of various structures. (3) "I told them: if we are the keepers of order, we must not break the law," Kadyrov said. (4) - Weddings happen on Saturdays, but in a month or more, maybe one occasion where one shot is fired. (5) In the old days, they shot to signal that the bride was being taken. (6) Now this can be done by cell phone, send SMS. "(7) Kadyrov stressed that the custom of shooting at a wedding is not a custom of the Chechen people. (8) He also noted that the custom of kidnapping a bride is prohibited in Chechnya. (9) Commentary Kadyrova is connected with the resonant incident with the shooting in Moscow during the celebration of the Dagestan wedding. (10) On September 30, a wedding cortege moving along Leningradsky Prospekt towards Tverskaya Street began shooting in the air and other cars. (11) The police blocked the violators in the Mokhovaya area , detaining 15 people. (12) At first, the wedding guests were released, having issued a fine, but later materials on six participants in the incident were sent to the courts. (13) Two of them have already been arrested for 15 and 5 days for disorderly conduct and disobedience to police officers. "
(1) В это время в их деревню приезжает и: (1) At this time, Mitka Polyakov, Katerina's brother, comes to their village from Murmansk without a penny of money. (1) Немецкий актер Готфрид Йон, известны: (1) German actor Gottfried Jon, known for his roles as General Urumov in the Bond film Golden Eye and Caesar in Asterix and Obelix against Caesar, died at the age of 73. (1) Актёр Кит Харингтон, играющий Джона: (1) Actor Kit Harington, who plays Jon Snow in Game of Thrones, marveled at the fans' attention to his beard, The Daily Express reported on Thursday June 9th. \"(1) Правительство Донецкой народной ре: "(1) The government of the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) will create its own Republican Guard to maintain order on the territory of the self-proclaimed state, RIA Novosti reports, citing the head of the Committee on Prisoners of War and Refugees Leonid Baranov. (1) На ежегодном чемпионате по скорости: (1) A new winner was announced at the annual Hot Dog Eating Speed ​​Championship held in New York on July 4. (1) Джо встречается с двумя полицейскими: (1) Joe meets with two police officers who inform him that there was a robbery in the neighborhood of his house last night. (8) He warns Joe that the people in this city will always look at him as a murderer, so he should consider going somewhere else. (9) Joe does not like this idea, and he says for the hundredth time that he is innocent. (10) Joe later searches for his joint photo with Kelly, which he finds in the closet. (11) Marisa confesses that she was going to get rid of the photo. (12) She tore it apart and wanted to throw it away, but changed her mind at the last minute and saved the parts of the photo by putting them in an envelope. (15) He plans to see her today and give her a gift - all the love letters he wrote to her in prison but never sent.
\"(1) Исполнитель главной роли в фильме: "(1) Shia LaBeouf, the leading actor in the film" Transformers, "admitted that he hates the second part of the picture. \"(1) В США в понедельник, 9 августа, на: "(1) In the United States on Monday, August 9, the trial of the youngest inmate of the American prison at Guantanamo Bay begins. (2) According to AFP, the defendant will appear before a military commission, and this trial will be the first such trial during the presidency of Barack Obama. (3) 23-year-old Canadian citizen Omar Khadr was arrested in Afghanistan in 2002. (4) Then he was 15 years old. (5) Khadr is charged with the murder of an American soldier - a teenager threw a grenade at Sergeant Christopher Spear. Speer.) (6) According to Voice of America, if Khadr is found guilty, he faces life imprisonment. (7) A preliminary hearing in the case of Omar Khadr is scheduled for August 9, the trial will take place on the 10th. (8) The 23-year-old Canadian is on trial. there will be a 15-jury panel, which will consist of at least a third of career military. (9) Khadr's trial will be the first trial of a teenage fighter in US history. (10) According to AFP, since 2001, military courts have found and the four prisoners of Guantanamo. (11) At the same time, the US federal courts managed to sentence about 200 terrorist suspects during this period. (12) Earlier, Omar Khadr had appeared in court, but his trial was suspended on a motion by the prosecution filed at the request of Barack Obama. (13) Soon after his inauguration, the President recommended the suspension of the proceedings of Guantanamo detainees. (14) During his election campaign, he also promised to close the prison. "
(1) В Армении арестованы сын губернатора: (1) Tigran, son of Syunik region governor Suren Khachatryan, and his bodyguard Zarzand Nikoghosyan were arrested in Armenia. (2) Reported by Armenia Today. (9) The murder in question was committed on the night of Sunday, June 2, in Goris (a city in the Syunik region), near the house of Khachatryan. (10) Avetik Budagyan, a former candidate for mayor of this city, was killed. (11) Two people were also wounded: the brother of the ex-mayoral candidate, Colonel Artak Budagyan, who is the commander of one of the military units of the unrecognized Nagorno-Karabakh Republic, and the governor's guard Nikolai Abrahamyan. \"(1) Главный тренер футбольного клуба Ц: "(1) The head coach of CSKA football club Leonid Slutsky admitted that his team's victory over Spartak Moscow (2: 1) in the match of the 15th round of the Russian championship was illogical. (1) В 1812 г. французская армия двигаетс: (1) In 1812 the French army moves to Russia. (2) Austria, being an ally of Napoleon, also participates in this campaign with a corps of thirty thousand under the command of Prince Schwarzenberg. (3) However, von Paulich, to the amazement of Daville, behaves as if he wants to show the vizier and everyone around that this war is entirely a French idea. (4) By the end of September, it becomes known about the capture of Moscow, but von Paulich, with impudent calmness, claims that he has no news of hostilities, and refuses to talk with Daville. (5) Ibrahim Pasha is surprised that Napoleon is moving north on the eve of winter, and tells Daville that it is dangerous. (6) Daville is tormented by painful forebodings. (7) Therefore, he is not surprised when he learns about the complete defeat of the French army in Russia. (8) A fierce winter is raging in Travnik, people suffer from hunger and cold, and for several months the consul is cut off from the outside world and does not receive any news. (9) In March, Daville learns that Ibrahim Pasha has been removed. (10) For Daville, this is a heavy blow and an irreparable loss. (11) Ibrahim Pasha warmly says goodbye to Davil, with whom he became close over the years.
(1) Сотрудник полиции погиб в результате: (1) A police officer was killed in a shootout between law enforcement officers and alleged owners of a drug den in Detroit, the Associated Press reported May 4. (2) This is the first time a police officer has been killed while on duty in a city in the past six years. (3) Four more police officers received injuries of varying severity. (4) It is reported that a police squad arrived at the building where the incident occurred early in the morning, after neighbors reported shots at the house. (5) Brian Huff, 42, and his partner entered the building first, leaving less experienced colleagues at the entrance. (6) Huff was killed two minutes later. (7) The murder suspect tried to escape and was arrested. (8) According to unconfirmed reports, this is 25-year-old Jason Gibson, also known as James Everett. (9) He came to the attention of the police many times, including in connection with attacks on police officers, possession of cocaine and illegal acquisition of weapons. (10) He was convicted at least twice and violated the conditions of the probationary period. (11) Residents of neighboring houses told reporters that there was apparently a drug den in the house. (12) For example, a woman living in the neighborhood was offered several times to buy drugs when she passed by. (13) According to police officers, the deceased Brian Huff was on night watch. (14) The call to the drug den fell on the end of his shift. (15) The policeman is survived by his wife and ten-year-old child.

\"(1) В Ставропольском крае возбуждено д: "(1) In the Stavropol Territory, a fraud case was initiated, from which a deputy of the State Duma of the Russian Federation suffered. (6) Murga's term expired in three years, however, his opponents said that after being elected to the State Duma, he would not have enough time to manage the Chamber of Commerce. (7) Bondarenko became the new head of the Chamber of Commerce. (8) Murga did not agree with this. (9) On August 25, the court reinstated him as president of the Chamber (10) Now the Investigative Committee learned that on August 22, Bondarenko demanded 1 million rubles from Murga. (11) In exchange, he promised to resign from the chamber himself and dismiss four other employees. (12) Also Bondarenko promised to give a receipt on non-disclosure of defamatory information about the deputy. (13) Murga turned to law enforcement. (14) Bondarenko was detained while receiving a fake money and writing a receipt. (15) His actions are regarded as attempted fraud. "
(1) Тик-так, тик-так! (2) Ночью в тишин: (1) Tick tock, tick tock! (2) At night, in silence and loneliness, it is terrifying to listen to the impassive eloquence of the pendulum of the clock: the sounds are monotonous and mathematically correct, consistently marking always the same thing - the tireless movement of life. (3) Darkness and sleep envelop the earth, everything is silent - only the clock coldly and loudly marks the disappearance of the seconds ... (4) The pendulum knocks, and with each sound life is reduced by a second, by a tiny fraction of time given to each of us, by a second that will not return to us. (5) Where do the seconds come from and where do they disappear? (6) No one will answer this ... (7) And there are still many questions that have not been answered, there are other, more important questions, and our happiness depends on their resolution. (8) How to live in order to feel that you are necessary for life, how to live without losing faith and desire, how to live so that not a single second disappears without disturbing the soul and mind? (9) Will the clock, whose movement has no end, ever answer all this - what will the clock say to this? (10) Tick tock, tick tock! (11) There is nothing in the world more dispassionate than a clock: they knock equally correctly at the moment of your birth, and at the time when you greedily pluck the flowers of the dreams of youth. (12) From the day of his birth, every day a person becomes closer to death. (13) And when you wheeze in agony, the clock will calmly and dryly count its seconds. (14) In their cold count - listen - there is something omniscient and tired of this knowledge. (15) Nothing, never excites them and is not dear to them. (16) They are indifferent, and we, if we want to live, need to create for ourselves other hours, full of sensations and thoughts, full of actions, in order to replace these boring, monotonous, melancholy, reproachful and cold-sounding hours. (17) There is no fixed point in the tireless movement of the clock - what do we call real? (18) After one second born, the second is born and pushes the first into the abyss of the unknown ... (19) Tick-tock! - and you are happy. (20) Tick tock! - and now the burning poison of grief is pouring into your heart, and it can stay with us for the rest of your life, for all the hours of your life, if you do not try to fill every second of your life with something new and alive. (According to M. Gorky).
(1) Федеральная прокуратура в Карлсруэ о: (1) The Federal Prosecutor's Office in Karlsruhe has officially filed charges of violating the international arms embargo on Iran against two men: 52-year-old Iranian Mohsen A. and 49-year-old engineer, German citizen of Iranian origin Behzad Z. ( Behzad S.), reports AFP. (2) It is reported that both accused are to appear before the Supreme Regional Court in Düsseldorf. (3) According to the prosecutor's office, for 850 thousand euros, they bought a vacuum furnace from a German company and shipped it to Iran, which can be used to heat-resistant the warheads of nuclear missiles and guidance systems. (4) The purchase was initiated by one of the major Iranian officials in charge of the arms development program. (5) The German prosecutor's office believes that the accused were aware that the vacuum furnace they had bought would be used to develop Iran's military program. (6) At the same time, Mohsen A. went on to deceive, declaring to the German seller that they themselves are the final buyers. (7) The furnace was delivered to Iran in March 2008, after which the employees of the German firm proceeded to install it. (8) The work, however, was soon discontinued as it was suspected that Mohzen A. was working for the Iranian government. (9) He was detained by German law enforcement in October of the same year and has been in pre-trial detention in Germany ever since. (10) His accomplice Behzad Z. was left at large.
(1) Актёр Сергей Безруков назначен худож: (1) Actor Sergei Bezrukov has been appointed artistic director of two theaters in the Moscow region - the Moscow Regional Chamber Theater and the Ostrovsky Moscow Regional Drama Theater. (12) The most famous roles of Bezrukov are in cinema ("Pushkin. The Last Duel", "Irony of Fate 2") and on television ("Brigade", "The Master and Margarita", "Plot", "Yesenin").
(1) Константин Павлович Карновский родил: (1) Konstantin Pavlovich Karnovsky was born in Kazan, into a large bourgeois poor family. (2.) Both under the father and after his death, the children lived in constant humiliation. (3) But Kostya managed to defend his independence: he worked hard, entered the university and began to provide for the whole family. (4) Even when Kostya was preparing to enter the gymnasium, an internal “countdown” began for him: not a minute could be wasted in vain. (5) But the established order of his life turned upside down every time he met Lisa. (6) Her "grace, sincerity and carelessness" spoke of the existence of "some immutable truth, which was stronger than all his mathematics and did not require any proof." (7) In St. Petersburg, Liza listens to lectures, goes to theaters and museums. (8) In one of her letters, she talks about a trip to her aunt in Moscow - here, at a dispute about painting, she suddenly really wanted to be the same as the artist Goncharova. (9) Lisa is waiting for a date with Kostya: it seems to her that only with him can she share her doubts, hopes and desires. (10) After all, Karnovsky “lives consciously, does not rush from side to side,” as she does. (11) But a short visit to Kazan on the way to Yalta, where Liza goes to treat her lungs, does not give her satisfaction: she doubts Karnovsky, in his love.
\"(1) Проект нового федерального закона: "(1) The draft of the new federal law" On Education "on December 1 will be posted for general discussion on the Internet, as previously happened with the law" On the Police. (1) Сотрудники испанских правоохранитель: (1) Spanish law enforcement officers detained a 41-year-old US citizen who threatened to kill physicist Stephen Hawking. (2) He arrived in Tenerife to participate in the Starmus Science Festival 2016, The Local reported on Friday 1 July. (3) It is noted that the day before, the American sent the 74-year-old physicist several dozen messages promising to kill him. (4) One of Hawking's sons raised the alarm. (5) The Local notes that the stalker is likely suffering from a mental disorder. (6) According to police, the woman persistently persecuted the scientist for several years. (7) In particular, she wrote threatening messages to Hawking on Twitter and by email. (8) Stephen Hawking is known for his work in the field of cosmology and the popularization of science. (9) So, he first published an article in which he suggested that black holes can evaporate. (10) A rare disease, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, was discovered in the scientist as a student, when he was studying at Oxford University. (11) As a consequence, Hawking's muscle activity has been minimized to date. (12) A computer system developed by Intel helps him to communicate with others. (13) She analyzes the movement of a scientist's pupils and suggests a suitable set of words. (14) Hawking was married twice, he has three children from his first marriage - two sons, Robert and Timothy, and a daughter, Lucy.
(1) Однажды Архимед сел в ванну и вдруг: (1) Once Archimedes sat down in the bath and suddenly felt as if he had become lighter. (2.) He had sat in the bath before, and many had done the same before him. (3) But before this historical incident, it had never occurred to anyone that a body immersed in a liquid loses in its weight as much as the liquid displaced by the body weighs. (4) Archimedes was surprised. (5) When he was surprised, he thought. (6) And when he thought about it, he discovered the great secret of nature. (7) Maybe all this did not happen like that. (8) But the fact remains: Archimedes' law exists, and those who receive “deuces” for not knowing it can confirm this. (9) It seems to me that all discoveries come from the fact that people are not indifferent. (10) That they know how to be surprised. (11) Let's say Newton was sitting in the garden. (12) Looks - an apple has fallen. (13) Well, it fell and fell. (14) Get up and eat. (15) No one was ever surprised by this. (16) And Newton was surprised: "Why did it fall?" (17) I was surprised, thoughtful and discovered the law of universal gravitation. (18) Of course, all this is much more complicated. (19) All this required tremendous work, tremendous knowledge. (20) I talk about this so easily because you probably know it, and I just want to say that if you don’t know how to be surprised, if you are indifferent, you will be bored living in the world. (according to L.I. Likhodeev)

(1) А теперь, пирамида, я покажу тебе ко: (1) Now, pyramid, I will show you something else. (2) They were still boys, but the ringing of spurs did not drown out someone's groans for them. (1) Давно это было, ещё в стародавние вр: (1) It was a long time ago, even in ancient times. (2) Once an eider and a loon argued. (3) And their names are similar. (4) And the plumage of the loon at that time was white. (5) “Here I am - a beauty. (6) She is snow-white herself, on her chest - a black tie, on the back - a black cloak, and on her head - a black elegant beret, ”the eider boasts. (7) And the loon has nothing to boast about, only ornaments - black beads of eyes. (8) And the eider won't calm down: “Of course it's bad that you can't tell us apart from afar. (9) But everyone will see my beauty up close. " (10) The loon got upset and swam away from all the birds. (11) And then he asks the river: “River, tell me what to do? (12) The eider doesn't want me to look like her even from a distance. " (13) The river answers her: "And you take a walk on the grass, get distracted, just enjoy life, beautiful nature." (14) A loon came out on the shore. (15) Yes, and froze, the sun was already hiding behind the mountains and a bright scarlet sunset spilled over the sky. (16) The loon stood and admired until the last ray of dawn touched the loon's neck and left its bright scarlet trace. (17) Dusk fell to the ground and painted the wings and back of the loon in a dark silver color. (18) The next morning, in the blue smooth surface of the river, as if in a mirror, I saw a loon reflected and was amazed. (19) A beautiful bird looked at her: there is a bright scarlet decoration on her neck, the wings and back are covered with a dark silver cloak. (20) And the river laughs, rolling in waves: "Well, now no one will confuse you with a loon!"

\"(1) Француз Зинедин Зидан и итальянец: "(1) Frenchman Zinedine Zidane and Italian Marco Materazzi, who became the heroes of the main scandal of the 2006 FIFA World Cup, reconciled. (1)Осень в этом году стояла вся напролёт: (1) Autumn this year was all dry and warm. (2) Birch groves did not turn yellow for a long time. (3) The grass did not fade for a long time. (4) Only a bluing haze covered the stretches on the Oka and distant forests. (5) I was sailing in a boat down the river and suddenly I heard someone in the sky begin to carefully pour water from a ringing glass vessel into another similar vessel. (6) Water gurgled, tinkled, gurgled. (7) These sounds filled the entire space between the river and the firmament. (8) It was the cranes who were kicking. (9) I raised my head. (10) Large schools of cranes followed one after another directly to the south. (11) They confidently and steadily walked south, where the sun played with quivering gold in the backwaters of the Oka, flew into a warm country. (12) I dropped the oars and looked at the cranes for a long time. (13) A few days before this meeting with the cranes, a magazine asked me to write an article about what a “masterpiece” is, and tell about some literary masterpiece. (14) In other words, about a perfect and impeccable work. (15) I chose Lermontov's poems. (16) Now on the river I thought that masterpieces exist not only in art, but also in nature. (17) Isn't this clique of cranes and their majestic flight along the airways unchanged for many millennia a masterpiece? (18) What can I say! (19) Each autumn leaf was a masterpiece, the finest ingot of gold and bronze, sprinkled with cinnabar and niello. (20) Each leaf was a perfect creation of nature, a work of her mysterious art, inaccessible to us humans. (According to K.G. Paustovsky *)

(1) Немец Михаэль Х. (Michael H.) выигра: (1) German Michael H. won a case against Comdirect, which mistakenly transferred 200 million euros to its account, writes Hamburger Abendblatt. (2) The bank's representatives argued that their client was carrying out transactions with money that did not actually belong to him, and therefore must pay compensation. (3) However, the court sided with Michael H. (4) The bank is going to appeal this decision. (5) The incident that triggered the current trial occurred in April 2011. (6) Michael H. sold the shares for 20 thousand euros, and the bank Comdirect, through which the operation was carried out, mistakenly deposited 200 million euros into his account. (7) Seeing this amount of money, the German immediately transferred 10 million euros to an account in another bank. (8) As a result, Comdirect got back all 200 million euros. (9) However, due to the weekend, the bank was able to receive ten million euros, which ended up in another bank, only after three days. (10) For this delay, Comdirect decided to charge the German 14.4 percent for the overdraft of the account, or 12 thousand euros. (11) Michael H. filed a lawsuit claiming that the bank did not have time to incur such losses. (12) He was willing to pay one thousand euros, Comdirect agreed to reduce the amount of interest to only six thousand euros. (13) The bank error, as it turned out, was a computer malfunction that caused a comma in the amount to be misplaced.

(1) Природа — зеркало нас. (2) Видящий в: (1) Nature is a mirror of us. (2) He who sees in it the mill of death sees enemies everywhere. (1) Родилась она под Киевом, в тихом име: (1) She was born near Kiev, on the quiet estate of her father, the hero of the war with Napoleon, General Raevsky.
