(5) The girl easily captivated the hearts of the hussars and uhlans, who stood with shelves near the Raevsky estate, but none of them touched her heart. (6) As soon as Masha was eighteen years old, her father found her a groom - the hero of the war of 1812, wounded near Leipzig, beloved by the sovereign General Sergei Volkonsky. (7) The girl was embarrassed that the groom was much older than her and she did not know him at all. (8) But the father strictly said: "You will be happy with him!" - and she did not dare to object. (9) The wedding took place two weeks later. (10) Masha rarely saw her husband after the wedding: he was constantly on business trips, and even from Odessa, where he finally went to rest with his pregnant wife, Prince Volkonsky was unexpectedly forced to take Masha to his father. (11) The departure was alarming: the Volkonskys were leaving at night, burning some papers before that. (12) Volkonsky did not have a chance to see his wife and first-born son, not under his own roof ...
(1) Заключённые подняли бунт в колонии №: (1) Prisoners started a riot in colony No. 6 in the Kirovograd region of Ukraine. (2) On Friday, June 3, the former head of the State Penitentiary Service, Sergei Starenky, wrote about this on his Facebook page. (3) “A real riot is when employees are attacked, keys and special equipment are taken away, all doors are opened or broken down,” the message says. (4) According to Starenky, the employees of the institution do not enter the territory of the colony because they fear for their lives. (5) All this, he specifies, has been going on for three days. (6) In addition, the former civil servant believes that the riots could spread to other places of detention. (7) According to him, the riots are ready to support the prisoners of correctional colony No. 49 and the remand prison of the Kirovograd region. (8) “I didn't want to write about it for a long time. (9) I was still waiting for the Ministry of Justice to react. (10) But the situation is already out of control. (11) A little more - and the intervention of external forces will be necessary. (12) Police, National Guard, "stresses Old. (13) On Friday, the British Times, citing UN Assistant Secretary General for Human Rights Ivan Shimonovich, reported that the United Nations accused the Ukrainian authorities of systematically using torture of detainees. (14) A UN report on the matter notes "the scale and brutality of the torture system supported by the state [Ukraine]" and discloses the existence of five secret government prisons.
\"(1) Бывшего офицера МЧС Юрия Жидкова п: "(1) Former EMERCOM officer Yuri Zhidkov was sentenced to 11 years in prison for the murder of ex-participant of the show" Dom-2 "Andrei Kadetov. (2) This was reported on May 4 by the Interfax agency. (3) It was established that in December 2010 23-year-old Zhidkov spied on his peer Kadetov on the street in St. Petersburg, when he was walking with the dog, and stabbed him. (4) The officer was detained in March 2011. (5) Initially it was reported that the suspect was an active employee of the Ministry of Emergencies, but then the department announced that he had resigned a few weeks before the arrest. (6) Zhidkov in the past was in a romantic relationship with a girl named Alexandra. (7) In 2010, 23-year-old Cadets met Alexandra. (8) The couple went to the country house , after which the girl announced that Kadetov had raped her. (9) However, then Alexandra withdrew the statement. (10) Unconfirmed information appeared in the media that the participant of "House-2" was subjected to blackmail. (11) So, Kadetov's friend Alexei Sidorov in an interview with the publication "Peter-Today" claimed that it was about 100 thousand rubles. (12) Sidorov told Baltinfo that Kadetov was also faced with extortion from the police - they allegedly demanded 150,000 rubles to close the case. (13) As it became known to journalists, the Internal Security Directorate even developed a plan to detain the extortionists, but Kadetov was killed literally a few hours before the money was handed over. (14) It is assumed that the motive for the murder was revenge for rape or unsuccessful blackmail. "
(1) Андрей собирается на работу, когда е: (1) Andrei is going to work when offended Masha calls him and, crying into the phone, again threatens to commit suicide. (2) Arriving at her place, the hero offers to help her hang herself. (3) Masha again rolls the scene for him. (4) Andrew asks to leave him alone and live his own life, not a fictional one. (5) “And you, I hope, will someday understand that the end of the story is the end of the story. (6) That it is low to speculate on suicide, and to seek love where it has never been is stupid. " (7) Masha curses him. (8) At the planning meeting with the director of the channel Lobov, Andrey is bored. (9) He is irritated by the hypocrisy of what is happening. (10) In his opinion, there is no smell of creativity here. (11) Lobov adheres to family values, while at the same time considering himself advanced. (12) He came to television from the financial business, and now, like any top manager who has grasped for creative work, he constantly admires himself. (13) He often uses the word "creativity" and alludes to extensive connections at the top. (14) Andrey considers the concepts of “morality”, “responsibility”, “filling” to be a set of meaningless clichés that “are thrown onto our heads once every two weeks”.
\"(1) Британский фотограф-любитель Марк: "(1) British amateur photographer Mark Bridger captured an owl living in a small brick shed. (2) As it turned out, a male owl named Gandalf suffers from agoraphobia - a fear of open spaces - and prefers to spend all the time indoors, writes The Daily Telegraph (3) Bridger confessed that he was shocked to see an owl sitting by the window of a brick building. (4) “I looked closely and realized that it was an owl. (5) I was shocked. (6) After all, not every day you see an owl in the house. (7) He looked like a ghost, "- the photographer shared his impressions. (8) According to the owner of Gandalf, Janet Southard, the owl's phobia became known when they tried to move it from the barn, where the bird was temporarily placed, into a special aviary (the owl lives on (9) "He didn't want to move, so now he lives in this cute red brick shed," Janet said. (10) Southard also reported that Gandalf likes to look out the window and watch birds. flying in the fresh air. (11) How long Gandalf has been living in the barn is not specified. (12) His age is also not named. (13) Great gray owls can live up to 40 years or more. (14) Photos of Gandalf can be viewed here. "
\"(1) Президентом Латвии избран Андрис Б: "(1) Andris Berzins was elected President of Latvia. (2) This was reported by Telegraph on June 2. Berzins, a former banker, was elected head of state by the deputies of the Latvian Seim (Latvia is a parliamentary republic, and the president is elected by the deputies). (3) In In the second round of voting, he received 53 votes in his favor. (4) To win, the candidate had to collect at least 51 votes out of 100. (5) Berzins' rival in the elections was the incumbent President of Latvia Valdis Zatlers. (6) His candidacy was supported by 41 parliamentarians; 56 voted against. (7) According to Interfax, three parliamentarians voted against both candidates. (8) Two ballots were invalidated. (9) A second round of voting was required because none of the candidates received the required minimum of votes in the first round . (10) In particular, Berzins won the support of 50 deputies of the Saeima in the first round. (11) Five legislators voted against both candidates in the first round. Zatlers' powers expire. July 7, 2011. (12) He became the first president of Latvia not to be re-elected for a second term. (13) As noted, Zatlers' position was shaken by his own recent speech, in which he harshly criticized the deputies and announced the beginning of the Diet dissolution procedure. "
(1) Начались осенние ливни и бури, по но: (1) Autumn showers and storms began, at night the poplar creaked, groaned, beat its branches against the wall, as if asking for protection from the weather. (2) Gradually, leaves flew from its branches, first from the upper ones, then from the lower ones. (3) Leaves streamed in streams, covering the balcony, and some stuck to the glass and looked in horror into the room, expecting something. (4) And now not a single leaf remained on the poplar, it stood naked, black, as if burnt, and against the background of the blue sky every black twig, every vein was visible, it was solemnly quiet and sad in nature, the unheating sun shone on summer. (5) And, as always, I remembered my childhood and thought: who are you? (6) What is the meaning of life? (7) Then again there was spring, and everything was all over again, and life seemed endless. (8) But one morning I heard a sound under the window, as if my poplar were screeching. (9) I rushed to the window. (10) Below there were scrapers and road rollers, which were cutting a new street, and a worker with an electric saw was cutting down a poplar in the middle of the road. (11) And from above, I saw a tremor go through his whole green body, he staggered, thought for a moment and collapsed onto a new street, blocking it in full width with rustling green collapsing foliage. (12) And the red-brick, boring, bare wall of the house on the other side of the street opened up to me, and since then I see only it and a piece of the sky. (13) I often remember my poplar. (14) And it still seems that he did not disappear from the ground, but grows somewhere in the forest, in a clearing, rustling with all the leaves. (According to B. Yampolsky)
\"(1) Редкий сингл группы The White Stri: "(1) The rare White Stripes single was auctioned for $ 12,700, New Musical Express reported. (2) The auction took place a few days ago. (3) The lot was bought by an unnamed collector. (4) The sold-out record was released by the Detroit duo on white vinyl records in a circulation of 1,000 copies (15 of them were individually numbered - one of these copies was sold at auction). (5) Cover design was done by The White Stripes singer Jack White and owner Italy Records David Buick. (6) The single contains the compositions "Lafayette Blues" and "Sugar Never Tasted So Good." (7) A two-song LP by The White Stripes was released in 1998. (8) In 2001 it was re-released on black vinyl (also with a circulation of 1,000 copies). (9) The single "Lafayette Blues" is now considered a phylophonic rarity and is sold at various auctions, including the online marketplace eBay. (10) The White Stripes were formed in Detroit in 1 997. (11) During its creative activity, the collective has released six studio albums. (12) The last disc of the group - "Icky Thump" - is dated 2007. (13) In 2011, Jack White and Meg White announced the breakup of the group. (14) Jack White is currently engaged in several of his projects, as well as a solo career - on April 23, 2012, his album "Blunderbuss" was released. "
(1)Многие считают понятие чести устарелы: (1) Many consider the concept of honor to be outdated, outdated, in the sense that it is not applicable now - not the right conditions. (2) For some, this is associated with such actions as a duel: they say, how else can you protect your honor from insults? (3) Others believe: honor has now been replaced by a higher concept - adherence to principles. (4) Instead of a man of honor - a man of principles ... (5) How can the feeling of honor, self-esteem, a purely personal moral feeling become obsolete? (6) How can the concept of honor, which is given to a person once, along with a name, and which can neither be compensated nor corrected, which can only be cherished? (7) I recall a case associated with the name of A.P. Chekhov. (8) In 1902, the tsarist government annulled the election of Maxim Gorky to the honorary academician. (9) In protest, Korolenko and Chekhov renounced the title of academicians. (10) For Chekhov, this was not only a public act, but also a personal one. (11) He wrote in a statement that when Gorky was elected, he saw him and was the first to congratulate him. (12) And now, when the Academy of Sciences announced that the elections were invalid, it turns out that he, Chekhov, as an academician, recognizes this. (13) “I congratulated heartily, and I recognize the elections as invalid - such a contradiction does not fit into my consciousness, I could not reconcile my conscience with him,” he wrote to the Academy of Sciences. “And after a long reflection I could come to only one the decision ... to resign from me the title of honorary academician. " (14) But such were the circumstances, which seemed to be independent of Chekhov, and he could find an excuse for himself. (15) Beliefs are, of course, a necessary thing. (16) But there is such a simpler, concrete concept as a word given by a person. (17) It is not confirmed by any document, certificate. (18) Just a word. (According to D. Granin)
(1)С чьей-то лёгкой руки природу русског: (1) With someone's light hand, the nature of the Russian North is called by journalists discreet, dull and modest. (2) Meanwhile, nowhere in the country are there such bright, such expressive, very contrasting and polyphonic colors as in the North of Russia. (3) The beauty of these places is due not only to the variety of landscapes, combining low mountains, hills, valleys, creeks, lakes and rivers, framed by forests, meadows, bushes; it is also due to the diverse, now and then replacing landscape moods. (4) This change sometimes occurs literally in a matter of seconds, not to mention the changes associated with the four seasons. (5) A forest lake from deep blue can instantly transform into silver-lilac, it is worth blowing out of the forest with a light comic breeze. (6) Rye field and birch forest, river bosom and meadow grass change colors depending on the strength and direction of the wind. (7) But besides the wind there is also the sun and the sky, the time of day and night, the new moon and the full moon, warmth and cold. (8) The innumerable change of states and combinations of all this is immediately reflected in the landscape, accompanying it also with the originality of smells, sounds, and then with absolute silence, which happens in the pre-morning season of a white, windless night, or in winter, also completely calm, cold night. (9) Let us recall short, almost black-and-white winter days, accompanied, it would seem, by the same graphics: white fields, black forests and hedges, gray houses and buildings. (10) Even at such a time, the snows have their own shades, but what can we say about a sunny morning and a frosty evening dawn! (11) A person does not yet have such colors, and there are no names for many color states of the sunset or morning sky. (12) To say that the dawn is scarlet (or crimson, or lilac) means almost nothing: the dawn changes its colors and shades every minute, there are some colors on the horizon line, completely different ones a little higher, and the very border between dawn and the sky does not exist ... (13) And what color would you call a winter crust, brightly blinding with the sun's shine, bluish-translucent in the shade and silvery, as if melting under direct rays? (14) The frosty sun gives rise to the same richness of color tones as, for example, warm ... (15) But even with dense clouds, especially before the beginning of spring, the winter landscape is heterogeneous, the snow is either bluish, or with a barely noticeable yellowness, forest distances are either smoky lilac, or slightly bluish with the brown color of a closer vine, with a bluish alder, with clear pine greens and barely perceptible salad color of aspens. (16) Such a pre-spring state is associated with a serene silence, with the smells of snow, wood flesh, hay, stove smoke. (17) And how many states of the night deep-purple sky with clusters of stars going into perspective and infinity! (18) The spring and summer sky changes its colors just as quickly, does not skimp on shades and colors, its generosity in colors is limitless, constantly changing and the green colors of the forest, and the color of the water surface in lakes and rivers. (19) The water is now light, steel, then blue, then blue to an inky density, then suddenly, especially in the silence of the first autumn cold weather, it becomes greenish. (20) One must be deaf and blind or painfully carried away by something detached from one's own, in order not to notice these endlessly changing pictures of the world. (According to V. Belov *)
(1) Берг взял краски, бумагу и пошёл на: (1) Berg took paints and paper and went to the lake. (2) He was in a hurry. (3) He wanted all the power of colors, all the skill of his hands and a keen eye, all that trembled somewhere in his heart, to give this paper, in order to depict the splendor of these forests, dying majestically and simply, at least in a hundredth share. (4) Berg worked like a man possessed. (5) No one has ever seen him like this! (6) Returning to the city, Berg found an exhibition notice. (7) He was asked to indicate how many of his belongings he would display. (8) Berg sat down at the table and quickly wrote: "I exhibit only one watercolor sketch, made by me this summer - my first landscape." (9) It was midnight. (10) Fluffy snow fell outside on the windowsill. (11) In the next apartment someone was playing a Grieg sonata on the piano. (12) Berg wanted to trace the elusive ways in which a clear and joyful feeling of the Motherland appeared in him. (13) It matured for years, but the last impetus was given by the forest edge, autumn, the cries of cranes ... (14) Why? (15) Berg could not find an answer in any way, although he knew that it was so. (16) Berg knew that now he was connected with his country not only with reason, but with all his heart, as an artist, and that love for his homeland made his smart, but dry life warm and cheerful. (17) A hundred times more beautiful than before. (According to K.G. Paustovsky)
(1) Two days later, the antiquarian did not appear. (2) On the fifth day, Anna Vyacheslavovna called him herself. (3) “I'm on a business trip, not in Moscow,” the young man replied. - (4) I will come in two days - and immediately to you with a book. " (5) A week has passed since this conversation. (6) Anna Vyacheslavovna called again. (7) This went on for about a month. (8) In the end, the young man suggested replacing the lost book with Simonov's collected works. (9) “Well, don’t you understand,” Anna Vyacheslavovna almost cried, “there is also the autograph of Alyosha Simonov. (10) This is so important to me. " (11) The young man paused into the receiver. (12) “It's just a book,” he said. - (13) Simonov's poems can be found in any other edition, and the Internet is full of them. (14) And an autograph, well, an autograph. (15) Just a few words written by a long-dead person. (16) Well, sorry, it happened. " (17) After that, he stopped answering calls. (According to N. S. Litvinets)
(1) С возвращением Барберена Реми с ужас: (1) With the return of Barberen, Remy learns with horror that he is not his own son, but an adopted one. (2) One day Barberen found a five-month-old baby on the street with tags cut off on his clothes. (3) Barberen offered to take the boy to him until his parents were found. (4) Judging by his clothes, the child was from a wealthy family and Barberen expected a good reward. (5) Then the Barberen family had their own son, and Barberen's wife was able to feed two. (6) But the Barberens' son soon died, and the woman became attached to Remi, forgetting that he was not his own child. (7) Now Remi becomes a burden and Barberen demands that his wife send him to an orphanage. (8) Barberen, succumbing to the persuasion of his wife, decides to ask the village administration for an allowance for Remy. (9) But he meets a wandering artist Vitalis, wandering with a monkey and three dogs, making his living by performing circus performances. (10) Vitalis offers to buy Remy from Barberen, in order to make him his assistant. (11) Without letting the boy say goodbye to the woman he loves like his own mother, Barberen sells to Remy.
(1) Основатель Tesla Motors Илон Маск за: (1) Tesla Motors founder Elon Musk said that he does not consider Apple as a competitor, despite rumors of an electric car being developed by its specialists, German newspaper Handelsblatt reports. (2) In an interview with the publication, Musk explained his point of view, noting that Apple is accepting engineers fired from Tesla Motors. (3) “We always jokingly call Apple the Tesla graveyard. (4) Those who failed to work in our company go to them. (5) I'm not kidding, ”he said. (6) At the same time, Musk praised Apple for its commitment to electric cars. (7) “It is logical for them to move in this direction if they want to present something truly revolutionary,” he stressed. (8) In his opinion, a new pencil or a larger iPad is no longer enough for Apple to remain an innovator. (9) But, as Musk noted, cars are much more complex than smartphones and watches. (10) The head of Tesla Motors considers Chinese companies to be serious competitors. (11) He explained that in the US alone, there are four start-ups producing electric vehicles valued at over a billion dollars and funded by Chinese businessmen. (12) Officially, Apple has not yet confirmed that it is developing the car, however, information appeared in the media that the novelty, codenamed Titan, will be launched into production by 2019. (13) The company reportedly has no plans to make its first electric vehicle fully autonomous. (14) Apple has hired several experts on self-driving cars, but the possibility of such a project is part of the long-term plans.
(1) Подозреваемый по делу о перестрелке: (1) A suspect in a Hanover bar shootout that killed two people surrendered to authorities. (2) This is reported by The Local. (3) According to the newspaper, 42-year-old German citizen Holger B. surrendered to the authorities of the Spanish island of Mallorca, to which he left after the incident on Tuesday, July 6. (4) The suspect is currently in custody in the capital of the island province, Palma. (5) The incident took place on July 5 in a bar in Hanover. (6) Visitors to the establishment had an argument over the performances of their favorite teams at the World Cup and other soccer championships. (7) After a quarrel, one of the visitors ran out into the street, but soon returned with a pistol and opened fire on his interlocutors. (8) The victims were Italian citizens, 47-year-old Franco Siccu and 49-year-old Giuseppe Longhitano. (9) Initially, only one of the men was reported to have died, but it soon became known that both died from their injuries. (10) It was also not confirmed that the murder suspect was detained by the German police immediately after the incident. (11) According to representatives of the Hanover police, investigators immediately assumed that the suspect had fled to Mallorca, a popular holiday destination among Germans. (12) Up to four million citizens of the Federal Republic of Germany visit the island annually. (13) The Hannover Prosecutor's Office is confident that there will be no problems with the extradition of Holger B. to Germany.
(1) В крупном университетском городе, в: (1) In a large university city, in the family of Sarah and David Shapiro, a university entrant Gersh Rabinovich rented a room for a rather high price. (2) Sarah is surprised that a young man does not understand a word in Jewish, hears for the first time that a Jew should have the right to live in the city, does not know Jewish customs and traditions. (3) Nevertheless, making fun of Gersh, Sarah is pleased with her tenant. (4) A friendly, cheerful young man is engaged for free with the youngest son Filming and with the eldest daughter Betty. (5) Sarah dreams that Syomka will receive a gold medal. (6) At the university, Gersh Rabinovich meets Jewish youths who are trying to enter. (7) He meets the applicants Tumarkin and Lapidus. (8) Tumarkin is outraged by the cowardly Lapidus, who is ready to please the oppressors. (9) Lapidus, in turn, hates those who are outraged by Jews who have converted to Orthodoxy. \"(1) В Новокузнецке Кемеровской области: "(1) In Novokuznetsk, Kemerovo Region, a 16-year-old schoolgirl who killed her stepfather was sentenced to three years in an educational colony. (2) Interfax reports this on March 1. (3) According to the newspaper Komsomolskaya Pravda, the convict's name is Margarita Bagulina. (4) It was established that during a family conflict on July 29, 2010, a girl stabbed her stepfather in the chest with a knife. (5) The man died on the spot. (6) Before the trial Bagulina was left at large under recognizance not to leave. (7) After that, she moved from the house of her mother and stepfather to the house of her own father. (8) Bagulina claims that her stepfather constantly drank, forced her to do all the housework and beat her. (9) According to the girl, her mother supported in all the quarrels stepfather. (10) After the murder, the woman also sided with her boyfriend. (11) She stated that her daughter spent time in a dysfunctional company, and her stepfather tried to resist. (12) The mother claims that her stepfather never beat Margarita and always treated her as well as to her native children. (13) The Bagulina case caused a wide response. (14) According to the local Channel 10, the schoolgirl, who was on her own recognizance, appeared on a TV show, talking about the bullying that her stepfather allegedly subjected her to. "
(1) ЦСКА проиграл «Динамо» в матче 22-го: (1) CSKA lost to Dynamo in the match of the 22nd round of the Russian football championship. (2) The meeting ended with a score of 2: 1 in favor of the "blue-white". (3) The game was broadcasted live by the NTV-Plus Sport Plus TV channel. (4) The score was opened in the ninth minute of the game: Dynamo midfielder Alexey Ionov went one-on-one with the army team goalkeeper Igor Akinfeev, beat the goalkeeper and sent the ball into the net. (5) CSKA got back in the 15th minute thanks to a free kick from the Bulgarian Georgi Milanov. (6) The decisive goal in the 24th minute was scored by the Hungarian midfielder of Dynamo Balazs Djudzak. (7) He scored with an accurate shot from outside the penalty area. (8) Dynamo midfielder Igor Denisov, suspended from work with the main team, did not take part in the meeting. (9) Also, due to injury, the main goalkeeper of the “blue-white” Vladimir Gabulov was unable to play, he was replaced by Anton Shunin. (10) After 21 matches, Dynamo have 39 points and are in fourth place in the standings. (11) CSKA, with 43 points, is in third place. (12) Zenit St. Petersburg is in the lead (54 points), followed by Krasnodar (44 points). (13) The last time CSKA fought against the White-Blue was in September 2009. (14) Since then, the teams have played 13 matches in the Russian championship, a draw has been recorded five times, and Dynamo have won eight times. (15) This victory was the fourth in a row for Dynamo in the matches against the army team.
\"(1) Обвиняемые в убийстве бывшего депу: "(1) The accused of the murder of the former State Duma deputy Ruslan Yamadayev refused to admit their guilt, Interfax reports. (11) Yamadaev was killed on the spot, Kizyun was wounded and hospitalized. (12) The investigation believes that Dadaev was shooting, and Khatsuev was driving a BMW, in which the criminals fled. (13) Dubai police also named Khatsuev a suspect in the attempted murder of Hero of Russia Sulim Yamadayev, who was allegedly killed in the UAE six months after his older brother. (14) Those who ordered the murder of Ruslan Yamadayev have not been identified, their case has been separated into a separate proceeding. "
\"(1) Картина Кузьмы Петрова-Водкина \"В: "(1) Kuzma Petrov-Vodkin's painting Vasya was sold for 1.8 million pounds ($ 2.6 million) at Christie's" Russian auction "on June 8, according to a press release from the auction house. (6) "Animal Farm on the River Bank" by Mikhail Klodt (1858) was sold for 769 thousand pounds (1.1 million dollars). (7) Portrait of a Man (1920) by Boris Grigoriev was sold for 657 thousand pounds (about 950 thousand dollars), "Lying Nude" by Zinaida Serebryakova - for 577 thousand pounds (832 thousand dollars). (9) In the first section and Chrisie's Russian trades lots were 57 paintings; in the course of the auction gained 8 million pounds (11.6 million dollars). (12) Most paid for the painting by Alexander Yakovlev "Titi and Narange, daughter of the leader Eka Bondo" - 2.5 million pounds (3.6 million dollars). "
(1) Посадив медвежонка в мешок и связав: (1) After putting the bear cub in a bag and tying it to the puppy with a rope, Challoner floats on a canoe on the lake. (2) During the swim, Miki, sympathizing with the bear, tries to make friends with him, but he yearns for his mother. (3) During one of these attempts, the shuttle swims through a dangerous place, and the bear and the puppy fall into the rapids. (4) Challoner can do nothing to help them and is sure that they died. (5) But due to its mass and fat, Neeva is unsinkable. (6) It becomes a lifebelt for the puppy tied to it. (7) Finally, the bear manages to cling to a snag, which safely carries them through the rapids. (8) Having got out to the shore, Neeva and Miki find themselves in the forest, which is the home for the bear. (9) But Miki is afraid of unfamiliar terrain, especially since he, like a domestic dog, cannot get food for himself in the forest, unlike Neeva, who feeds on wasps and ants. (10) For Mika, there are dangers in the forest at every turn. (11) Holding together, the animals help each other out and gain experience of survival. (12) Finally, having mastered, they lead a serene life.
(1) Пока командор отсутствует, Лауренсья: (1) While the commander is absent, Laurencia and Frondoso decide to get married - to the delight of their parents and the entire village, which has long awaited this event. (2) In the midst of the wedding and general fun, the commander returns: irritated by the military failure and remembering his resentment against the inhabitants of the village, he orders to seize Frondoso and take him to prison. (3) Laurencia, who dared to raise her voice in defense of the groom, was also taken into custody. (4) The inhabitants of the village gather for a gathering, and opinions are divided: some are ready even now to go to the commander's house and deal with the cruel ruler, others prefer to be cowardly silent. (5) In the midst of the dispute, Laurencia comes running. (6) She looks terrible: her hair is disheveled, she herself is covered in bruises. (7) The girl's agitated story of the humiliation and torture she was subjected to, that Frondoso was about to be killed, makes a strong impression on the audience. (8) Laurencia's last argument - if there are no men in the village, then the women will be able to defend their honor themselves - decides the matter: the whole village rushes to storm the commander's house. (9) He at first does not believe that the inhabitants of Fuente Ovejuna could rebel, then, realizing that this is true, decides to release Frondoso. (10) But this can no longer change anything in the fate of the commander: the cup of the people's patience is overflowing. (11) The commander himself was killed, literally torn to pieces by the crowd, and his loyal servants did not go well.

(1) Кто такие шакалы, Коля узнаёт на сле: (1) Kolya finds out who the jackals are the next day. (3) In a daze, he hands over the soup, and some older girl shares her portion with the boy's younger sister. (4) Kolya understands that these are jackals - starving children who beg in school canteens. (5) The next day Kolya comes to the eighth canteen early due to the canceled physical education. (6) He has in his briefcase a piece of bread that the boy pulled from the sideboard the night before. (7) In the longest queue, right in front of Kolya, a company of impudent and tall guys, led by a big-nosed guy, wedges in. (8) From the gang carries tobacco and "some brute and evil force, with which even adults preferred not to get involved." (9) I did not envy such gangs, there were many of them then, almost in every yard or even class - unrighteous laws, evil and injustice reigned there. (10) Kolya begins to look out for the yellow-faced boy, but sees other jackals, more insolent - they steal food from trays. (11) A neighbor on the table tells Kolya that such jackals can take away not only bread, but also a plate of soup or cutlet. (12) At this moment, Kolya sees a yellow-faced. (13) This time he also takes bread without permission. (14) The robbed girl begins to roar, a hubbub rises, and the yellow-faced man has time to jump out into the street.
(1) Это было несколько лет тому назад. (: (1) This was a few years ago. (2) Everyone preparing to celebrate Christmas prepared trees and gifts. (H) Shop windows and windows of houses shone with festive lights. (4) Garlands and huge colored balls were hung everywhere. (5) A crowd of townspeople, motley, noisy and cheerful, filled the streets. (6) And I, a homeless wanderer, was lonely in a foreign country - no family, no friend, and it seemed to me that I was abandoned and forgotten by everyone. (7) There was only emptiness around and there was no love: a distant city, strangers, cold hearts. (8) Once, in longing and despondency, I suddenly remembered a stack of old letters that I managed to save through all the trials of the dark days. (9) For the first time in the past year I took it out of my suitcase, untied it ... (10) Then I opened the first of the letters - it was a letter to my mother, written twenty-seven years ago. (11) “My dear child, Nikolenka! (12) You complain to me about your loneliness, and if you only knew how sad and painful your words are to me. (13) With what joy I would come to you and convince you that you are not alone and you cannot be alone! (14) But, of course, you know that I cannot leave my dad, because he suffers a lot and constantly needs my care. (15) And you need to prepare for exams in order to successfully graduate from the university. (16) Well, let me at least tell you why I never feel lonely. (17) You see, son, a man is lonely when he does not love anyone. (18) And if he loves, then it does not even occur to him to think about whether he is alone or not. (19) In love, a person forgets himself, he lives in others. (20) And this is happiness. " (According to I.A.Ilyin)
(1) Пришла зима. (2) Тяп-Ляп с удовольст: (1) Winter has come. (2) Tyap-Lyap gladly ate his supplies, but his joy did not last long. (1) Руководство детского лагеря «Артек»: (1) The leadership of the children's camp "Artek" invited the chairman of the Central Election Commission Vladimir Churov to the election of the president of the camp and the children's parliament. (1)С перебитой ногой я лежал у окна сани: (1) With a broken leg, I was lying at the window of an ambulance train with my back to the traffic. (2) The departing terrain opened up in front of me, and therefore I saw these three tanks as we passed them. (3) Opening the hatches, the tankers looked at us. (4) They were without helmets, and we took them for ours. (5) Then the hatches were closed, and this was the last minute, when it was still impossible to assume that in the ambulance train, in which there were probably at least a thousand wounded, other, healthy people could fire from cannons. (6) But that is exactly what happened. (7) The carriages moved with an iron screeching, I was thrown, and I involuntarily groaned, leaning on my wounded leg. (8) I could see through the window how the first wounded, jumping out of the heating stations, fled and fell, because the tanks fired at them with shrapnel. (9) Somehow I crawled out of bed, and the crowd of wounded carried me out to the site. (10) I lay down under the carriage, helpless, languishing with rage and pain. (11) Someone took my hand tightly. (12) It was a nurse. - (13) I'm not going anywhere! - I said. - (14) Leave me! (15) I have a gun, and they won't get me alive. (16) But two nurses grabbed me, and the three of us rolled under the embankment. (17) Romashov flashed somewhere ahead at this minute. (18) Having somehow got over the swamp, we lay down in a small aspen grove: girls, me, Romashov and two slightly wounded soldiers who joined us on the way. (19) I sent these soldiers to reconnaissance, and when they returned, they reported that the Germans were standing in different directions. - (20) You can, of course, leave, but since the captain cannot move independently, it is better to use a railcar. (According to V.A.Kaverin *)
\"(1) В Мосгорсуде присяжные признали ви: "(1) In the Moscow City Court, the jury found the former head of the Moscow department of the Ministry of Property of the Russian Federation Tatyana Naydenova and her deputy Vladimir Polyutov guilty, accused of exceeding powers in the privatization of FSUE Stankoimport. (6) These assets were transferred to 19 companies registered abroad. (1) Министр сельского развития Индии Гоп: (1) India's Rural Development Minister Gopinath Munde had an accident and later died of cardiac arrest, Reuters reported. (8) For an hour, the doctors tried to revive the politician, but could not. (9) After the accident, the minister's driver was arrested. (10) An investigation was launched into the accident. (1) А ещё у Пигмалиона был то ли правнук: (1) And Pygmalion also had either a great-grandson, or a great-granddaughter, by the name of either Kenida, or Kenya. (1) Самолет МЧС с эвакуированными сотруд: (1) The plane of the Ministry of Emergencies with evacuated employees of the Russian embassy in Libya landed at the Domodedovo airport. (2) On October 4, RIA Novosti reports. (3) Flight RF9702 Tunis-Moscow landed at 10:37. (4) According to the Interfax agency, 51 Russian citizens are on board. (5) On October 3, Russian diplomats and members of their families were taken from the Libyan capital Tripoli to neighboring Tunisia, and an Emergencies Ministry plane arrived there for them. (6) At the same time, some diplomats remained in Tunisia to continue negotiations with the Libyan side. (7) On October 2, a protest action took place near the building of the Russian diplomatic mission in Tripoli. (8) The reason for the action was the murder of an officer of the Libyan Army Air Force, in which, according to some sources, a citizen of the Russian Federation Yekaterina Ustyuzhaninova may be involved. (9) She is under arrest. (10) The protesters smashed the gates of the diplomatic mission and set fire to a car parked nearby. (11) The guards opened fire on the attackers, but some of them were able to break into the building. (12) One attacker was killed. (13) The diplomats took refuge in protected premises. (14) Libyan Foreign Minister Mohammed Abdel-Aziz told Russian Ambassador Ivan Molotkov that he could not guarantee the safety of diplomats. (15) After that, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov demanded that Abdel-Aziz resolve the situation as soon as possible.

(4) We have something different: we have such wise men who will speak quite differently with a landowner who has two hundred souls than with the one who has three hundred, and with the one who has three hundred, they will again speak in a different way. as with the one who has five hundred of them, and with the one who has five hundred, again it is not the same as with the one who has eight hundred of them - in a word, even if you go up to a million, everything will have shades. (5) Suppose, for example, there is an office, not here, but in a distant state, and in the office, let's say, there is a ruler of the office. (6) I ask you to look at him when he sits among his subordinates - but simply because of fear you cannot utter a word! (7) Looks out as an eagle, appears smoothly, measuredly. (8) The same eagle, as soon as it left the room and approaches the office of its boss, is in such a hurry with a partridge with papers under its arm that there is no urine. (9) In society and at a party, whether everyone is of a small rank, Prometheus will remain Prometheus, and a little higher than him, with Prometheus, such a transformation will take place, which Ovid would not invent: a fly, even less than a fly, was destroyed into a grain of sand. (10) “But this is not Ivan Petrovich,” you say, looking at him. “Ivan Petrovich is taller, but this one is both short and slender; he speaks loudly, bass and never laughs, but this devil knows what: he squeaks like a bird and laughs all the time. " (11) You come closer, you look - like Ivan Petrovich! (12) "Ehe-he!" - you think to yourself ...
(1)Наукой заниматься трудно. (2)Это хоро: (1) Science is difficult. (2) This is well known to the one who devoted his life to her. (3) A scientific vocation is always associated with a high degree of risk and courage, since a scientist takes on his shoulders a notoriously difficult burden and must show truly sophisticated patience in his work, not to mention the daily drama of his personal struggle with intellectual darkness in the name of achieving clarity ... (4) Scientific thought is remarkable in that it is one of the organizing principles of the human psyche and is aimed at preserving, constantly renewing, correcting, revising the results of its activities. (5) That is why it assumes courage, constancy, perseverance, which gives the everyday work of a scientist a genuine drama. (6) Science is not only difficult. (7) It is necessary to study science. (8) Research activity - a wise teacher - fosters personality, develops memory and observation, accuracy and subtlety of thinking. (9) In my opinion, the more people get research skills, the better the society. (10) With the help of the mind, a person can not only cognize the world, but can, by his will, change the environment, create a new quality that did not exist in nature before. (11) It is not only necessary to engage in science. (12) Science is pleasant to do. (13) Firstly, because the overcome difficulty brings a small, but strong enough, bright happiness, causes the desire to repeat one's own feat and again experience the sweetness of victory. (14) Secondly, because research activity gives meaning to everyday life. (15) Thirdly, because a real scientist enjoys the most rough work done with his own hand. (16) The subject of knowledge is inexhaustible not only for reason, but also for our love, our feelings. (17) "Why have you been doing worms all your life?" One scientist was asked. (18) “The worm is so long, but life is so short,” he replied. (19) These words sounded long ago, and recently in one of the towns of Australia, the Museum of Worms was opened, where visitors are invited to feel like a worm, crawl through the maze, and be "inside" a worm. (20) But it all started, too, with the love of single researchers for their research subjects. (According to V. Kharchenko)
(1) Фантастическая лента Гэвина Худа «Иг: (1) Gavin Hood's science fiction film "Ender's Game", released on November 1, topped the American distribution. (15) Alfonso Cuarón's fantastic film Gravity, which was in third place, has now moved up to fifth position.
\"(1) В Москве совершено покушение на бы: "(1) In Moscow, an attempt was made on the life of the former deputy general director of the Shinnik football club, Yuri Shishlov. (7) The former deputy general director of Shinnik is currently in hospital. (8) His condition is assessed as grave. (9) Law enforcement officers are working at the crime scene. \"(1) Я слушал и чувствовал, что краснею: "(1) I listened and felt that I was blushing. (2)" Well, well! (3) So, then, I'm 'gray'? " (4) At first, of course, I was offended. (5) But then, on reflection, I realized that the cook is absolutely right in her own way. (6) True, in the morning I did not forget to say hello to her, politely avoided when she carried to the table a boiling samovar or a heavy pot of cabbage soup, and getting up from the table, thanked her for dinner. (7) But this did not surprise her. (8) For her, all this was familiar and natural. (9) But these are the gaps in my upbringing , about which there was a speech, were very noticeable. (10) And she could not reconcile with them. (11) However, on my part there was no great fault here. (12) Since childhood I lived in an apartment with running water, ate from a separate plates. (13) I didn’t have to wash over a bucket from a ladle, I didn’t happen to eat from a common artel cauldron. (14) Therefore, I did not know the special rules of behavior that were obligatory for people living in other conditions. (15) they were no less important than the urban ones that I used to obey. (16) This incident made me think for the first time about what a ho well-mannered person. (17) What are actually the rules of conduct that we are obliged to obey? (18) Subsequently, I was convinced more than once that these rules exist in any society, in each collective, in some ways they differ, but in the main they are always the same: respect those around you, reckon with them. (19) By strictly observing the rules of conduct, you will be a good companion to everyone who communicates with you in the family, at school, on vacation. (According to A. Dorokhov) "
(1) Береника беспокоится о своей судьбе: (1) Berenice worries about her fate - Titus's mourning for his father is over, but the emperor is silent. (2) She believes that Titus loves her. (3) Titus suffers and does not dare to tell Berenice that he must abandon her. (4) Berenice cannot understand what she was guilty of. (5) Maybe he is afraid of breaking the law? (6) But he himself told her that no law could separate them. (7) Perhaps Titus learned of her meeting with Antiochus, and jealousy began to speak in him? (8) Titus learns that Antiochus is going to leave Rome, and is very surprised and annoyed - he needs his old friend, with whom they fought together. (9) Titus informs Antiochus that he must part with Berenice: he is Caesar who decides the fate of the world, but is not able to give his heart to the one he loves. (10) Rome will agree to recognize his wife only a Roman woman - "any, pitiful - but only of his blood", and if the emperor does not say goodbye to the "daughter of the East", then "in front of her, the angry people will demand her exile." (11) Titus asks Antiochus to inform her of his decision. (12) He wants his friend, along with Berenice, to go to the East and remain good neighbors in their kingdoms.
\"(1) Глава ЦИКа Владимир Чуров во вторн: "(1) The head of the CEC, Vladimir Churov, on Tuesday, May 8, handed over to Vladimir Putin the certificate of the President of the Russian Federation, Interfax reports. (2) The meeting between Churov and the head of state took place in the country residence of the president in Novo-Ogaryovo. (3) Good afternoon. , Mr. President! (4) Let me give you a certificate, "RIA Novosti quotes Churov. (5) The head of the CEC noted that he is presenting" the only document "certifying that Putin is the president of the country. (6) In response, the head of state thanked Churov, the members Of the Central Election Commission and everyone who worked in the elections. (7) “I know that it was not an easy, hard work, and we worked in difficult political conditions. (8) But they coped with dignity and worked in full accordance with the law. (9) Thank you very much, "Interfax quotes Putin. (10) The President promised to do everything to guarantee the rights and freedoms of citizens of the country, including electoral ones. (11) Vladimir Putin took office as President of the Russian Federation on May 7 (12) After the inauguration ceremony, he was given control of Russia's strategic nuclear forces. (13) Soon after taking office, Putin submitted to the State Duma the candidacy of former Russian President Dmitry Medvedev for the post of prime minister. (14) On the day of the inauguration, opposition supporters held a number of spontaneous actions in the center of Moscow. (15) The actions continued the next day: the opposition gathered first at Kitai-Gorod, and then at Chistye Prudy, staging "unlimited festivities."
(1) Дрезину они нашли под насыпью у разъ: (1) They found the railroad car under the embankment at the crossing. (2) The soldiers and nurses left to pick her up and put her on the rails. (3) Romashov and I were left alone in a small wet birch grove. (4) It is difficult for me to talk about what that day was. (5) We waited and waited endlessly. (6) When leaving, the nurse put her shoulder bag under my head. (7) Obviously, there were crackers in the bag: something snapped when I knocked the bag higher with my fist. (8) Romashov began to whine that he was dying of hunger, but I shouted at him, and he fell silent. “(9) They won't come back,” he said nervously. - (10) They left us. (11) I was probably in a bad mood, because I pulled out my pistol and told Romashov that I would kill him if he didn’t stop whining. (12) He fell silent and, it seems, could hardly restrain himself from crying. (13) It was bad business! (14) Already the first dusk began to sneak into the grove, but the girls did not return. (15) Of course, I did not even think that they could leave on a railcar without us, as Romashov basely assumed. (16) For now, it was better not to think that they would not return. (According to V.A.Kaverin)
(1) Утром 8 апреля на заседании Верховно: (1) On the morning of April 8, a fight broke out at a meeting of the Verkhovna Rada, UNIAN reports. (2) According to RBC-Ukraine, deputies from the Communist Party of Ukraine and the nationalist party "Svoboda" took part in it. (3) The reason for the fight was the speech of the leader of the communists Pyotr Symonenko, who made accusations against the representatives of the current government. (4) Symonenko stated that they contribute to the split of Ukraine and the destruction of its independence. (5) “Today you threw armed people at those who peacefully defended their interests. (6) You are intimidating and arresting people, ”the Communist leader chided the Ukrainian leadership, commenting on the recent events in the east of the country. (7) The speech caused discontent among the deputies from the current ruling party "Svoboda". (8) They ran to the podium and pushed Symonenko out of it. (9) One of the nationalists, according to the NBN, ripped off the microphone. (9) After that, deputies from the Communist Party, as well as the Party of Regions, ran to the podium. (10) A scuffle ensued. (11) Speaker of the Verkhovna Rada Oleksandr Turchinov announced a break in connection with the fight. (12) After the scuffle ended, the Communists and part of the Party of Regions faction, according to LigaBusinessInform, left the meeting room.
\"(1) Бранислав Младич (Branislav Mladic: "(1) Branislav Mladic, a cousin of Colonel General Ratko Mladic, admitted to hiding him in his house in northern Serbia for five years. (2) Serbian newspaper Vecherne Novosti reports. (3) ) "Ratko Mladic is a member of our family, and I refuse to renounce him," Branislav Mladic said in an interview with the publication. (4) Branislav Mladic faces one year in prison and three years of probation. (5) The final court sentence must to be handed down on August 8. (6) Ratko Mladic, the former chief of the general staff of the armed forces of the Republika Srpska, is accused of the massacre that took place in the Bosnian enclave of Srebrenica in 1995 following the capture of the city by Serb forces under the command of Mladic. (7) During the military operation around 8,000 people were killed, from babies to old people. (8) In July 1995, the International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia accused Mladic of war crimes, crimes against humanity and genocide. (9) However, for 16 years, the general fled from justice. (10) Mladic was arrested in May 2011 at the house of his cousin Branislav Mladic, where he was hiding under the name of Milorad Komadic. (11) On June 3, 2011, the general first appeared before the Hague Tribunal. (12) The trial, suspended in May 2012, resumed in July. (13) Mladic does not admit his guilt. (14) If the general is found guilty, he will face life imprisonment. "
\"(1) Американский певец Бек Хансен анон: "(1) American singer Beck Hansen has announced the release of a new, experimental album. (2) The disc, titled" Beck Hansen's Song Reader ", will be released on paper only as a compilation of sheet music. (3) According to the musician's website," Song Reader "will be released in December 2012 by the American publishing house McSweeney's. (4) The collection will include the scores of 20 new compositions by Beck, two of them will be instrumental. (5) It is noted that all the songs have never been released or recorded before. ( 6) So, in order to hear Beck's new songs, fans will have to play them themselves. (7) Among others, the album will feature songs "Do We? (7) We Do "and" Don't Act Like Your Heart Isn't Hard ". (8) The 108-page collection will include illustrations for songs by artists Marcel Zam, Lynn Chapton, Josh Cochran, Jessica Hirsch, abstract by The New York Times journalist Jody Rosen and a foreword by Beck himself. (9) The best musical performances of Beck's new songs will be published on the McSweeney's website. (10) It is unknown whether the author's audio version of the compilation "Beck Hansen's Song Reader" will be released. (11 ) "Beck Hansen's Song Reader" will be Beck's 12th album. (12) His previous album, "Modern Guilt", was released in July 2008. (13) Earlier in 2012, Beck released a joint single with Jack White, "I Just Started Hating Some People Today "."
(1) Банк Snoras, национализированный пра: (1) Bank Snoras, nationalized by the Lithuanian government in November, will repay insured deposits to the population and organizations for five years. (2) This was stated by the Minister of Finance of the country Ingrida Szymonite, DELFI reports. (3) According to her, the Deposit Insurance Fund will receive a government loan in the amount of LTL 3.3 billion to pay compensation. (4) This is substantially more than previously planned. (5) The total amount of compensation should be about LTL 4.1 billion. (6) 1.7 billion is at the disposal of the fund itself. (7) The government expected to lend the missing 2.4 billion to the organization, but revised this amount upward: the country's leadership does not want to rush to sell the securities on the fund's balance sheet in order to avoid losses. (8) The specific need for funds will depend on how quickly people will return the funds invested in the bank. (9) To avoid a rush, the period for issuing compensation was made as long as possible. (10) Snoras was nationalized on November 16. (11) The authorities suspected the shareholders - Russian businessman Vladimir Antonov and Lithuanian Raimondas Baranauskas - of illegal withdrawal of funds. (12) The owners were abroad at that time. (13) Later it became known that Antonov and Baranauskas handed over their passports to the London authorities and were not going to leave England. (14) The bankers were detained on November 25, but then released on bail.
(1)Тогда у нас ещё был только один ребён: (1) Then we had only one child - the eldest son. (2) We were remarkably poor. (3) Ate fried cabbage and buckwheat. (4) They started buying New Year's gifts for the child six months before, not later, because they knew for sure that on the New Year's Eve there would not be enough money for all the surprises he had ordered from Santa Claus. (5) So they lived, acquiring one gift a month: sometimes it took a third of my simple salary. (6) The elder believed in Santa Claus for a very long time, almost until he was eight years old. (7) At least, I remember exactly that in the first grade he reacted to his classmates who shouted that there was no Santa Claus as fools. (8) Every year he made lists: what he wants to get for the holiday. (9) We performed everything according to the list, sometimes adding something from ourselves. (10) And now, I remember, another New Year happened. (11) My wife and I, deep after midnight, laid out a huge bag of gifts under the tree. (12) We went to bed in anticipation - there is no greater joy than to see the happiness of your child. (13) In the morning, at 9 o'clock, we look - he crawls out of his room. (14) The look is concentrated, the forehead is frowned: maybe Santa Claus forgot to come in. (15) I noticed the bag, sat down next to it and let's spread everything. (16) There was an airplane on a string. (17) There was a steamer on a stand. (18) Soldiers of three armies in ammunition terrifying the enemy. (19) A book with gorgeous pictures. (20) When he unloaded all this, we could not see our child from the bed. (According to Z. Prilepin *)
\"(1) Компании \"Ростелеком\" и \"Скарте: "(1) Rostelecom and Scartel, operating under the Yota brand, will be able to deploy LTE networks at the frequencies previously allocated for WiMAX. (2) This statement was made by the head of Roskomnadzor Sergei Sitnikov, writes RBK daily. (3) According to Sitnikov, the implementation of LTE will have to be carried out using the equipment specified earlier in the tender documentation for the allocation of frequencies for WiMAX. (4) The official stressed that the introduction of LTE is "hypothetically" possible. (5) One of the possible methods of re-equipping the equipment under LTE Sitnikov called it a "flashing." (6) Scartel's plans to switch to a more promising LTE standard became known in May 2010. (7) Then it was reported that the company intends to invest up to two billion dollars in this project. (8 ) At the same time, the first LTE networks should appear in five cities of Russia by the end of 2010. (9) At the end of May, Deputy Head of Roskomnadzor Alexander Katulevsky said that the holders of licenses for frequencies allocated for communication networks "Thursday generation "will not be able to deploy LTE networks on their allocated bands instead of WiMAX. (10) However, it was previously reported that the tenders are technologically neutral and do not require the deployment of WiMAX networks. (11) LTE technology allows data transmission at speeds of hundreds of megabits per second. (12) This is several times the maximum data transfer rate in WiMAX networks. (13) So far, LTE networks have been deployed only in Oslo and Stockholm. (14) Similar networks are expected to appear in the US and Europe by the end of the year. "

(1) Старые люди. (2)Сколько их ныне с пр: (1) Old people. (2) How many there are now with outstretched hand. (3) And this lonely elderly woman on the waterfront, with bunches of dry wormwood! (1) Саудовская Аравия отказалась принима: (1) Saudi Arabia refused to accept four pygmy marmosets (a species of small monkeys) from the Swedish zoo due to political differences between the two countries. (2) This is reported by BBC News. (3) The primates were supposed to end up in the Riyadh Zoo. (4) Jonas Walstrom, director of the menagerie located in the Skaansen ethnographic complex in Stockholm, criticized the Saudi side’s decision. (5) “Because of the political situation, they no longer need monkeys. (6) It's pretty funny. (7) Now I can only wait for the Swedish businessmen to need visas again. (8) Maybe they will be introduced for monkeys as well, ”said Walstrom. (9) On March 11, it became known that Saudi Arabia had recalled its ambassador from Stockholm. (10) On March 10, Sweden refused to renew the military agreement with the kingdom of the Middle East. (11) This happened after Riyadh thwarted the March 9 speech by Swedish Foreign Minister Margot Walström to the Foreign Ministers of the Arab League member countries in Cairo. (12) The reason for this was Stockholm's criticism of Riyadh because of the human rights situation in Saudi Arabia, where the remarks of Swedish officials are perceived as interference in the internal affairs of the state. (13) The pygmy marmoset is one of the smallest representatives of the entire order of primates. (14) Their size ranges from 11 to 15 centimeters, and their weight ranges from 100 to 150 grams. (15) These monkeys are common in Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, Bolivia, and Brazil.
(1) Дервиль, симпатизирующий влюблённым,: (1) Derville, sympathetic to lovers, intervenes, wanting to explain the true state of affairs to the viscountess. (2) He begins from afar: in his student years he had to live in a cheap boarding house - there he met Gobsek. (3) Even then, he was a deep old man of a very remarkable appearance - with a "moon face", yellow, like a ferret's eyes, a sharp long nose and thin lips. (4) His victims sometimes lost their temper, cried or threatened, but the usurer himself always kept his cool - it was a "man-bill", "a golden idol". (5) Of all the neighbors, he maintained relations only with Derville, to whom he once revealed the mechanism of his power over people - gold rules the world, and the usurer owns gold. (6) For edification, he talks about how he collected a debt from one noble lady - fearing exposure, this countess handed him a diamond without hesitation, for her lover received the money on her bill. (7) Gobsek guessed the future of the countess by the face of a blond handsome man - this dandy, mot and gambler is capable of ruining the whole family. (8) After completing his law course, Derville was promoted to senior clerk in the solicitor's office. (9) In the winter of 1818/19, he was forced to sell his patent - and asked for one hundred and fifty thousand francs. (10) Gobsek lent money to the young neighbor, taking from him only thirteen percent "out of friendship" - usually he took at least fifty. (11) At the cost of hard work, Derville managed to get even with the debt in five years.
(1) Представители Движения сопротивления: (1) Representatives of the Afrikaner Resistance Movement (AWB) have refused to avenge their leader Eugene Terreblanche, who was killed in South Africa last week. (2) This is reported by BBC News with reference to a statement made by the organization's spokesman Pieter Steyn. (3) According to him, no AWB member is going to use violence. (4) The organization issued this statement after representatives of the ruling party called the African National Congress (ANC) offered their condolences to the Terblanche family. (5) Party leader, President of the Republic of South Africa Jacob Zuma also called on the population to remain calm. (6) Eugene Terblanche was found dead on his farm in northwestern South Africa. (7) According to police, the sleeping 69-year-old politician was beaten to death by workers who were not paid for their work. (8) A 21-year-old man and a 15-year-old teenager have already been arrested in this case. (9) The suspects are charged with murder. (10) Activists of the Afrikaner Resistance Movement opposed the negotiations that preceded the establishment of democracy in South Africa. (11) On the eve of the 1994 elections, they organized several terrorist attacks. (12) Eugene Terblanche himself, who fought for a state for whites, was sentenced to five years in prison for assaulting a gas station employee and attempting to kill a black guard. (13) After his early release in 2004, he was not active in politics.
(1) Новичок владикавказской «Алании» Рой: (1) Royston Drenthe, a newcomer to Vladikavkaz “Alania”, said that he had held negotiations with the Russian team in his own clothing store. (2) This is reported by the "Sports Day by Day" edition. (3) Drenthe was left without a team at the end of the 2011/12 season after being abandoned by English Everton. (4) Since then, he has lived in his native Rotterdam, doing business. (5) Drenthe said that representatives of the Vladikavkaz club came to his store. (6) The footballer did not specify exactly when this happened. (7) “The guys and I chatted for a long time, it turned out that we have a lot in common. (8) The guys told me about the team, their attitude to it and to their homeland ... (9) In fact, it turned out that although we are from different countries, we have a lot in common, ”the footballer said. (10) On February 2, 25-year-old Drenthe signed a three and a half year contract with Alania. (11) The footballer has already joined the new team at the training camp in Turkey. (1) Вы знаете, кто придумывает для вас с: (1) Do you know who comes up with dreams for you? (2) I'll tell you a secret, your pillow brings you dreams. (3) Yes, yes, the one on which you sleep. (4) If she is in a good mood, she will come up with a kind and magical dream for you, but if she is offended by you, then she can come up with a very bad dream, a real nightmare! (5) Therefore, never offend your pillow, it needs to be loved and taken care of. (6) Once upon a time there was one little mouse. (7) He lived with his mom and dad in a cozy burrow. (8) In that hole, everyone had their own room where mice slept, just like people! (9) In their family, everyone had their own pillow: dad had the largest pillow, mom had the smallest mouse, and the mouse had the smallest. (10) But the mouse has always believed that his pillow is the best, most comfortable and soft. (11) In the evenings, the mouse hugged his pillow and said: - You are my favorite pillow! (12) I will never leave you!
(1)Хотя лейтенанта Володина тошнило и го: (1) Although Lieutenant Volodin was nauseous and his head was poured like lead, although he felt terrible weakness, his legs were giving way and his arms were like strangers, he was walking now to his platoon, to the village, to the positions where the battle was still raging. (2) Walked to fulfill the soldier's duty. (3) Behind the dust raised by artillery shells, the extreme Solomkin huts were barely visible. (4) Gaps darted across the field, flashed to the right and left along the highway, and between the gaps, tacking, two "jeep" made their way. (5) Finally, the "Willis" emerged from the fire and suddenly found themselves so close that he clearly saw even the faces of those sitting behind the windshield. (6) He immediately recognized the lieutenant general, a member of the Military Council of the Voronezh Front, who yesterday, together with the commander, inspected the defenses in Solomki. (7) Volodin caught himself, was about to move to the side of the road, but it was already too late, the front "jeep", creaking the brakes, stopped right in front of him. - (8) Injured? The general asked, not waiting for Volodin to report who he was, why he was on the highway, what he was doing and what he was going to do. - (9) No, comrade general, - Volodin answered embarrassedly, noticing how the general was intently examining his face and clothes, and thought: "Now it will fly in!" (10) But a member of the Front Military Council unexpectedly turned to the colonel sitting behind and said: - This is the same lieutenant ... - (11) From machine-gun nests? - (12) Well ... (13) The general and the colonel sitting behind him knew many details of the Solomkin battle, they also knew about Volodin, how he was sent to the machine-gun nests, how he got hit by a tank and how a soldier, risking his life, saved him, their commander. - (14) There? - (15) Yes, to the company, comrade general! - (16) Have you released? (17) Discharged? - (18) He left himself, - Volodin added and thought that lying under the bombs is much easier than standing in front of the general. (19) Although he was worried, he was still pleased that he had told the truth. (According to A.A. Ananiev)
\"(1) Глава Чечни Рамзан Кадыров рассказ: "(1) The head of Chechnya, Ramzan Kadyrov, spoke about plans to create tourist bases in the mountainous regions. (1)От нашего класса у меня остались восп: (1) From our class, I have memories and one photograph. (2) Group portrait with the homeroom teacher in the center, girls around and boys around the edges. (3) The photo has faded, the edges, blurred even during the shooting, are now completely blurred; sometimes it seems to me that they have blurred because the boys of our class have long passed into eternity, and did not have time to grow up, and their features were dissolved by time. (4) Of forty-five people who once finished 7 "B", nineteen survived to gray hair. (5) For some reason now I don't want to remember how we ran away from lessons, arranged a crush in the locker room in order to touch at least for a moment the one that we loved so secretly that they did not admit it to ourselves. (6) And also, since childhood, we played what we ourselves lived with. (7) Classes competed not for grades or percentages, but for the honor of writing a letter to Papanin's people or calling themselves "Chkalovsky", for the right to attend the opening of a new plant shop or to select a delegation to meet the Spanish children. (8) And I also remember how I grieved that I would not be able to help the Chelyuskin people, because my plane made an emergency landing somewhere in Yakutia, and did not reach the ice camp. (9) The most real fit: I got "bad" without learning the poem. (10) Then I learned it: “Yes, there were people in our time ...” (11) And the point was that there was a huge homemade map on the wall of the class and each student had his own plane. (12) An excellent rating was given for five hundred kilometers, but I got "bad" and my plane was taken off the flight. (13) “Bad” was not just in the school magazine: it was bad for me myself and a little - a little! - Chelyuskinites, whom I let down. (14) I spend hours looking at a faded photograph, at the already blurred faces of those who are not on this earth: I want to understand. (15) After all, no one wanted to die, right? (16) And we did not even know that a war was on duty outside the threshold of our class. (17) We were young, and the ignorance of youth is filled with faith in our own immortality. (1) Молодой лейтенант Джованни Дрого, ис: (1) The young lieutenant Giovanni Drogo, filled with bright hopes for the future, is assigned to the Bastiani fortress, located next to the endless Tatar desert, from where, according to legend, enemies came. (1) Людочка задумалась об отчиме. (2) Ка: (1) Lyudochka thought about her stepfather. (2) How difficult he was, but recklessly grew into the economy. (6) Lyudochka was very surprised to see how his stepfather - “a man with a shaved head turning graying on all sides, with deep furrows on his face, all in tattoos, squat, long-armed, slapping himself on the belly, suddenly jumped along the shallows, and hoarse a roar of joy burst out of the burnt or corroded insides of a person she did not know much, ”Lyudochka began to guess that he had no childhood. (9) From an early age in exile and in camps, under escort and guardianship in a state bathhouse. (1) Берг собирал ягоды шиповника и пахуч: (1) Berg collected rose hips and fragrant junipers, carefully examined the autumn leaves. (2) At sunsets, flocks of cranes flew over the lake to the south with a chirp. (3) For the first time, Berg felt a stupid offense: the cranes seemed to him to be traitors. (4) They abandoned without regret this desolate, forest and solemn land, full of nameless lakes and impassable thickets. (5) It started raining in September. (6) Yartsev was about to leave. (7) Berg got angry. (8) How could you leave in the midst of this extraordinary autumn? (9) Berg felt Yartsev's desire to leave now in the same way as he once had a flight of cranes - it was treason. (10) What? (11) Berg could hardly answer this question. (12) Treason to forests, lakes, autumn, finally, a warm sky drizzling with frequent rain. “(13) I stay,” Berg said sharply. - (14) I want to write this autumn. (15) Yartsev left. (16) The next day Berg woke up from the sun. (17) Light shadows of branches trembled on the clean floor, and a quiet blue spread beyond the door. (18) Berg met the word "radiance" only in the books of poets, considered it pretentious and devoid of clear meaning. (19) But now he understood how exactly this word conveys that special light that comes from the September sky and sun. (20) Berg took paints and paper and went to the lake. (According to K.G. Paustovsky)
\"(1) Генеральный директор московского ф: "(1) The general director of the Moscow football club Spartak, Valery Karpin, called the decision of the Russian Football Union (RFU) to soften the limit on legionnaires in Russian football as lawlessness. (1) Современное общество озабочено тем,: (1) Modern society is concerned that language has begun to change. (2) The expansion of written language is especially noticeable, which displaces oral speech from different spheres. (H) If earlier we communicated, spoke primarily orally, and written speech nevertheless served to store, to transmit information at a distance, after a while, then today written speech, displacing oral from some areas of dialogue, acquires a kind of orality. (4) There are different ways of revitalizing written speech, giving it orality. (5) Actually, this is what its current changes consist of. (7) I think not. (8) I think that, of course, there are people who completely go to the Internet, and this is not normal. (9) But for many it is salvation, because there are people who are still not adapted for oral communication, who are too shy. (10) And here they may well feel confident; someone is lonely, but on the Internet you can always find an interlocutor. (11) And what is significant: the Russian language, as we know, came out on the Internet, took the second place. (12) In fact, it goes on a par with the German language, lagging very far behind English, but nevertheless ... (13) And the more the Russian language is present on the Internet, the more it experiences the pressure of the new conditions of communication ... (14) But I think the younger generation is finding some sort of reasonable balance. (15) Of course, if we look at, say, fifty and twenty, we see that their relationship to social networks is different. (16) For a fifty-year-old or sixty-year-old, there is a question: to start functioning on social networks or not to start? (17) But for a twenty-year-old, this question, in principle, is not. (18) That is, he will be a black sheep if he does not start. (19) So in that sense, the world has changed. (20) There is more written speech, it has become more oral, but still people are not numb, just the existing balance has been slightly disturbed - it is unusual for us, but so far, it seems to me, there is no way back. (1) В Америке прибывшую труппу встречает: (1) In America, the arriving troupe is met by Madame Chernyak. (1) В мартовском и апрельском номерах жу: (1) The story of Marina Golubitskaya “That's all love” was published in the March and April issues of the Ural magazine for 2004. (2) It is dedicated to the Perm literature teacher, famous in the 70-80s, Elena Nikolaevna (the surname in the story has been changed, but the name and patronymic are not). (3) And I knew Elena Nikolaevna well. (4) Under Soviet rule, she was survived from the elite school: they did not love then, so that the person stood out with intelligence and sincerity - oh, how they did not love! (5) And she went to work in a school for working youth, where I just served as a librarian. (6) In fact, it only seemed to me that I knew Elena Nikolaevna well! (7) I knew, but I did not know! (8) The story contains letters from Elena Nikolaevna, many of her wonderful letters. (9) Deep, vivid letters, in which her love for her students, her memory of each of them so struck me! (10) I cried for a long time when I finished reading the story, and these were enlightened, grateful tears. (11) I felt happy both because Marina Golubitskaya wrote this wonderful story about a wonderful man, and because this man - Elena Nikolaevna - lived in Perm, my city! (12) And most of all I was pleased with the thought that in fact "time is an honest person." (13) How the teacher loved her students! (14) And they reciprocated her! (15) When Elena Nikolaevna ended up abroad, where she suffered from nostalgia, loneliness and illness, the students wrote, came, helped, wrote again, came again ... (16) And the same Marina Golubitskaya dreams someday - there - again to meet with Elena Nikolaevna and sit with her on the bench, as it happened, to talk to his heart ... (According to N. Gorlanova *)
(1) Чтобы завоевать Полиньку, нужно врем: (1) It takes time to conquer Polinka. (1) Мужчины со злорадством рассуждают: с: (1) Men with gloating reason argue: Empedocles has surrendered, and deserves him. (2) He thought too much of himself, revealed divine secrets to the rabble, which should have remained the property of some priests. (3) His influence on the people was harmful - all these impudent speeches about a new life, which should replace the old, familiar way of life, calls not to obey the original customs and traditional beliefs. (4) A person should not violate the limits set for him, rebellion turned into defeat for Empedocles. (5) As he withdrew from everyone, word spread that the gods took him alive to heaven. (6) The people are accustomed to considering Empedocles a prophet, sorcerer, demigod, it is necessary to overthrow him from his pedestal, expel him from the city. (7) Let fellow citizens see him as a broken spirit, having lost its former eloquence and extraordinary abilities, then it will cost nothing to restore them against Empedocles. (8) Empedocles is tormented - it seems that pride ruined him, the immortals did not forgive him for trying to become equal with them, turned away from him. (9) He feels powerless and devastated - he subdued nature, mastering its secrets, but after that the visible world lost its beauty and charm in his eyes, everything in him now seems petty and unworthy of attention. (10) Moreover, he still remains misunderstood by his compatriots, even though they worship him. (11) He never succeeded in raising them to the height of his thought.
(1) Полиция, мстя за убийство капитана,: (1) The police, in revenge for the murder of the captain, suspend profitable activities that are carried out in violation of the law. (2) This brings a loss to all five families in New York, and since the Corleone family refuses to extradite the murderer, the civil war of 1946 begins in the underworld.
