(1) В городе Оленегорск Мурманской облас: (1) Vladimir Doronin, a defendant in the case of embezzlement in housing and communal services, died in the city of Olenegorsk, Murmansk region. (2) Flash Nord reported on September 2. (3) Doronin was admitted to the city hospital on August 30, and died on September 2 in the morning. (4) The cause of death was not disclosed. (5) Lawyer Vasily Ananiev said only that the relatives of the deceased would seek his posthumous rehabilitation in court. (6) Doronin was the general director of the management company Housing and Communal Services Olenegorsk. (7) According to the investigation, he did not transfer the heating payment for the period from September 6, 2012 to January 20, 2013 to the municipal enterprise Olenegorsk Heating Networks. (8) As a result, the company suffered damage in the amount of RUB 49 million. (9) Doronin was charged with abuse of power in February. (10) He was under house arrest. (11) The second person involved in the case was Elena Parkhomchuk, director of UK ZhilKomfort LLC, was detained, the investigation will petition for her arrest. (12) It is assumed that her company did not transfer money to power engineers from October 30, 2012 to January 20, 2013. (13) According to the investigation, Housing and Utilities Service Olenegorsk and Management Company ZhilKomfort are affiliated with companies controlled by the former adviser to the governor of the Murmansk region, ex-head of the company Kolenergosbyt, Gennady Shubin. (14) He was arrested in the fall of 2013 on suspicion of embezzling 430 million rubles. (15) In total, about ten cases were initiated on the fact of embezzlement in the Murmansk housing and communal services system.
(1) Около 2200 г. Магистром становится И: (1) Around 2200, Joseph Knecht becomes the Master, having passed all the way that the Castalians pass. (2) His name means "servant" and he is ready to serve truth and harmony in Castalia. (3) However, the hero only temporarily finds harmony in the play of glass beads, for he increasingly sharply senses the contradictions of the Castalian reality, intuitively tries to avoid the Castalian limitations. (4) He is far from scientists like Tegularius, a lone genius who has shut himself off from the world in his passion for sophistication and formal virtuosity. (5) The stay outside Castalia in the Benedictine monastery of Mariafels and the meeting with Father Jacob have a great influence on Knecht. (6) He thinks about the paths of history, about the relationship between the history of the state and the history of culture and understands what is the true place of Castalia in the real world: while the Castalians are playing their games, the society from which they move farther and farther may find Castalia a useless luxury. (7) The task, Knecht believes, is to educate young people not outside the walls of libraries, but in the "world" with its harsh laws. (8) He leaves Castalia and becomes the mentor of his friend Designori's son. (9) Swimming with him in a mountain lake, the hero dies in icy water - so the legend says, as the chronicler leading the story says. (10) It is not known whether Knecht would have achieved success on his way, one thing is clear - one cannot hide from life in the world of ideas and books.
(1) Британский бренд Paul Smith обновил: (1) British brand Paul Smith has revamped its 531 bike line, HighSnobiety reports. (2) The new collection includes T-shirts, leggings, shorts and jackets made from ultra-light breathable materials. (3) The priority in the creation of the garment was to provide air access to the skin of the athletes and to reduce perspiration. (4) The garments are brightly colored in natural shades and, according to the brand representatives, are ideally combined with each other, both aesthetically and in terms of hygiene and comfort. (5) Collection prices range from $ 150 for a tee to $ 640 for a waterproof jacket. (6) British fashion designer Paul Smith opened his first store in Nottingham in 1970. (7) Initially, he only produced clothes for men. (8) In 1998, the first women's collection Paul Smith was released, later a children's line. (9) The range of the brand includes clothing, shoes, accessories, household items. (10) The 531 cycling line has been produced by the brand since 2014. (11) In 2000, Queen Elizabeth II conferred a knighthood on Paul Smith. (12) In September 2015, the designer opened a brand boutique in Moscow.
(1) Прошли годы, Волшебная страна раздел: (1) Years passed, Fairyland was divided into parts, warring among themselves. (2) In one of the states, Prince Bofaro planned to overthrow his father, King Naranya, from the throne. (3) The conspiracy was discovered, and the father imprisoned his son with his family, with all the conspirators and their families in the dungeon forever. (4) This is how the land of underground miners appeared. (5) Its inhabitants tamed the terrible monsters with six legs and dragons that lived in the underground. (6) Gradually, these people became unaccustomed to sunlight and came to the surface only at night to exchange the precious stones they had mined underground for food. (7) Prince Beauforo had seven sons. (8) In order not to offend anyone, Beauforo decreed: each heir will rule the country one by one, for a month. (9) The heirs lived in a palace divided into parts, each of which was painted with one of the colors of the rainbow. (10) Each king had his own ministers, and they made their own laws. (11) Ordinary people worked hard to satisfy the whims of the rulers. (12) Since there was no change of day and night in the underground country, the time was recognized by the hourglass followed by the Keeper of Time.
(1) По возвращении из краёв далёких заса: (1) Upon returning from distant lands, I planted my vegetable garden in the village with all kinds of woody varieties, mountain ash and viburnum. (2) One mountain ash nestled near the side of a modern concrete road, on a steep skid, was crushed by the wheels of cars, scratched, crumpled. (H) I decided to dig it up and take it to my wild garden. (4) It was in the fall. (5) Several dusty leaves and two crumpled rosettes of berries survived on the mountain ash. (7) And every summer, every autumn she was decorated with one or two rosettes, and she became so bright, so elegant and self-confident - you can't take your eyes off! (8) And if a warm autumn fell out, the mountain ash tried to bloom a second time. (9) Two years later, the seedlings were brought from the city nursery, I planted four more mountain ash in an empty place. (10) These went in breadth. (11) Barely one or two rosettes of berries will grind out, but the greenery is already lush on them, but the leaves are already swarms, such imposing young ladies from city lands. (12) And my wild game is quite adult and cheerful. (13) One autumn, a particularly bright berry grew on it. (14) And suddenly a flock of waxwings fell on top of her, together the birds began to feast on the berry. (15) And they talk, talk: this is the kind of mountain ash we found, what kind of yummy summer has in store for us. (16) In about ten minutes the crested elegant workers cleaned out the tree, but they did not even sit down on those from the nursery. (17) I thought, then, when there is less food left in the forests and gardens, the birds will certainly come. (18) No, they didn't. (19) In the following autumn, if waxwings happened to fly into my forest, which had grown over the garden, they habitually sat down on the wild ashberry and, as before, on those nursery trees, lazily torturing out several outlets, they never once did. (According to V. Astafiev)
\"(1) Джон Малкович поставит спектакль,: "(1) John Malkovich will direct a play based on critical reviews of his production of The Infernal Comedy: Confessions of a Serial Killer, according to ContactMusic. (2) Premiere of" Infernal Comedy " "took place in July 2009 at the Vienna Ronacher Theater. (3) The role in the production was about Jack Unterweger, the serial killer of prostitutes, whose role was played by Malkovich. (4) Soon after the premiere, it became known that the play would go on a European tour. (5) ) In the summer of 2010, "Infernal Comedy" was shown in Turkey as part of the XVII International Theater Festival in Istanbul. (6) The performance was extremely negatively received by critics. (7) However, Malkovich drew attention to one review, which, according to the actor, was " funny and well-written. "(8) Moreover, John even found it possible to partially agree with the author's point of view. (9)" I am generally inclined to self-criticism, "said the actor. (10) Especially for the text of the review was on music is written. (11) The production was called "The Malkovich Torment". (12) In 2011, the actor intends to come to Istanbul again - this time with a new performance. (13) In addition, he expressed a desire to personally meet with the author of the review that inspired him to create Malkovich's Torment. "
(1) В Пакистане при посадке потерпел ава: (1) A United Nations helicopter crashed while landing in Pakistan, Agence France-Presse reports, citing statements from UN and Pakistani officials. (2) The incident took place in the area of ​​the village of Dadu in Sindh province. (3) According to UN spokesman Barry Came, the helicopter made an emergency landing on the water. (4) He was involved in the delivery of food to the victims of the August 2010 floods. (5) According to Iqbal Memon, a spokesman for the local authorities, the helicopter required an emergency landing due to a technical malfunction. (6) According to the agency, there were 12 people on board the helicopter. (7) At the same time, the Associated Press reported 13 passengers on the helicopter. (8) As a result of the accident, several people received various injuries. (9) The exact number of victims is not named. (10) According to RIA Novosti, five of the crew members on board are Russians. (11) UN spokeswoman Jackie Dent told the agency about this. (12) According to her information, in addition to the Russians, among those who were in the helicopter were four Pakistanis, two Australians and one citizen of Sudan. (13) The Russian diplomatic mission does not yet have accurate information on the citizenship of the helicopter pilots. (14) According to Tural Dzhamalov, attaché of the Russian Consulate General in Pakistan, we can talk about Russian-speaking citizens of other countries.

(1) Действие происходит в течение нескол: (1) The action takes place over several days in January 1947 in the town of Olinger, Pennsylvania. (2) The novel begins with the words "Caldwell turned away and an arrow pierced his ankle." (3) The class laughs, but Caldwell the centaur, meanwhile, has no time for laughter, he feels a piercing pain that "shot up the thin core of the lower leg, drilled the gyrus of the knee and, expanding, raging, poured into the stomach." (4) Caldwell, a biology teacher, wrote the estimated age of the earth - 5 billion years - on the blackboard at the moment the arrow hit his leg. (5) The class continued to laugh, not allowing the centaur to "be left alone with pain, measure its strength, listen to how it will freeze, carefully dissect it." (6) At this time, the pain already "launched tentacles into the skull," and the teacher thought that he was "a huge bird, awakened from sleep." (7) The pain spread even further. (8) She “with furry paws pressed the heart and lungs; so she got close to her throat, and now it seemed to him as if his brain was a piece of meat, which he lifted high on a plate, saving from predatory teeth. (9) The students jumped on the seats of their desks and continued to “poison” the teacher. (10) He leaves the class. (11) While the teacher wanders along the corridor, he already fully feels like a centaur, and the plumage of the arrow scratches the floor, scratching the wound. (12) He is sick, dizzy. (13) French speech, history lesson, singing is heard from the classrooms.
(1) Урсула с беспокойством наблюдает за: (1) Ursula observes with concern the extravagances of the descendants. (2) War, fighting cocks, bad women and delusional undertakings - these are the four disasters that caused the decline of the Buendía clan, she believes and laments: the great-grandchildren of Aureliano Segundo and José Arcadio Segundo collected all family vices, not inheriting a single family virtue. (3) The beauty of the great-granddaughter of Remedios the Beautiful spreads the destructive spirit of death around, but here is a girl, strange, alien to all conventions, incapable of love and not knowing this feeling, obeying free attraction, ascends on freshly washed and hung out to dry sheets, picked up by the wind. (4) The dashing reveler Aureliano Segundo marries the aristocrat Fernanda del Carpio, but spends a lot of time outside, with his mistress Petra Cotes. (5) José Arcadio II breeds fighting cocks, prefers the company of French getters. (6) His turning point occurs when he miraculously escapes death by shooting striking workers at the banana company. (7) Driven by fear, he hides in the abandoned room of Melquíades, where he suddenly finds peace and immerses himself in the study of the sorcerer's parchments. (8) In his eyes, the brother sees a repetition of the irreparable fate of his great-grandfather. (9) And it starts to rain over Macondo, and it pours for four years, eleven months and two days. (10) After the rain, lethargic, slow people cannot resist the insatiable gluttony of oblivion.

(1) Так он движется по кругам своего про: (1) So he moves in the circles of his process, being drawn into the funnel of strange and impersonal procedures, and the more he seeks to protect himself, the more surely he harms his own business. (1) Футбольный клуб «Спартак-Нальчик» сн: (1) Football club "Spartak-Nalchik" will withdraw from the championship of the Football National League (FNL) and lose its professional status. (2) Acting Minister of Sports and Tourism of Kabardino-Balkaria Aslan Afaunov stated this, RIA Novosti reports. (3) According to Afaunov, the club has multimillion-dollar debts to the players, and it is not possible to cover them from the republic's budget. (4) We also failed to find a sponsor for the team. (5) Financial difficulties for Spartak-Nalchik began in December 2013 after the resignation of Arsen Kanokov from the post of head of Kabardino-Balkaria. (6) After that, the Sindika holding set up by Kanokov stopped funding the team. (7) On December 30, Andzor Belimgotov, who served as chairman of the club's board of directors, called Spartak's financial situation difficult, but not critical. (8) On December 31, Belimgotov was dismissed. (9) Spartak-Nalchik scored 30 points in 23 matches of the FNL season 2013/14. (10) The team is ranked 12th in the standings. (11) Earlier it was reported about the possible withdrawal from the tournament of Vladikavkaz "Alania", which is in second place in the FNL. (12) A decision on the future of this team can be made on 12 January. (13) FNL clubs often face financial difficulties. (14) In the summer of 2013, the Metallurg-Kuzbass club was expelled from the FNL, which could not be licensed. (15) Before the start of the 2012/13 season due to financial difficulties and the revocation of licenses, the FNL lost four teams at once.
(1) Страшнее всего было громадное, на дв: (1) Most terrible of all was the huge, on the two middle pages, to a shiver of gloomy image of Louvain burning from the German bombing. (2.) There were flames, and puffs of smoke like cotton wool, and running people, and ruined houses, and searchlights in the ominous sky. (3) In a word, it was so terrifying and captivating that there was no strength to turn the page. (4) It seemed to me that nothing more terrible and majestic could be. (5) Now I remember this picture: it was well executed. (6) I still remember every detail in it, every curl of swirling smoke, and it suddenly becomes quite clear to me how powerless, helpless art is. (7) No puffs of smoke, no tongues of flame licking the sky and ominous reflections can convey the feeling that I am experiencing now, sitting on the shore in front of burning Stalingrad. (According to V.P. Nekrasov)
\"(1) До двух миллионов человек выросло: "(1) The number of demonstrators in Tahrir Square in Cairo and surrounding areas has grown to two million. (2) Qatari TV channel Al-Jazeera, which broadcasts live from the scene, reported on its blog. (3) February 1 in the capital, the opposition "March of the Million" is being held, the participants of which demand the resignation of President Hosni Mubarak. (1) Однажды тигр, встретив зебру, завёл: (1) Once a tiger, having met a zebra, started a conversation with her: - Tell a zebra, why do you walk on the plain calmly and are not afraid of me? (2) - I can see you from afar, and I know that I can easily hide from you behind the branches by jumping into the bushes. (3) After all, I do not just walk all in stripes. (4) They help me disappear among the branches whenever someone is about to hunt for me, - she answered warily. (5) - Ah, zebra, your stripes are so beautiful. (6) Could you share with me, you have a lot of them! The tiger continued the conversation. (7) - I know that you are cunning, but I am not as stupid as you think. (8) As soon as I give you my stripes, I will have even more enemies. (9) And I will no longer be able to hide behind the branches, because you will be there. (10) But the tiger was not only cunning, he was also wise. (11) After a little thought, he suggested: - Let's conclude a contract with you. (12) You give me some stripes, and I will go hunting to distant lands, where we will never meet. (13) And you will have one fewer enemies. (14) After a little reflection, the zebra threw off some of the stripes on the ground and disappeared behind the branches of the bushes. (15) Since then, no one has seen the bright red tiger in the edges. (16) He kept his word and went into the most distant and dense forests. (17) There he became the real king of his domain, thanks to his extraordinary new and beautiful skin.
(1) Очередная размолвка с нелюбимой жено: (1) Another quarrel with his unloved wife leads to the fact that he gets into the car and drives wherever they look, as if hoping to break out of the vicious circle of everyday worries and troubles. (2) But, having reached West Virginia, the Rabbit still cannot stand it and, turning the car around, returns to his native Pennsylvania. (3) Not wanting, however, to return to the disgusted house, he comes to Mr. Totero, his former school coach, and he lets him spend the night. (4) The next day, Totero introduces him to Ruth Lenard, with whom the Rabbit begins a relationship that does not, however, resemble love at first sight. (5) Meanwhile, Janice, worried about the sudden disappearance of her husband, moves to her parents. (6) Her mother insists that the police be involved in the search for the fugitive, but her husband and daughter are against. (7) They prefer to wait. (8) A young ward priest Jack Eccles comes to their aid. (9) He is generally distinguished by a desire to help his parishioners, among whom there are too many in need of comfort. (10) Sparing neither time nor energy for those entrusted to his care, Eccles is in stark contrast to the priest of the Angstrom parish. (11) The old man Kruppenbach does not approve of the "vanity" of his young colleague, believing that the true duty of a clergyman is to set a positive example to his flock with his own exemplary behavior and unshakable faith.
\"(1) Сотрудники правоохранительных орга: "(1) Law enforcement officers detained one of the leaders of the gang, which is suspected of kidnapping the son of the vice-president of Rosneft, Mikhail Stavsky. According to the investigation, the group that headed by Gorchkhanov, was engaged in the abductions of Moscow entrepreneurs. (6) The ransoms received for the release of prisoners, criminals sent to the needs of the bandit underground in the Caucasus. \"(1) Члены южноафриканской организации: "(1) Members of the South African Organization Against Cruelty to Animals (SPCA) released a python that was used by a local sangoma as a medium to communicate with spirits. (2) Sangoma took money from football fans, promising to ensure the success of their team at the World Championships, BBC News reports. (3) During the World Championships, the sorcerer specially brought a python named 2010 to Cape Town from Natal. (4) Sangoma told fans that with the help of the python he could contact the ancestral spirits and ask them to ensure success national team. (5) Which teams the sorcerer promised to lead to success is not specified. (6) According to the SPCA spokeswoman Sarah Scart, the python was kept in "absolutely unacceptable conditions." (7) The reptile was diagnosed with pneumonia, a disease of the oral cavity, and also lack of weight and dehydration. (8) Python (2.8 meters long) has already been referred for treatment at the veterinary center and should recover. (9) Scart added that the sorcerer is not charged not presented, but SPCA finds out how the python was transported from Natal to Cape Town. (10) In South Africa, special permission is required to transport such animals. (11) The rescued python is scientifically called the dark brindle python or the Burmese python. (12) It is a subspecies of the brindle python. (13) As noted by BBC News, the cult of ancestors in South Africa is widespread. (14) Sometimes animals are sacrificed to propitiate the spirits, and sometimes the Sangomam use animals as mediums (intermediaries) to communicate with the spirits. "
(1) Новый секретарь осваивается быстро:: (1) The new secretary is quickly mastered: after three months, the Marquis considers Julien to be a completely suitable person for himself. (2) He works hard, is silent, understanding and gradually begins to handle all the most difficult cases. (3) He becomes a real dandy and fully masters the art of living in Paris. (4) The Marquis de La Mole presents the order to Julien. (5) This calms Julien's pride, now he is more relaxed and does not feel offended as often. (6) But with Mademoiselle de La Mol he is emphatically cold. (7) This nineteen-year-old girl is very smart, she is bored in the company of her aristocratic friends - Count Kelyus, Viscount de Luz and the Marquis de Croisenois claiming her hand. (8) Once a year, Matilda wears mourning. (9) Julien is told that she is doing this in honor of the ancestor of the Boniface de La Mol family, beloved of Queen Margaret of Navarre, who was beheaded on April 30, 1574 in the Place de Grève in Paris. (10) Legend has it that the queen demanded the head of her lover from the executioner and buried it in the chapel with her own hand.
(1) Прокуратура Черногории сняла обвинен: (1) The Prosecutor's Office of Montenegro has dropped charges of theft of electricity from the former financial director of the aluminum plant in Podgorica, Dmitry Potrubach. (4) He explained that the court had not yet had time to change the measure of restraint for him. (5) Montenegrin investigators believed that Potrubach, as director of the plant, had stolen electricity from the European network in the amount of 9.64 million euros. (6) According to the Russian, the law enforcement agencies were never able to provide the materials on the basis of which he was accused of this crime. (7) The prosecution of the Trumpet by the law enforcement agencies of Montenegro began in the summer of 2013. (8) In July, he was detained for 30 days. (9) After the court decision was appealed by Oleg Deripaska's company En +, the financial director was released on bail. (10) The Russian Foreign Ministry also stood up for Potrubach after his arrest. (11) En + holds a 29.3% stake in the Podgorica mill. (12) The same share belongs to the Montenegrin authorities. (13) Shortly before the arrest of Potrubach, the authorities of Montenegro launched a bankruptcy procedure for the plant. (14) Deripaska's company argued that the actions of the local authorities were pressure on the creditors and shareholders of the aluminum plant.

(1) Уинстон решает вести дневник. (2) Эт: (1) Winston decides to keep a diary. (2.) This crime is punishable by death or hard labor camps, but he needs to throw out his thoughts. (3) They are unlikely to reach the future: the police of thought will get to it anyway, thought crime cannot be hidden forever. (4) Winston doesn't know where to start. (5) He recalls the morning two minutes of hatred in the ministry. (6) The main object of two minutes of hatred has always been Goldstein - a traitor, the main defiler of party purity, an enemy of the people, a counter-revolutionary: he appeared on the TV screen. (7) In the hall, Winston met a freckled girl with thick dark hair. (8) He disliked her at first sight: such young and pretty were "the most fanatical adherents of the party, swallowers of slogans, voluntary spies and sniffers of heresy." (9) O'Brien, a high-ranking party member, entered the hall. (10) The contrast between his good manners and the physique of a heavyweight boxer was puzzling. (11) Deep down, Winston suspected that O'Brien was “politically not entirely right”.
(1) Дэвид Боумен решает сесть на Япет в: (1) David Bowman decides to board Iapetus in the capsule, and her approach awakens the forces trapped in the Stargate. (2) The top face of the black monolith suddenly goes deep, the capsule begins to fall into the bottomless shaft. (3) This is the opening of the Stargate. Time stops - the clock stops counting the seconds - but perception and consciousness continue to work. (4) Bowman sees the black walls of the "mine", and in the gap there are myriads of stars "scattering" from the center. (5) He is aware that something is happening with time and space that is beyond his understanding, but does not feel fear, feeling that he is under the protection of an infinitely powerful Reason. (6) It ends up being hundreds of light years away from Earth. (7) The capsule aspires to a giant red star, to the kingdom of flames, but when the journey ends, Bowman thinks that he has gone mad - he is in an ordinary earthly hotel. (8) Only after a while does he realize that all this is a decoration made by the hosts for a guest on a television movie two years ago. (9) Bowman goes to bed and falls asleep for the last time in his life. (10) It merges with the cosmic mind, losing its physical body, acquires the ability to move in time and space by the effort of thought, and saves the home planet from an impending nuclear catastrophe.
(1) Медленно налаживаются отношения Рут: (1) Ruth and Rabbit's relationship is slowly improving, but when something akin to closeness arises between them, Eccles's call returns the hero to the past - Janice was in the hospital and is about to give birth. (2) Rabbit informs Ruth of his decision to return to his wife and try to help her in this difficult hour. (1) О-Сан и Моэмон поселились в глухой д: (1) O-San and Mauemon settled in a remote village, and at first everything went well, but then Mauemon yearned for the capital and went there, although he had no business there. (2) He walked past the pond and saw the face of the moon in the sky, and in the other water a reflection, just like he and O-San, and his sleeve was moistened with silly tears. (3) He got to the busy streets of the capital, wandered along them for a long time, breathing in the familiar air of the joys and joys of the capital, and accidentally heard conversations about himself. (4) Friends praised him for his bravery - he seduced such a beauty, and even the owner's wife! (5) - for this it is not a pity to pay with his life, while others assured that he was a living creature, but only hiding somewhere with O-San. (6) Hearing about this, Mauemon rushed to run through the lanes and yards out to the outskirts of the city. (7) Then he saw wandering artists performing on the street, he stopped to look. (8) According to the play, one of the heroes kidnapped a girl - and it became very unpleasant for him. (9) Yes, then he also saw the wife of Mrs. O-San among the audience! (10) The spirit was seized from Mauemon, he froze, almost dizzy with fear and again began to run.
\"(1) МЧС России предложило геологическо: "(1) The Russian Emergencies Ministry proposed the US Geological Service to unite to monitor and predict strong earthquakes. (2) Vladislav Bolov, head of the All-Russian Center for Emergency Monitoring and Prediction of the Ministry of Emergency Situations (Antistikha center), said this. . (4) As a first step in this direction, the head of Antistikha called “putting in order the legislative framework.” (5) As an example, Bolov cited the accident at Fukushima: “Russian rescuers. (6) They could have joined the operation earlier, if not for the contradictions in the regulatory framework of the two countries. "(7) Efforts are proposed to concentrate mainly on the Pacific region. (8) Bolov referred to the fact that the United States and Russia in this there are “certain achievements.” (9) He also noted that in recent years there has been an increase in the number of strong earthquakes. (10) Bolov also said that Russia and the United States should cooperate on the asteroid hazard. (11) “Monitoring is now well established large and medium-sized asteroids. (12) The most vulnerable link is the monitoring of small asteroids, which can cause big problems on earth. (13) For example, if an asteroid about a hundred meters in diameter falls into the ocean, it can cause a powerful destructive tsunami with catastrophic consequences, "RIA Novosti quoted Bolov as saying."
\"(1) Питерский хоккейный клуб СКА начал: "(1) The St. Petersburg hockey club SKA began negotiations with goalkeeper Ilya Bryzgalov, who plays for the Phoenix Coyotes in the NHL. \"(1) В Кемеровской области направлено в: "(1) In the Kemerovo region, the case of a man who calls himself a wandering monk was sent to court. (9) The police began to explain how to get to the destination by bus. (10) But soon the interlocutor seemed suspicious to them, and they decided to check him on the bases. (1) Бывший главный тренер московского «Л: (1) Former head coach of Lokomotiv Moscow and Rostov, Miodrag Bozovic, who is now head of Serbian Crvena Zvezda, spoke about raising Serbs in love for Russia. (1) Вскоре в библиотеке происходит сканд: (1) Soon a scandal breaks out in the library. (2) One of the library servants, who has been following the Self-Taught Man for a long time, catches him when the latter sits in the company of two boys and strokes one of them on the hand, accuses him of baseness, that he sticks to children, and, giving him with a fist, kicks him out of the library in disgrace, threatening to call the police. (3) On Saturday, Roquentin arrives in Paris and meets with Annie. (4) For six years, Annie has grown very stout, she looks tired. (5) She changed not only externally, but also internally. (6) She is no longer obsessed with "perfect moments", for she realized that there will always be someone who will spoil them. (7) Previously, she believed that there are certain emotions, states: Love, Hatred, Death, which give rise to "winning situations" - building material for "perfect moments", and now she realized that these feelings are inside her. (8) Now she remembers the events of her life and arranges them, correcting something, into a chain of “perfect moments”. (9) However, she herself does not live in the present, she considers herself a "living dead". (10) Roquentin's hopes for renewing relations with Annie are dashed, she leaves for London with a man who is in custody, and Roquentin intends to permanently move to Paris. (11) He is still tormented by the feeling of the absurdity of his existence, the consciousness that he is "superfluous."
(1) Такие опасные разговоры ведутся в от: (1) Such dangerous conversations are conducted in the absence of a cultural leader, whom the general calls a secret employee of the Gestapo, and where Schmidt-Lausitz directs culture - a "cesspool." (1) Действие — в Тавриде перед храмом Ар: (1) Action - in Tauris in front of the temple of Artemis. (2) Iphigenia comes out to the audience and tells them who she is, how she was saved in Aulis and how she now serves Artemis in this Scythian kingdom. (3) The service is difficult: all the foreigners who are brought here by the sea are sacrificed here to Artemis, and she, Iphigenia, must prepare them for death. (4) What happened to her father, mother, brother, she does not know. (5) And now she had a prophetic dream: the Argos palace collapsed, there is only one column among the ruins, and she dresses this column as foreigners are dressed here before the victim. (6) Of course, this column is Orestes; and the death rite can only mean that he died. (7) She wants to mourn him and leaves to call her servants for this. (8) While the stage is empty, Orestes and Pylada enter it. (9) Orestes is alive, and he is in Taurida; they are assigned to kidnap an idol from this temple, and they are looking closely at how to get there. (10) They will do this at night, and they will wait out the day in a cave by the sea, where their ship is hidden. (11) There they go, and Iphigenia returns to the stage with a chorus of servants; Together with them, she mourns Orestes, and the evil fate of her ancestors, and her bitter lot in a foreign land.
(1) В те отдалённые прежние времена приб: (1) In those distant former times, at approximately the same level of the collapse of civilizations as we observe now, harsh, denouncing prophets arose among the nations, and then barefoot, simple-haired ideas, with anger, sword and torch in hand, burst into reality to produce the necessary sanitary cleaning. (2) Nature has spent too much hope and effort on man to let him die so easily and like a dog. (3) For the last century, the machine of civilization has been operating at critical speeds with the risk of fatal overload. (4) The dust of moral wear suspended in the air burned the breath more and more. (5) It would seem that our contemporaries have no grounds for special pessimism. (6) After all, everything is moving around so systematically. (7) Progress is in good health and rushes forward at full gallop. (8) Showcases overflowing with goods sparkle, streams of passers-by, tourists, all kinds of modern cars move along the streets. (9) Air liners cover the distances in a day that Marco Polo and Afanasy Nikitin took three years to cover. (10) The whole world is pasted over with fascinating posters, calling with the help of various means to quietly while away the boredom of life. (11) Museums are no longer enough for cutting-edge works of art, and inquisitive sciences with extraordinary efficiency are probing the surrounding unknown in order to derive benefit from there for further pleasures. (12) Everyone has in their hands outlandish devices that make it possible to communicate almost with the North Pole, which would terrify our ancestors who did not know anything about technology. (13) But look how the arrows of the manometers that determine the spiritual well-being in the world tremble, how the burnt fumes spread from overheated underfoot, overstressed wires, how the excessively hot air burns the face, what suspicious hums crawl along the ground not only from the awakening of the continents or the emergence of innovative ideas, but also from something ... (14) You experience something similar in a dream, when, sneaking up to the door, you hear behind it the hidden breath of some indescribable creature that is just waiting to insert a knee, a small crack will open slightly and burst into your warm, habitable housing. (15) The impression is that humanity has approached the end of the modest eternity allotted to it. (16) And science, with a running start breaking through the zero phase of time and physical existence, will burst into another, not yet mastered mathematical space with the transfer of the intellectual capital of the universe there. (17) The now obvious collapse of yesterday's era will end with the inevitable revision of the sadly unjustified pairing of Good and Evil. (18) Knowledge helps to look into the abyss, but does not contain instructions on how not to fall into it. (19) The very progress should be likened to the burning of the fuse-cord: our happiness lies in the fact that it is not visible how little is left before the charge. (According to L. M. Leonov)
(1) Три портрета королей династии Тюдоро: (1) Three portraits of Tudor kings from Britain's National Portrait Gallery will be sent for restoration. (2) The Daily Telegraph writes about it. (3) Among the paintings awaiting work with the restorers is a portrait of Elizabeth I, created around 1575. (4) This is one of two large portraits of the Queen believed to have been painted by the English painter Nicholas Hilliard (circa 1547-1619). (5) The large-scale canvas is an important work in the work of Hilliard, who became famous mainly for the portrait miniatures of the courtiers of the monarch. (6) The varnished portrait of Elizabeth I turned significantly yellow, as a result of which the color of the paint layer was distorted. (7) During the restoration, the painting must return to its original appearance. (8) Together with the portrait of the Queen, two paintings depicting Edward VI, son of Henry VIII, will be restored. (9) Both canvases are by an unknown artist. (10) According to the publication, one of them depicts Edward with his dying father, pointing to his heir. (11) This painting was painted during the reign of Elizabeth I (1558-1603). (12) How much is planned to be spent on restoration is not reported. (13) However, it is known that the funds to finance the work will be directed by Bank of America Merrill Lynch, which is carrying out a large-scale art restoration project Art Conservation Project. (14) The collaboration with the National Portrait Gallery is one of the bank's 24 restoration projects to be implemented this year in 16 countries.
(1) Житель Северной Каролины Эрнесто Род: (1) North Carolina resident Ernesto Rodriguez took his dog to a tattoo artist for a session, WGHP reports. (2) A 4-month-old American Bulldog got a tattoo on the belly. (3) According to the owner of the animal, named Duchess, during the procedure, his pet was asleep and she was not in pain. (4) Rodriguez stated that the tattoo is a distinctive feature of his pet's appearance. (5) His second dog, Duke, also got a tattoo. (6) As the American explained, the tattoos were made "just in case": if something happens to the dogs, for example, they are lost, they will be easily identified and returned to the owner. (7) When the Duchess got a tattoo, its owner posted photos of the result of visiting the salon on his Facebook. (8) Most of those who saw these pictures criticized Rodriguez and accused him of cruelty to the dog. (9) He, however, stated that he did not consider the tattoo to be cruel. (10) According to the North Carolina, tattooing, even on a dog, is an art. (11) The owner of the Duchess also emphasized that he loves his dogs very much and treats them as attentively and reverently as he treats his own children. (12) He does not intend to give up the practice of tattooing dogs in the future. (13) According to Rodriguez, he will also get tattoos for his future pets. (14) Animal welfare organizations did not comment on the situation.
(1) Певец Мэрилин Мэнсон подвергся напад: (1) Singer Marilyn Manson was attacked by a man in a cafe in Alberta, Canada, NME reports. (2) The musician was hit in the face. (3) According to a spokesman for Manson, the incident was unprovoked. (4) As the publication clarifies, when the vocalist was having dinner in a cafe, two girls approached him and asked to be photographed with him. (5) At this time, an unknown person first pushed Manson, and then hit him and shouted that he would try to disrupt his next concert. (6) Witnesses confirmed that the musician was calm and friendly and did not give any reason for aggressive actions towards him. (7) They also added that Manson was bleeding after being hit. (8) The singer himself did not comment on the incident. (9) Marilyn Manson is an American rock musician, showman and artist. (10) His stage name is a combination of the names of two iconic figures - the actress Marilyn Monroe and the killer Charles Manson. (11) The musician's previous album, Pale Emperor, was released in January 2015. (12) Manson's work is often viewed negatively. (13) For example, in June last year, a musician's concert in Novosibirsk was canceled after 400 local residents spoke at a rally. (14) The townspeople claimed that Manson's lyrics were "a mixture of obscenity, drug propaganda, sexual perversion and insults to the Christian faith." (15) The musician's performance was also disrupted in Moscow.
(1) Правоохранительные органы Турции пре: (1) Turkish law enforcement authorities prevented a terrorist attack at Istanbul's Ataturk airport by detaining an alleged suicide bomber. (2) On Thursday, September 8, Sabah reported. (3) The intelligence services received information that Ebru Firat, a woman close to one of the leaders of the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK, considered terrorist in Turkey), Murat Karayilan, was sent to Istanbul from Diyarbakir. (4) Firat was detained, it is not specified whether she had a suicide belt. (5) Security measures have been strengthened at the airport. (6) More than 30 people were killed in the bombings at Istanbul airport. (7) On June 28, three terrorists opened fire with automatic weapons near the Istanbul airport, after which two of them set off explosive devices inside the terminal, the third at the entrance to the building. (8) 43 people died, more than 200 were injured. (9) The Turkish leadership stated that the Islamic State group was behind the attack. (10) The police detained 13 suspects of involvement in the attack. (11) Among them are three foreigners. (12) Akhmed Chatayev, a native of Chechnya, who has been on the federal wanted list since 2008, is suspected of organizing the attack. (13) According to law enforcement agencies, he emigrated to Europe several years ago. (14) Chataev allegedly worked for the leader of the Caucasus Emirate grouping Doku Umarov, and after the latter's death he joined the Islamic State (both groups are banned in Russia).
(1) Прометей предлагает в награду за осв: (1) Prometheus offers to reveal the future to Zeus as a reward for his release. (2) He, first doubting the prophetic gift of the titan, immediately surrenders: Prometheus guesses unmistakably that Zeus is going on a date with Thetis - Nereis, one of the sea goddesses. (3) And Zeus warns: if a Nereid bears him a son, he will overthrow his father from the Olympic throne. (4) Convinced and even slightly moved by this prediction, Zeus refuses the fatal date and orders the blacksmith god Hephaestus to release Prometheus. (5) Called to account for his cruel tricks, Eros asks Zeus to have mercy on him, for he is, they say, still a child. (6) “Are you a child ?!” exclaims an indignant Zeus. (7) - After all, you, Eros, are much older than Ialeth. (8) Because you do not have a beard and gray hair, you want to be considered a child, although you are an old man, and, moreover, a scoundrel! " (9) As punishment for numerous bullying, Zeus intends to bind Eros. (10) After all, it was by his grace that he was forced, in order to win the love of women, to turn into a bull, an eagle, a swan, a satyr, and could not appear to them in his true form.
(1) Экшн Watch Dogs можно будет пройти п: (1) Action Watch Dogs can be completed with little or no kills. (2) Senior director of the game Dominique Gue told about this in an interview with Polygon. (3) According to him, a stealthy walkthrough, in which the main character does not need to kill anyone, will be available in about 95 percent of all missions in the game. (4) The number of tasks in which murders still have to be performed is very limited. (5) Thus, in most cases, how exactly one episode is played - to kill everyone in a row or not to attract attention - depends entirely on the player. (6) Watch Dogs is an open-world action game set in Chicago. (7) Its main character is a hacker named Aidan Pierce, who is connected to the city's control system and thanks to this is able to manipulate city objects. (8) So, Pierce is able to change the color switching mode at traffic lights, suspend the movement of trains in the subway, and also turn off and turn on electricity. (9) The hero is also able to learn personal information about ordinary inhabitants of the city and gain access to their funds. (10) He can also find places where crime will occur in the near future and prevent it. (11) With the help of his skills, Pierce will try to take revenge on people who, in his beliefs, are to blame for the tragedy that happened to his family. (12) Watch Dogs will be released in November. (13) The game will be released on PS3, Xbox 360, PC, Wii U and next generation consoles Xbox One and PS4.
(1) Флешмоб с хештегом #ForceForDaniel (: (1) A flash mob with the hashtag #ForceForDaniel (#PowerForDaniel) unfolded on social networks, reports The Telegraph. (2) The participants asked the creators of the seventh episode of "Star Wars" to show the picture to American Daniel Fleetwood, a cancer patient. (3) A man may not live to see the official premiere in December. (4) As the newspaper notes, 32-year-old Fleetwood from Texas has a malignant tumor of the salivary glands. (5) He was confident that he could watch the tape, but the disease began to progress. (6) The man has been fond of Star Wars since he was eight and was among the first to buy tickets for the latest films in the franchise. (7) On Twitter, actors from the movie saga - Mark Hamill and John Boyega joined the action. (8) Disney executives, director JJ Abrams and the film's producers have not yet responded to the flash mob. (9) Abrams faced a similar situation before. (10) In 2013, he hosted a private screening of the unfinished version of Star Trek: Retribution for a cancer patient with a few weeks left to live. (11) "Star Wars" is a fantastic film epic directed by George Lucas. (12) Consists of the original trilogy (1977-1983) and the prequel trilogy (1999-2005). (13) The seventh film, The Force Awakens, is the start of a new sequel trilogy that will continue in 2017 and 2020. (14) In the USA, the novelty will be released on December 18, in Russia - on the 17th.
(1) Под Цюрихом, в психиатрической лечеб: (1) Near Zurich, in the psychiatric hospital of Dr. Domler, his friend and colleague Franz Gregorovius works. (2) The daughter of the American millionaire Nicole Warren has been in this hospital for three years; she lost her mind, becoming the mistress of her own father at sixteen. (3) The program of her recovery included correspondence with the Diver. (4) For three years, Nicole's health has recovered so much that she is going to be discharged. (5) After seeing her correspondent, Nicole falls in love with him. (6) Dick is in a difficult position: on the one hand, he knows that this feeling was partly provoked for medicinal purposes; on the other hand, he, who “collected her personality from pieces,” like no one else, understands that if this feeling is taken from her, then an emptiness will remain in her soul. (7) And besides, Nicole is very beautiful, and he is not only a doctor, but also a man. (8) Contrary to reason and advice from Franz and Domler, Dick marries Nicole. (9) He is aware of the fact that relapses of the disease are inevitable - he is ready for this. (10) He sees a much bigger problem in Nicole's wealth - after all, he does not marry her money (as Nicole Baby's sister thinks), but rather in spite of them, but this does not stop him either. (11) They love each other, and in spite of everything, they are happy.
(1) Британец Бен Хупер, пытающийся перес: (1) Briton Ben Hooper, trying to swim across the Atlantic Ocean, covered only 67 nautical miles (about 124 kilometers) in the first 18 days. (2) The Daily Mail notes that at this rate he will not reach the goal until 2018. (3) A 38-year-old man who was a former police officer in Gloucestershire began swimming on November 13 in Senegal. (4) According to The Guardian, he plans to spend 10 hours a day in the water and reach the Brazilian city of Natal by March. (5) On the way he is accompanied by a ship with 10 people on board, including a representative of the Guinness Book of Records. (6) Hooper attributed the delay to unforeseen difficulties. (7) The special repellent with which he expected to scare away jellyfish does not work. (8) Sharks swim around, and big waves turn the swimmer over and over. (9) To top it off, a fish of the Pegasus family climbed into his ear. (10) "Jellyfish sting me constantly, and we saw sharks twice," Hooper wrote on Facebook. (11) He also reassured readers that neither he nor his team consumed alcohol during the expedition. (12) The first swimmer to cross the Atlantic was the Frenchman Benoit Lecomte. (13) In 1988, he sailed from Massachusetts to the United States to France in 73 days. (14) The Guinness Book of Records did not count the record because the swimmer spent a week in the Azores due to seasickness. (15) In October, it was reported that a resident of the state of Colorado (USA) swam without stopping a record distance of 132 kilometers. (16) The marathon swim lasted 56 hours.
\"(1) ДНК-экспертиза подтвердила подлинн: "(1) DNA examination confirmed the authenticity of the remains recovered from the grave of the Romanian dictator Nicolae Ceausescu. (2) Agence France-Presse reported on November 3. (3) According to the agency, DNA samples recovered from the remains matched the materials, taken from the brother and son of Ceausescu. (4) Thus, the ownership of the remains to the dictator is almost certain. (5) Experts say that complete certainty could be achieved only if they had any genetic material taken from Ceausescu during his lifetime. (6) The examination of the remains, presumably belonging to Ceausesco's wife Elena, has not yet been completed. (7) Nicolae Ceausescu led Romania since 1965. (8) In December 1989, the dictator was overthrown. (9) Ceausescu and his wife were recognized guilty of genocide and sentenced to death. (10) A short trial was broadcast on television. (11) The verdict was carried out immediately after the broadcast. (12) First, the bodies of the executed were taken to the Steaua stadium. (13) Then the new authorities announced that the dictator and his wife were buried in the Genç cemetery, located next to the stadium. (14) In the summer of 2010, Ceausescu's relatives, who doubted the official version of the dictator's burial place, obtained the exhumation of the remains in order to identify them. "
\"(1) Марихуану для гостей вечеринок Сил: "(1) Marijuana for party guests Silvio Berlusconi was delivered on his private plane. (2) According to The Daily Telegraph, this information is contained in the testimony of a prostitute Nadia Macri, who twice provided sexual services to the Italian Prime Minister. (7) According to Macri, the impresario Lele Mora introduced her to the politician. (8) Mora had previously appeared in the testimony of another prostitute who calls herself Ruby. (9) About her relationship with Berlusconi became known at the end of October. (10) At first it was reported that she slept with the prime minister when she was underage.
