(1) До второй мировой войны, в середине: (1) Before World War II, in the mid-thirties, Faber dated a girl named Hanna. (2) They were bound in those years by a strong feeling, they were happy. (3) Ganna got pregnant, but for personal reasons and, to a certain extent, due to the instability of the political situation in Europe, she told Faber that she would not give birth. (4) Faber's friend, the physician Joachim, was to undergo an operation to terminate the pregnancy. (5) Shortly thereafter, Hanna fled from the mayor's office, where she was supposed to register her marriage with Faber. (6) Faber left Switzerland and went alone to work in Baghdad, on a long business trip. (7) It happened in 1936 (8) In the future, he knew nothing about the fate of Hanna. (9) Herbert reports that after the departure of Faber, Joachim married Hannah and they had a child. (10) However, they divorced after a few years. (11) Faber makes some calculations and comes to the conclusion that the child born to them is not his. (12) Faber decides to join Herbert and visit his longtime friend in Guatemala.
(1) Бывший главный тренер «Адмирала» Сер: (1) Former Admiral head coach Sergei Svetlov will head Lada Togliatti from next season, which returned to the KHL after a four-year absence. (2) The club's official twitter reports. (3) Andrey Pyatanov will be Svetlov's assistant. (4) The contracts with both specialists are signed for two years. (5) Under the leadership of Svetlov, who replaced Admiral's head coach Hanna Yortikka, the Vladivostok club made it to the playoffs, where in the first round they lost to the future Gagarin Cup winner, Metallurg Magnitogorsk. (6) The 53-year-old specialist has already headed Lada in the 2009/10 season. (7) After that he worked in the Khabarovsk "Amur" and the Moscow region "Atlanta". (8) In addition to the Togliatti team, the Finnish Jokerit and Sochi Leopards will debut in the league this season. (9) Lada played in the first two seasons of the KHL. (10) In 2010, the team was expelled from the league due to financial difficulties. (11) Since that time, the club has played in the Major Hockey League (VHL). (12) In the 1990s, Lada won the Russian championship twice (in 1994 and 1996). (13) In 1997, the club became the winner of the European Cup.
(1) Правоохранительные органы установили: (1) Law enforcement agencies have identified the suicide bomber who organized the terrorist attack on the Central Market of Vladikavkaz. (2) RIA Novosti reports about it on September 9. (3) It turned out that a man named Archiev was driving the exploded car. (4) The owner of the car was a person named Dobriev. (5) 20 minutes before the attack, this car crossed the border of North Ossetia and Ingushetia. (6) The attack took place near the main entrance to the Central Market in the late morning of September 9. (7) A suicide bomber blew up a car filled with 30-40 kilograms of explosives. (8) According to the latest figures, 15 people were killed and about 80 injured. (9) There are four children among the injured, two of them are in serious condition. (10) A criminal case was initiated in connection with the terrorist attack. (11) Experts fear that terrorists will soon arrange new explosions in Vladikavkaz. (12) All law enforcement agencies and power structures of the city were transferred to an enhanced regime of service. (13) The students of all schools were sent home. (14) Reports on the terrorist attack to Russian President Dmitry Medvedev were read by the director of the FSB of the Russian Federation Alexander Bortnikov, the head of North Ossetia Taimuraz Mamsurov and the plenipotentiary in the North Caucasus Federal District Alexander Khloponin. (15) The president ordered the latter to go to North Ossetia in person.
(1) Во время бала-маскарада султан выслу: (1) During the masquerade ball, the sultan listens to the treasures of the townspeople: some want pleasure, others - money. (2) And after the ball, two officers almost kill each other: Amina, Alibeg's mistress, gave hope to Nasses! (3) But the treasure of Amina admits that it was not Nasses who gave hope, but his stately lackey. (4) How stupid men are! (5) Think that such little things as ranks and titles can deceive a woman's treasure! (6) The officers recoil from Amina in horror, and the Sultan listens to the treasure of Cypriot - a withered person who wants to be considered a blonde. (7) In her youth, she danced in the Moroccan theater; owner - Megemet Tripadhud brought her to Paris and abandoned her, but the courtiers were seduced by the Moroccan woman, and she earned a lot of money. (8) However, great talents need a big stage. (9) Cypriot labored in the sweat of her brow in London, Vienna, Rome, Spain and India, visited Constantinople - but she did not like the country where treasures sit under lock and key, although Muslims are distinguished by the ease of the French, the ardor of the English, the strength of the Germans, and resilience. Spaniards and a touch of Italian sophistication. (10) Then Cypriot worked gloriously in the Congo, and becoming useless for anything, she picked up a noble and wealthy good-natured husband. (11) The treasure-traveler talks about his adventures in English, Italian, Spanish and Latin, but the author does not recommend translating these obscenities to ladies.
(1) Пока идут длительные переговоры межд: (1) While there are lengthy negotiations between women and Tetahiti, Parcel indulges in bitter reflections: not wanting to shed blood, he killed his friends. (2) If he had sided with the Tahitians after the first murder, he could have saved Baker, Jones, Hunt - perhaps even Johnson and White. (3) Tetahiti promises not to kill Parcel, but demands that he leave the island, since he no longer wants to deal with the deceitful, insidious "Peritani". (4) Parcel requests an extension until the baby is born. (5) Soon, little Ropati is born, and this becomes a huge event for the entire colony - even Tetahiti comes to admire the baby. (6) And women hypocritically pity the "old" leader: he is already thirty years old - he will overreach with his wives. (7) Having exhausted the theme of the inevitable death of Tetahiti, the women start another song: the Tahitians are too black, the peritani are too pale, and only Ropati has the skin that is needed - if Adamo leaves, no one will have golden children. (8) Tetahiti listens unperturbed, but eventually breaks down and invites Parcel to try out the boat. (9) They go out to sea together. (10) The Tahitian asks what Adamo will do if Peritani land on the island. (11) Parcel answers without hesitation that he will defend freedom with arms in hand.
(1) После этого страшного первого утра д: (1) After this terrible first morning, Gregor began a humiliated monotonous life in captivity, with which he slowly became accustomed. (2) He gradually adapted to his ugly and clumsy body, to his thin tentacle legs. (3) He discovered that he could crawl on walls and ceilings, and even loved to hang there for long periods. (4) While in this terrible new guise, Gregor remained the same who he was - a loving son and brother, going through all the family worries and suffering from having brought so much grief into the lives of loved ones. (5) From his confinement, he silently eavesdropped on the conversations of his relatives. (6) He was tormented by shame and despair, since now the family was without means and the old father, sick mother and young sister had to think about earnings. (7) He painfully felt the disgust that the closest people felt towards him. (8) Mother and father for the first two weeks could not bring themselves to enter his room. (9) Only Greta, overcoming her fear, came here to quickly get out or put a bowl of food. (10) However, Gregor was less and less suitable for ordinary food, and he often left the plates intact, although he was tormented by hunger. (11) He understood that his sight was unbearable for his sister, and therefore he tried to hide under the sofa behind the sheet when she came to clean.
(1) Курсанта Омского танкового инженерно: (1) A cadet at the Omsk Tank Engineering Institute was sentenced to eight years in a strict regime colony for taking hostages. (2) RIA Novosti reports about it on August 5. (3) Cadet Denis Gaponenko was found guilty of taking hostages, illegal imprisonment, hooliganism, attempted murder, as well as theft and illegal carrying of weapons and ammunition. (4) Gaponenko himself admitted his guilt in part. (5) During the investigation, he voluntarily compensated his ex-girlfriend for moral damage in the amount of 50 thousand rubles, paid 30 thousand rubles each to two other victims, and also paid for the repair of an apartment damaged by shots from a machine gun. (6) On December 18, 2009, Gaponenko learned that his girlfriend was going to leave for work in Italy for three months. (7) He was so outraged by this news that he voluntarily left the post, taking a submachine gun with him. (8) A cadet caught a taxi and broke into the apartment of three friends of his girlfriend. (9) He forced them to trick her into the apartment, after which he began to forcibly hold all four hostages in the room. (10) The offender did not present any intelligible demands. (11) Father Gaponenko was summoned to the scene. (12) After negotiations with him, the cadet agreed to release the hostages and surrendered. (13) None of the hostages were injured.
(1) Мартин Иден становится наконец знаме: (1) Martin Eden is finally becoming famous, but he is deeply indifferent to all this. (2) He receives invitations from those people who previously ridiculed him and considered him a bum, and sometimes even accepts them. (3) He is comforted by the thought of going to the Marquesas Islands and living there in a reed hut. (4) He generously distributes money to his relatives and people with whom he was tied by fate, but nothing can touch him. (5) Neither the sincere ardent love of the young worker Lizzie Conolly, nor the unexpected arrival of Ruth to him, now ready to disregard the voice of rumor and stay with Martin. (6) Martin sails to the islands in the Mariposa, and by the time he leaves, the Pacific Ocean seems to him no better than anything else. (7) He understands that there is no way out for him. (8) And after several days of sailing, he slips out into the sea through the window. (9) To deceive the will to live, he draws air into his lungs and dives to great depths. (10) When all the air runs out, it is no longer able to rise to the surface. (11) He sees a bright, white light and feels that he is flying into a dark abyss, and then consciousness leaves him forever.
(1)Трудное и запутанное дело — писательс: (1) Writing is a difficult and confusing business. (2) A writer should not observe life, but live in life, observing it not from the outside, but from the inside. (3) Meanwhile, the usual life story of a writer is as follows: he succeeded in a thing, drew attention to himself - and quits his previous job and becomes a professional. (4) And now a man sits down to write not when he needs to say something, but when he needs to pay the rent, sew a coat for his wife. (5) And before our eyes a fresh sprout of talent turns yellow and dries. (6) And there is no longer a writer. (7) An aspiring writer, if he respects and values ​​his talent, should not “live” with literature. (8) Get a livelihood with anything you like, but not by writing. (9) The time will come, and the same writing by itself will begin to feed you with the works written earlier. (10) Not to mention this, but a writer, becoming a professional, pulls himself out of life himself. (11) The usual environment for him now is fellow writers, section meetings, restaurants, a writers club. (12) Cooking in its own juice. (13) And then he goes somewhere, walks with a notebook and "collects material." (14) You need to live in life, work - as an engineer, doctor, teacher, worker. (15) - Well, when will I write it then? - you ask. (16) - After work. (17) On days of rest. (18) In a month of vacation, - I will answer. (19) - Will you write a lot then? (20) - And it's very good that not much: everything that is written then will be complete, you need. (According to V. Veresaev)
(1) Пользователь Twitter под ником korow: (1) A Twitter user under the nickname korowin drew attention to the Instagram account of the girl Elena Smirnova, whose photos no one liked. (2) The microblogger invited his subscribers to support the child with the help of likes. (3) According to the user, he went to Smirnova's profile thanks to a comment she left under one of the posts of Moscow Mayor Sergei Sobyanin. (4) The girl wished the mayor good night. (5) Smirnova started an Instagram account in June. (6) All summer she published selfies and photographs from her vacation in the country. (7) At the time of this writing, almost every photo of the girl has collected more than a hundred likes, and the last selfie posted - almost 400. (8) In the comments, in addition to words of support, users argue about whether it is right to pay too much attention to the fact that they came to her page from Twitter. (9) There are also offensive comments under the girl's posts. (10) Their author does not comment on the recording. (11) In the spring of 2016, 11-year-old Stepan became the hero of Runet, whose mother asked to support his page on VKontakte. (12) Peers ridiculed his hobby for dinosaurs, and a friend laughed at him for having few likes on his page. (13) As a result, tens of thousands of "like" marks appeared under the student's notes. (14) Stepa was supported by famous people, the boy became a hero of the stories of several TV channels and appeared on the air of the show "Evening Urgant".
(1) Между отцом и матерью шла постоянная: (1) A relentless war was going on between father and mother. (2) Different temperaments, different attitudes provoked constant clashes. (3) In 1904, when the World's Fair opened in St. Louis, Eliza insisted on going there, renting a house, and renting rooms to visitors from Altamont. (4) Gant hardly agreed to this business of his wife: his pride suffered - the neighbors might think that he was not capable of supporting his family. (5) But Eliza felt that this trip should be the beginning of something bigger for her. (6) Children, except for the elders, went with her. (7) For little Eugene, life in the "fairground" city seemed like a vivid surreal nightmare, especially since his stay there was overshadowed by the death of twelve-year-old Grover - the saddest and most tender of the Gantts' children. (8) But life went on. (9) The family was in the prime and fullness of life together. (10) Gant poured out his abuse, his tenderness, and an abundance of food on the household. (11) The children enthusiastically listened to his eloquent philippics directed against his wife: the father's eloquence, thanks to daily practice, acquired the harmony and expressiveness of classical rhetoric,
\"(1) В Саратовской области неизвестные: "(1) In the Saratov region, unidentified persons tore off several banners of" Fair Russia "with the image of local leader of spravooros Alexey Poleshchikov, according to the website of the regional branch of the party. (2) One poster was torn down in the city of Ershov and three more in Saratov. (4) A total of 180 banners with portraits of Poleshchikov and the leader of the party, Sergei Mironov, were placed in the region. (5) In addition to those torn off by unknown persons, the party lost 30 more posters. (6) As Poleshchikov told Interfax, one advertising company dismantled 30 party banners. (7) "They said, 'I'm sorry, I'm sorry, the hitting is such that we can't.' (8) And where the persistent turned out to be, hooligan antics started: they tear down banners at night, "said the leader of the Saratov spravoorosov. (9) According to Poleshchikov, United Russia is behind the elimination of banners. (10) Spravoorosy are preparing to contact law enforcement (11) Earlier it became known that the leader of the "Right Cause" Mikhail Prokhorov, who was depicted on the posters, lost banners in Novosibirsk and Yekaterinburg. (12) In Novosibirsk, unidentified persons removed more than 170 posters with a portrait of the politician. (13) Yekaterinburg was cut open on a part of the banner, measuring 70 by 20 meters. (14) The Ministry of Internal Affairs said that it was removed due to the fact that the advertising company considered the image of Prokhorov to be political agitation. (15) Before the start of the election campaign, according to the law, political campaigning is prohibited. ( 16) Therefore, parties place their banners as public service announcements. "
\"(1) Президент США Барак Обама ответит: "(1) US President Barack Obama will answer questions from Twitter users. (2) The president's communication with microbloggers is scheduled for the evening of July 6 Moscow time. (3) Obama's responses, as reported by USA Today, will not be limited to 140 characters familiar to the service. (4) The forum will be moderated by Jack Dorsey, executive chairman of Twitter and one of its founders. (5) Dorsey will process posts marked with the hashtag #AskObama and forward specific questions to the president. (6) That the head of the United States will talk with Twitter users, representatives of the White House announced on June 30. (7) The main topics of the session will be the economy and the labor market in the US. (8) But, as the newspaper writes, users will be able to discuss with the president any issues - from the legalization of marijuana to the quality of food in school cafeterias. (9) Macon Phillips, White House director of new media, said the event's main goal is to find new ways to connect with Americans. (10) Dent of America has hosted similar forums on Facebook and YouTube. (11) Barack Obama's Twitter was created in 2007, but it began to be constantly kept only in 2009. (12) At the moment, he has almost 9 million subscribers. (13) In the summer of 2011, it was announced that the president’s twitter was going into “pre-election regime,” so it will be conducted mainly by the team of his headquarters. (14) However, Barack Obama himself did not refuse to conduct Twitter: he periodically adds there entries signed by BO. "
\"(1) Американский актёр Морган Фримен с: "(1) American actor Morgan Freeman entered the campaign of Republican politician BJ Lawson without his consent. (2) The actor's voice was heard off-screen in a television commercial shot in support of the US Congressional candidate from North Carolina. (3) The Guardian writes about it. (4) The appearance of this advertisement caused bewilderment of the actor, known for his democratic views. (5) Freeman categorically denied his involvement in the creation of the video, according to the portal Contactmusic.com. (6) According to the portal, the Republican at first he insisted that it was Freeman who voiced the advertisement. (7) However, Lawson later explained that such information was provided to him by the MEI Political agency, to which the politician paid 4,500 dollars for "radio advertising with Morgan Freeman." (8) According to The Guardian, the ad could even sound the voice of another person, similar to the voice of Morgan Freeman. (9) As it became known, Lawson apologized to the actor. (10) The promotional video disappeared from the office social site policy. (11) On November 2, the US held elections for governors. (12) Representatives of the Republican Party won elections in 25 of 37 states. "
(1) Позже Гофолия посылает к Иосавеф Мат: (1) Later, Athaliah sends Matthan to Josabeth to tell her that for the right to pray to his God in the temple, Jehoiada and the Levites must give her the foundling Eliakim. (2) If they refuse, this will confirm suspicions and rumors that the child is from a noble family and is being raised for a hidden purpose. (3) Jehosabeth relays Matthan's words to Jehoiada and invites him to run with the child into the wilderness. (4) However, the high priest accuses her of cowardice and decides that it is time to act and it is no longer possible to hide Eliakim - he must appear in a royal dress and a crown. (5) The choir of virgins sings the glory of the Lord. (6) This choir and the Levites are the only defense of the heir to the throne of David, there is no one else in the temple, but Jehoiada believes that the Lord will give such strength to this army that no one will break them. (7) In the temple, the ceremony of enthronement to the kingdom is being prepared, Josabeth tries on the royal crown on Joash (Eliakim). (8) He does not yet understand what the matter is, and believes that he will only help to perform the rite of Jehoiada, whom he honors as a father. (9) Jehoiada asks if the boy is ready to follow David's example in life, and he replies that he is ready. (10) Then Jehoiada kneels before him and proclaims that he is honoring his new king. (11) Other priests also take an oath of loyalty to him.
\"(1) Хроника Первомая: на митинг ЛДПР н: "(1) Chronicle of May Day: about one and a half thousand people gathered for a rally of the Liberal Democratic Party on Pushkin Square on May 1. (2) This was reported by RIA Novosti, citing data from the press service of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs in Moscow. (3) Party leader Vladimir Zhirinovsky claimed with scenes that at least two thousand people are present at the rally. (4) The central event of the event was Zhirinovsky's speech, in which he promised not to allow any wars or revolutions in Russia. (5) He also noted several times that the LDPR is leading a political the struggle for more than 20 years and criticized new parties, which are now just being registered. (6) Broadcast from Pushkinskaya Square was broadcast by the TV channel "Russia 24". (7) Earlier it was reported that Zhirinovsky planned to celebrate his birthday on the square. (8) From the stage the leader of the Liberal Democratic Party said only that all those present at the exit were waiting for gifts (according to Interfax, the gifts were bottles of Zhirinovsky cologne). (9) At the end of his speech, Zhirinovsky called on his supporters to come to the rally on November 4 I. (10) In parallel with the rally on Pushkinskaya Square, a rally of nationalists took place in the vicinity of the Shchukinskaya metro station. (11) Approximately 400 nationalists marched from Oktyabrsky Pole to Shchukinskaya, where a meeting was held. (12) Several other demonstrations took place in Moscow earlier. (13) The largest of these was the trade union procession led by Prime Minister Vladimir Putin and President Dmitry Medvedev. (14) In addition, communists traditionally held meetings in the capital on May 1. "
(1) Узнав о решении Басилио отдать корон: (1) Upon learning of Basilio's decision to give the crown of Poland to the Prince of Muscovy, the people revolt and frees Sekhizmundo from prison. (2) People do not want to see a stranger on the throne, and the rumor about where the crown prince is hidden has already spread around the kingdom; Sehismundo leads the popular uprising. (3) The troops under his leadership defeat Basilio's supporters, and the king has already prepared himself for death, surrendering himself to the mercy of Sehismundo. (4) But the prince changed: he changed his mind a lot, and the nobility of his nature prevailed over cruelty and rudeness. (5) Sehizmundo himself falls at the feet of Basilio as a loyal subject and obedient son. (6) Sehizmundo makes another effort and steps over his love for Rosaura for the sake of the woman's feelings for Astolfo. (7) The Prince of Muscovy tries to refer to the difference in their origin, but then the noble Clotaldo enters into the conversation: he says that Rosaura is his daughter, he recognized her by the sword, once presented to him by her mother. (8) Thus, Rosaura and Astolfo are equal in their position and there are no more barriers between them, and justice triumphs - Astolfo calls Rosaura his wife. (9) Estrella's hand goes to Sehismundo. (10) Sehismundo is friendly and fair with everyone, explaining his transformation by the fact that he is afraid to wake up again in prison and wants to use happiness like a dream.
(1) Жительница дагестанского села Темирг: (1) Sagibat Islammagomedova, a resident of the Daghestani village of Temirgoe, killed about 80 snakes that had crawled onto her site with a shovel. (2) She accidentally discovered a reptile nest when she was planting potatoes in a vegetable garden, RIA KCHR reports. (3) Several reptiles managed to escape. (4) Information about this case leaked to the media after the woman's son posted pictures of his mother with snakes on the Internet. (5) As noted by "Komsomolskaya Pravda in Stavropol", fellow villagers called her act brave and asked the district administration to reward Islammagomedova for her courage. (6) At the same time, the massacre of snakes interested zoologists. (7) According to experts, the murder could turn into an environmental disaster. (8) “The woman killed the harmless yellow-bellied snakes and snakes. (9) These snakes do not pose any danger, they even bring benefits by eating rodents. (10) We would have warmed up in the sun and crawled out, ”said Lyudmila Mazanaeva, head of the Department of Zoology and Physiology of DGU. (11) The zoologists intend to conduct an explanatory conversation with local residents so that such an incident does not happen again. (12) In February, in the Kemerovo region, rescuers caught a snake in the apartment of one of the residents of the city of Yurga. (13) The woman reported that she found the reptile in the hallway when she woke up in the morning. (14) At the same time, it remained a mystery how the snake got into her dwelling on the third floor.
(1) Вторым грешником был тот самый Пелоп: (1.) The second sinner was the same Pelop, son of Tantalus. (2) From Asia Minor, he came to southern Greece and recaptured it from the evil king, who forced the aliens to compete with him in chariot racing, and killed the defeated. (3) Pelop defeated him by cunning: he bribed the king's driver, he took out the bushing that held the wheel on the axle, the chariot crashed, and the king died. (4) But Pelop wanted to hide his cunning; instead of a reward, he pushed the king's charioteer into the sea, and he, falling, cursed Pelop and all his descendants for treachery. (5) In the third generation, Atreus and the fiestos, the sons of Pelope, became sinners. (6) They began to argue for power over Argos. (7) In the Pelopian herd there was a golden fleece ram - a sign of royal power; he was inherited by Atreus, but Fiestos seduced Atreus's wife and kidnapped the ram. (8) Dissensions began, Fiestos was expelled and lived in poverty in poverty. (9) The kingdom went to Atreus, but this was not enough for him: he wanted to take revenge on his brother for deceiving his wife. (10) He remembered the Tantalus cannibalistic feast: he decided to slaughter the Fiesta children and feed the Fiesta their meat. (11) So he did; the gods were horrified, the Sun itself turned from the heavenly path so as not to see the terrible meal. (12) Seneca wrote his bloody tragedy about this.
(1) Президент России Владимир Путин заяв: (1) Russian President Vladimir Putin said that the country's citizens have proven the ability to solve problems in difficult conditions. (2) He said this in his address to the Federal Assembly. (3) The words of the Russian leader are quoted by the correspondent of Lenta.ru. (4) “It will be about our tasks in the economy, social sphere, foreign and domestic policy. (5) This time we will pay more attention to economics, social issues and domestic politics. (6) We have to solve these problems in difficult, extraordinary conditions, as has happened more than once in history, ”Putin said. (7) As the head of state emphasized, "the Russian people have once again convincingly proved that they are capable of responding to difficult challenges, upholding and defending national interests, sovereignty and the country's independent course." (8) Putin also thanked citizens for rallying around patriotic values. (9) “They united (...) not because they are happy with everything, that everything suits them. (10) No, there are enough difficulties and problems now. (11) But there is an understanding of their reasons. (12) And most importantly, the confidence that together we will certainly overcome them. (13) Willingness to work for the sake of Russia, heartfelt, sincere concern for it - that is what lies at the heart of this association, ”the president stressed.
\"(1) За день до гибели Борис Немцов нап: "(1) The day before his death, Boris Nemtsov wrote a letter to his RPR-Parnas colleague Olga Shorina, in which he outlined the details of his investigation in Ukraine. (2) Reuters got acquainted with the text. (3) She said that the politician was preparing report on the participation of Russian troops in the conflict in Ukraine. (4) "The paratroopers from Ivanovo approached me. (5) 17 killed, they did not give money. (6) But they are still afraid to speak," the note says. (7) Shorina, Nemtsov had in mind the fighters of the 98th Guards Airborne Division, which is stationed in the Ivanovo region as well. (8) She did not say how the politician kept in touch with them. (9) Nemtsov, Shorina said, did not wanted to say anything out loud to her, fearing wiretapping, so he told everything on paper. (10) The agency could not confirm the authenticity of the letter. (11) She also said that the politician planned to publish the report titled “Putin. War” with a circulation of one million copies. ( 12) In it, he was not going to do any sensational conclusions, since he took information from open sources, as well as from the words of the relatives of Russian soldiers who allegedly fought in eastern Ukraine. (13) Ilya Yashin, a member of the bureau of the RPR-Parnas federal political council, said that he had previously posted this note on his Twitter. (14) We are looking for materials that Nemtsov prepared for the report "Putin and the War". (15) I managed to collect some notes in his handwriting. "
\"(1) Британская компания Future Films э: "(1) British company Future Films is filming Alan K. Barker's book" Dyatlov Pass ", according to The Hollywood Reporter. (2) Barker's work is based on real events. (3) In January 1959, a group of students and alumni of Uralsky Polytechnic Institute went on a campaign. (4) The tourists were led by a fifth-year student Igor Dyatlov. (5) Nine participants of the campaign died in the mountains, and their bodies were found only a few months later. (6) According to the results of the investigation, on the night from 1 to 2 On February, the tourists left the tent (one of its walls was ripped open) and began to go down the slope of the mountain on which the camp was located. (7) At the same time, they left their outerwear and shoes in the tent. (8) Six people died from hypothermia, three more died due to their injuries. (9) Traces of radiation were found on the clothes of some tourists. (10) It is still not known what exactly caused the strange behavior of the participants in the hike. (11) There are many versions about However, Alan K. Barker in his book pays close attention to the paranormal version of what happened. (12) Andy Briggs, who previously worked primarily on television projects, will write the screenplay for Barker's book. (13) The director of "Dyatlov Pass" will be Simon Fellowes, known for the film "Malice in Wonderland."
(1) Диего, молодому врачу, неважно, о чё: (1) Diego, a young doctor, no matter what the comet warns about, the main thing is not to be afraid. (2) He loves the judge's daughter Victoria, is going to marry her. (3) In the meantime, the governor decides to pretend that nothing has happened, because "a good governor is a governor in whose reign nothing happens," and even the slightest mention of a cosmic sign is forbidden to the townspeople. (4) Nada pointedly notes that lying is "not stupidity, this is politics." (5) And now life is in full swing on the market square, someone praises their goods, recalling the morning comet, someone accidentally recalls the sign in conversation, and lovers Diego and Victoria coo. (6) But suddenly someone in the crowd suddenly falls to the ground. (7) After examining the patient, Diego, with considerable effort, pronounces a diagnosis disappointing for the whole city - the plague. (8) In the palace of the judges, the governor is informed about the growth of the epidemic, he is upset that this happened just when he was going to hunt. (9) At the same time in church people confess, atone for sins. (10) Diego, not sparing himself, helps the sick. (11) Victoria wants to see him, but he is full of fear of illness, of death.
(1) Российский пилот «Формулы-1» Даниил: (1) Russian Formula 1 driver Daniil Kvyat, driving for Red Bull, will leave the team at the end of the 2016 season. (2) This was announced on Monday, May 2, by commentator and journalist James Allen. (3) His words are quoted by Eurosport. (4) “At the end of the season, Red Bull will give Max Verstappen a place in the team, and he will most likely take the place of Kvyat. (5) This became clear early in the season. (6) Sources claim that the decision has already been made. (7) He [Verstappen] is a better driver than Kvyat, ”Allen said. (8) At the Formula 1 Grand Prix in Sochi, which took place on May 1, Kvyat provoked an accident, as a result of which German racer Sebastian Vettel retired. (11) The Russian takes 8th place in the overall standings, having 21 points in the asset. (12) 18-year-old Verstappen plays for the Toro Rosso team. (13) Highest driver's place in the current season - sixth at the Bahrain Grand Prix. (14) In Sochi, Verstappen finished 19th. (15) The Dutchman is in 10th place overall (13 points).
(1) Когда при Берге произносили слово «Р: (1) When the word "Motherland" was pronounced under Berg, he grinned. (2) He did not understand what this meant. (3) The homeland, the land of the fathers, the country where he was born - it is not so important where a person was born. (4) Land of the Fathers! (5) Berg did not feel any attachment either to his childhood or to the small town where he was born. - (6) Eh, Berg, dry soul! - friends told him with a heavy reproach. - (7) What kind of artist are you when you don’t love your native land, eccentric! (8) Perhaps that is why Berg did not succeed in landscapes. (9) He preferred a portrait, a poster. (10) He tried to find the style of his time, but these attempts were full of failure and ambiguity. (11) Once Berg received a letter from the artist Yartsev. (12) He called him to come to the Murom forests, where he spent the summer. (13) August was hot and calm. (14) Yartsev lived far from a deserted station, in a forest, on the shore of a deep lake with black water. (15) He rented a hut from a forester. (16) Carrying Berg to the lake is the son of a forester Vanya Zotov, a stooped and shy boy. (17) Berg lived on Lake Berg for about a month. (18) He had no intention of working and did not take oil paints with him. (19) He only brought a small box of watercolors. (20) For whole days he lay in the glades and looked with curiosity at the flowers and herbs. (According to K.G. Paustovsky *)
(1) Перебрав все строительные бригады по: (1) After going through all the construction crews of the village, Polushkin ended up in a laborer, but he did not stay here for a long time either. (2) One day, on a warm May day, Polushkkin was instructed to dig a trench under a sewer pipe. (3) Yegor worked joyfully. (4) The trench was straight, like an arrow, until an anthill met in its path. (5) Polushkin regretted the hardworking goosebumps, let the trench bypass, but did not realize that there are no crooked sewer pipes. (6) This incident became known to the entire village, and finally strengthened the reputation of a poor bearer for Polushkin. (7) Kolka, however, began to come from school all covered in bruises. (8) The boat station became Yegor's next place of work. (9) She stood by a small lake, which appeared on the site of a dammed river. (10) The station served tourists who came to this revived corner not only from the regional center, but also from Moscow itself. (11) Yegor's golden hands came in handy here. (12) The head of the boat station, "an elderly man who was very tired of life," Yakov Prokopych Sazanov, was pleased with Egorova's work and diligence, and Polushkin himself liked the work.
\"(1) По меньшей мере два взрыва произош: "(1) At least two explosions took place in the Afghan capital Kabul on the morning of May 2, a few hours after US President Barack Obama left the country, Agence France-Presse reports. (2) One of the explosions was carried out by a suicide bomber in a car. (3) According to police, the attacker's target was a hotel for foreigners. (4) At least six people were killed. (5) 17 people were injured. (6) The Afghan branch of the Taliban claimed responsibility for the incident. (7) ) In a statement, the Taliban said that one of their supporters detonated a bomb near the "military base", while other Taliban members allegedly managed to get inside. (8) However, the Afghan Interior Ministry denied information about the number of terrorists. (9) Po According to the ministry, there was only one suicide bomber. (10) The American Embassy in Kabul raised the alarm and urged its employees not to leave the embassy grounds and stay away from windows. (11) Barack Obama arrived with no the announced visit to Afghanistan late in the evening of May 1. (12) During the visit, he and Afghan President Hamid Karzai signed a strategic partnership agreement that will regulate relations between the two countries after the withdrawal of American troops from Afghanistan. (13) Obama later visited the Bagram airbase, where he made a televised address to US citizens. (14) Obama, in particular, stated that he sees the Taliban as participants in the political life of Afghanistan, but only if the Taliban sever all ties with the Al-Qaeda terrorist network. "
\"(1) Бывший трейдер банка Societe Gener: "(1) Former Societe Generale trader Jerome Kerviel, sentenced on October 5 to three years in prison and a € 4.9 billion fine, compared himself to a killed soldier in his first interview after the sentencing. (2) AFP reports. (3) "I have the feeling that they decided to make me pay for everyone at once to save Societe Generale, and therefore they decided to kill the common soldier Kerviel," the former trader told the radio station Europe 1. (4) Kerviel admitted (5) He added that his first thought after the verdict was the thought of his mother and father. (6) Former SocGen employee is about to appeal the verdict. (7) On the eve of his lawyer Olivier Metzner (Olivier Metzner ) called the court's decision “senseless” and “excessive.” (8) On October 5, Kerviel was found guilty on all counts, including forgery, violation of his obligations by a trustee, unauthorized use of a computer bank's computer systems. (9) The prosecution demanded that he be imprisoned for four years. (10) Kerviel did not admit his guilt and repeatedly stated that the SocGen management knew about his machinations and turned a blind eye to them as long as they brought income to the bank. (11) Due to Kerviel's illegal exchange transactions, which SocGen announced in early 2008, the bank suffered losses of almost five billion euros. (12) The investigation into the case of the former trader lasted a year and ended in January 2009. (13) The trial of Kerviel took place in June this year. "
(1) Сомс посещает Ирэн, чтобы форсироват: (1) Soames visits Irene to force the divorce case, and is forced to confess that this woman still worries him. (2) He leaves her house confused, confused, with pain in his heart, with vague anxiety. (3) His next visit he timed to coincide with the thirty-seventh anniversary of Irene's birth, he brings a diamond brooch as a gift. (4) He agrees to forget everything, asks her to return, to give birth to his son. (5) The answer sounds like a blow of a whip: "I would rather die." (6) In an effort to get rid of the harassment of her ex-husband, Irene goes abroad. (7) Soames applies to the detective agency with the instruction to establish surveillance for her. (8) He justifies himself by the fact that he cannot continue to be in the web, and in order to break it, he has to resort to such a vile method. (9) Jolyon goes to Paris, where he meets Irene, his belated infatuation turns into a strong feeling. (10) And then Soames himself goes to Paris with the intention to once again break Irene's resistance, her unwillingness to accept a reasonable proposal and create a relatively bearable existence for herself and him. (11) Irene is forced to hide again from his persecution.
(1) Всякое плохое искусство, всякая глуп: (1) Every bad art, every stupid speech, every empty book is noise. (2) At the same time, noise arises from the spiritual "nothing" and dissolves into the spiritual "nothing". (3) He lures a person out of his spiritual refuge, from his concentration, irritates him, binds him, so that he no longer lives a spiritual, but exclusively external life. (4) Speaking in the language of modern psychology, he instills in a person an "extraverted attitude", without compensating him in any way. (5) Something like this: “Greetings, man !. (6) Listen! (7) However, I have nothing to say to you! " (8) And again ... (9) And again ... (1O) The poor man is attacked and cannot even repel the attacker: "If you have nothing to say, leave me alone." (1) Где-то, когда-то, давно-давно тому н: (1) Somewhere, once, a long time ago, I read a poem. (2) I soon forgot it ... (3) but the first verse remained in my memory: How nice, how fresh the roses were ... (4) Now it is winter; frost smashed the windows; one candle burns in a dark room. (5) I am sitting huddled in a corner; but in my head everything rings and rings: How good, how fresh the roses were ... (6) And I see myself in front of the low window of a Russian country house. (7) Summer evening quietly melts and turns into night, in the warm air smells of mignonette and linden; and at the window, leaning on a straightened hand and bowing her head to her shoulder, a girl sits - and silently and intently looks at the sky, as if waiting for the appearance of the first stars. (8) How ingeniously inspired pensive eyes, how touchingly innocent the open, questioning lips, how evenly the chest, not yet fully blossomed, still not agitated by anything, breathes, how pure and tender the appearance of a young face! (9) I do not dare to speak to her - but how dear she is to me, how my heart beats! (10) How good, how fresh the roses were ... (11) And the room is getting darker and darker ... (12) A burning candle bursts, fugitive shadows vibrate on the low ceiling, the frost hides and gets angry behind the wall - and it seems like a boring, senile whisper ...

(1) Лидер Корейской народной демократиче: (1) For the first time in 19 years, the leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea delivered a New Year's televised address to citizens. (1) Американская интернет-корпорация Yah: (1) American Internet Corporation Yahoo! is considering acquiring two large and about half a dozen smaller companies. (2) All Things Digital reports, citing unnamed sources within the company. (1) Пожаловавшийся президенту России Вла: (1) Farmer John Kopiski, who complained to Russian President Vladimir Putin about the lack of income, decided to sell his farm. (10) On April 16, during a direct line, Kopiski discussed milk yield with Putin and complained that during the entire existence of the farm he had not received a dime of income. (11) He also pointed out to the head of state the plight of Russian milk producers. John Kopiski, an Englishman of Polish-Russian origin, has been living in Russia since the early 1990s. (15) According to the website of the LavkaLavka farmer's cooperative, cheeses from farmer John Kopiski are sold at 1,960 rubles per kilogram.
(1) Наступил сентябрь. (2)Вадим должен б: (1) September has come. (2) Vadim would have to finish tenth grade this year. (3) But there was still no study. (1) В Новосибирске судья отпустил по амн: (1) In Novosibirsk, a judge released under amnesty a man who beat Yevgeny Mezdrikov, editor-in-chief of the Taiga.info information site, last December. (2) According to TASS, the court ruled that the attack was of an everyday nature and not related to the journalist's professional activities. (3) It is noted that Alexei Anikin was found guilty of committing a crime under the article of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation “Beatings” and sentenced to a year of restriction of freedom. (4) However, the man was released from the courtroom under an amnesty. (5) Mezdrikov and his lawyer intend to appeal the court decision. (6) The incident at the Taiga.info office took place on the evening of December 8, 2014. (7) Two men disguised as couriers entered the editorial office located in the city center. (8) They had empty boxes in their hands. (9) One of them struck Mezdrikov several times in the face, the second pushed a resisting editorial staff member to the floor. (10) Immediately after this, the men, who did not hide their faces, left the scene of the crime. (11) Colleagues of the journalist stated that the attack was directly related to the professional activities of the editor-in-chief. (12) Governor Vladimir Gorodetsky and Novosibirsk Mayor Anatoly Lokot promised to take the investigation under personal control. (13) "Taiga.info" is a private information and analytical agency founded in 2004 in Novosibirsk. (14) The portal covers the main events in the Siberian Federal District. (15) Mezdrikov became editor-in-chief in 2011.

(5) The role of the ports of the Archipelago was played by shippers, temporary camps consisting of tents, dugouts, barracks or open-air plots of land. (6) On all shipments, specially selected prisoners, or “socially close ones”, helped to keep the "political" in check. (7) Solzhenitsyn visited the Krasnaya Presnya shipment in 1945. (8) Emigrants, peasants and "small nations" were transported by red trains. (9) Most often, such trains stopped from scratch, in the middle of the steppe or taiga, and the convicts themselves built the camp. (10) Particularly important prisoners, mainly scientists, were transported by special convoy. (11) Solzhenitsyn was transported in this way. (12) He introduced himself as a nuclear physicist, and after Krasnaya Presnya he was transported to Butyrki.
(1) Сбербанк обратился в Арбитражный суд: (1) Sberbank applied to the Arbitration Court of St. Petersburg and the Leningrad Region with a claim to recover more than a billion rubles from Yulmart. (4) The co-defendants in the claim are Yulmart Development, Yulmart Regional Sales Company and Yulmart Product-Purchasing Company. (5) No review date has been set. (6) In November, a bankruptcy claim was filed with Yulmart. (7) It was submitted by a certain Oleg Morozov, information about which was not disclosed. (8) The court session is scheduled for December 15, 2016. (9) On November 11, a Cypriot court seized the accounts of Yulmart's parent company. (10) This was preceded by a conflict between the main shareholders of the retailer. (11) In September, it was reported that co-owners of Yulmart, Alexei Nikitin and Mikhail Vasinkevich, filed a lawsuit with the London International Arbitration Court (LCIA) against their business partners - the main shareholders of the company, Dmitry Kostygin and August Meyer. (12) The plaintiffs demanded to oblige their partners to buy out shares in the company at a certain price. (13) At the same time, the defendants believe that it is higher than the market. (14) The company "Yulmart" is one of the leaders of the Russian Internet trade, ranking fourth in terms of business volume in the segment. (15) The company's turnover in the second quarter of 2016 increased by 5.1 percent, up to 10.3 billion rubles (in the first half of the year, the figure was 20.7 billion rubles). (16) In June, it was reported that the company predicts revenue at the end of 2016 at the level of one billion dollars.
(1)Над письменным столом висит фотографи: (1) A photograph of my father hangs above the desk: he is without a hat, gray hair curls violently and youthfully over a wide forehead, and his eyes are slightly narrowed, smiling mockingly and shrewdly, seeing everything, understanding everything ... (2) Father's eyes were dark blue , and in the photo they are completely black, southern, very lively. (3) Old acquaintances often tell his mother: - Dima has become very much like his father. (4) Looks like Pyotr Andreevich! (5) Vadim is pleased to hear this: he wants to be like his father. (6) And Vera Fadeevna, smiling sadly and restrainedly, answers: - Yes, there is a lot in common ... (7) Father died at the beginning of the war, in December 1941. (8) This was his third war, although his father's profession was the most peaceful - a teacher. (9) For the last fifteen years, he has worked as a school director. (10) And ‚when my father, along with other militias, left for the front - this was in July, at the Belorussky railway station - many teachers and school youth came to see him off. (11) They stood around their father in a noisy, close crowd, spoke, interrupting each other, warm farewell words, and the head teacher, a gray-haired old woman with glasses, even cried, and the father had to console her. (12) He himself was calm, he spoke jokingly: - This is my third meeting with the Germans. (13) It's not scary for the third time ... (14) It was unusual and strange for Vadim to see his father in heavy soldier's boots, with an overcoat rolled over his shoulder, in a cap. (15) Saying goodbye to Vadim, the father said: - The main thing is to believe firmly, son. (16) This is the most important thing in life. (17) To believe firmly is to win halfway. - (18) And, strongly, like a man, squeezing Vadim's hand, added in an undertone: - Take care of your mother! (19) You, brother, are the head of the family now, support ... (20) When we were returning from the station, Vadim took his mother's arm for the first time. (According to Yu.V. Trifonov *)
(1) Экспансия коммерческой литературы су: (1) The expansion of commercial literature narrows the circle of potential readers, of whom there are not so many left in Russia. (2) It would seem, what kind of trouble? (3) Read - and let them. (4) Anything is better than drinking. (5) But it's not that simple. (6) There are books you can live without. (7) There is a TV, there are newspapers, there are computer shooters. (8) And there are books, without which it is difficult to live. (9) And if in his youth a book that plowed the soul did not come across, the reader is lost for literature. (10) He will chew literary popcorn in full confidence that he is reading a book, not suspecting that it is just like a book and has nothing to do with life-giving literature. (11) And there are more and more such readers. (12) But is it really so hopeless? (13) Is it really for the reader who loves a living book to be comforted by the imperishable classics? (14) Fortunately, no. (15) A striking pattern. (16) The living book miraculously makes its way to the reader. (17) And the dictates of the market are not too much of a hindrance to her. (According to V. Ivanov).
(1) (1)Каждая встреча с любым шедевром –: (1) (1) Each encounter with any masterpiece is a breakthrough into the shining world of human genius. (2) It causes amazement and joy. (3) Masterpieces! (4) Masterpieces of hand and chisel, thought and imagination! (5) Masterpieces of poetry! (6) Each masterpiece contains something that can never become familiar - the perfection of the human spirit, the power of human feeling, instant responsiveness to everything that surrounds us both outside and in our inner world. (7) The thirst to reach ever higher limits, the thirst for perfection drives life. (8) And gives birth to masterpieces. (9) I am writing all this on an autumn night. (10) Autumn is not visible outside the window, it is filled with darkness. (11) But as soon as you go out on the porch, the autumn will surround you and begin to breathe persistently into your face with the coldish freshness of its mysterious black spaces, the bitter smell of the first thin ice, which bound the still waters by night, will begin to whisper with the last foliage, flying around continuously day and night ... (12) And it will flash with the unexpected light of a star that broke through the wavy night fogs. (13) And all this will seem to you a great masterpiece of nature, a healing gift, reminding that life around is full of meaning and meaning. (According to K.G. Paustovsky *)
\"(1) Экспертиза доказала, что 60-летняя: "(1) The examination proved that the 60-year-old mother of the on-the-run businessman Yevgeny Chichvarkin died in an accident. (1) На норвежском острове Утойя, где в 2: (1) A youth camp has reopened on the Norwegian island of Utoya, where terrorist Anders Breivik staged a massacre in 2011, the Associated Press reports. (2) More than a thousand students are planning to visit it within three days. (3) According to Dagsavisen, on Thursday, August 6, the day before the opening, the former Prime Minister of Norway, the current NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg arrived at the camp. (4) “I will try to come to the island every summer. (5) I did this before July 22, 2011 and intend to continue the tradition. (6) Now it is even more important than before, ”said the head of the North Atlantic Alliance. (7) According to Stoltenberg, Utoya will always remind of sorrow and joy, death and life. (8) “We must learn to accept this duality,” he added. (9) Some buildings were renovated by the time the students arrived. (10) An exception was the canteen, where 13 people were shot dead. (11) It was decided to leave traces of bullets on the walls of the building. (12) “Utoya will always be a place for us where we remember our comrades, where we study and participate in political discussions,” said the president of the youth group Mani Hussaini. (13) On July 22, 2011, Breivik set off an explosion in the government quarter of Oslo, which killed eight people. (14) On the same day, he shot the guests of the youth camp on the island of Utoya - 69 people died there. (15) Breivik was sentenced to 21 years in solitary confinement with the possibility of an extension.
(1) Бой украинского боксёра Владимира Кл: (1) The fight between Ukrainian boxer Vladimir Klitschko and Australian Alex Leapai will take place on April 26, 2014 in Oberhausen, Germany. (12) In addition to the WBO title, 37-year-old Klitschko holds the titles of the WBA (World Boxing Association) and IBF (International Boxing Federation) world champion. (1) Полковник Най-Турс к 10 декабря зака: (1) Colonel Nai Tours finishes the formation of the second division of the first squad by December 10. (2) Considering the conduct of a war without winter equipment for soldiers is impossible, Colonel Nye Tours, threatening the head of the supply department with a colt, receives boots and hats for his one hundred and fifty cadets. (3) On the morning of December 14, Petliura attacks the City; Nai Tours receives an order to guard the Polytechnic Highway and, if an enemy appears, to take battle. (4) Nai-Tours, having entered the battle with the advanced detachments of the enemy, sends three junkers to find out where the hetman's units are. (5) The sent ones return with the message that there are no units anywhere, there is machine-gun fire in the rear, and the enemy cavalry is entering the City. (6) Nye realizes that they are trapped. An hour earlier, Nikolai Turbin, corporal of the third division of the first infantry squad, receives the order to lead the team along the route. (7) Arriving at the appointed place, Nikolka with horror sees the running cadets and hears the command of Colonel Nai-Tours, ordering all the cadets - both his own and from Nikolka's team - to rip off shoulder straps, cockades, throw weapons, tear documents, run and hide. (8) The colonel himself covers the withdrawal of the cadets. (9) In front of Nikolka's eyes, the mortally wounded colonel dies. (10) Shocked Nikolka, leaving Nai-Tours, makes his way to the house in courtyards and alleys.
(1) Однажды я ехал в электричке. (2) Сид: (1) Once I was on a train. (2) A modestly dressed, restrained woman sitting next to me at the window opened a volume of Chekhov. (3) The road was long, I did not take books, the people around were strangers, I began to think about work. (4) And in the same tone as they ask, for example: "Do you know if we will arrive soon?" - I unexpectedly for myself and even more so for a neighbor asked her: - Excuse me, you do not know what happiness is? (5) The woman with the volume of Chekhov in her hands turned out to be a wonderful companion. (6) She did not ask me why I asked such a strange question, did not immediately answer, she closed the book and was silent for a long time, looking out the window - she thought. (7) Finally, when I completely decided that she had forgotten about the question, she turned to me ... (8) It turned out that she is a researcher, a specialist in the field of protein chemistry. (9) After pondering my question for a long time, she said: (10) - I cannot give a definition of happiness. (11) Here is a scientist! (12) A scientist is not one who knows everything, but one who knows exactly what he does not know. (13) But maybe so? (14) A person has spiritual aspirations: when they are satisfied, he feels happy. (15) Sounds like the truth? (According to S.L. Soloveichik *)
(1) С согласия госпожи де Франваль Вальм: (1) With the consent of Madame de Franval, Valmont takes Eugénie away, but Franval catches up with them and kills Valmont. (2) Then, in order to avoid the punishment of justice, Franval flees to one of his remote castles and takes his wife and daughter with him. (3) Learning that Eugénie was kidnapped with the knowledge of his wife, he decides to take revenge on Madame de Franval and instructs his daughter to poison her mother. (4) He himself was forced to flee abroad, for he was sentenced to death. (5) On the way, robbers attack Franval and take from him everything he had. (6) Wounded and exhausted, Franval meets Clairville: a worthy priest managed to get out of the scoundrel's dungeons. (7) However, full of Christian humility, Clairville is ready to help his tormentor. (8) On the way, Franval and Clairville meet a gloomy procession - they bury Madame de Franval and Eugénie. (9) Having poisoned her mother, Eugénie suddenly felt such burning remorse that she died overnight near her mother's cold body. (10) Throwing himself on his wife's coffin, Franval stabs himself with a dagger. (11) Such is the crime and "its terrible fruits" ...
(1) Федеральная антимонопольная служба (: (1) The Federal Antimonopoly Service (FAS) plans to make the same price for air tickets over equal distances. (2) The head of the department, Igor Artemiev, said this in an interview with RBC. (3) The FAS considers it unacceptable that the cost of a flight from Moscow to Astana may be more expensive than a flight from the capital to New York operated by the same airline. (4) According to Artemiev, at a meeting with First Deputy Prime Minister Igor Shuvalov, an agreement was reached that the service would compile comparative tables of the cost of flights over the same distance in the same season in Europe and Russia. (5) The service's initiative drew sharp criticism from air carriers. (6) Thus, a source close to Aeroflot considers the proposal of the FAS to be incorrect. (7) The price of air tickets includes, inter alia, the cost of fuel, airport services and aircraft maintenance. (8) At the same time, both in different countries and in different regions of Russia, these costs can have significant differences. (9) For example, the maintenance of airports located in the northern regions requires the purchase of snow removal equipment, which increases the cost of their maintenance. (10) In addition, an 18 percent tax is imposed on domestic Russian flights, which also affects the final cost of tickets. (11) The representative of Transaero also noted that the price depends on the workload of flights. (12) “None of the airlines wants to fly at a loss. (13) If we feel that tickets are too expensive for buyers, we start sales, ”he said.
(1) Магазин расположен на первом этаже д: (1) The store is located on the ground floor of the Torrens' house, and therefore Jibe's return from the hospital is seen by customers who are there at that moment. (11) Drinking dry, smoking until stupefying, staggering God knows where with the first person you meet - all this is good for twenty-year-old idiots, and not for a person who is thirty today.
(1) Заинтригованная Ник принимает у себя: (1) Intrigued, Nick receives Poirot and Hastings. (2) Endhouse turns out to be a gloomy, old house in need of renovation. (3) Poirot shows Nick the bullet he found in the park, and this makes her believe that someone is trying to kill her. \"(1) Бывший виолончелист и один из осно: "(1) Former cellist and co-founder of the British band Electric Light Orchestra, Mike Edwards, was killed in an absurd accident. (7) His driver was not injured. (8) Police identified the musician from photographs and YouTube recordings. (9) According to law enforcement agencies, Edwards had no family, but the police tracked down his brother and ex-lover, who may assist in the official identification process. (12) After the CD "Eldorado" Edwards left the band. (13) It is known that he became interested in Buddhism and even changed his name to Deva Pramada. \"(1) Убийство дагестанского мирового су: "(1) The murder of the Dagestani magistrate Abdurakhman Gamzatov was committed by mistake, writes Kommersant. (2) As the head of the Untsukul district of Dagestan Magomedgadzhi Tagirov told the publication, the killers of the judge themselves told Gamzatov's wife, who was at the scene of the crime, that they were" wrong ". (3) The murder took place on the night of June 8 in Gamzatov's house. (4) The door was not locked, and two criminals freely entered the veranda where the judge was sleeping, after which they shot him twice. (5) She went out to the noise of the shots. Gamzatov's wife, and the killers tied her up. (6) When leaving, they apologized to the woman for the mistake, writes Kommersant. (7) The criminals fled the scene in a Zhiguli car. (8) They did not hide their faces, however - because of the darkness, the woman could not see them. (9) At the scene of the crime, two shells of 9 mm caliber were found. (10) The head of the Untsugul region could not guess who the criminals were going to. (11) According to him, next to Gamzatov's house alive ut "simple villagers". (12) Abdurakhman Gamzatov has worked as a magistrate for the past two years and dealt with minor cases. (13) He did not deal with high-profile crimes. (14) Until 2008, he worked in the prosecutor's office and was the prosecutor of the Gumbet region, and until 1997, Gamzatov headed the administration of the Untsukul region. (15) A criminal case was initiated into the murder of a judge under part two of Article 105 ("murder committed by a group of persons") and under part two of article 222 ("illegal arms trafficking") of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. "
(1) В Стамбуле Пуаро останавливается в о: (1) In Istanbul, Poirot stays at a hotel. (2) There he notices an elderly American, Mr. Ratchett, accompanied by his secretary, Mr. McQueen. \"(1) В Нью-Йорке на 48-м году жизни уме: "(1) In New York City, at 48, Beastie Boys co-founder and member Adam Yauch, aka MCA, has died, reports the Associated Press on Friday, May 4. (1) Да, странные чудеса сопутствуют Лени: (1) Yes, strange miracles accompany Leni Pfeiffer ... (1) Павлик воспринял это как предательст: (1) Pavlik took this as a betrayal and did not speak to Yura for a whole year. \"(1) Парламент Нижней Саксонии избрал п: "(1) The Parliament of Lower Saxony has elected 39-year-old David McAlister as chairman of the state government. (2) According to The Local. (3) McAllister will become the youngest prime minister in the history of the German states, as well as the first head of regional government to have British nationality. (4) Half Scottish on his father's side, he has dual citizenship, but from the point of view of German law this is not an obstacle to holding public office. (5) David McAlister, a member of the Christian Democratic Union (CDU), received a parliamentary 80 votes out of 148. (6) As Prime Minister of Lower Saxony, he replaces Christian Wulff, who was elected President of Germany on June 30. (7) Like Wolff, McAlister is a representative of the German ruling coalition, which includes the CDU / CSU and Free Democrats. (8) As prime minister, he is expected to continue the policies of his predecessor and do without changes in the composition of the states new government. (9) David McAlister, often referred to simply as "Mac" in Germany, was born in 1971 in West Berlin. (10) His father is a Scottish soldier, his mother is a German music teacher. (11) McAlister spent most of his life in Germany. (12) He studied law at the University of Hanover and served for two years in the German armed forces. (13) McAlister was first elected to the Lower Saxony parliament in 1998. (14) In 2002, he became secretary of the local CDU branch, and since 2003 has been the party leader in Lower Saxony. "
(1) Как-то раз погожим осенним деньком Т: (1) Once, on a fine autumn day, Tyap-Lyap and Tip-Top were walking through the forest and came across a large spreading apple tree, and under it a whole bunch of ripe apples. (2) The hedgehogs were delighted, fussed, ran, began to pick these apples. (3) Tyap-Lyap deftly piled on his back all the apples that he came across on his way, and, quickly, quickly fingering his paws, dragged them to his hole. (4) He just thought about how to pile more apples on his back, and quickly drag all of them home to him. (5) Tip-Top wasted no time either, but it worked much slower. (6) He chose an apple for himself, examined it carefully and, making sure that everything was in order with it, carefully put it on his back. (7) If the apple was crumpled, broken, or even slightly spoiled, he threw it away.
\"(1) Российский центровой клуба НБА \"Д: "(1) Russian NBA center Denver Nuggets" Timofey Mozgov played the assistant to the head coach of his team Melvin Hunt.
