(1) В наше время чтение художественной л: (1) Reading fiction is, in fact, a privilege these days. (2) This occupation takes too much time. (3) Lack of time. (4) And reading is also work, and first of all - on oneself. (5) Even if it is imperceptible, not so burdensome, a person who has spent a day solving problems that require physical or intellectual and mental dedication sometimes simply does not have the strength to inquire about novelties in literature. (6) This does not justify anyone, but the reasons are obvious, and, unfortunately, not everyone has developed a persistent habit of serious reading. (7) For the majority of adults and elderly people these days, television replaces reading; if they get acquainted with the novelties of the book market, then with rare exceptions in a primitive television presentation. (8) Young people are increasingly learning the world of the word through headphones, players and Internet resources, through smartphones and tablets, which are always at hand. (9) Perhaps I am exaggerating and someone will be able to paint a more optimistic picture, but, in my opinion, the realities of the time are exactly that. (10) I manage to read and write. (11) Published the fourth collection of poems. (12) I do not dwell on this, the folders of manuscripts and drafts are replenished, although flights, trips and night wakefulness are all the writer's resource that I still have. (13) Reading is even more difficult, pauses are rare. (14) If you try to characterize everything that I have selected and recently read, then the first thing that comes to mind: it was written by individuals! (15) People who made themselves. (16) You believe them. (17) But it is very important to believe the author, no matter what we read: scientific literature, novel or memoirs. (18) The famous "I don't believe!" Stanislavsky now penetrates into all genres and types of art. (19) And if in the cinema the dynamics of the frame and the daring of the plot can distract the viewer's attention from inconsistencies and outright falsehood, then the printed word immediately pushes any lies to the surface, everything that is written for the sake of a catchphrase is sucked out of the finger. (20) For me, the main criterion was and remains the result: to be believed. (According to A.N.Sobolev *)
(1) Чтобы узнать о судьбе заложенных у у: (1) In order to find out about the fate of the things that were pledged from the murdered, but in fact - to dispel the suspicions of some acquaintances, Rodion himself asks for a meeting with Porfiry Petrovich, the investigator in the case of the murder of the old woman pawnbroker. (2) The latter recalls Raskolnikov's recently published article "On Crime", inviting the author to explain his "theory" about "two categories of people." (3) It turns out that the "ordinary" ("lower") majority is just material for the reproduction of their own kind, it is they who need a strict moral law and must be obedient. (4) These are "trembling creatures." (5) "People proper" ("higher") have a different nature, possessing the gift of a "new word", they destroy the present in the name of the best, even if it is necessary to "step over" the moral norms previously established for the "lower" majority, for example, to shed someone else's blood. (6) These “criminals” then become “new legislators”. (7) Thus, not recognizing the biblical commandments (“Thou shalt not kill,” “Thou shalt not steal," etc.), Raskolnikov “allows” “those who have the right” - “blood according to conscience”. (8) The clever and shrewd Porfiry unravels in the hero an ideological killer who claims to be the new Napoleon. (9) However, the investigator has no evidence against Rodion - and he lets the young man go in the hope that his good nature will conquer the delusions of the mind in him and will herself lead him to a confession of his deed.
(1) В Лондоне история Роксаны завязывает: (1) In London, Roxanne's story ties genuinely dramatic knots, taking in her past. (2) She finally became interested in the fate of her five children, abandoned fifteen years ago at the mercy of relatives. (3) The eldest son and the youngest daughter have already died, the younger son (orphanage) and his two sisters, the elder and the middle one, who left the unfriendly aunt (sister-in-law of Roxana) and decided "in the people" remained. (4) It is not in Roxana's calculations to open up to children and relatives and friends in general, and Amy conducts all the necessary searches. (5) The son, “a nice, intelligent and suave fellow,” an apprentice, did the hard work. (6) Posing as the former maid of the unfortunate mother of these children, Amy arranges the boy's fate: she buys from the owner and assigns him to the studies, preparing him for the merchant career. (7) These benefits have an unexpected result; one of Roxanne's maids returns from the city in tears, and from questions Amy concludes that this is Roxanne's eldest daughter, dejected by her brother's luck! (8) Having found fault with a trifling matter, Amy counts on the girl. (9) By and large, the removal of her daughter suits Roxanne, but her heart is now restless - in it, it turns out, "there was still a lot of maternal feelings." (10) Amy here, too, subtly relieves the unfortunate girl.
(1) Загадка кажется неразрешимой, но тут: (1) The riddle seems insoluble, but here fate itself sends Count von Zelten to Jean. (2) Jean once loved Celten as much as Germany. (3) Now this country does not exist for him, but sometimes he feels the bitterness of loss. (4) At one time, Celten came up with a funny game, proposing to share the disputed territories in the highest moments of friendship and love. (5) As a result, Zelten gave his friend the whole of Alsace, but Jean held on firmly and tore off only one insignificant district from France at a time when Zelten looked especially like a naive good-natured German. (6) Upon meeting, Zelten confesses that he fought for four years in order to return his gift. (7) A deep scar is visible on his arm - before, Jean had never seen the healed trace of a French bullet. (8) Celten survived - perhaps some grain of love for Germany is still capable of being reborn. After hearing Jean's story about the mysterious plagiarist, Zelten promises to find out everything and soon informs from Munich that ZFK may be none other than Forestier. (9) At the very beginning of the war, a naked soldier in a feverish delirium was picked up on the battlefield - he had to be re-taught to eat, drink and speak German. (10) He was given the name Siegfried von Kleist in honor of Germany's greatest hero and most soulful of her poets.
\"(1) В Екатеринбурге задержан участник: "(1) A member of the extremist Taliban movement Asliddin Nurov was detained in Yekaterinburg, Valery Gorelykh, the head of the press service of the main department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs for the Sverdlovsk region, told TASS. During a search of a rented apartment, the security forces found and seized about ten books in a foreign language. (4) They were submitted for examination. (5) According to the police, in Tajikistan Nurov is suspected of participating in illegal armed groups. (6) “Since 2010, he participated in fighting on the side of the Taliban on the border of Afghanistan and Pakistan, "Gorelykh said. (7) He added that in 2009 in the Pakistani city of Peshawar, the suspect mastered the eastern martial art. (8) Between 2005 and 2008- Nurov studied the norms of Islam at a religious institution in Iran. (9) The Taliban are a radical Islamist movement that originated in the Pashtun part of Afghanistan in the early 1990s. (10) During the civil oyna defeated the coalition forces of the mujahideen. (11) By 1997, the Taliban had taken control of the entire territory of the country, with the exception of the Panjshir regions controlled by the Tajiks of the Northern Alliance. (12) The Taliban ruled Afghanistan de facto until 2001, when the United States launched an operation against them following the al-Qaeda attack on the World Trade Center in New York. (13) The UN Security Council in 2003 recognized the movement as a terrorist organization. (14) Al-Qaeda and Taliban are banned in Russia. "
\"(1) Татарская транспортная прокуратура: "(1) The Tatar Transport Prosecutor's Office will conduct an investigation in connection with the delayed flight of the Tatarstan airline from Kazan to Moscow on September 30, Interfax reports. (2) The director for macroeconomic research of the State University Higher School of Economics Sergey Aleksashenko, who wrote about this in his blog. Aleksashenko flew a delayed flight, returning to Moscow from a business trip. (3) The flight was delayed by 50 minutes due to the fact that the commercial director of Tatarstan Airlines Lazar Iliev was late for it. (4) Describing the situation in his blog, Aleksashenko called Iliev "over-the-top haml", "brazen mug" and "brute." (5) "Tomorrow, I hope, we will have initial results and information about what happened and how they were violated or not the rights of passengers at the airport were violated, "a representative of the prosecutor's office told the agency. (6)" For such violations, a fine is provided, "he added. (7) The secretary of the Tatarstan airline refused to comment on the incident. (8) A similar case with a flight delay occurred on June 8 in Irkutsk. (9) Then the flight to Moscow was delayed for more than an hour due to the fact that the governor of the Irkutsk region Dmitry Mezentsev was late for it. (10) Arriving and boarding, the governor apologized to the passengers, none of whom had filed a complaint about the incident. (11) The Baikal-Angarsk Transport Prosecutor's Office, which conducted an inspection of the incident, recognized the delay as illegal, but nothing was reported about the punishment for this violation. "
(1) Martin decides to write for a living. (2) He rents a tiny room from the Portuguese woman Maria Silva. (3) Strong health allows him to sleep five hours a night. (4) The rest of the time he works: he writes, learns unfamiliar words, analyzes the literary techniques of various writers, searches for "the principles underlying the phenomenon." (5) He is not too embarrassed that not a single line of him has yet been printed. (6) "Scripture was for him the final link in a complex mental process, the last knot that connected separate disparate thoughts, summing up the accumulated facts and provisions." (7) But the streak of bad luck continues, Martin's money dries up, he puts on his coat, then the watch, then the bike. (8) He is starving, eating only potatoes and occasionally dining with his sister or Ruth's. (9) Suddenly - almost unexpectedly - Martin receives a letter from a thick magazine. (10) The magazine wants to publish his manuscript, but is going to pay five dollars, although, according to the most conservative estimates, it should have paid a hundred. (11) From chagrin, a weakened Martin falls ill with a severe flu. (12) And then the wheel of fortune turns - checks from magazines begin to come one after another.
\"(1) В далекие времена жили по соседств: "(1) In ancient times, a rooster and a peacock lived in the neighborhood. (2) The rooster was much more beautiful than a peacock. (3) Its golden-yellow feathers sparkled in the sun, everything shimmered. (4) All birds were jealous alongside the rooster. (5) ) They sat on the top of a tree and complained that they did not have such a beautiful outfit. (6) The rooster was very proud of the outfit and was friends only with the peacock, was not friends with anyone else. (7) The rooster walked back and forth, nibbling grains importantly (8) Once a peacock was going to visit distant countries. (9) He began to regret that his outfit was too poor for guests. (10) "Who will I be visiting in such an outfit? (11) Maybe I should ask a rooster for an outfit? (12) Will he give it or not? "- he doubted. (13) After thinking, he went with a request to the rooster:“ Give me your outfit until tomorrow. ”(14) The rooster, after reflection, said:“ What should I do if you tomorrow won't you come by dawn? "(15) The peacock answers him:" If I don't come at dawn, then you call me, I will definitely come to your call. (16) If I don't come in the morning, then shout at noon, if I don't come at noon, then shout in the evening. (17) I will certainly arrive in the evening. "
(1) Суд поместил под арест зампредседате: (1) The court placed under arrest the deputy chairman of the Committee on Culture and Information Policy of the Legislative Assembly of the Krasnodar Territory, Sergei Zirinov, suspected of organizing the assassination attempt on the murder of the koshevoy ataman of the Anapa department of the Kuban Cossack army Nikolai Nesterenko. (2) The Kommersant newspaper writes about this on April 4. (3) Zirinov was detained on April 3 in a hotel in Krasnodar. (4) Shortly before that, he returned to Russia from the United Arab Emirates. (5) According to Kommersant sources, in the UAE the deputy tried to "resolve the issue" with the criminal case by telephone. (6) Earlier, on suspicion of attempted murder of Nesterenko and the murder of his driver Viktor Zhuk, three officers of the Anapa private security company controlled by Zirinov were detained. (7) They were contacted thanks to the testimony of eyewitnesses and checking the connections of mobile phones from the crime scene. (8) The detainees pleaded guilty and showed the pond in which the weapons had been drowned. (9) They stated that Zirinov had ordered the attack. (10) The attempt on Nesterenko's life was committed on the morning of February 22. (11) Ataman was shot at when he got into a car outside his house. (12) The beetle died, and Nesterenko was wounded. (13) In the first reports of the assassination attempt, Nesterenko was named a candidate for mayor of Anapa, but then this information was not confirmed. (14) According to the organization "Environmental Watch for the North Caucasus", Zirinov is called "the shadow master of Anapa." (15) It is alleged that he maintained close relations with the last two mayors: Anatoly Pakhomov and Tatyana Evsikova.
(1)Был осенний серенький день в конце ли: (1) It was a gray autumn day at the end of leaf fall. (2) And a gray mood. (3) I came to Timiryazevsky Park for a walk. (4) It was deserted in the park and quiet. (5) And suddenly a hare followed from the forest across the road, five steps away from me. (6) He did not run, but slowly skipped past, honoring me with only a sidelong glance. (7) Not far from me, he stopped, scratched behind his ear with a long hind leg and quietly and peacefully jumped into the bushes. (8) Eco event, say. (9) However, my mood immediately changed. (10) I walked, whistling, remembered the hare, imagining what he was doing now. (11) At home over tea I again remembered the hare. (12) And my soul felt good and warm. (13) This phenomenon is common. (14) You go out of town with a backpack and, if you haven't seen anything alive during the day, you return, though satisfied with the walk, but still with the feeling that something important was not there. (15) This important can be a duck flying up from under your feet from a small pond with a bang and quack. (16) These can be fascinating, exciting scenes of a duel between two flyers - a light-winged dragonfly and a long-tailed magpie. (17) Or suddenly, through binoculars, I saw: a hardworking woodpecker was dragging the chicks into the nest box not of larvae, but ripe strawberries. (18) All living things, closely intertwined with many connections, is a miracle called Life, very possibly the only one in the endless Universe. (19) Any manifestation of life gives a sense of the joy of being. (20) Of all human values, the main value is life itself with the sunrise, with clouds, birds singing, frogs croaking, cricket tricking and grass rustling. (According to V.M. Peskov)
(1) Стой! (2) Какою я теперь тебя вижу –: (1) Stop! (2) As I see you now - remain forever so in my memory! (3) The last inspired sound escaped from the lips - the eyes do not shine and do not sparkle - they fade, burdened with happiness, the blissful consciousness of that beauty that you managed to express, that beauty, after which you seem to stretch out your triumphant, your exhausted hands! (4) What light, finer and purer than the light of the sun, is spread over all your members, over the smallest folds of your clothes? (5) What god, with his gentle breeze, threw back your scattered curls? (6) His kiss burns on your, like marble, pale brow! (7) Here it is - an open secret, the secret of poetry, life, love! (8) Here it is, here it is, immortality! (9) There is no other immortality - and it is not necessary. (10) At this moment, you are immortal. (11) It will pass - and you are again a pinch of ash, woman, child ... (12) But what do you care! (13) At this moment - you have become higher, you have become outside of everything that is transitory, temporary. (14) This moment of yours will never end. (15) Stop! (16) And let me be a participant in your immortality, drop a reflection of your eternity into my soul!
\"(1) Хамовнический суд Москвы, где прох: "(1) The Khamovnichesky Court of Moscow, where the Pussy Riot case is being held, was evacuated because of a bomb call, the Lenta.ru correspondent reports. (2) An explosive device was allegedly planted on the fourth floor of the building. (3) The call came soon after. after the start of the hearing, during which the defense managed to challenge the judge. (4) The evacuation began when the judge retired to the deliberation room. (5) According to Echo Moskvy's correspondent Alina Grebneva on Twitter, the press secretary of the Khamovnichesky court stated that the building will check for about an hour. (6) "Usually such calls are made in order to disrupt the hearings," Interfax quotes the press secretary of the court Daria Lyakh. (7) According to Lyakh, there is no reason for concern. (8) Press the secretary added that the caller demanded the release of the girls. (9) Hearings in the Pussy Riot case began in the Khamovnichesky court on July 30. (10) The trial is widely covered in the media: several dozen journalists are present at each session, some publications conduct text online n-broadcast of meetings. (11) Over the past three days, the victims in the Pussy Riot case and several prosecution witnesses have appeared in court. (12) The defendants and their lawyers express dissatisfaction with the course of the hearings, arguing that the judge rejects their requests without giving reasons. (13) In this regard, the accused have already filed five motions for the disqualification of the judge, but none of them were accepted. "
(1) Клаас Керстинг (Klaas Kersting), осн: (1) Klaas Kersting, founder and former CEO of Gameforge, set up a mobile game development studio, VentureBeat writes. (2) Kersting's new company was called flaregames. (3) It was created several months ago, but until recently it existed in secret mode. (4) According to Pocketgamer.biz, flaregames is currently working on its first game for iOS devices. (5) It will be presented in the second half of August at Gamescom, which will be held in Cologne. (6) In addition to Kersting, there are 15 more people in the studio. (7) Andreas Suika became the Creative Director of flaregames. (8) He contributed to several games from the Settlers franchise and was the lead designer for The Settlers: Rise of an Empire. (9) Matthias Schindler took over as CTO of flaregames. (10) He previously worked for EA, Acclaim and Infogrames. (11) His portfolio includes projects such as Spellforce 2 and Boulder Dash Rocks. (12) Gameforge, which Claes Kersting left in spring 2010, is one of Europe's leading online game development studios. (13) Gameforge specializes in browser projects. (14) The company owns the games OGame, BattleKnight, Ikariam, Nox Mortis and others.
\"(1) Социальный новостной агрегатор Dig: "(1) Social news aggregator Digg has cut 10 percent of its employees. (2) Creator and CEO of the service, Kevin Rose, posted the layoffs on a company blog. (3) According to Digg, fewer than 10 people were laid off. : In the "About Us" section, Digg has 72 employees. (4) Rose expressed confidence that the downsizing will benefit the company in the long term. (5) He noted that the company will invest more effort in development and service development. (6) So, despite the layoffs, the company is still looking for new developers. (7) Kevin Rose took over as CEO of Digg in early April. (8) He replaced Jay Adelson, who worked at that capacity for five years. (9) Not long before Adelson left, Digg also left Chief Strategy Officer Mike Maser, who moved to AOL. (10) Digg last announced a staff cut in January 2009. (11) Then Adelson said the company also cut about 10 percent of the company's 75 employees. (12) Digg is one of the most popular social news aggregators. (13) It was launched in December 2004. (14) The main distinguishing feature of the site is the ability to vote for this or that news and thus form the rating of events. (15) The site has over 35 million users. "
(1)Когда я вошёл в новую пустую квартиру: (1) When I entered a new empty apartment, the only one who met me was an old snow-covered poplar outside the window, it remained from the village estate that was in this place, and now, looking into the second floor, as if he said to me: “Hello "- and from its beautiful white branches light poured into the room, pure, immaculate, incorruptible. (2) Then spring came, and one morning, after a warm night rain, something green, smoky, indefinite peeped in the window. (3) Every spring the same thing is repeated, and every time it is like a miracle, a miracle of renewal, and one cannot get used to it. (4) I stood and looked for a long time and could not get enough of it. (5) Now it was as if someone alive had settled outside the window, made a noise and suddenly fell silent, and in the wind gently and meekly tapped on the window. (6) He lived with all his leaves, thousands of thousands of leaves, exposing them to the sun, moon, wind, rain. (7) He enjoyed life with might and main, every minute, every second of his life. (8) And I, reflecting on my life, would like to learn from him this constant joy in freedom under heaven. (9) Birds flew on its branches, they whistled, sang their short city songs, maybe the poplar told them about me, and they looked out the window and grinned. (10) What a long wonderful summer it was in that first year of life in a new room, with a living poplar near the window, what endless sunsets, and light nights, and light dreams were! (11) Only sometimes I suddenly dreamed that I was why I have lost my new room and again I live in an old, dark and dreary one, with a bare light bulb on a long cord. (12) But I woke up, and the poplar looked into a room with clean, fresh walls, and the pre-dawn green noise merged with the feeling of a happy awakening. (13) Then autumn came, the leaves turned yellow, and the room became quiet, sad. (14) Autumn showers and storms began, at night the poplar creaked, groaned, beat its branches against the wall, as if asking for protection from the weather. (15) Gradually, leaves flew from its branches, first from the upper ones, then from the lower ones. (16) Leaves streamed in streams, covering the balcony, and some stuck to the glass and looked in horror into the room, expecting something. (17) And now not a single leaf remained on the poplar, it stood naked, black, as if burnt, and against the background of the blue sky every black twig, every vein was visible, it was solemnly quiet and sad in nature, the unheating sun shone on summer. (18) And, as always, I remembered my childhood and thought: who are you? (19) What is the meaning of life? (20) Then again there was spring, and everything was all over again, and life seemed endless. (According to B. Yampolsky *)
\"(1) Вратарь клуба НХЛ \"Финикс Койотс\: "(1) Phoenix Coyotes NHL goalkeeper Ilya Bryzgalov said he expected more from Dinamo Riga, with whom Phoenix played a friendly on 6 October. "(8) In the match against Riga. Dynamo “Bryzgalov went on the ice in the starting lineup, and in the middle of the game was replaced by Jason Labarberu. (1) Задержанные ФСБ подозреваемые, возмо: (1) The suspects detained by the FSB may have been preparing terrorist attacks against participants in the "Immortal Regiment" action timed to coincide with Victory Day. (2) On Thursday, May 5, Interfax reports citing a source. (3) Also on Thursday, the Preobrazhensky Court of Moscow authorized the arrest of Aibek Saidov, who was detained last Monday in the south-west of Moscow and, possibly, involved in the preparation of the terrorist attack. (4) So far, Saidov is accused of encroachment on the life of a law enforcement officer (Article 217 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation) and illegal possession of weapons (Article 222 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation). (5) The court has not yet received any applications regarding other detainees in the same case. (6) On May 4, the FSB reported on the detention of citizens of Central Asian countries who were planning to stage a series of terrorist attacks in the Moscow region for the May holidays. (7) A total of 12 people were detained. (8) For example, during searches in a residential building on Novoyasenevsky Prospekt, explosives, grenades, Kalashnikov assault rifles and extremist literature were found. (9) Correspondence with militants from Syria and Turkey about planned attacks in crowded places was found in two of the phones. (10) The detainees are mostly citizens of Uzbekistan, among them there were also two citizens of Russia and one from Kyrgyzstan. (11) Almost all of the detainees - natives of Central Asia, were legally in Russia and had registration. (12) Two citizens of Russia, Elerdin E. and Anvarzhan T., were detained directly for the preparation of the terrorist attacks. (13) Both were taken to the central office of the FSB. (14) Others are checked for links with militants.
(1) Мужская сборная команда Норвегии по: (1) The Norwegian men's national biathlon team won the relay race at the World Cup in Oberhof, Germany. (2) The French were second, and the German team won the bronze. (3) Russian biathletes could not even compete for fourth place, being more than two minutes behind the Norwegians. (4) This is the worst result of the Russian national team in the current season. (5) The Austrians became the fourth in Oberhof. (6) The legendary Ole Einar Bjoerndalen entered the fourth stage with the Norwegian national team. (7) However, Norway was among the leaders from the very beginning of the race, having successfully completed all four stages. (8) Ivan Tcherezov, Anton Shipulin, Evgeny Ustyugov and Maxim Chudov played for the Russian national team in Oberhof. (9) The race did not work out from the very beginning: if Tcherezov was accurate on shooting from a prone position, then from a standing position he made several mistakes, as a result of which he had to run one extra lap. (10) After that, the gap between the Russian team and its rivals only increased. (11) Recall that the day before, Russian biathletes won their relay. (12) Anna Bogaliy-Titovets, Anna Bulygina, Olga Medvedtseva and Svetlana Sleptsova played in the Russian national team. (13) They were ahead of their main rivals - the German women - by only 0.3 seconds.
(1) (1)Набегали тучки. (2)Небо хмурилось: (1) (1) Clouds were falling. (2) The sky was dark. (3) Gray whirlwinds curled and ran along the road, beckoning and teasing someone. (4) Lisa stopped Sepp: - Listen, Paul, come to me for a minute. (5) Paul went to a side path. (6) He walked next to Liza. (7) His gait was determined and firm, and his eyes boldly looked ahead. (8) It seemed that in his soul the solemn sounds of warlike music beat rhythmically. (9) Lisa looked at him with loving eyes. (10) He said: - Do not be afraid of anything, Lisa. (11) As long as we are alive, we will not let the Germans go far. (12) And whoever enters Russia will not be delighted at our reception. (1) Редакция французского сатирического: (1) The editors of the French satirical weekly Charlie Hebdo, which survived a terrorist attack that killed 12 people, decided to take a break from work. \"(1) В Москве вечером в воскресенье, 31: "(1) In Moscow on Sunday evening, January 31, the winners of the Sixth International Viola Competition, initiated by Yuri Bashmet, were announced. (1) Но в один прекрасный день он забрал: (1) But one fine day he took from his wife a five-year-old son, whom doctors considered mentally retarded, and together with the child began to live as a recluse in a shelter. (2.) He himself appointed himself to be the confidants of those whom he loved most in the world — trees and whales. (3) He changed his name to emphasize his new identity, and began to call himself Ooki ("mighty tree") Isana ("brave fish"). (4) He is engaged in looking at photographs of whales, watching through binoculars the trees growing outside. (5) To be closer to nature, he made a 30 × 30 centimeters hole in the floor of the bunker and plunges into thought, putting his bare feet on real earth. (6) Isana recorded the voices of various birds on tape, and his son Jin learned to recognize them accurately: it turned out that the boy has an unusually keen hearing. (7) One day, an incident occurs in a swampy lowland that is visible from the windows of the refuge. (8) A young girl seduces a police agent, and her friends attack him and take the gun away. (9) To save himself, the agent chooses the weakest of the attackers and, having contrived, puts a handcuff on his hand, while the second handcuffs he clicks on his hand. (10) Teenagers beat the agent, and the boy tries to cut off his arm in order to escape. (11) The police agent unfastens the handcuff and runs away, and the teenagers scream after him for a long time.
\"(1) В интернете были опубликованы перв: "(1) The first stills from Steven Spielberg's film" The Adventures of Tintin: The Secret of the Unicorn "were published on the Internet. \"(1) В тринадцать лет я впервые прочел: "(1) At the age of thirteen I read Anna Karenina for the first time. (2) The war drove up to Tuapse itself. (3) Sukhumi was casually bombed several times, and my mother and sister and I moved to the village of Atary, where my mother's sister lived. ( 4) We rented a room from a straw widow, we were given land for a vegetable garden, where we grew pumpkins, melons, tomatoes and other vegetables no less amazing at that time. (5) In this house I accidentally found Tolstoy's book and read it while sitting under the cherry laurel in a green courtyard. (6) Of course, I hardly understood many of the features of this novel then, but I understood the main thing. (7) This is evident from the fact that I was shocked as I had never been before or after reading this books. (8) For three days I walked like a drunk and bellowed some savage requiem about the death of the heroine. (9) Already not inclined to be zealous with a shovel and a hoe, these days I did not even respond when my mother and sister called me to the garden. (10) To scorch stupid pumpkins when the world, together with Anna Karenina, is crushed under the wheels steam locomotive ?! (11) I walked through the village, and the mourning train of the requiem fluttered behind my back. (12) Unfortunately, this masterpiece perished forever due to my musical illiteracy, as well as my lack of musical memory. (13) However, perhaps I will remember him when I start falling into childhood, from which I still cannot fall out. (According to Fazil Iskander) "

\"(1)Её звали Александра Ивановна. (2)Он: "(1) Her name was Alexandra Ivanovna. (2) She was the head teacher of our huge five-story school and for some reason walked all the time with a huge bunch of school keys. (3) It was a seemingly puny creature of small stature, dry, wrinkled and completely (4) We did not perceive her as a woman either: so ... something of a neuter gender. (5) Shura (as we called A.I. among ourselves) taught a history lesson in our class. (6 ) Our Shura had a surprisingly tinned throat, and, if necessary, her deafening voice, like the roar of a fire siren, overlapped all other sounds at school and was heard, in my opinion, far beyond its borders. (7) Her sparse hair, like a fluff , inconceivably "laid" on her head in a semblance of a hairstyle, rather reminiscent of a bird's nest, were the constant object of our reciprocal exercises in backbiting Shurani. (8) Feeling obvious antipathy on our part, she did not remain in debt and paid us in the same coin . (9) At the big break, Shuranya flew into our class and, as always, ra she told us all of a sudden who we really are, and that we all need a "nasty broom" ... and so on. (10) Furious and offended by Shurani's insults, 9th "B" went to ram. (11) Immediately they found a blank sheet of paper, laid the table (and in five minutes the history lesson was to begin) and one of the most desperate wrote in bold pencil across the entire table: "SHURA IS FOOL" !!! (12) They wrote and froze themselves from such unheard-of insolence and outright rudeness. (13) But the deed was already done, the flywheel spun, and events rushed with speed .. (14) Oh, it's a shame to remember everything that happened next ... (15) The bell rang, and Shuranya flew into the class, already pretty much someone- then twisted and angry. (16) Even from the threshold, she saw a blank sheet of paper on the table, and her gaze gave a slight weakness: it even seemed to us that Shura knows how to smile. (17) Some semblance of a light smile barely touched her eyes, but the next moment, as she approached the table, a painful shadow appeared on her face, it suddenly became gray and lifeless. (18) Her eyes read our "message" to her. (19) She didn’t even throw her bunch of keys, as always, she stood there in silence for several minutes, maybe seconds, and quietly and slowly left the classroom. (20) I will never forget this May 8, while I live! (According to L. Klochkova-Zarutskaya *) "
\" (1)Природа никогда не создаёт шума. (: "(1) Nature never creates noise. (2) It teaches man greatness in silence. (3) The sun is silent. (4) The starry sky unfolds silently before us. (5) We hear little and rarely anything from the core of the earth "(B) Graciously and blissfully the royal mountains are resting. (7) Even the sea is capable of" deep silence. "(8) The greatest in nature, that which determines and decides our destiny as such, happens silently ... (9) ) And a person makes noise. (10) He makes noise early and late, intentionally and unintentionally, working and having fun. (11) And this noise has nothing to do with the result achieved thanks to him. (12) One would like to say that noise is “a privilege "A person in the world, for everything that nature gives our hearing is a mysterious and meaningful sound, not an annoying and empty noise. (13) Struck and captured, we stand when our voice raises a thunder, volcano or hurricane, and listen to this voice that intended to tell us something majestic. (14) The roar of the Rhine Falls or the sea, the collapse We hear mountain avalanches, the whisper of the forest, the murmur of a stream, the singing of a nightingale, we hear not as noise, but as the speech or song of our kindred, but mysterious forces. (15) The rumble of trams, the crackle and hiss of factories, the roar of motorcycles, the squeal of braking cars, the clap of the whip, the beating of the scythe, the harsh sounds of garbage trucks and, oh, so often ... the roar of the radio is a noise, an annoying noise, so insignificant in a spiritual sense. (16) Noise is present everywhere where sound means little or nothing at all, where rumbling, whistling, buzzing, humming, roaring, penetrating into a person, gives little to him. (17) Noise - cocky and disappointing, arrogant and empty, self-confident and superficial, merciless and deceitful. (18) You can get used to noise, but you can never enjoy it. (19) He does not conceal anything spiritual in himself, he “speaks” without having anything to say. (20) Therefore, any bad art, any stupid speech, any empty book is noise. (According to I. Ilyin) "
(1)Для меня ясно одно: главные участники: (1) One thing is clear to me: the main participants in history are People and Time. (2) Do not forget Time - it means not to forget People, not to forget People - it means not to forget Time. (3) The number of divisions that participated in a particular battle is calculated with scrupulous accuracy by historians. (4) However, they will not be able to overhear a conversation in a trench before a tank attack, to see the suffering and tears in the eyes of an eighteen-year-old girl-sanitary instructor dying in the semi-darkness of a dilapidated dugout, around which the bursting German tanks are buzzing, to feel the crackle of a machine-gun burst that kills life. (5) We were then twenty years old. (6) We dreamed of returning to that sunny pre-war world, where the sun seemed to us as a festive sun, rising above the earth from day to day according to its immutable regularity; the herb was a herb meant to grow; lanterns - in order to illuminate the dry April sidewalk, the evening crowd of walkers, in which you walk too, eighteen, tanned, strong. (7) All the showers merrily passed over your head, and you were mischievously glad to the blaze of lightning and the cannon rolls of thunder; all the smiles in that time were intended for you, all deaths and tears were strangers ... (8) The whole world, transparently radiant, lay at your feet in early blue April, warming with kindness, joy, expectation of love. (9) There, behind, there was no fierce intransigence, everywhere there was a greenish-light watercolor in the air; and there were no hard black paints. (10) For the long four years of war, feeling the fiery breath of death near our shoulder, silently passing by fresh bumps with inscriptions in a chemical pencil on tablets, we did not lose the old world of youth in ourselves, but we matured by twenty years and, it seemed, lived them so detailed, so rich that these years would have been enough for two generations to live. (11) We learned that the world is both strong and shaky. (12) We learned that the sun may not rise in the morning, because its brilliance, its warmth can be destroyed by bombing when the horizon sinks in a black-purple curtain of smoke. (13) Sometimes we hated the sun - it promised flying weather and, therefore, shoals of Junkers diving into the trenches. (14) We learned that the sun can tenderly warm not only in summer, but also in the most severe January frosts, at the same time indifferently and mercilessly exposing with its light in all its details the recent battle scene, torn apart by direct hits from guns, the bodies of the dead, whom you were a minute ago called by name. (15) We came to know the world along with human courage and suffering. (16) Time has already touched the memory: details have faded, the faces of the dead are half-forgotten, the smells of trenches torn apart by shells are not so acutely perceptible in memories, you do not bend down instinctively on the street at the distant sound of a jackhammer, reminiscent of the battle of a large-caliber machine gun. (17) When festive rockets flash over the rooftops of houses, an involuntary cry does not burst from the throat: "Get down!" (18) As usual, you do not look for a place on the corner, near a pharmacy or a department store (a place for a firing position with a wide firing sector), and a child's cry, accidentally heard in the twilight, does not recall the black outlines of broken villages, stove fumes of smoking ruins, charred gardens crying in the dark. (19) The long-awaited world (we walked to it for four years) has firmly entered our consciousness - a world with the shine of the morning sun on the pavements, with the rustle of overcrowded trolleybuses in the evenings and a cozy ride of doves on the cornices at dawn. (According to Yu. Bondarev *)

\"(1) Избирательная комиссия Ярославля п: "(1) The election commission of Yaroslavl recognized the election of the mayor of the city, which was won by the opposition leader Yevgeny Urlashov, valid and valid. (1) Проснувшись утром, он решил попросит: (1) Waking up in the morning, he decided to ask for one last bag of ducats and began to think about who to sell the devil to. (2) Protecting Rabid's nerves, the professor did not tell him that the operation was successful, that he would certainly become sighted again. (3) Any ten thousandth chance of failure could turn everything into tragedy. (4) Amid the excruciating tension, anticipation and all kinds of assumptions, Rabid heard the voice of Daisy Garan approaching him. (5) It was a girl who served in the clinic; often in difficult times, Rabid asked her to put her hand on his forehead. (6) And now he happily expected that this small friendly hand would slightly cling to his head numb from immobility. (7) When she withdrew her hand, he, who had looked inside himself for so long and had learned to unmistakably understand the movements of his heart, realized once again that his main fear lately was the fear of never seeing Daisy. (8) Even when he was brought here and he heard a impetuous female voice, commanding the patient's device, a gratifying sensation of a gentle and slender creature, drawn by the sound of this voice, stirred in him. (9) It was a warm, cheerful and close to the soul the sound of a young life, rich in melodious shades, clear as a warm morning. (10) Gradually, her image clearly emerged in him, arbitrary, like all our ideas about the invisible, but necessary for him. (11) Talking for three weeks only with her, submitting to her light and persistent care, Rabid knew that he began to love her from the first days; now he sought to recover primarily for her sake. (12) And he did not know at all that this girl, whose voice made him so happy, thought of his recovery with fear and sadness, since she was ugly. (13) He was blind, and she could calmly look at herself with his inner idea of ​​her, which he expressed not in words, but with his whole attitude, and she knew that he loved her. (14) The hour of testing has come. (15) In no time, the bandage was removed. (16) Rabid realized that he had received his sight. (17) Now he was impatiently waiting for all the people who had restored his sight to leave, to call Daisy and tell her the most important thing. (18) Learning that the operation was a success, Daisy went out with a smile on her face and execution in her soul to the door, behind which everything changed so extraordinarily. (19) And, remembering with all the speed of the last minutes many little things of their meetings and conversations, she realized that he definitely loved her. (According to A. Green)
(1) Один маленький зайчонок не любил ест: (1) One little hare did not like to eat. (2) The rabbit mother often persuaded him to eat at least something, but the son refused everything. (3) - Well, please, eat at least a piece! - Mom was worried. (4) - Look how thin you have become! (5) Like a feather! (6) But the hare continued to refuse food. (7) He himself did not notice that he became very thin and weak. (8) One day the bunny went with his mother for a walk in the forest. (9) As soon as they left the house, a strong wind swooped down on them, picked up the hare like a feather, and carried it away. (10) The hare was very frightened, he started to scream, but the wind carried him very quickly, and soon he was already far from his home. (11) The bunny flew over a dense dark forest, now evening had come, and the wind began to gradually subside. (12) When the hare landed, he looked around with caution. (13) There was only a dark scary forest around.
(1) 11880 год, 13-ый год эпохи Мэйдзи по: (1) 11880, 13th year of the Meiji era in Japanese chronology. (2) The narrator recalls his student life in Kamijou's dorm, where he met Okada, a medical student who came across as a handsome young man with a strong build with a healthy blush. (3) He was not a crammer, but at the same time he studied well and found time to rest, loved walking and was engaged in rowing. (4) Okada quickly gained prestige at the boarding house. (5) They got along with the narrator because of their interest in books. (6) In September, while walking down Muenzaka Hill near the milliner's house, Okada saw a young woman and their eyes met. (7) The next time he passed her house, Okada saw the girl's smiling face in the window. (8) He felt a friendly disposition towards her, and from that day he began to greet her. (9) Okada read out Chinese stories. (10) He was attracted by the type of heroine who valued her beauty above all else. (11) A woman should be the embodiment of love and admiration. (12) From her appearance, Okada guessed that the girl was a kept woman. (13) What follows is the story of the "woman in the window," which later became known to the narrator.
(1) Тургенев в одном письме раздраженно: (1) Turgenev, in one letter, irritably argues with Tolstoy's method. (2) He says: Tolstoy describes how Napoleon's boots shone, and it seems to the reader that Tolstoy knows everything about Napoleon. (3) He doesn't really know a damn thing about him. (4) Napoleon is Tolstoy's ideological enemy. (5) According to Tolstoy, it is possible to renew humanity only if a person, educating himself, liberates himself from within. (6) This is what Tolstoy did all his life. (7) According to Tolstoy, this was the only way it was possible and necessary to conquer humanity. (8) And Tolstoy, like the new Kutuzov, expels Napoleon from the realm of the spirit. (9) Therefore, according to Tolstoy, Napoleon is a huge soldier and there is no need to judge him above a boot. (10) Tolstoy does not intend to use his own powerful psychological apparatus even for a negative characterization of Napoleon. (11) He is afraid to refinish him by this. (12) According to Tolstoy, the complexity of evil is contrived complexity. (13) Napoleon Tolstoy has no charm. (14) As if anticipating the tragic events of the twentieth century, he tries to keep a person from being carried away by a strong personality, from even more bloody triumphs. (According to Fazil Iskander)
(1) Букмекерские конторы усомнились в по: (1) Bookmakers doubted the victory of the Russian national team over the Swedish team in the qualifying match for Euro 2016. (2) This is reported by the "Rating of Bookmakers". (3) The meeting in Stockholm will begin on Thursday, October 9 at 22:45 Moscow time. (4) You can bet on the victory of the Scandinavian team with odds 2.6. (5) The odds for Russia to win is 2.9. (6) The probability of a draw is estimated as 3 to 1. (7) These figures are given by the specialists of the British bookmaker William Hill. (8) The bookmakers considered Zlatan Ibrahimovic to be the most likely scorer for the Swedish national team - 2.75. (9) There are several main contenders in the Russian national team: Alexander Kerzhakov (3.1), Alexander Kokorin (3.3) and Artem Dzyuba (3.6). (10) Judging by the quotes, the match between Sweden and Russia is unlikely to be rich in goals. (11) The fact that less than three goals will be scored in the match can be bet with odds of 1.53. (12) Given that the Swedes are the favorite of the match, the Russian team is considered the main contender for the victory in the group. (13) The coefficient for the championship of the Russians is 1.73. (14) In the first qualifying meeting of the 2016 European Championship, the Russian national team defeated the Liechtenstein team (4: 0). (15) After the starting round, the Russians with three points are leading in group G. (16) Sweden (1 point) takes third place.
(1) Двое друзей, Леандр и Криспин, прихо: (1) Two friends, Leander and Crispin, arrive in an unfamiliar town. (2) Their position is rather difficult, since they are completely without money. (3) Crispin, more cunning and cheerful than Leander, is determined to get money and even get rich, for which he offers a daring plan. (4) Leander must pass himself off as a rich and noble man who has come to the city on an important public matter, and Crispin will take care of the rest under the guise of his servant. (5) Leandro is not very fond of this idea: he is afraid of the possible consequences of such a deception, but he surrenders to the insistence of his friend, realizing that their situation is hopeless. (6) Friends are knocking on the door of the hotel and asking for better rooms and a hearty supper. (7) The owner at first treats them with distrust, but Crispin's arrogance and assertiveness convince the innkeeper that he is facing important gentlemen. (8) Soon, Harlequin, a local poet, and his friend the Captain arrive. (9) More than once they ate on debt at this inn and hope to dine here today. (10) However, the patience of the innkeeper has run out, and he refuses to feed them. (11) Sharp-witted Crispin decides to attract Harlequin and the Captain to his side, pretending that he knows the brilliant poems of the Harlequin and the bold exploits of the Captain. (12) He immediately orders that Harlequin and the Captain be fed dinner at the expense of Leander, and the innkeeper does not dare to refuse: he has already learned that these noble gentlemen cannot be contradicted in anything.
(1) Во Франции отдали под суд 35-летнюю: (1) In France, 35-year-old Bouchra Bagour was put on trial for dressing her three-year-old son in a T-shirt glorifying terrorism, writes BBC News. (2) Her brother Zeyad Bagour, who presented the child with a T-shirt, is also involved in this case. (3) Their trial began in Avignon on March 6, Le Figaro writes. (4) The child who was at the center of the scandal is called Jihad. (5) On September 25, 2012, his mother brought him to kindergarten wearing a T-shirt with the words “I am the bomb” on the front and “Jihad Born on September 11” on the back. (6) A teacher from a kindergarten where the child goes to filed a lawsuit against her in September 2012. (7) Both persons involved in the case deny their guilt. (8) Bushra Bagur claims that she put the child in a T-shirt, without even thinking about the inscriptions on it. (9) She insists that the emphasis was not on terrorism, but on the date of birth of her son, who was indeed born on September 11th. (10) Zayyad Bagur also claims that he presented the T-shirt exclusively on the occasion of his birthday. (11) The prosecutor's office was not convinced by the assurances of the Bagur family. (12) The representative of the state prosecution insists that the inscriptions on the T-shirt directly refer to the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks in the United States. (13) He called on the court to sentence the boy's mother to a thousand euros in a fine, and his uncle to three thousand euros.
(1) В Германии грабитель несуществующего: (1) In Germany, the robber of a non-existent bank received seven years in prison. (2) The incident that triggered the proceedings at the Osnabrueck Regional Court occurred in May 2011. (3) 57-year-old Siegfried K. from Gelsenkirchen, with 22 convictions, came to rob a bank in Walchum, not knowing that it had closed there in 1994. (4) Only two ATMs and a sign remained from the bank branch. (5) But Siegfried K., not knowing this, was going to rob the cash register for ten thousand euros. (6) He drove a stolen Volkswagen Caddy to the bank and parked it next to the building. (7) On the way, he took hostage a passing 52-year-old Elke L. and, threatening her with a weapon, dragged her inside. (8) Only when he was in the building, he did not find the cash register there and realized that the bank was closed. (9) Then he left the hostage alone, threw the car and fled the scene of the crime. (10) At the same time, he left a toy pistol in the car, which he used to threaten the woman. (11) His fingerprints remained on him, and the police tracked him down on them.
(1) Вице-губернатор по строительству и ж: (1) Deputy Governor for Construction and Housing and Utilities of the Volgograd Region Igor Pikalov resigned in connection with the wildfires that occurred in the region in early September. (2) RIA Novosti reports. (3) Pikalov combined the post of deputy head of the Volgograd administration with the post of chairman of the regional commission on emergency situations. (4) In addition to him, the head of the Kotovsky municipal district, Alexander Kazachkov, and the head of the Rudnyansky municipal district, Viktor Morozov, also resigned - the heads of the districts most affected by the fire. (5) Fires in the Volgograd region broke out on September 2. (6) Because of the strong wind, the fire quickly spread over a large area, including settlements, which was facilitated by hot dry weather. (7) In total, 13 out of 33 districts of the region suffered from the fire, more than 500 houses burned down, more than 900 people were left homeless. (8) Eight people died. (9) By the weekend, the fires were extinguished. (10) Meanwhile, in connection with the incident, the UPC opened two criminal cases under the article of negligence. (11) Russian President Dmitry Medvedev demanded that Prosecutor General Yuri Chaika conduct inspections and, if necessary, bring officials to justice. (12) It is assumed that some of the fires were caused by breaks in power lines, and some - as a result of careless handling of fire. (13) One billion rubles have been allocated to liquidate the consequences of fires. (14) In addition to Volgograd, large wildfires in early September also occurred in Saratov, Samara and Penza regions.
(1) Школенко посидел с полчаса, вскинул: (1) Shkolenko sat for half an hour, threw up the machine gun and again walked in the same direction as in the morning. (2) Now he took to the right of the village and closer to the river, hiding in the bushes growing along the sides of the road. (3) We had to walk along a long ravine, making our way through the thick hazel, which scratched hands and face, through the undergrowth. (4) Near a large bush, three mortars were clearly visible, standing in a beam. (5) Shkolenko lay down flat and pulled out the paper on which he had decided in advance to draw for accuracy exactly where the mortars were. (6) But at the moment when he made this decision, seven Germans standing at the mortars approached each other and sat down at the mortar closest to Shkolenko, just eight meters from him. (7) The decision was born instantly, maybe so instantly because only today, in exactly the same situation, he was already lucky once. (8) The explosion was very strong, and the Germans lay dead. (9) Suddenly, two dozen steps away from him, there was a strong rustling in the bushes. (10) Pressing his machine gun to his stomach, Shkolenko fired a long burst in a fan, but his good friend Satarov, a fighter of the 2nd battalion, who had been taken prisoner a few days ago, jumped out of the bushes instead of the Germans. (11) Sixteen more people followed him out of the bushes. (12) Three were bloody, one of them was supported in his arms. - (13) Did you shoot? - asked Satarov. –– (14) Here, I hurt them, –– Satarov showed his hand at the bloodied people. –– (15) Where is everyone? - (16) And I am alone, - answered Shkolenko. –– (17) What are you doing here? - (18) We were digging a grave for ourselves, - said Satarov, - two submachine gunners were guarding us, when they heard the explosion, they fled. (19) Shkolenko looked at the mortars. (20) - Rather take mortars, now let's go to our own. (According to K.M.Simonov)
(1) Гарри вынужден идти на противозаконн: (1) Harry is forced to make an illegal deal: for a thousand dollars, he agrees to smuggle several Chinese out of Cuba. (2) The mediator makes it clear that the Chinese do not need to be brought to the mainland, but simply slapped along the road. (3) Morgan prefers to kill the villainous intermediary himself, and disembarks the Chinese on the Cuban coast, not far from the place where he took them on board. (4) The Chinese, not realizing that they were saved from certain death, are unhappy that they were cheated, but they do not openly complain. (5) Dashing trouble is the beginning. (6) Harry, who needs to feed his family, becomes a smuggler - transporting whiskey from Cuba to Key West. (7) One day, when Harry, along with a negro henchman, is on an ordinary voyage with a load of whiskey, a naval police boat catches up with them. (8) They are ordered to stop. (9) When the law enforcement officers see that they are on the motorboat and do not think to obey the order, they open fire and injure Harry and the negro. (10) Those, however, manage to get away from the pursuit, but the Negro is completely limp, and Harry barely drops anchor in the waters near Key West. (11) Storms. (12) Harry is afraid that the middlemen will not come for the dangerous cargo.
(1) Димка Сомов тоже примыкал к этой ком: (1) Dimka Somov also belonged to this company, but did not obey Mironova. (2) The smartest boy in the class, he behaved independently, and did not even get into Shmakova's "slave". (3) Next to him is the village of Lenka. (4) She liked Dima - he looked like a sculpture in a local park called "Sleeping Boy". (5) Besides, he was the only one to intercede for her. (6) Their classy Margarita Ivanovna at that time was getting married, was in love and did not notice anything around her. (7) On that day, Margarita Ivanovna announced that the class would go on an excursion to Moscow, and she would go with them - her fiancé lived in Moscow. (8) Here Dimka decided not to take money from his parents, but to earn money for the tour himself. (9) The class picked up the idea, and the children began to earn money - picking apples, sweeping the streets, and even gluing toys at a local factory. (10) Now the group was headed by Dimka Somov. (11) He got hold of a huge china piggy bank somewhere and put the money he earned there. (12) Lenka was allowed to join the group, she even made friends with Dimka.
(1)Больше всех украшает наш замкнутый зе: (1) A certain tall plant with lush white flowers adorns our closed earthly world most of all. (2) That is, each flower individually is very small and would be completely invisible, but flowers gathered on the stem in countless numbers and form a lush, white, slightly yellowish cap of the plant. (3) And since its stems never grow alone, the lush caps merge, and now, as it were, a white cloud slumbers among the motionless forest grass. (4) I see these flowers every time, and I do not just see them, but I single them out from all other flowers. (5) But ask me what they are called - I don't know, for some reason I have never heard their names from others who also grew up here. (6) Dandelion, chamomile, cornflower, plantain, bell, lily of the valley - we still have enough for this. (7) We can also call these plants by name. (8) However, why generalize at once - maybe I am the only one who does not know? (9) No, whoever I asked in the village, showing white flowers, everyone shrugged their shoulders: - Who knows! (12) It grows fully: both on the river and in forest ravines. (11) And what are they called? .. (12) What do you need? (13) Flowers and flowers, you can't harvest them, don't thresh them. (14) You can sniff even without a name. (15) Actually, I would say, we are a little indifferent to everything that surrounds us on earth. (16) No, no, of course, we often say that we love nature: these copses, and hills, and fontanelles, and fire, half-sky, warm summer sunsets. (17) Well, collect a bunch of flowers, and, of course, listen to the singing of birds, to their chirping in the golden forest tops at a time when the forest itself is still full of dark green, almost black coolness. (18) Well, go mushrooming, well, fish, and just lie on the grass, looking up at the floating clouds. (19) And what is the name of the grass on which you now lie so thoughtlessly and so blissfully? (20) In the place that you took with your body, there are two dozen different herbs, and each of them is interesting in something: either a way of life, or healing properties for a person. (According to V.A.Soloukhin *)
(1) Священник Йорик, друг семьи, давно с: (1) Priest Yorick, a family friend who has served in the area for a long time, visits Father Shandy, who complains that Tristram has difficulty in performing religious rites. (2) They discuss the question of the foundations of the relationship between father and son, according to which the father acquires the right and power over him, and the problem of the further education of Tristram. (3) Uncle Toby recommends young Lefebvre as governor and tells his story. (4) One evening, Uncle Toby was sitting at supper, when suddenly the owner of the village inn entered the room. (5) He asked for a glass or two of wine for a poor gentleman, Lieutenant Lefebvre, who had fallen ill a few days ago. (6) With Lefebvre was a son of about eleven or twelve years old. (7) Uncle Toby decided to visit the gentleman and learned that he served in the same regiment with him. (8) When Lefebvre died, his uncle Toby buried him with military honors and took custody of the boy. (9) He sent him to a public school, and then, when young Afebvr asked permission to try his luck in the war with the Turks, he handed him his father's sword and parted with him as his own son. (10) But failures began to haunt the young man, he lost both health and service - everything except the sword, and returned to his uncle Toby. (11) This happened just when Tristram was looking for a mentor.
(1) В Западной Африке от лихорадки Эбола: (1) Ebola has already killed 887 people in West Africa, Reuters reports, citing the World Health Organization (WHO). (2) The African Development Bank pledged on Monday August 4 to immediately commit $ 50 million to Sierra Leone, Liberia and Guinea to fight the epidemic. (3) The World Bank will give these countries up to $ 200 million. (4) According to RIA Novosti, WHO Director General Margaret Chan has already expressed the idea that the consequences of the spread of the fever could be catastrophic. (5) According to her, a meeting of the WHO emergency committee is to be held on August 6, at which it will be decided whether the spread of the deadly Ebola fever is a global threat. (6) Earlier it was reported that the virus first became infected with US citizens. (7) Two American doctors Kent Brentley and Nancy Wrightball contracted the Ebola virus while in Liberia on a mission to combat the disease. (8) They will be in the isolation ward of Emory Research University Hospital in Atlanta for a year, where they will receive treatment for their fever. (9) The infection was first recorded in 1976 in Zaire on the banks of the Ebola River. (10) Hence the name of the virus. (11) Then more than 300 people became victims of the fever. (12) The current outbreak is the first in history in western Africa. (13) The previously deadly virus raged only in the center of the Black Continent. (14) The disease is transmitted through tactile contact and has a 90 percent fatality rate.
(1) К гуляющему вблизи султанского дворц: (1) A novice from the monastery, sent by the patriarch, who wants to find out the reason for Saladin's mercy, approaches the templar walking near the Sultan's palace. (2) The Templar knows nothing but rumors, and the novice conveys to him the Patriarch's opinion: the Almighty must have saved the Templar for "great deeds." (3) The Templar notes with irony that the salvation of a Jewess from the fire is certainly one of these matters. (4) However, the patriarch has an important assignment for him - to transfer the military calculations of Saladin to the camp of the Sultan's enemy - the crusaders. (5) The young man refuses, because he owes his life to Saladin, and his duty as a templar of the order is to fight, and not serve "in scouts." (6) The novice approves of the templar's decision not to become an "ungrateful scoundrel." (7) Saladin plays chess with his sister Zitta. (8) Both understand that a war they don't want is inevitable. (9) Zitta is outraged by Christians who extol their Christian pride instead of honoring and following common human virtues. (10) Saladin defends Christians, he believes that all evil is in the order of the Templars, that is, in organization, and not in faith. (11) In the interests of chivalry, they have turned themselves into "stupid monks" and, blindly relying on good luck, they break the truce.
(1) Гек находит пещеру в самой высокой т: (1) Huck finds a cave at the highest point on the island, and he and Jim are getting on well. (2) Soon a terrible thunderstorm with heavy rain begins, the Mississippi overflows its shores and floods the island, but water does not reach the cave. (3) Huck and Jim fish in the river for a link from a raft with solid flooring. (4) Then a house floats past their island. (5) Huck and Jim search him, find a lot of useful things, money and the corpse of a man, to which the black man does not admit the boy. (6) So days passed after days, and the river again slept and entered the banks. (7) Huck decides to visit the city and find out the latest news. (8) Having changed into a woman's dress, he knocks on a house on the outskirts where people who have recently moved to the town live. (9) An unfamiliar woman tells Gek that at first Finn's father was suspected of his murder, who disappeared into no one knows where. (10) Now, the fugitive Negro Jim is considered the killer and they are looking for him all over the district. (11) The woman noticed smoke over the island and sent her husband there to see if the Negro was hiding there. (12) She quickly realizes that Huck is not a girl, but lets him go, believing in a new lie.
\"(1) Российский пилот «Формулы-1» Дании: "(1) Russian Formula 1 driver Daniil Kvyat, who plays for the Toro Rosso team, explained his expulsion from Red Bull with a defeat in behind-the-scenes battles. (2) The driver's words on Sunday, September 4, are quoted by Match TV. (3 ) “Naturally, the decision was very strange, especially at the time and the conditions in which it was made. (4) Of course, I did not expect this, but, as we know, Formula 1 is not only that what are you doing on the track, but there are also a lot of behind-the-scenes battles outside of it. (5) Apparently, some of them were lost. (6) This is the only explanation I see, "said Kvyat. (7) The driver was transferred from Red Bull to subsidiary team - Toro Rosso May 5. (8) In Red Bull he was replaced by 18-year-old pilot from the Netherlands Max Verstappen. (9) Also on Sunday, it was reported that Kvyat may lose his place in Toro Rosso. ( 10) French driver Pierre Gasly announced that he will replace the Russian at the Singapore Grand Prix. (11) “On Saturday I was informed that I would probably compete in the Grand Prix Singapore. (12) I hope that this is true, but everything will become clear after the meeting with Helmut Marko (Red Bull's motorsport advisor - Lenta.ru's note), ”Laf1.es quoted Gasli as saying. (13) The Singapore Grand Prix will take place from 16 to 18 September. (14) At the Italian Grand Prix, which took place on Sunday, September 4, Kvyat retired. (15) This season, 22-year-old Kvyat has once made it into the top three at the Formula 1 stages, finishing third at the Chinese Grand Prix. (16) The Russian takes 14th place in the overall standings. "
(1) Министерство обороны США завершило п: (1) The US Department of Defense has completed the training of the first Air Force combat pilot instructor who will train other pilots to fly F-35 Lightning II fighters, Flightglobal reported. (2) Lieutenant Colonel Lee Kloos became the commander of the 58th Fighter Squadron. (3) He passed his last exam on May 31, 2012. (4) In the near future, it is planned to complete the training of four more F-35 instructors, who will have to begin testing the fighter for combat use this summer. (5) Pilot training is currently being conducted in the interests of the 33rd Fighter Wing, which includes the 58th Squadron. (6) Klas will also take part in the training of these instructors and F-35 combat pilots. (7) During the training program, pilots will have to undergo theoretical training, and then complete six flights each on a new fighter. (8) After passing the exams, they will become F-35 pilots. (9) Until now, only Lockheed Martin and US Air Force test pilots could fly the F-35. (10) There are currently only two F-35 fighter instructor pilots in the US Air Force: Klas himself and his flight director, Air Force test pilot Lt. Col. Eric Smith. (11) So far, only experienced pilots who already have significant experience in flying other types of fighters are selected for retraining for the F-35. (12) Pilots from the 33rd Fighter Wing and two pilots from the 31st Test Squadron will be selected to train four new instructors.
\"(1) Газета \"Ведомости\" назвала двух: "(1) The Vedomosti newspaper named two candidates for the post of head of the press service of Moscow Mayor Sergei Sobyanin. (2) This position will be taken either by the head of the media department of the presidential press service department Gulnara Penkova, or by RIA Novosti journalist from the Kremlin pool Elena Glushakova. (3) Glushakova herself denied information about her appointment in an interview to the newspaper. (4) The newspaper was unable to contact Penkova. (5) According to Penkova's colleagues interviewed by Vedomosti, she is sociable and non-conflicting. (6) "This is just the most beautiful girl in the Kremlin press service, a real oriental beauty, is walking down the corridor - everyone is parting, "the publication's anonymous interlocutor described her. (7) Nezavisimaya Gazeta writes that Sobyanin has not yet decided on the candidacy of his press secretary. (8) The fate of the former head of the press service of the Moscow authorities, Sergei Tsoi, is unknown. (9) He himself told NG that he was “packing things.” (10) According to Vedomosti, he may stay at the mayor's office for a while. until he is removed from the board of directors of the TVC channel. (11) In addition to the new press secretary, Sobyanin will have a new plenipotentiary representative in the Moscow City Duma. (12) She will be Anastasia Rakova, head of the Moscow government's staff, the newspaper Vedomosti writes. (13) On the proposal of Russian President Dmitry Medvedev, the Moscow City Duma on October 21 approved Sergei Sobyanin as mayor of Moscow. (14) He immediately proceeded to reshuffle personnel. (15) So, he changed three prefects of the districts, and also deprived several officials of the status of ministers. "
(1) В комнате тихо, полутемно; мамаша си: (1) The room is quiet, semi-dark; mother is sitting next to me; I hear her voice. (2) All this makes me jump up, wrap my arms around her neck, press my head against her chest. (3) She kisses me even more tenderly. (4) After that, as happened, you come upstairs and start packing in your cotton robe, what a wonderful feeling you experience, saying: "I love papa and mamma." (5) I remember, you used to wrap yourself in a blanket; the soul is light, light and joyful; some dreams drive others, but what are they about? (6) They are elusive, but filled with pure love and hopes for bright happiness. (7) Remember your favorite porcelain toy - a bunny or a dog - you put it in the corner of a down pillow and admire how nice, warm and comfortable it is to lie there. (8) You will also think about making everyone happy, making everyone happy and having good weather tomorrow for a walk, turn on the other side, thoughts and dreams get confused, and you will fall asleep quietly, calmly. (9) Will that freshness, carelessness, the need for love, and the power of faith that you possess as a child ever return? (10) What better time could be than when the two best virtues — innocent joy and the boundless need for love — were the only motives in life? (According to Leo Tolstoy *)
\"(1) Продажи путёвок за рубеж по всем н: "(1) Sales of vouchers abroad in all directions have practically stopped in travel agencies due to the accident of the A321 passenger airliner in Egypt. (2) The press secretary of the Russian Union of Tourism Industry Irina Tyurina told Interfax-Tourism. (3) What happened ? (4) "In agency networks, we are told that on Saturday the drop in sales was 30-50 percent compared with the usual indicators. (5) On Monday, sales rose in almost all directions," Tyurina said. (6) According to her words , against the background of the search for versions of the disaster and "active discussion of the topic of" external influence ", tourists are not ready to book tours with flights. (7) Tyurina clarified that there are also cancellations of tours, and not only of Brisco, whose clients died as a result of the plane crash in Egypt, but also other tour operators. (8) Although the number of refusals of tickets is still small, the agencies expect that there will be much more, the spokeswoman added. (9) Airbus A321, owned by the Russian company Kogalymavia, took off from Sharm el-Sheikh to St. Petersburg on October 31 at 06:51 Moscow time. (10) At 07:14, the liner did not get in touch with Larnaca (Cyprus), the tag disappeared from the radar screens. (11) The plane crashed in the north of the Sinai Peninsula. (12) Onboard there were 217 passengers (including 214 Russians) and 7 crew members. (13) They all died. (14) The flight was commissioned by the tour operator Brisco. "
