(1)Как художник создаёт пейзажную картин: (1) As an artist creates a landscape painting, a whole people gradually, unwittingly, even, perhaps stroke by stroke, over the centuries creates the landscape and landscape of their country. (2) The face of old, pre-revolutionary Russia was determined, for example, to a large extent by those hundreds of thousands of churches and bell towers that were placed throughout all its expanses in predominantly elevated places and which determined the silhouette of each city - from the largest to the smallest, as well as hundreds monasteries, countless wind and water mills. (3) Tens of thousands of landowners' estates with their parks and pond systems also contributed to the country's landscape and landscape. (4) But, of course, first of all, and small villages and villages with willows, wells, sheds, bathhouses, paths, orchards, vegetable gardens, pledges, spinners, carved platbands, skates, porches, fairs, sundresses, round dances, mowing, shepherd's horns, sickles, flails, thatched roofs, small individual fields, plowing horses ... (5) The face of the country changed when all these factors determining the landscape disappeared. (6) Just as a landscape painter puts a particle of his soul into his creation and creates a landscape, in essence, in his own image and likeness, so the soul of the people and the idea of ​​beauty that is in the soul is embedded in the landscape of any country this or that people lives. (7) It is bad if the soul is asleep, if it is distracted, drowned out by collateral circumstances, interests, noises, self-interest or other considerations, if it is dead or, more precisely, in lethargy. (8) Then spirituality leaves the landscape. (9) The landscape remains a landscape, but it seems to be empty, the form remains in the absence of content, it blows cold, alienation, indifference, and that's just emptiness. (10) Becomes indifferent for an individual and a whole nation: how will it look? (11) What will a house, village, river, valley, hills, country as a whole look like? (12) What will the face of the country look like? (13) Yes departments for the development and extraction of minerals, for the construction of roads, for agriculture, for electrification, for light, heavy and automobile industries, but there is no department for the appearance of the country (land), for its neatness, tidiness, spirituality ... (14) We think about the strength of structures, about the nature and volume of earthworks, about the amount of wood, about centners and tons, about cubic meters and square meters, but do not think about how it will look? (15) How will it look not only in to myself, but in combination with the environment, with the locality, in accordance with traditions and with a projection into the future. (16) The landscape in all its complexity and totality is not just the face of the earth, the face of the country, but also the face of a given society. (17) Trashy forest, trashed roads with bogged down cars, shallow rivers, green meadows streaked with tractor tracks, half-abandoned villages, agricultural machines rusting in the open, standard houses, fields infested with weeds, speak of the inhabitants of a particular village, one or another a different area is no less than an unsightly and neglected apartment about its tenants. (According to V. Soloukhin *)
(1) В молодости я считал себя человеком: (1) In my youth, I considered myself a well-bred person. (2) When meeting acquaintances, he knew how to politely greet. (3) In the conversation, I listened attentively to the interlocutor, not allowing myself to interrupt his story, no matter how long it was. (4) In a dispute, even the most heated, he never shouted and, moreover, did not use harsh words. (5) There was no case that I, inadvertently pushing someone, did not apologize or went through the door first, without making way for a companion. (7) But only it seemed. (8) And it turned out quite unexpectedly. (9) Once, during my student practice, I had to live for two weeks with an artel of lumberjacks. (10) And then one evening I accidentally overheard a conversation that I remember forever. (12) It was about me. - (13) The guy is nothing, - said the cook, - literate, but it's too gray! (14) There is no upbringing. - (15) Why? - the headman was interested. - (16) Yes, he does not do everything in a human way. (17) He starts to wash - the whole floor will flood, then wipe after him. (18) He sits down to the table - no, so that at first he sips liquid, immediately, without a command, he begins to drag meat from the bottom. (19) It’s not difficult to put a spoon to your mouth, but I’m not accustomed to it: he won’t put bread under the spoon, it will drip on the table. (20) And where did he live until now? (According to A. Dorokhov)
(1) Известный американский боец смешанны: (1) The famous American mixed martial arts fighter Jeff Monson got a tattoo depicting a sculpture of the Motherland, according to Nakanune.ru (2) The tattoo is located on the athlete's left leg. (3) The image of the statue occupies almost the entire hip. (4) The tattoo was done by a master of one of the salons in Moscow. (5) The depicted sculpture is the center of the monument-composition to the heroes of the Battle of Stalingrad on the Mamayev Kurgan in Volgograd. (6) Other tattoos are also present on the body of 44-year-old Monson, including the words "freedom", "solidarity" and "fighter" in Russian. (7) The athlete himself explained their presence by his love for the state language of the Russian Federation. (8) In total, the fighter has more than 20 tattoos of various themes. (9) For example, his body bears images of symbols of anarchism and communism, cartoon characters, the names of his children in Japanese, the names of sponsorship firms and political slogans. (10) In the fall of 2014, the American announced that he wanted to take Russian citizenship. (11) The world champion in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu has been dating a Russian girl for several years. (12) Prior to this, Monson had repeatedly confessed his sympathy for Russia. (13) In May 2014, he supported the St. George Ribbon campaign, and entered the ring both to the anthem of the Soviet Union and to the anthem of Donbass.

\"(1) Глава фонда \"Сколково\" Виктор Ве: "(1) The head of the Skolkovo Foundation, Viktor Vekselberg, compared the innovation city project with the concept of a" valley of death "in the venture business, Interfax reports. (2) According to Vekselberg, this definition of Skolkovo is suitable both literally and figuratively (3) Usually the initial stage of the project is called the "valley of death" in the innovation business. (4) During this period, there is no product sample, but there is only a technology that needs to be invested. (5) According to Vekselberg, the innovation city managed to create a balanced system of public administration. (6) The state provides funds for the project in the format of a subsidy agreement. (7) Vekselberg added that the "bottleneck" of the innovation city is the commercialization of its projects. (8) To achieve this goal, he considers it extremely important to involve large corporations to the activities of Skolkovo. (9) Skolkovo, located in the village of the same name near Moscow, is one of the main projects of Russian President Dmitry Medvedev, who proclaimed the urs to modernize the country. (10) Skolkovo should become the Russian equivalent of Silicon Valley in the United States. (11) The law on the creation of an innovation city was adopted by the State Duma in September 2010. (12) Several large world companies, including Microsoft, Nokia and Philips, have already agreed to work in the Moscow region. (13) They will be granted tax breaks. (14) According to Vekselberg, financing of the Skolkovo project will require 180-200 billion rubles over three years. "

\"(1) Полиция Канады принесла официальны: "(1) Canadian police have made an official apology to the family of a Pole killed in 2007 at a Vancouver airport. (2) Reuters reported this on April 1. (3) The apology, which became part of the out-of-court settlement with the victim's mother, said: (4) "Your son came from Poland to start a new life in Canada. (5) We are deeply sorry that he did not succeed. "(6) Financial details of the settlement were not disclosed. (7) Robert Dziekanski was killed by security personnel at Vancouver Airport in October 2007. (8) He arrived at Canada, where his mother Zofia Cisowski was already living, for permanent residence. (9) At the airport he got lost and began to get very nervous. (10) Taking him for a violator, the police shot him several times with a stun gun. (11) The Pole died shortly thereafter. (12) Later investigations could not establish the exact cause of death. (13) Meanwhile, the incident sparked criticism against Canadian law enforcement. (14) According to Deputy Chief of Police Gary Bass, his agency does not take full responsibility for the death of Robert Dzikanski, but admits that it played a "significant role." (15) As BBC News adds, Canadian police also said that the incident with Dzikansk and "taught the operational staff a lot," and their instructions were amended accordingly. "

(1) Прогуливаясь днём по городу, он нахо: (1) Walking around the city during the day, he finds an irreplaceable penny and begins to experiment with it, buying various things with it. (1) Министерство культуры Великобритании: (1) UK Department of Culture authorized News Corp. media mogul Rupert Murdoch to fully buy out the BSkyB television company. (2) At the same time, Murdoch will lose control of the influential TV channel Sky News (now part of BSkyB), which will be spun off, according to Reuters. (3) Sky News shares will be redistributed among the current BSkyB shareholders in accordance with their shares. (4) Thus, News Corp. will remain 39.1 percent of Sky News. (5) The BSkyB buyout would presumably cost News Corp. $ 14 billion. (6) The profit of the company, which has several pay satellite TV channels, is growing steadily. (7) At the same time, Sky News is suffering losses, but is considered one of the most influential media in the UK. (8) News Corp. will fund Sky News for 10 years. (9) In addition, the channel will be able to use its current brand under a license for seven years. (10) The majority of the Sky News board of directors will be independent directors, and only an independent director can become the chairman of the board. (11) Murdoch's plans to buy out BSkyB spark protests from many in the UK media market. (12) They express fears that the media mogul will gain too much influence on the market and on public opinion. (13) Reuters notes that the permission of the Ministry of Culture can still be challenged in court.
\"(1) Элис Купер объявил конкурс, победи: "(1) Alice Cooper has announced a competition, the winners of which will be able to take part in two concerts of the musician. (7) The concerts will take place on October 31 and November 1, 2010 at The Roundhouse in London. (8) "London is full of freaks, and I would like people to they knew it. (9) Unfortunately, Halloween is not as popular in the UK as it is in the US. (10) And I would like this holiday to be as big as Christmas, "Cooper said. (11) Alice Cooper has released 25 studio albums in his nearly 50-year career. (12) The last of them," Along Came a Spider ", went on sale in July 2008. (13) It is assumed that the musician is currently working on his next LP, which will be called" The Night Shift "."
(1) Ты не забыта мною, моя далекая родин: (1) You are not forgotten by me, my distant homeland, Siberia, rich in gold, dense forests, frosts and wonderful natural phenomena! (2) As the first dreams of my youth, as my favorite childhood games, I remember your age-old cedars, your silent deserts, rocks broken by centuries in the gorges of the mountains and your immense, blue as the eyes of a Siberian maiden, light as a block of ice, Angara, on the banks which carelessly, cheerfully and quickly flew by the days of my childhood. (3) Siberia! (4) How far away you are and how close to my soul! (5) Everything that was once impressed into my youthful memory, I remember everything, even the roar of the wind through the pine forests, when, crossing from the mossy tundra, he walks in your wilderness, the powerful son of the Arctic Sea, and carries fogs, and nature, and passions that surround the sky here, in Russia, and dim in my eyes and magnificent buildings, and velvet meadows, and flowering fields, warmed by the sun, strewn with rainbows of flowers and devoured by an envious person. (6) Looking at the local bare fields, can I forget your boundless, untouched steppes, Siberia is a gold mine! (7) Forgive the memories of the past, my friends! (8) Marvel at the strangeness of the human heart: I have seen a lot since the last time, with hopes, with dreams for the future - still young, still full of life - I looked at Irkutsk, over which the sun was splendidly rising and the blue waters of the Angara were golden with its rays and the green shores of Irkut .. (9) Much time has passed that; my soul has experienced much both sorrow and joy; many of those with whom she shared, made forever the path of life and rest under the coffin sod .. (10) But wherever I was - and on the peaks of the Urals, and near the Caucasus and Taurida, and on the shores of the Sea of ​​Azov, and on the banks lined with granite Baltic Sea, and in the luxurious pastures of Ukraine - nowhere, no, nowhere did my soul worry so much, my heart didn’t beat so hard, my head didn’t burn so ardently as there, in my wild homeland! (11) It was a world of enchantments, a world that flew by in an instant dream. (12) If any of you, my friends, will be in Irkutsk - let him go out of town, to the place where Ushakovka flows into the Angara near the old, destroyed mill. (13) Here the winding course of this river will lead him to the place where Ushakovka divides into two islands, where opposite it on the meadow side will be the old Admiralty - my father lived here; here were the limits of my first world; here I dreamed, wept for Plutarch, thought to be a great man, like the great people he described; proudly paced the meadow, retreating into the shade of trees, inspired by his first love, sharing the first feelings of friendship .. (14) There, they say, everything has changed: the old father's house does not exist; the kind people who once gathered in it were blown away by the storm of life, and fate took me, a careless young man, far from my homeland .. (15) And now Siberia is still sparsely populated, and now its forests are still wild; but before it was even less populous, its forests were even wilder. (16) There was a time that the voivode, sent from Moscow, drove to Irkutsk for two years, resting in secluded prison and winter quarters from the endless road. (17) Now everywhere you see the footprints of a person: forests have been cut through, swamps are covered with bridges, mountains are dug. (18) You often travel and nowadays you do not meet a living human being; but right there you see that the man was already in these places, cut down, dug down, paved it and left. (19) Before you would have sought him in vain. (According to N. Polevoy *)
(1) Эдмон пылает страстью к госпоже Пара: (1) Edmond has a passion for Madame Parangon. (2) An unhappy woman, whose heart has long been filled with love for a daring villager, tries to resist their mutual attraction. (3) "It's easier for me to die than to lose respect for you ..." - she writes to Edmond. (4) Godet cynically advises his ward to master the "charming touchy": in his opinion, the victory over her will drive out of his heart an absurd reverence for female virtue and drain his "village slobber"; defeating Mistress Parangon, he will become "the most adorable moth fluttering in the flowers of love." (5) And now the inflamed Edmond is committing violence against Mrs. Parangon. (6) For several days the unfortunate victim is between life and death. (7) When she finally comes to her senses, she irrevocably removes Edmond from herself. (8) At the appointed hour, her daughter is born - Edme-Colette. (9) A letter comes from Mrs. Kanon - Yursul has been kidnapped! (10) She “did not lose her chastity, but lost her innocence ...” (11) Edmond rushes to Paris, challenges the offender-marquis to a duel, wounds him, but, having quenched his thirst for revenge, immediately bandages the wound of his opponent. (12) While Edmond is hiding, Madame Parangon acts as his intercessor to the family of the Marquis. (13) As a result, the old count promises to Edmond his patronage, he is accepted in the world, and the ladies, admiring his beauty, rush to order their portraits for him.
(1) Бывший работник Louis Vuitton подал: (1) A former Louis Vuitton employee sues the manager of a London fashion boutique after hearing a racist comment from him. (2) The Daily Mirror reports. (3) The man quit after an incident in which his boss called him a "slave." (4) In his lawsuit, Oliver Koffi, an African, accused the manager (his name has not been released) of racial discrimination. (5) Coffey quoted the abuser as saying, "Black people are slaves who eat dirt off the floor." (6) On what occasion the manager uttered offensive words for the employee is not specified. (7) In its own defense, the defendant in the claim stated that his remark was a joke. (8) Coffey, in turn, expressed doubts about the veracity of such a statement. (9) The African noted that this and other offensive remarks addressed to him were pronounced by the manager of the boutique in a "cold and calm" tone. (10) Coffey emphasized that he was forced to resign because the work environment had become "hostile and intimidating" for him. (11) According to the man, the abuser had previously indulged in racist remarks about other Africans and Asians. (12) He called Louis Vuitton's products a rude word, citing the fact that the brand's things are made in China as proof. (13) Representatives of Louis Vuitton confirmed that the lawsuit was filed and said that they had conducted an internal investigation into the incident. (14) According to them, the manager accused of racism was fired from the company as soon as the incident became known.
\"(1) Музыка, мелодия, красота музыкальн: "(1) Music, melody, beauty of musical sounds are an important means of moral and mental education of a person, a source of nobility of heart and purity of soul. (2) Music opens people's eyes to the beauty of nature, moral relations, labor. (3) Thanks to music in a person the idea of ​​the sublime, majestic, beautiful not only in the world around us, but also in ourselves is awakening. (4) On winter days, when all our paths were covered with snow, we sat in the school room, listening to the melodies of P. Tchaikovsky, E. Grieg, F. Schubert, R. Schumann. (5) If in early childhood the beauty of a musical work is conveyed to the heart, if in the sounds a child feels the multifaceted shades of human feelings, he will rise to a level of culture that cannot be achieved by any other means. (6 ) By developing the child's sensitivity to music, we ennoble his thoughts, aspirations. (7) The task is for the musical melody to open in every heart a life-giving source of human feelings. (8) But melody - this language of human feelings - conveys to the child's soul not only the beauty of the world: it reveals human greatness and dignity to people. (9) The spontaneous, disorganized influence of music on children does not contribute to, but rather harms, the correct aesthetic education: the child becomes a hostage of musical noise, he is suppressed by a pile of sounds, he is not able to distinguish beauty from ugliness. (10) So he will go into the world, confused, unsure of himself. (11) You can't just put a child down and make him listen to music, no, the child must have a Teacher who will help him in musical education. (12) I chose melodies for listening, in which, in vivid images, understandable to children, the sounds that they hear around them are conveyed: the charming chirping of birds, the rustling of leaves, the rumble of thunder, the murmur of a stream, the howling of the wind. (13) I used no more than two melodies a month, but before getting to know each melody I did a lot of educational work, the purpose of which was to awaken the desire in children to listen to music again and again, to ensure that every time the guys discovered a new beauty in the work. (14) In early autumn, when every sound is clearly heard in the transparent air, I suggested listening to the melody "Flight of the Bumblebee" from the opera "The Tale of Tsar Saltan" by N. Rimsky-Korsakov. (15) Music found an emotional response in children. (16) The kids said: (17) “The bumblebee is approaching and moving away. (18) The chirping of small birds is heard ... ”(19) Children want to hear the melody again. (20) Beauty has been revealed in what until now seemed to them ordinary - such is the power of music. (according to V. A. Sukhomlinsky) "

(1) Художник Андрей Кузькин показал перф: (1) Artist Andrey Kuzkin showed a performance as part of his project "The Phenomenon of Nature, or 99 Landscapes with a Tree" in Voronezh. (2) The author undressed and buried himself upside down in a snowdrift in the city center. (3) Voronezh newspaper "Moe!" (4) Andrey Kuzkin presented a photo from the performance on February 2 at the local gallery "HLAM", where his personal exhibition "Affection" is taking place. (5) The author said that he was inspired by the work of his father, artist Alexander Kuzkin, "99 landscapes with a tree." (6) In addition, according to Kuzkin Jr., in his youth he composed a poem: "I want to fall from the floor and stick my head into the asphalt, so that later I can swing my legs like branches of trees." (7) Within the framework of the project "The Phenomenon of Nature, or 99 Landscapes with a Tree", a naked Kuzkin or other volunteers are buried in the ground up to their shoulders in different parts of the world. (8) Thus, according to the author, the body becomes like a tree. (9) Voronezh turned out to be the 36th city where Kuzkin showed his performance. (10) Prior to this, the artist's work was seen, in particular, by residents of Cape Town, Berlin, Kiev, Moscow, New York, London, Krasnoyarsk. (11) Andrey Kuzkin was born in Moscow in 1979. (12) For the first time attracted attention in 2008, when during the youth biennale “Stop! Who goes?" showed several works at once, including the installation "A Place Where No One Bothers" and the performance "In a Circle", during which Kuzkin kneaded the cement with his feet until it solidified. (13) For this work Kuzkin received the State Prize in the field of contemporary art "Innovation".
\"(1) Заместителю начальника Московского: "(1) Grigory Dymovets, the Deputy Head of the Moscow Investigation Department for Transport of the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation, was charged with taking a bribe on an especially large scale, associated with extortion. (2) Interfax reports this with reference to the lawyer of the accused Marcel Valiullin. (3) 34 -year-old Dymovets is suspected of receiving 1.5 million dollars. (4) After receiving a million, he released from custody two defendants in the criminal case on meat smuggling, the investigation believes. (5) During the receipt of 500 thousand on May 25, he was caught red-handed. (6) In total, the investigator extorted $ 4 million, confirms the prosecution. (7) Dymovets himself does not plead guilty and claims that he was accused by the defendants in the smuggling case. (8) On May 27, the Basmanny Court arrested the investigator, his lawyer has already filed a complaint about it decision. (9) Earlier, the media reported that Dymovets was investigating the case of importing meat into Russia using forged documents. (10) The organizer of the smuggling was US citizen Mikhail Grinberg, who deceived by way of obtaining licenses from the Ministry of Economic Development for the preferential import of meat. (11) Five employees of the Federal Customs Service assisted him in deliveries. (12) The criminal case was opened in February 2010. (13) Kommersant wrote that the investigator was asked to remove the arrest not from the defendants, but from the detained batch of meat. "
\"(1) Дефицит инвестпрограммы РЖД в ближ: "(1) The deficit of the investment program of Russian Railways in the next five years will amount to 710 billion rubles. (2) This was stated by the president of the monopoly Vladimir Yakunin, Vedomosti writes. (3) Yakunin did not specify how this figure developed. (4) According to the data Vice-President of Russian Railways Vadim Morozov, internal transportation of the company is reduced, and they will return to the pre-crisis level no earlier than 2013, and therefore it is difficult for it to find internal resources for capital investments. (5) The volume of underinvestment funds since 2001 is estimated at 2 trillion rubles. (6) The total volume of the investment program of Russian Railways until 2015 is unknown. (7) In 2009-2011, it was planned to invest 1.8 trillion rubles, but due to the crisis, the plan was cut in half. (8) In 2010, the size of the investment program is 270.5 billion rubles. (9) At the same time, in February, Vladimir Yakunin reported that the company needs state support in the amount of 400 billion rubles in the next five years. (10) It is still not clear what type of state aid Russian Railways wants. (11) As the newspaper notes, railway workers can ask not only for direct subsidies, but also for additional indexation of tariffs. (12) According to Yakunin, however, the company has no such plans. (13) It is assumed that tariff indexation in 2011 will be 9.2 percent. (14) RZD is the operator of the railway infrastructure in Russia and one of the largest transport companies in the world. (15) The company is wholly owned by the state and generates about 2.5 percent of Russia's GDP. "
(1) Варавва, мальтийский еврей, сидит в: (1) Barabbas, a Maltese Jew, sits in his office in front of a pile of gold and awaits the arrival of ships with goods. (2) He reflects out loud that everyone hates him for his luck, but honors him for his wealth: "So it’s better / Everyone hates the rich Jew, / Than the pitiful Jewish poor!" (3) He sees in Christians only malice, lies and pride, which do not fit with their teaching, and those Christians who have a conscience live in poverty. (4) He rejoices that Jews have seized more wealth than Christians. (5) Having learned that the Turkish fleet approached the shores of Malta, Barabbas is not worried: neither peace nor war touches him, only his own life, the life of his daughter and the acquired property are important to him. (6) Malta has long been paying tribute to the Turks, and Barabbas suggests that the Turks have increased it so much that the Maltese have nothing to pay, so the Turks are going to take the city. (7) But Barabbas took precautions and hid his treasures so that he was not afraid of the arrival of the Turks. (8) The son of the Turkish Sultan Kalimat and the Pasha demand the payment of tribute for ten years. (9) The Governor of Malta Farnese does not know where to get so much money, and confers with those close to him. (10) They are asking for an extension to collect money from all residents of Malta. (11) Kalimat gives them a month of grace. (12) Farnese decides to collect tribute from the Jews: each must give half of his property; the one who refuses will be immediately baptized, and the one who refuses to give up half of his property and be baptized will lose all his property.
\"(1) Бывшая ведущая программы «Давай по: "(1) The former host of the Let's Get Married program, astrologer Vasilisa Volodina, decided to interview her subscribers who they consider the best candidate for the presidency:" the perky Trump Twin "or" Scorpio Hillary Clinton, once offended by her husband for the whole world. (1)Не бывает абсолютно одинаковых и совс: (1) There are no absolutely identical and completely incompetent people! (2) Everyone is born with the seal of some kind of talent. (3) The need for creativity is as natural as the need to drink or eat; it glimmers in each of us, even in the most incredibly difficult conditions. (4) Each person is talented and unique in his own way. (5) Fortunately, people who are absolutely bad internally and externally do not exist. (6) The fact that the need for creativity is inherent in everyone is evident at least from the fact that in childhood, even in infancy, the child has a need for play. (7) Every child wants to play, that is, to live creatively. (8) Why, over the years, creativity gradually disappears from our life, why does the creative principle persist and develop not in each of us? (9) Roughly speaking, because we either did not do our own thing (did not find ourselves, our face, our talent), or did not learn to live and work (did not develop talent). (10) The second often depends on the first, but the first is not always free from the second either. (11) If you do not learn to work, you will never know what nature has rewarded you with. (12) If the spiritual potential is weak, then the personality is erased, leveled, quickly loses the individual, inherent in her one feature. (13) Any mental, family, social or world discord, any disorder, which, by the way, can be different, can hinder a slender ascent, creative emancipation of the individual. (14) For example, it is one thing when there are no shoes to go to school (or even the school itself), and quite another when you are forced to comprehend musical literacy. (15) Of course, the second case is preferable, but discord is discord. (16) Therefore, we see that social orientation is by no means always infallible and that fashion is generally harmful in such a matter as finding oneself. (17) Why, in fact, only the life of an artist or an artist is considered creative? (18) After all, an artist and an artist can be in any business. (According to V. Belov *)
(1) Во время прогулки Алька встретила св: (1) During a walk, Alka met her acquaintances: her neighbor, Peka Kamenny, who did not immediately recognize her, in a car, which he had long dreamed of; played her teacher Evlampia Nikiforovna, went into an almost completed new club, where she really liked everything. (2) I met with my girlfriends, helped them mow the hay, and then swam merrily and screechingly in the river. (3) Alka was extremely happy to return to her native village atmosphere. (4) At home, at dinner, Alya discussed everything with the old women gathered in her aunt's house: pensions, icons, berries, the benefits of living water ... (5) Then Anisya and I went to pick berries. (6) In the forest, the special smell of foliage reminded Ale of her deceased mother and inspired sadness ... (7) But going out on the road, she again met Peka and, having talked with him, was distracted from the memories of her mother. (8) Returning from a walk, Alka met the old woman Khristoforovna. (9) She said that the path to the river was renamed the Paladin path in honor of Alina's mother. (10) She was still that hard worker - no one walked this path as much as she did. (11) Reaching the bakery where the mother worked, Alka again became sad, because this bakery brought the mother to the grave. (12) She stood and waited for her mother to appear in the window. (13) But this did not happen, and Alya went to the local store.
\"(1) В американском штате Огайо задержа: "(1) In the US state of Ohio, a man was detained who tried to bring weapons, knives and ammunition to the evening screening of a film about Batman. (4) The manager of the establishment noticed a suspicious man with a bag who came to the screening of The Dark Knight Rises at 22:00. (8) According to the police, the detainee was 37- year-old Scott Smith - not licensed to carry weapons. (9) The reasons that prompted Smith to bring the weapons to the theater are not reported. (10) After the arrest of the man, the police are known to have searched his home. (11) Results search No data. (12) On July 20, 2012, 12 people were killed and 58 were injured at the premiere of The Dark Knight Rises at the Aurora, Colorado movie theater. (13) The 24-year-old James Holmes opened the shooting at the cinema-goers, carrying four weapons, including an AR-15 rifle, into the hall unhindered. (14) Holmes is currently in custody. (1) В то время как художник работал над: (1) While the artist was working on the painting, his daughter became more and more sad. (2) The inhabitants of the palace wondered what the reason for her sadness was: in sorrowful thoughts about her father or in love longing. (3) It was soon rumored that his lordship was coveting her love. (4) One night, when the narrator was walking through the gallery, the monkey Yoshihide suddenly ran up to her and began tugging at the hem of her skirt. (5) The narrator went in the direction where the monkey was pulling her and opened the door to the room from which voices were heard. (6) A half-dressed daughter, Yoshihide, jumped out of the room, and in the depths there was the sound of receding steps. (7) The girl was in tears, but did not say the name of the one who wanted to dishonor her. (8) About twenty days after this incident, Yoshihide came to the palace and asked for an appointment with his lordship. (9) He complained that he could not complete the picture of the torment of hell. (10) He wanted to depict in the middle of the screen how a carriage falls from above, and in it, sweeping away the black hair engulfed in flames, an elegant court lady wriggles in agony. (11) But the artist cannot paint what he had never seen, so Yoshihide asked his lordship to burn the carriage in front of him.
(1) Детство у меня было замечательным. (: (1) I had a wonderful childhood. (2) As a child, there was no money, there was no interesting job, but all this is a profitable business. (A) But in childhood there were father and mother. (4) Our family has always been ruled by a father with his indisputable authority. (5) There was no place for a mother in boyish games. (6) Of course, I could not live without her breakfasts, lunches and dinners, but it was so commonplace that it was imperceptible ... (7) Tenderness was not accepted in our family. (8) We did not kiss my mother before going to bed and did not say in a fit of feelings: - I love you ... (9) Did I tell her this at least once? (10) Life was so filled with important things that there was no place for the usual: he ran home for a minute, had a snack - and again there, where friends, games and passions. (11) Ninety percent I consisted of my mother's worries, but I did not notice them, just as we do not feel and do not see the air we breathe at all. (12) My mother and I lived side by side, but as if in different worlds. (13) These worlds came into contact only once, when a story happened that turned out to be more interesting than all the adventures and undertakings: playing football, shooting a self-propelled gun and launching rockets. (14) Usually my mother spent time at the stove, in the bathroom or on the couch - reading books, I remember, she cried over Dostoevsky's Poor People. (15) But sometimes she suddenly jumped up from the sofa, full of energy and ready for exploits. (16) She was attracted by business activity, her mother was full of the most daring business plans. (17) She loved to say: "We lived poorly - that's enough!" (18) But her business was usually limited to dreams and laughter: she shared her plans with those close to her, and they made fun of her. (19) And yet, one day my mother was able to captivate me with her plan: it was about flying on an airplane! (20) I was assigned the role of an assistant: in the morning she bought three buckets of cherries at our bazaar, we got on a plane and in half an hour we were already in the regional center, where the same cherries could be sold with considerable profit! (According to Yu. Nechiporenko)
(1) Трейлер первого художественного филь: (1) The trailer for the first feature film about American musician Jimi Hendrix, All Is by My Side, has been released on the XLrator Media multiplatform. (2) The film was first shown in 2013 at the Toronto Film Festival, but it will be presented to the general public in September 2014. (3) The role of the musician in this tape was played by a member of the hip-hop duo Outkast Andre Benjamin, also known as Andre 3000. (4) The film tells about the early stage in Hendrix's work - performances in New York clubs, life in London, relationships with girlfriends Linda Keats and Katie Etchingham and preparing the first album Are You Experienced. (5) As the project was not approved by Experience Hendrix, which owns the rights to Hendrix's musical heritage, no original guitarist songs were included in the film. (6) Instead, the tape features covers of The Beatles and Muddy Waters. (7) Attempts have already been made to film the musician's biography. (8) In particular, Eddie Murphy and Will Smith wanted to play Hendrix. (9) In addition, director Paul Greengrass was interested in the project. (10) However, the Greengrass tape never went into production In 2009, Hendrix was named the greatest guitarist of all time by Time magazine. (11) Experts call the musician one of the most inventive and virtuoso guitarists in rock history. (12) His name is featured on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.
(1) Определился первый финалист Открытог: (1) The first finalist of the French Open Tennis Championships (Roland Garros) in men's singles has been announced. (2) Robin Söderling of Sweden is ranked seventh by the Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP). (3) In the semifinals, Söderling beat the 17th racket of the world Tomas Berdych from the Czech Republic. (4) The official website of the tournament informs about it. (5) The match between Söderling and Berdykh lasted three and a half hours. (6) The Swedish tennis player lost in games 1: 2, but turned the tide of the match and won in five sets. (7) The final score of the meeting is 6: 3, 3: 6, 5: 7, 6: 3, 6: 3. (8) In the final, Söderling will play against the winner of the second semi-final, which will face Spaniard Rafael Nadal and Austrian Jurgen Melzer. (9) This match will take place on the evening of June 4th. (10) Söderling reached the Roland Garros final for the second time in a row. (11) In 2009, the Swede lost to the Swiss Roger Federer in the decisive match. (12) Interestingly, Söderling is the only tennis player to beat Nadal at the French Open. (13) Italian Francesca Schiavone and Australian Samantha Stosur will play in the women's singles final at Roland Garros. (14) Their match will take place on June 5th.
\"(1) Участник митинга оппозиции в Петер: "(1) A participant in an opposition rally in St. Petersburg, who suffered from police actions on July 31, identified the so-called" pearl ensign. "(2) Dmitry Semyonov told the Ekho Moskvy radio station that he was offered to identify three similar men in uniform and one from them he recognized his offender. (3) According to Semyonov, the warrant officer's name is Vadim Boyko. (4) It turned out that “he is divorced, he has two minor children, he pays alimony.” (5) According to the victim's lawyer, the warrant officer's arrest in this situation is unlikely. (6) Semyonov added that he was promised to be informed about further investigation. (7) The conflict between Semyonov and Boyko occurred during the dispersal of the opposition rally. (8) The ensign called the demonstrators "ferrets" and cursed them. (9) ) When Semyonov made Boyko a remark about inappropriate behavior, the policeman hit him in the face and grabbed him by the hair. (10) The video of the incident got on the Internet and caused a lot of responses. (11) The ensign received the nickname "pearl" because and on his hand was a bracelet made of a material similar to pearls. (12) A criminal case was initiated on the fact of harsh actions of the police during the dispersal of the opposition. (13) It was reported that there are no specific suspects yet. (14) In addition, the St. Petersburg City Internal Affairs Directorate investigates the actions of the police at the rally as part of an official check. (15) According to its results, disciplinary measures may be taken against the offenders. (16) The status of the identified warrant officer on investigative actions is not specified. "
\"(1) Арбитражный суд Москвы 28 февраля: "(1) The Moscow Arbitration Court on February 28 ruled that the NTV channel should pay the actress Tatyana Vasilyeva compensation in the amount of 50 thousand rubles. (2) RIA Novosti reports. (3) Vasilyeva filed a lawsuit against NTV for showing video "New Year's Tariff" of the mobile operator MTS, based on the film of the same name. (4) The court recognized that the actress's copyright had been violated and demanded that NTV pay her 10 thousand rubles for each video that appeared on the air. (5) В The MTS commercial used fragments of the film with Vasilyeva's participation without her consent. (6) The actress also filed lawsuits against MTS, the film production company Igor Tolstunov's Production Company LLC (Profit) and a number of media outlets. (7) In addition to NTV were submitted to Channel One, NTV, VGTRK, TV Center and TNT, which broadcast the video. (8) Earlier, the court dismissed Vasilyeva's claim against TV Center OJSC due to an incomplete set of documents. (9) Remaining claims court will consider in March. (10) on the 4th day of the court will hold a preliminary hearing on the claim against the Profit company. (11) The actress demands 6 million rubles from her. (12) The film "New Year's Tariff" was released in December 2008. (13) At that time, the MTS video was also broadcast on TV channels. (14) Grossing of the film "New Year's Tariff" in the CIS amounted to four million dollars. (15) Product placement (hidden advertising) cost MTS 11.3 million rubles. "
(1) Прежде всего Берлах приказывает держ: (1) First of all, Berlach orders to keep the murder story a secret, despite the disagreement of his boss Lutz. (2) On the same morning, he goes to Schmid's apartment. (3) There he discovers the dead man's folder with documents, but so far he has not told anyone about it. (4) When the next morning Tschanz summoned by him appears to his office, Berlach momentarily thinks that he sees the late Schmid in front of him, since Tschantz is dressed exactly like Schmid. (5) Berlach tells his assistant that he guesses who the murderer is, but refuses to reveal his name to Tschantsu. (6) Tschanz himself must find the answer. From Frau Schenler, with whom Schmid rented a room, Tschanz learns that on the days marked in the calendar with the letter "G", in the evenings her tenant put on a tailcoat and left home. (7) Tschanz and Berlach go to the crime scene. (8) Tschanz stops the car before turning onto the road from Twann to Lambouin and turns off the headlights. (9) He hopes that where Schmid was on Wednesday, a reception is being arranged today, and expects to follow the cars that will be heading for this reception. (10) And so it happens.
(1) Спецподразделения Воздушно-десантных: (1) Special units of the Airborne Forces have adopted more than 30 sniper rifles manufactured by the Austrian company Steyr Mannlicher. (2) Colonel Alexander Kucherenko, a representative of the Russian Ministry of Defense for the Airborne Forces, said this, according to RIA Novosti. (3) According to him, rifles of the Mannlicher system were the first such foreign-made weapons that entered the Airborne Forces. (4) The purchase of Austrian small arms has been going on since the end of 2010. (5) The supply of new sniper rifles to the special forces and reconnaissance units of the Airborne Forces will continue in the future. (6) The military has already undergone retraining for new weapons at interregional training centers and at the Ministry of Defense's sniper courses. (7) What kind of rifles were adopted by the special forces of the Airborne Forces, Kucherenko did not specify. (8) According to the Steyr Mannlicher product catalog, the Austrian company currently manufactures SSG 04, SSG 08, SSG 69, SSG Elite and HS.80 sniper rifles. (9) Currently, the Airborne Forces usually use SVD, SVDS and VSS sniper rifles. (10) Speaking about the supply of other types of weapons and military equipment, Kucherenko spoke about the renewal of the fleet of unmanned aerial vehicles. (11) What kind of devices entered service with the military is not specified. (12) In addition, the paratroopers received 20 sets of radar reconnaissance stations, 35 laser reconnaissance devices and several sets of new portable ground reconnaissance stations.
(1) Украинский спортсмен Вадим Титушко,: (1) Ukrainian athlete Vadim Titushko, convicted of beating two journalists in Kiev, will compete at the Mixed Martial Arts World Cup. (2) This was reported to Segodnya by Oksana Shkoda, Titushko's lawyer. (3) According to her, an athlete from Bila Tserkva (a city in the Kiev region) will represent one of the local clubs as part of the Ukrainian national team. (4) “The Cup will be held in late October - early November, and the venue is still being determined. (5) Athletes from many countries want to participate, ”said Skoda. (6) According to the newspaper, the competition can be held in Kiev or Yalta. (7) Who exactly organizes the tournament is not specified (there are several mixed martial arts federations in Ukraine). (8) Vadim Titushko, we recall, was tried for attacking an employee of Channel 5, Olga Snitsarchuk, and Vladislav Sodel, a photographer for Kommersant. (9) On May 18, they were beaten by a group of young people in the center of Kiev, where several political rallies were held simultaneously. (10) The opposition organized the final action "Get up, Ukraine!", And the ruling Party of Regions - the "anti-fascist march". (11) Each of them was attended, according to various sources, from four to 20 thousand people. (12) The athlete himself claimed that he came to the rally in order to "earn extra money", he denied the fact of beating up journalists. (13) At the end of August, Titushko entered into an amicable agreement with Snitsarchuk and Sodel. (14) Under its terms, he received a three-year suspended sentence and pledged to pay reporters compensation in the amount of 11 thousand hryvnia (1.3 thousand dollars) to each.
(1) Это было давным – давно, когда много: (1) It was a long time ago, when many things in our world were different. (2) The rivers flowed the other way, the mountains were in a different place, and the tigers were completely different. (3) They had the same claws, the same teeth, but the skin was not at all like that. (4) The skin of the tigers was bright, fiery red, one of the most beautiful skins of all animals. (5) But there was very little sense from such a beautiful skin. (6) The tiger was visible day and night, in the bushes and on the plain, everywhere it was given out by a bright color. (7) He has not had a good hunt for a long time. (8) And then one day a tiger, having met a zebra, started a conversation with her: - Tell a zebra, why do you walk on the plain calmly and are not afraid of me? the tiger asked. (9) - I see you from afar, and I know that I can easily hide from you behind the branches by jumping into the bushes. (10) After all, I do not just walk all in stripes. (11) They help me disappear among the branches whenever someone is about to hunt for me, - she answered warily.
(1) Новый хозяин Швейка — любитель живот: (1) The new owner of Švejk is a lover of animals and women. (2) Schweik helps Lukash in his affections: he hospitably receives a lady who has come to visit the lieutenant. (3) True, after a while you have to send a telegram to the guest's husband and send Katie home. (4) Schweik also skillfully treats animals: he accidentally feeds the lieutenant's favorite canary to the lieutenant's cat (the cat then eats the boot cream). (5) The dog that Lukasz asks to buy for him is stolen by Schweik from Colonel Zillergut. (6) The last incident ends with the fact that Lukash, together with Švejk, are sent to the ninety-first regiment in Budejovice. (7) The misadventures of Svejk and Lukash begin on the platform, where their suitcase was stolen. (8) In the compartment, the orderly and the lieutenant scolding him incur the wrath of the third passenger, the major general. (9) Svejk, finally escorted out of the compartment, with the participation of a railway worker, accidentally stops the train with an emergency brake. (10) For this, the gallant soldier is taken to the head of the station in Tabor, and Lieutenant Lukash happily leaves for the front without Schweik.
(1) Бой за титул чемпиона мира в супертя: (1) The fight for the world heavyweight title according to the World Boxing Council (WBC), which was previously refused by Ukrainian Vitali Klitschko, will be held in Mexico. (2) The official website of the WBC reports. (3) The exact place and date of the fight between the American Chris Arreola and the Canadian Bermaine Steven will be announced later. (4) WBC Press Officer Victor Kota said the fight would attract the attention of a huge number of fans around the world. (5) “This will be the third heavyweight championship fight to be held in Latin America and the second to be held in Mexico, so this is a historic event for boxing,” added Kota. (6) Arreola and Stevern were announced as contenders for the WBC title on January 23, 2014. (7) Before Klitschko's refusal, Stevern was the obligatory contender for his belt. (8) The Canadian received this status after the victory over Arreola in April 2013. (9) The 32-year-old Arreola has 36 wins (31 by knockout) in 39 fights in the professional ring, as well as three defeats. (10) 35-year-old Stevern had 25 fights, winning 23 (20 by knockout). (1) Они действительно остановились посер: (1) They really stopped in the middle of the bridge, and the man realized that he had only a few seconds to decide. (6) At first, he really was primitive and vulgarly sorry for his favorite cane. (7) Not because it was a pity that it cost money (if it was necessary to throw away the paper money, he would not hesitate), but because it was a beautiful, rare thing, ancient work, perhaps the only one in the whole world. (8) And in general it is a pity, and in general what a whim! (9) - Well, make up your mind, it's cold to stand here in the wind. (10) Yes or no? (11) Are you walking with me or are you turning back? (12) - But at least to see you off ... You can't leave here alone at this hour. (13) Let me see you ... (14) - I won’t let you, yes or no? (15) Alexei turned sharply and walked quickly back to the trolleybus stop. (16) “There is a limit to everything,” he said to himself, “an old, antique thing - to the Neva! (17) A humble servant. " (18) Many years have passed when, behind the sofa, behind the books piled under the sofa, while searching for one book he suddenly needed, Alexei discovered an object that he had not remembered, at least for the last three or four years, - beautiful, ebony cane with a bone knob. (19) Now he found her, dusty and forgotten. (20) What an idle, what an unnecessary object - if you could now exchange it for ... if you could exchange a hundred canes, all that are in the world, canes, all these soulless, pitiful objects ... (1) На пикнике Огастут хотел поцеловать: (1) At the picnic, Augustute wanted to kiss Hazel, but the girl was not ready for such a relationship. (1)Позвольте напомнить известное изречен: (1) Let me remind you of the famous saying: “Where is our wisdom, lost in knowledge? Where is our knowledge lost in information? " (2) The highest that a person can achieve is wisdom. (3) She should have become a school subject, wisdom should be taught. (4) More precisely, wisdom must be taught - as caution in judgments, refraining from insufficiently substantiated statements, the ability to take into account many factors, relying on what is born of a variety of historical experience. (5) It is more than knowledge. (b) It is also intuition and aversion to self-deception. (7) A wise person is never presumptuous: he does not consider the results of thought obtained by him to be final, he admits their error, comparing them with directly opposite statements and finding gaps in what seemed indisputable. (8) Wisdom needs knowledge, but is not limited to it. (9) Someone may know, say, all types of butterflies and not understand anything about environmental problems. (10) Don't even be interested in them. (11) In this case, a person loses sight of the connection of a single butterfly with the structure of the world. (12) Knowledge answers the question “Why?”, And information - only the questions “What? Where? When? How?". (13) Knowledge consists of "understandings" and is the property of science. (14) Knowledge needs information, but it is not limited to it - it is higher because it knows how to check the accuracy of information. (15) Knowledge in the European and now in the worldwide scientific tradition has always opposed opinion. (16) Opinion is just some relation to something, and knowledge is, I repeat, an understanding of a pattern. (17) It is important not so much to defend your opinion without fail, as to think about it being proven, even if it strives to become knowledge. (18) The desire to encourage unfounded opinions in every possible way as an end in itself is very dangerous for a growing person. (19) It is not enough to think on your own - you still need to think correctly. (20) It turns out that one's own thought requires a long and painful argument with oneself, an internal rigid requirement for checks and re-checks, building long chains of reasoning - this is a serious work. (According to B. Bim-Bad *)

\"(1) 24 члена правительства Москвы пода: "(1) 24 members of the Moscow government have filed a lawsuit against the leader of the Liberal Democratic Party, Deputy Speaker of the State Duma Vladimir Zhirinovsky and the VGTRK television company, ITAR-TASS reports. 3) The class action lawsuit of Moscow officials concerns the protection of honor, dignity and business reputation. (1) На Украине собираются поднять со дна: (1) In Ukraine, they are going to raise from the bottom of the Black Sea the Soviet submarine "Shch-216", which sank during the Great Patriotic War. (2) This was reported by the press service of the President of the Republic Viktor Yanukovych. (3) The President instructed to "study the issue of the possibility of lifting" the submarine. (4) Specialized institutions will have to prepare project documentation and provide funding. After the submarine is lifted, the remains of its crew will be buried. (5) It is planned to create a museum on the basis of Shch-216. (6) The president instructed the head of his administration, Sergei Lyovochkin, and the head of government, Nikolai Azarov, to deal with this issue. (7) Information that a sunken Soviet submarine was found off the coast of Crimea (near Cape Tarkhankut) was disseminated by the local committee for the protection of cultural heritage in early July. (8) The head of the government of the autonomy, Anatoly Mogilev, called it a “unique find” and a landmark event for Ukraine. (9) Meanwhile, according to some reports, the sunken submarine "Shch-216" was discovered back in the 1950s. (10) At the same time, the log was reportedly raised to the surface. (11) Diesel-electric submarine "Shch-216" (project "Pike") was built in 1940. (12) She was part of the Black Sea Fleet. (13) She took part in military operations, sank in 1944. (14) Presumably sunk by a depth charge. (15) The crew was killed.
\"(1) Канадский порноактер Лука Рокко Ма: "(1) Canadian porno actor Luca Rocco Magnotta, who was detained in Berlin on suspicion of murdering and dismembering a lover, was brought before a judge, Agence France-Presse reports, citing German prosecutors. (1) Повествователь примеряет своему геро: (1) The narrator tries on stories to his hero like dresses. (2) The novel begins with Enderlin having a car accident and nearly knocking over eleven schoolchildren. (3) As he was driving, he apparently wondered about the invitation to give a few lectures at Harvard, which he had received shortly before. (4) He loses the desire to appear in front of his acquaintances and everyone around him as a forty-year-old doctor of philosophy, and he decides to change his image, chooses a new role for himself - the role of the blind, and calls himself Gantenbein. (5) He acquires all the attributes of a blind person: glasses, a wand, a yellow armband and a certificate of the blind, which gives him a legal opportunity to gain a foothold in society in this image. (6) From now on, he sees in people what they would never allow him to see, if they did not consider him blind. (7) The true essence of all those with whom he communicates, whom he loves is revealed to him. (8) His dark glasses become a kind of element that splits truth and falsehood. (9) It is convenient for people to communicate with those in front of whom they do not need to put on a mask, who does not see too much. (10) Posing as a blind man, Gantenbein tries to free himself, in particular, from the vulgar jealousy inherent in him before. (11) After all, a blind man does not see, does not see much: glances, smiles, letters, those who are next to his beloved woman. (12) His appearance changes, but does his essence change?
(1) Около пятидесяти православных верующ: (1) About fifty Orthodox believers held a religious procession in Lipetsk on February 6 against the musical "Jesus Christ Superstar". (2) This is reported on the website of the Lipetsk Vremya TV and Radio Company. (3) They opposed the staging of a rock opera on the stage of a local drama theater, calling the musical "God-fighting." (4) The rock opera will be staged on February 18 by the Rock Opera Theater in St. Petersburg. (5) The protesters intend to go to the rally again on February 10 and 15, as reported to the townspeople in leaflets. (6) In October last year, Orthodox activists in Rostov-on-Don tried to disrupt the theater tour with the same performance. (7) Dissatisfied believers filed a complaint with the prosecutor's office, saying that the musical offends their feelings. (8) At the same time, the Rostov diocese opposed the ban on rock opera. (9) Church representatives called the activists' demands "a drift towards sectarianism." (10) As a result, on October 18, the musical still took place on the stage of the Rostov theater. (11) The rock opera "Jesus Christ Superstar" was written in 1970 by Andrew Lloyd Webber. (12) A year later, the musical was staged, with the title role performed by Deep Purple vocalist Ian Gillan. (13) In 1973, the rock opera was filmed by director Norman Jewison. (14) The Rock Opera Theater first staged a musical in Russian in 1990 in St. Petersburg. (15) It should be noted that in the 70s and 80s the opera was banned in the USSR as containing religious propaganda.
(1) Владелец похоронной компании из Ирла: (1) Irish funeral company owner David McGowan bought a decommissioned Boeing 767, previously operated by Transaero, to make a hotel out of it. (2) Reported by the Irish Independent. (3) The man spent 20 thousand euros on the purchase of the liner. (4) In the future, he plans to place an airplane on his site in the village of Enniskron (County Sligo) and make it a hotel. (5) “I have a 15-acre lot in a swampy area, and I thought for a long time what to do with it. (6) I have studied various unusual accommodations. (7) And the thought occurred to me that I could make a hotel out of an airplane, ”McGowan said. (8) In search of a suitable liner, the man contacted three nearby airports. (9) In Dublin and Cork, the businessman did not find anything, but the Shannon air harbor (County Clare) agreed to sell him the necessary plane. (10) It is noted that now the entrepreneur faces a difficult task - to deliver the liner from Shannon to Enniskron. (11) The weight of the aircraft is 70 tons, and the length is 55 meters. (12) Initially, McGowan wanted to transport him on public roads, but it turned out that 126 high-voltage wires, 26 traffic lights and other infrastructure objects would interfere with the plane's route. (13) The businessman is now planning to deliver the Boeing 767 to Sligo by sea. (14) To do this, he needs to wait for the seasonal rise in water level, which will occur from March 21 to 26.
(1) Задумала старая росомаха со своим ст: (1) The old wolverine and her old man decided to look for new places to live. (1) Дома Татарский заправил планшетку бу: (1) At home, Tatarsky filled the tablet with paper, laid his hands on it and summoned the spirit of Che Guevara. (1) Теперь в семье как можно чаще старал: (1) Now in the family, as often as possible, they tried to show each other signs of attention with gifts, and with Alena they often discussed the upcoming gift to relatives or friends.
