\"(1) В Казахстане завершился суд по иск: "(1) In Kazakhstan, the court on the claim of singer Aidos Sagat against the supermarket chain" Rakhmet ", which used his song in a commercial without permission, has ended. compensation, which the entrepreneurs were obliged to pay, turned out to be much less than what the executor demanded. (4) The trial in this case began in September. (5) Sagat, the leader of the ethno-pop group Urker, demanded from entrepreneurs about 74.5 million tenge (about 500 thousand dollars). (6) The lawsuit was based on the fact that a fragment of his song "Nauryz" was used in the commercial. (7) The representative of the defendant, Stanislav Govral, in response to the claims stated that the commercial "popularized "singer. (8)" This is good for the author, but it turns out that we also get a good amount, "he said. (9) Nevertheless, the entrepreneurs were still ready to pay compensation to Sagat, but they considered the amount claimed overestimated. (10) The court eventually appointed Sagat received compensation of half a million tenge (about 3.3 thousand dollars). (11) The respondents were satisfied with this decision. (12) That was the amount they offered the singer before the trial. (13) The plaintiff's representative, for his part, assessed the decision as an example of the fact that the author can defend his rights in court "and receive some money." (14) At the same time, the lawyer noted that "so far we cannot compare in terms of compensation with world performers."
(1) Вскоре, сидя с Морозовым за столиком: (1) Soon, sitting with Morozov at a table in front of the Fouquet restaurant, Ravik again saw a man who looked like Haake, and again lost him in the crowd on Place de la Etoile. (2) Morozov tried to calm down Ravik. (3) He advised a friend to draw up a plan of revenge and strictly follow it. (4) So did Morozov himself, who dreamed of meeting the people who destroyed his family during the Russian revolution. (5) Ravik sat in front of the restaurant for a long time, looking out for Haake and remembering Sibylla. (6) She was "a spoiled, beautiful creature accustomed to an absent-minded, easy life." (7) They were caught trying to leave Germany and tortured for three days. (8) Haake demanded recognition from Ravik, but he had nothing to confess. (9) After the Gestapo, he was sent to a concentration camp, then he ended up in a hospital, from where he fled. (10) Now his dreams were full of "the terror of fascist dungeons, the frozen faces of tortured friends." (11) Never seeing Haake, Ravik decided not to rummage “in the slag of the dead years, which came to life thanks to an absurd, accursed resemblance,” and not sacrifice Joan's love to an accidental illusion.
(1) Наконец терпение у хозяйки дома лопн: (1) Finally, the mistress of the house ran out of patience, and she forbade Pippi to come to visit them. (2) The frustrated girl left the house with the ladies. (3) Despite the grief and resentment, she still managed to finish her story on the way. (4) One day, Pippi went for a ride on horseback. (5) Arriving at the main square, she saw that a fire had started in the tallest building in the town - a three-story "skyscraper". (6) Suddenly, a window opened in the attic under the very roof, and people saw with horror two little boys in it. (7) They cried and called for help, but it was no longer possible to save them. (8) The fire raged, children in the attic window were shouting, people in the square were crying. (9) Realizing that the children would not get out on their own, Pippi decided to save them. (10) She made Mr. Nielson climb a tree with a smooth trunk growing next to a burning house and tie a long rope to a branch. (11) Taking a board with her, the girl climbed up the rope and put it on the fork in the branches. (12) The board reached the attic sill. (13) Pippi entered there and soon left with the boys in her arms.
(1) Чтобы сойти в городе, в котором редк: (1) To get off in a city where trains rarely stop, Clara pulls down the emergency stop valve and appears in front of the inhabitants, surrounded by a whole retinue of her entourage, consisting of her seventh husband, a butler, two thugs, chewing gum all the time and carrying her palanquin, maids and two blind men, Kobe and Loby. (5) Clara shows interest in the policeman, curious if he knows how to close his eyes to what is happening in the city, and the priest, asking him if he forgives the sins of those sentenced to death. (1) Музей Гуггенхайма в Абу-Даби предста: (1) The Guggenheim Museum in Abu Dhabi will present its collection, according to The New York Times. (2) "Looking Through the Light: Selected Items from the Guggenheim Abu Dhabi Collection" will open at the Manarat Al Saadiyat Exhibition Center on November 5, 2014. (3) The exhibition will feature 16 exhibits united by the idea of ​​light. (4) The exposition will be divided into thematic sections dedicated to different types of light - reflected, heavenly, transcendental and others. (5) According to the curators, they chose light as the theme of the exhibition, as it is a piece of art, regardless of time and culture. (6) In support of the exhibition in Abu Dhabi, two works from the main collection of the Guggenheim will be brought from New York. (7) The building of the Arab branch of the Guggenheim Museum, designed by Frank Gehry, will be built by 2017 on Saadiyat Island. (8) While only the foundation of the museum is ready, its curators have already managed to assemble a significant collection of 250 works of art created since 1960. (9) Several large museums are planned to open in the "cultural quarter" of Saadiyat Island. (10) Buildings of a branch of the Louvre in Paris and the Sheikh Zayed National Museum are under construction, designed by Norman Foster. (11) Both museums have already presented their collections at Manarat al-Saadiyat. (12) The Solomon Guggenheim Museum is one of the largest museums of contemporary art in the world, named after its founder, a famous American philanthropist. (13) Currently, four branches of the museum are open in the USA and Europe. (14) Four more branches are under construction or are at the design stage.
\"(1) Советские рекламные ролики 70-80-х: "(1) Soviet commercials from the 70s and 80s will be passed on to collector Jean-Marie Boursicot, the founding father of the Night of the Advertising Eaters festival. (2) This was stated by the producer of the festival in Russia, Daniil Kostinsky, RIA Novosti reports. (3) According to him, the collection of videos from the archives of Lendokfilm and Gosfilmofond will be handed over to Boursico. (4) The Russian "Night of the Advertising Eaters" will be the world premiere of the festival in 2010. (5) It will be held on the night of April 16-17 at the Moscow cinema "October" (6) In total this time about 400 videos will be shown, of which only 3 will be Russian. (7) Most of the festival program will include advertisements from Great Britain and France - 35-40 videos each. (8) The ratio of social and commercial advertising will be about 40 to 60. (9) "Night of the ad eaters" in Russia this year will stretch for the whole year, as it will be held in cinemas in different cities of the country. (10) The project will be completed on Christmas night in St. Petersburg . (11) Advertising, annually included in the show, is determined by Jean-Marie Boursicot himself, in whose collection there are about a million videos. (12) The collection itself is already thirty years old. (13) Each year, Boursicot receives more than 25 thousand videos from the world's advertising agencies. "
(1) Молодые пытаются завести ребёнка, но: (1) Young people are trying to have a child, but the examination reveals "inexplicable infertility", from which the family is unhappy. (2.) They are asked to consider adoption, but they hesitate. (3) Amir considers childlessness to be a payment for old sins, including before Hassan. (4) 2001. (5) Heroes live in San Francisco, in a beautiful house, work. (6) The call of Rahim Khan, offering to visit him in Pakistan, knocks Amir out of the established life. (7) An old friend in a conversation makes it clear that he knows all the unsightly secrets of Amir, and hints that there is an opportunity to fix everything. (8) On the night before leaving, the hero dreams of a happy Hassan. (9) Upon meeting, the hero barely recognizes Rahim Khan - he is dying. (10) He tells him about the unbearable situation in his homeland, which is ruled by the Taliban. (11) And he begins a story about Hasan, which is hard for Amir to hear. (1) Премьер-министр Японии Юкио Хатояма: (1) Japanese Prime Minister Yukio Hatoyama has appointed Naoto Kan as the country's new finance minister, Bloomberg reports. (2) The former head of the department, 77-year-old Hirohisa Fuji, retired for health reasons. (3) On December 28, 2009, Fujii was admitted to hospital with high blood pressure after weeks of hard work on the country's budget. (4) He later submitted a letter of resignation, but initially Hatoyama did not grant the request of his subordinate. (5) Naoto Kan previously headed the now ruling Democratic Party of Japan. (6) For a time he served as Minister of Health in the coalition government of the 1990s. (7) Immediately prior to his appointment, he was Fujii's deputy in the ministry. (8) Kang was appointed minister in a situation where the Japanese economy continues to suffer from deflation. (9) Although economic growth has resumed in the country since the second quarter of 2009, the likelihood of a second consecutive recession remains high. (10) One of Kahn's tasks will be to combat the uncontrolled growth of government spending. (11) The country's budget for 2010 showed a record deficit. (12) At the same time, the total public debt is approaching 200 percent, which is significantly more than in any other developed country. (13) Prior to Fuji, Seichi Nakagawa, who resigned in early 2009 after being convicted of public drunkenness, occupied the cabinet of finance minister. (14) In the fall of 2009, 56-year-old Nakagawa was found dead at his home. (15) The circumstances of his death are not known.
(1) Премьер-министр Великобритании Дэвид: (1) British Prime Minister David Cameron left his red briefcase with secret working documents unattended on the train. (2) This was reported to The Daily Mirror by a passenger on the same train who photographed a suitcase. (3) Representatives of the Prime Minister said that Cameron's security was watching the case, writes The Independent. (4) It is alleged that The Daily Mirror's source did not notice its employees. (5) The incident occurred on Saturday, September 7, when Cameron was driving from London to York for his relative's wedding. (6) According to the passenger who provided the photo, he met the Prime Minister in the dining car. (7) Then, walking along the train, an informant from The Daily Mirror saw the place where Cameron was sitting. (8) On the table, along with newspapers, lay a red case with the words "Prime Minister" on it. (9) The key to the briefcase, where secret documents are usually kept, was inserted into the lock. (10) The passenger calmly photographed the case and headed on. (11) This is not the first time Cameron has been accused of forgetfulness. (12) So, in the summer of 2012, he and his wife Samantha accidentally left their nine-year-old daughter in a pub and left the establishment. (13) The girl waited for her father for only 15 minutes. (14) The red cases are presented to British ministers in a tradition that began in the 1860s. (15) Each of them bears an inscription indicating the owner. (16) These cases are supposed to keep secret documents.
\"(1) Президент РФ Дмитрий Медведев похв: "(1) Russian President Dmitry Medvedev praised the officers of the Internal Affairs Directorate of the Northern Administrative District of Moscow, who detained the suspects in the murder of Spartak fan Yegor Sviridov. (2) This was reported on February 7 by the Interfax agency. (3)" The resonance was very great, you worked well, and then there were all sorts of miracles, "Medvedev said during a visit to the Internal Affairs Directorate. (4) The head of the Internal Affairs Directorate Ravil Sofyin responded by saying that CCTV footage helped to detain the suspects. (6) Yegor Sviridov was killed by a shot from a traumatic pistol during a fight between fans and natives of the Caucasus, which took place on Kronstadt Boulevard on December 6, 2010. (7) After the fight, all the natives of the Caucasus were detained by police. (8) However, soon all of them, In addition to the direct suspect in the murder of Aslan Cherkesov, they were released. (9) The release of the Caucasians aroused the indignation of Spartak fans. (10) They staged a number of actions ottesta, including the pogrom at Manezhnaya Square. (11) Soon, Khasan Ibragimov, Nariman Ismailov, Artur Arsibiev and Akay Akayev, released after the fight, were again detained. (12) Another Caucasian, Ramazan Utarbiev, was put on the wanted list. "
(1) Елисей находит винный погреб, сбивае: (1) Elisha finds a wine cellar, knocks down the locks with his fist, and drinks at his pleasure. (2) An old witch doctor comes to the tax farmer and boasts to him: they say, she is a master of various fortune-telling and conspiracies and can easily remove the addiction to wine from any drunkard. (3) The farmer is alarmed by her last statement, and he demands that she not wean off wine, but, on the contrary, bewitch the people to alcohol. (4) She refuses, and he drives her away. (5) Elisha has been wandering all this time. (6) It begins to seem to him that Bacchus himself with his retinue is coming to his aid and they are wreaking havoc in the cellar, after which they set out to empty the cellars of other tax farmers. (7) Zeus from Olympus observes the exploits of Elisha and decides to summon the gods to advise him how to deal with such a daring and daring drunkard. (8) The gods are divided, but most of them want to execute Elisha. (9) Zeus, after listening to their opinion, announces to the assembly that he has found the right solution. (10) He notifies the gods that soon people will gather at the "Ruka" drinking house for a fist fight. (11) There, Elisha will show the wonders of valiant prowess, after which his fate will be decided: from a dashing fist fighter should turn out to be an excellent warrior.
(1) Решив непременно совершить выдающийс: (1) Determined to accomplish an outstanding feat, Malone goes to the editor of the "Breaking News" section with a request to give him an assignment involving "adventures and dangers." (2) After some thought, the editor invites Malone to expose one "charlatan, the modern Munchausen" and sends the journalist to Professor George Edward Challenger. (3) Some time ago, a professor brought back evidence from South America confirming that prehistoric animals still exist. (4) The scientific community found this evidence to be falsified, which angered Challenger terribly. (5) Since then, the professor has fiercely attacked anyone who crosses the threshold of his house. (6) Challenger especially hates journalists. (7) Introducing himself as a novice naturalist, Malone sends the professor a letter from the address of the magazine "Nature", in which he asks for a meeting. (8) Soon a letter of invitation arrives, and Malone goes to Challenger. (9) The professor, a small man with very powerful shoulders, a stately posture, a huge head, a low, echoing voice and a square blue-black beard, very quickly exposes an imaginary naturalist. (10) There is a fight between him and Malone. (11) The case reaches the police, but the journalist refuses to bring charges against Challenger. (12) Seeing in the behavior of the journalist "some signs of decency," the professor exchanges anger for mercy and shows the evidence he brought from the Amazon.
(1) Когда девушка уходит с балкона, Хрис: (1) When the girl leaves the balcony, Christian Theodore surmises that the princess was his interlocutor. (2) He wants to continue the conversation, and he half-jokingly addresses his shadow lying at his feet, inviting her to go instead to the stranger and tell about his love. (3) Suddenly, the shadow separates and dives into the loosely closed door of the adjacent balcony. (4) The scientist becomes ill. (5) Annunziata rushing in, notices that the guest no longer has a shadow, and this is a bad sign. (6) She runs after the doctor. (7) Her father Pietro advises not to tell anyone about what happened. But in the city everyone knows how to eavesdrop. (8) So, the journalist Caesar Borgia, who entered the room, discovers full awareness of the conversation between Christian Theodore and the girl. (9) Both he and Pietro are sure that this is a princess, and do not want her to marry a newcomer. (10) According to Pietro, you need to find an escaped shadow, which, being the complete opposite of its owner, will help prevent the wedding. (11) Annunziata is full of anxiety for the future of the young man, since she secretly already loves him.
(1) Гремяченцы позажиточней в колхоз стр: (1) Not all of the Gremyachen residents were more prosperous on the collective farm. (2) Those dissatisfied with the authorities secretly gathered to discuss the situation. (3) Among them were the middle peasants, and even some of the poor, Nikita Khoprov, for example, who was blackmailed by the fact that he had been in a punitive detachment of whites for some time. (4) But Khoprov refused the offer of Ostrovnov to participate in the armed uprising. (5) Better he will inform himself. (6) By the way, who lives with Lukich in the chaff — isn't that “your honor” who is inciting to mutiny? (7) That same night, Khoprov and his wife were killed. (8) Ostrovnov, Polovtsev and the son of the dispossessed man, the first village handsome man and accordion player Timofey Rvany took part in this. (9) A district investigator was unable to obtain the clues leading to the murder. (10) A week later, the general meeting of collective farmers approved the newcomer Davydov as the chairman of the collective farm, and Ostrovnov as the manager. (1) Какое же зеркало жизни наш язык!(2): (1) What a mirror of life is our language! (2) No, it is truly great, remaining to this day free, truthful. (3) He accepts everything, responds to everything like Pushkin's echo, moreover, he will take in foreign words and teach them to produce new forms (not to clone!) (4) The only trouble is that all this sometimes goes on in an ugly, illiterate mixture. (5) So, in a short time they managed to become Russified and even delimited in meaning such words familiar in the sports environment as "fanatic" and "fan", and now "fan", and even religious fanaticism takes on a different coloring. (6) There were once "fans", even "claqueurs" (French). (7) There are also football fans (not "fans"), pop music. (8) Even the old-fashioned "private", once rarely found in everyday speech, in V. Dahl's dictionary is interpreted as "private", "personal", "special", "home" ("privat-docent", "private conversation "), We managed to nationalize so that the word" privatization ", even in everyday, always sensitive to shades of language, acquired a dismissive sound, becoming" privatization ". (9) But it is known that a word, a hero, a phenomenon that has fallen into the national language, folklore, anecdote, already become “ours”, “familiar”, like witty words from the films of Danelia, Ryazanov, Gaidai. (10) Linguistic colors are everywhere. (11) What a field for observing linguists, writers, actors! (12) But how unusual, spiritualized in our super-business speech are ancient words that have gone temporarily, but live on the pages of the classics and are waiting for bright days. (13) In no case should we close our eyes to the fact that, in addition to foreign words, we are also overwhelmed by criminal vocabulary. (14) Where did these “cool”, “cool”, “roofs”, “cool” come from? (15) Their source is clear. (16) But why do they flourish among quite decent youth, sound from the screen, dazzle in print? (17) Anyone who cares for our language can continue this conversation. (18) After all, even now he is “great, mighty, truthful and free”. (19) We only spoil it ourselves, forgetting that it is alive, therefore we should not offend him with vulgarity, foreign litter, profanity, clerical delights, incompatible mishmash. (According to T. Zharova *)
(1) Россиянин Дмитрий Михайленко стал об: (1) Russian Dmitry Mikhailenko won the title of North American champion according to the World Boxing Association (WBA NABA). (2) Sherdog portal reports about it. (3) On Saturday, August 8, 29-year-old Mikhailenko defeated Cuban Johan Perez by TKO in a bout in Indio, California. (4) At the beginning of the battle, the Russian received a cut eyebrow, but continued to fight. (5) The Cuban dominated for several starting rounds, but then Mikhailenko seized the initiative. (6) In the fifth round, he strongly shook the opponent with a right hand. (7) In the eighth round, the Russian boxer hit Peres in the jaw with a left hook, stunned him and sent him to the ropes. (8) Then Mikhailenko began to finish off the opponent. (9) The referee, seeing that the Cuban was unable to defend himself, stopped the bout. (10) “He caught me a couple of times with his punches, but it didn't become a big problem,” Mikhailenko said after the fight. (11) According to the athlete, he has not yet planned the next fights, since he has a sick mother in Russia who needs care. (12) The Russian boxer has 20 victories (nine by knockout) in 20 fights. (13) His opponent suffered a third defeat with 20 wins and one draw. (14) Mikhailenko competes in the welterweight category (up to 66.7 kilograms). (15) He is also the holder of the World Boxing Organization (WBO) European title.
(1) Жил-был маленький медвежонок. (2) У: (1) Once upon a time there was a little bear cub. (2) He had parents: mom - a bear and dad - a bear. (3) They loved their son very much and often said to him: - You are our sun! (4) We love you so much! (5) But one day the bear cub swam in the river and swam to the depths. (6) Mother - a bear, seeing this, was very frightened and strictly forbade him to swim to the depth. (7) Then the teddy bear thought: - How sternly my mother speaks to me. (8) She probably doesn't love me at all. (9) He was very upset and decided to leave home to find another mother.
\"(1) В Латвии вынесен приговор владельц: "(1) In Latvia, the owner of the Modeles.lv model agency Ruslan Tikhonov was sentenced, who was accused of pimping and human trafficking. (2) By the decision of the Riga Regional Court, he was sentenced to five years in prison with confiscation of property, reports Kriminal.lv. (3 ) So far, only an abbreviated court decision has been announced, the full text will appear on October 14. (3) After that, the convicted person, if he wishes, can appeal. (4) Whether he intends to appeal the verdict, the publication does not specify. (5) Investigation of Modeles.lv activity, how wrote "Komsomolskaya Pravda in Northern Europe", began in the fall of 2009. (6) The investigation was conducted by the law enforcement agencies of Latvia and Great Britain. (7) Tikhonov, according to Kriminal.lv, was detained in connection with an episode concerning the sending of two girls to the UK ( (8) The border guards, who interviewed the girls about the purpose of the visit, found out that they were “ordered to provide escort services.” (9) The client was a certain Russian citizen who lived at that time in UK. (10) In the course of the investigation, it turned out that businessmen chose models based on photographs posted on the Modeles.lv website (later the site was closed, the agency itself, according to the KP, was also terminated). (11) Girls were sent to the UK, France, Italy and the UAE. (12) Average rates for escort services were 1000-2000 euros per day. (13) The trial in this case was held behind closed doors. (14) Ruslan Tikhonov reportedly partially admitted guilt. "
(1) Телемак рассказывает о Египте, где ц: (1) Telemachus tells of Egypt, where Sezostris reigns, a wise sovereign who loves the people as his children. (2) All are happy to obey him, to give their lives for him, all have one thought - "not to be free from his power, but to be eternally under his rule." (3) Sesostris daily receives complaints from his subjects and administers judgment, but he does so with patience, reason and rightness. (4) Such a king is not afraid of his subjects. (5) However, even the wisest sovereigns are subject to danger, for "deceit and greed are always at the foot of the throne." (6) Evil and cunning courtiers are ready to please the sovereign for their own benefit, and woe to the tsar if he becomes a "playboy of evil deceit", if he does not drive "flattery from himself and does not love those who tell him the truth in a bold voice." (7) According to the slander of one of these courtiers, Telemac is sent along with the slaves to graze herds of cows. (8) After the death of Sezostris, Telemachus sails on a Phoenician ship to Phenicia, where Pygmalion reigns. (9) This is a greedy and envious ruler, from whom neither the people nor the state benefit. (10) From avarice, he is distrustful, suspicious and bloodthirsty, drives the rich, fears the poor, everyone hates him. (11) Violent death threatens him both in his "impenetrable palaces" and in the midst of all his bodyguards. (12) "Good Sezostris, on the contrary," argues Telemach, "was safe in the midst of countless people, like a father in a house with a kind family."
\"(1)На другой послеконцертный день мы с: "(1) On another post-concert day, Kozlovsky and I, having separated from the rest of the group, went to the Yuriev Monastery. (2) The once richest Orlova-Chesmenskaya, which was in turn patronized by Archimandrite Photius, flourishing under the golden protective rain, St. George's monastery was now inactive , was empty. (3) No fabulous treasures (for example, the icon "Sign" carved on a huge emerald), no monastic rank, no monastic meals, no large litanies, no loud deacons, no bell ringing that spread over Lake Ilmen twenty versts ... (4) Now there was only smooth green grass, and on it a white-stone building. (5) A monastic wall with towers, in the middle a grandiose, the second after Novgorod Sophia, St. George's Cathedral. (6) So the deceased person is still retains for the living, looking at him, features of similarity, and everything seems to have remained the same: nose, chin, and hands, but why should we deceive ourselves, a person is dead and cold, and his external likeness is itself I'm a blatant lie. (7) An elderly woman, rattling keys, opened the St. George's Cathedral to us, and we entered a cold, real space, bounded high above by a painted dome, and to our right with an iconostasis as high as an eight-storey building? (8) The key keeper remained below, but we climbed a narrow spiral staircase to the choir. (9) Probably, they corresponded to the fourth or even the fifth floor, but there was still a lot of height above them: a good half of the iconostasis, against which we stood, and above the iconostasis there is a dome, and above the dome there is an empty drum, one of it would be enough for a small little church. (10) We stood alone in the choir, and there was not a soul or a living spirit in the whole cathedral. (11) The housekeeper was supposed to remain below, but we did not see her, and she did not seem to exist for us. (12) We were each silent about our own, but it must be assumed that in many places our silence coincided, and the silence of the cathedral helped him and even, who knows, directed him in the right direction. (13) And then the silence burst like a pulled string, but only without a tearing string sound, but immediately another live and strong string sounded and instantly filled the entire huge cathedral with sound. (14) A wave of delight splashed in me from heart to eyes and throat. (15) The Rachmaninoff version of the famous chant was taken immediately and with full force. (16) Whether the acoustics of the cathedral contributed to the impression, was it an extraordinary moment itself, an extraordinary emotional mood, but maybe Kozlovsky never sang so beautifully and with inspiration in his life. (17) If it is true that the audience inspires, then what kind of audience was the singer holding now in front of his half-closed eyes? (18) His voice poured golden, dazzling light, and the stones of the cathedral, awakened and revived, resonated to him with every grain of sand. (19) Downstairs, the old woman with the keys was crying and was about to rush at the feet of the singer, but Kozlovsky lifted her up and calmed her down, stroking her shoulder: Nothing, nothing, granny, lock behind us, thank you, we'll go ... (20) Like this life gave me one of its best impressions, of those impressions that lie in the memory as golden seeds and which, generally speaking, do not accumulate so much in life. (According to V.A. Soloukhin *) "
\"(1)В письме к жене 18 мая 1836 года Пу: "(1) In a letter to his wife on May 18, 1836, Pushkin wondered: where did these sensible young people come from," they spit in their eyes, but they wipe themselves off "instead of defending their honor? (2) Sometimes it seems that we have left coats of these people. (3) The ringing of elastic steel is no longer heard in the word honor. (4) Let's open Dahl's dictionary in order to remember why a life full of great hopes and brilliant ideas was put at stake. (5) So, “ honor is the inner moral dignity of a person, valor, honesty, nobility of soul and a clear conscience. "(6) And here are examples:" A man of unblemished honor. By honor ... I assure you with honor. An act incompatible with honor ... I would have known you are honor ... A field of honor ... My honor requires blood ... "(7) Duel! - only this discharge of murderous power could rapidly restore moral equilibrium. (8) The scoundrel knew that his meanness could be punished by not charging a fine in a year by the court verdict, and tonight. (9) At the latest - tomorrow morning. (10) Went Iak did not speak ambiguities out loud, for fear of immediate retribution. (11) The gossip was forced to be careful. (12) In the menacing light of the dueling rules, the word quickly turned into lead. (13) But what about Pushkin? (14) What an irreparable and senseless death ... (15) Yes, irreparable, but not meaningless. (16) Yes, "slave of honor", but honor! (17) Three years before the duel, Pushkin wrote to Count Repnin: "As a nobleman and father of a family, I must respect the honor and name that I will leave to my children." (18) That is all that remains for the children: honor and name. (19) Everything else they do not need, everything else is irrelevant. (20) Obviously, we still have a lot to go through and change our minds in order to return to understanding this truth. (According to D. Shevarov) "
\"(1) В городе Аугсбург на юге Германии: "(1) Mitek (Mieczyslaw) Pemper, the compiler of the famous Schindler's list, has died in the city of Augsburg in southern Germany at the age of 91, according to Agence France-Presse. (2) The persons involved in this list, 1200 Jews, were saved from death in Nazi concentration camps during during World War II. (3) Pemper died on Tuesday, June 7. (4) The city authorities of Augsburg announced his death on June 9. (5) Pemper was born into a Jewish family in Krakow in 1920. (6) After the occupation of Poland, he ended up in the Plaszów concentration camp built near the city, where he worked as a commandant's machinist. (7) While working in the camp, he met the German industrialist Oskar Schindler and, at his request, compiled a list of 1200 camp prisoners, who then went to work in his factories. ( 8) During the war years, Schindler saved these people from the Nazis through various tricks, including bribes. (9) Oskar Schindler died in Germany in 1974. (10) His activities during the war formed the basis of the book on which Stephen S. Pilberg in 1993 directed Schindler's List, which won seven Academy Awards. (11) Mitek Pemper worked as a consultant during the filming of the film. Pemper has lived in Augsburg since 1958. (12) In 2003 he received a medal of merit, and in 2007 he became an honorary citizen of the city. (13) Pemper will be buried in Augsburg's Jewish cemetery on Friday, June 10th. "
(1) При взрыве в больнице пакистанского: (1) An explosion in a hospital in the Pakistani city of Quetta killed 53 people. (2) According to The International News, 50 more people were injured. (3) An explosive detonated in the intensive care unit of a Quetta hospital during the farewell ceremony for the lawyer Bilal Anwar Kasi, who was killed by unknown persons several hours ago. (4) After the explosion, shooting began in the squad. (5) Now the hospital is cordoned off by border guards (the city, the capital of the province of Baluchistan, is located near the border with Afghanistan) and police officers. (6) Security measures have been strengthened in all health facilities in Quetta. (7) Among the dead are journalists, police officers and lawyers. (8) So far, no one has claimed responsibility for the attack. (9) Bilyal Anwar Kasi, president of the Balochistan Bar Association, was shot by two unknown assailants. (10) They ambushed his car in one of the city streets. (11) This is the second attack on lawyers in Quetta in recent months. (12) In June, the rector of the University of Balochistan College of Law, Amanullah Achakzai, was fatally injured by two motorcyclists. (13) It was not possible to find them, Achakzai later died in the hospital. (14) In protest against the police's indecisive actions, Balochistan lawyers boycotted and refused to participate in all legal proceedings in the province.
\"(1) В северо-восточном мексиканском шт: "(1) In the northeastern Mexican state of Tamaulipas, on Monday, July 4, military personnel entered into a firefight with militants. (2) According to Agence France-Presse, 13 attackers were killed as a result. (3) According to the agency, the first to fire (4) After the shootout ended, the military arrested one person and also confiscated several vehicles. (5) Whether there were any casualties among them is not specified. ( 6) It is also not known which group the militants belonged to. (7) Military personnel have been patrolling the state of Tamaulipas since June 25. (8) Then 1,800 soldiers were brought into the region, who will temporarily replace the local police. (9) During this period, the authorities plan to investigate corruption police connections with drug cartels, whose members are especially active in this state. (10) In particular, in Tamaulipas there are groups Zetas and Cartel Golfo. (11) One of the most high-profile episodes in which representatives of Zetas are suspected, with more than 200 immigrants have been murdered in the state. (12) In this case, the Mexican police have already arrested at least two leaders of the cartel, who, according to the investigation, were involved in the killings. (13) We are talking about Martin Estrada Luna and Abraham Barrios Caporal. (14) The state of Tamaulipas is also one of the transshipment points through which drugs are transported to the United States. (15) The confrontation between drug cartels and the Mexican authorities escalated after President Felipe Calderón came to power in 2006, who declared war on gangsters. "
(1) Сегодня я впервые осознала: расстава: (1) Today I realized for the first time: it will be sad to part. (2) Just sad, without any metaphors and unnecessary comparisons. (3) Eleventh grade is like an hourglass. (4) Above - school, below - you. (5) And now you take everything from the school that it gives, and you do not wait for the lesson to end, when you can close the class door behind you, rush at full speed along the corridor, run down the stairs, jump like a grasshopper: “ Home, home! " (6) I don't want to now! (7) It's fun to study in the eleventh grade. (8) We joke more often, we laugh louder, we quarrel less often. (9) We do not quarrel at all! (10) It's not time to study at the lessons, because I like to look at growing up classmates, sigh: "What ..." (11) Remember who was in love with whom, who liked whom. (12) Some are laughing, some offended, some eccentric, some will always help, and some will postpone. (13) In eleventh grade, it is easy to love everyone, and everyone seems to be the best. (14) Those who annoyed quietly become the best friend. (15) The one you thought was stupid, you now consider simply very simple. (16) And good. (17) And you don’t call anyone names, you even try to forget about school “klikuhi”: to everyone by name. (18) Respectful and like a friend. (19) Recently, in literature lessons, it seems to me that between us, classmates, windows are breaking, curtains are torn down, everything becomes clear ... (20) We break away from a work of art, from the stories of Bunin and Kuprin, spring with literary lines, jump and fly away beyond the horizons of the school curriculum, to where life begins ... (According to N. Mikhailova *)
(1) Тем временем донья Сирена, знатная,: (1) Meanwhile, dona Sirena, a noble but impoverished widow, is about to throw a ball. (2) The chief guest on it should be Punchinelle, the richest man in the city. (3) He has a daughter, a marriageable bride, whose hand is hunted by many young people, attracted primarily by the wealth of her father. (4) Counting on the help and protection of dona Sirena, each of these seekers of happiness promised her a considerable sum as soon as he marries the daughter of Polichinelle. (5) Therefore, the coming evening is very important for dona Sirena. (6) But her faithful servant Columbine brings sad news: no one else wants to trust her mistress in debt - neither the tailor, nor the cook, nor the musicians, which means that the ball will have to be canceled. (7) Dona Sirena is in despair, but then Crispin appears with the message that his master will take upon himself all the expenses for arranging the ball, if Dona Sirena helps him to gain the favor of Polichinel's daughter. (8) Leander comes after Crispin, whose courtesy makes the most favorable impression on Dona Sirena. (9) Gradually guests gather, excited by rumors about the arrival of an important person in the city. (10) And only Polichinelle leaves this news completely indifferent - he is concerned exclusively that his beloved daughter reads too many novels and refuses to marry some rich merchant. (11) The daughter's point of view is fully shared by her mother, Mrs. Punchinelle.
(1) Найденный в коробке у дороги в Сан-Х: (1) Found in a box off the road in San Jose, California, a kitten named Smurf, whose fur someone dyed purple, befriended a blind cat, Wanda. (2) On Thursday, January 7th, Mashable reports. (3) The animals met at the Nine Lives Foundation in Redwood City. (4) Between them, the newspaper writes, a truly close relationship has been established, they regularly lick each other. (5) The couple spend so much time together that purple tints have already appeared on Wanda's coat. (6) Smurf, now two months old, entered the shelter on December 28. (7) When he was found, in addition to the purple fur, he also had bite wounds and cuts and weighed less than a kilogram. (8) Dr. Monica Rudiger, quoted by ABC News, believes Smurf was mutilated for fun. (9) “I think the kitten was used as a chew toy for a dog,” she noted. (10) Rudiger added that the animal's front and hind legs are damaged. (11) The kitten underwent surgery, after which he began to recover. (12) The Foundation noted that Smurf will receive all the necessary medical care until he fully recovers. (13) It cannot be taken from the shelter until the purple paint has peeled off. (14) This, according to Rudiger, will take months.
\"(1) Деревню, где снимали вышедший неда: "(1) The village where the recently released Hunger Games movie was filmed was put up for sale for $ 1.4 million, reports the Associated Press. (2) The village is referred to in the film as District 12. (3) It is located in North Carolina and is actually called Henry River Mill Village. (4) It is 72 acres (about 0.3 square kilometers) of land with about 20 abandoned houses and a former store building, according to the Daily Mail. (5) The store located in the village, featured in the film as the Mellark family bakery. (6) Among the attractions in the village there is also the house where the main character, Katniss Everdeen, lived in the story, whose role was played by Jennifer Lawrence. (7) Henry River Mill Village fell into an abandoned state after 1977 the year when the mill, where most of the villagers worked, burned down. (8) The land owner, 83-year-old Wade Shepherd, complains about the annoying film fans: “Day and night they come here, take pictures, go out, walk. (9) They just torture me. ”(10) Shepherd also admitted that he had not read the book by Susan Collins, which was used to make the film. (11) Whether he watched a movie is not specified. (12) The village did become a place pilgrimages for Hunger Games fans. (13) For example, Time magazine reports that North Carolina travel portal VisitNC.com is already offering film fans a four-day tour of filming locations. (14) The Hunger Games movie was released in the United States on March 23, 2012 and has already raised nearly $ 300 million in the country. (15) Two sequels are planned for the future. "
\"(1) Подарок лидера ЛДПР Владимира Жири: "(1) The gift of the leader of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia Vladimir Zhirinovsky - an off-road vehicle" Tiger "- was handed over to the Luhansk militias. (2) This was reported by" Komsomolskaya Pravda in Ukraine ". (3) According to TSN, the military vehicle was transported across the border at night. (4) When "Tiger" broke through the outpost of Ukrainian border guards, all four wheels were punctured. (5) Press secretary of the Luhansk border detachment Alexander Trokhimets noted that the car crossed the border illegally. (6) "I just went to break through the border at the Izvarino checkpoint. (7) The duty squad tried to stop her, but the hull was armored. (8) In addition, despite the four punctured wheels, thanks to self-pumping, the car broke through and left the chase, "Trokhimets said. (9) In Luhansk, the self-proclaimed "Governor" of the Luhansk region Valery Bolotov. (10) "Like a real Russian, Russians should help Russians," Bolotov commented on Zhirinovsky's gesture. (11) Currently, a jeep with the party symbols of the Liberal Democrats is located near the seized regional administration building in Lugansk. (12) Zhirinovsky announced his intention to hand over the armored Tiger jeep to pro-Russian activists in Luhansk on 6 May. (13) He explained his decision by the fact that “this car is more needed there”. (14) Earlier in Luhansk, militiamen hijacked a T-34 tank under reconstruction, which was parked in the area of ​​the Ostraya Mogila memorial complex. (15) According to the agency, the combat vehicle was driven up to the barricades near the seized SBU building on Thursday morning, May 8. "
(1) Легендарный бразильский футболист Пе: (1) The legendary Brazilian footballer Pele was admitted to hospital, reports globoesporte.globo.com on Friday, May 8. (2) He was admitted to the Albert Einstein Clinic in São Paulo. (3) The patient was operated on for prostatic hyperplasia. (4) The operation was prompted by doctors' concerns about a possible urinary tract infection. (5) The athlete remains in the hospital, the date of his discharge is not disclosed. (6) This is not the first time that the king of football has entered the Albert Einstein clinic. (7) In 2012, he underwent hip surgery here, and a joint prosthesis was installed. (8) In November 2014, he visited the clinic twice: on November 13, a 74-year-old patient underwent emergency surgery to remove kidney stones, and on November 24, he was re-hospitalized. (9) Then the media reported that the condition of the former athlete deteriorated so much that he was placed in intensive care. (10) Pele himself denied the fact of being transferred to the intensive care unit. (11) To reassure fans, he recorded a video in which he plays the guitar in a hospital room surrounded by relatives. (12) Pele (real name Edson Arantis do Nascimento - approx. "Lenta.ru") is officially recognized as "The best footballer of the XX century." (13) This title was awarded to him by the FIFA Football Commission. (14) The International Olympic Committee named him the best athlete of the 20th century. (15) The Brazilian remains the record holder for the number of world championship titles - he is three times world champion in football.
(1) Доктор Меччио, пытаясь разорвать неж: (1) Doctor Mecchio, trying to break the tender union of Afra and Ortruda, plunges his girlfriend into a hypnotic sleep, passes off as the deceased and takes her away from the castle. (2) The news of Afra's death deprives the queen of her will to live. (3) She ascends to the volcano as the source of fiery death, casts a spell over it three times, but in vain. (4) Catastrophe is imminent. (5) The city is dying. (6) Queen Ortrud suffocates in clouds of bloody mist. (7) The tragic events in the kingdom of the United Islands make Trirodov think about many things. (8) He subscribes to the island newspapers, studies Spanish, reflects on the role of the individual in history, where the crowd destroys, man creates, society preserves. (9) Georgy Sergeevich comes to the idea of ​​becoming the king of the United Islands. (10) Elizabeth is surprised and does not believe in the success of the case, but Trirodov sends a letter to the first minister, Loreno, about nominating himself for the vacant seat of the king. (11) Loredo, in irritation, orders this message to be printed in the Government Index. (12) People who are busy with their own affairs do not pay attention to him, but the opposition is interested in a stranger.
(1)Стала она слепнуть. (2)Текст расплыва: (1) She became blind. (2) The text blurs before the eyes, the letters do not add one to one, they jump and jump like a cardiogram. (3) Sometimes you catch a good poet from your ears, you demand texts from him, but you cannot read them. (4) Or you still lie in bed, open your eyes in the morning and think: "This is all or it is still dark." (5) Everyone fled under this case. (6) While the magazine was being published, they swarmed around, but there was not a bell. (7) It was bad, without an ISBN, it was not sent to libraries, but in Bryansk its "uncensored" only knew and carried their chirping not to the Writers' Union of Russia, but to it. (8) Alexandra Fyodorovna herself ran after the poets, pulled out one of the cops, the second from the psychiatric hospital, the third from the binge. (9) She borrowed money, quarreled with her family, knocked out money for grants and scholarships. (10) And then everyone scattered and fell silent, like sparrows in frost. (11) The first issue was a flop, and the second too, if not for the schedule of buses and commuter trains in the app, which was announced by local television. (12) Mainly the supplement was sold, the magazine was not taken. (13) For ten years she published another thirty issues of the magazine and two hundred books by authors, sold out crumbs. (14) And then the magazine was banned in court, because it had not issued anything, and the name coincided with another officially registered publication. (15) Then Alexandra Feodorovna began to go blind, and everyone scattered, only Olenka remained, she would come in the evening, clean up, cook something. (16) He reads poems from the Internet. (17) Aleksandra Fedorovna will let go a little, her eyes will sparkle, a blush will appear on her cheeks, plans will go: “We will make a new magazine, we will find new money, we will convince sponsors”. (18) Only where there, the old people did not pay off their debts, they almost lost their apartment, and Bryansk is a small city, everyone knows about everyone. (19) Olenka will shake her head, she will also tell her local newspapers and will go to her home to call the poets so that they will come to visit her, but where are they? (20) They, her poets, former pets, have now scattered to warm, grain-rich lands, now everyone is in Moscow, everyone is in Petersburg, they read poetry, receive prizes, participate in tournaments. (According to V. Kharchenko)
\"(1) Бывший городской прокурор Клина Эд: "(1) The former city prosecutor of Klin, Eduard Kaplun, who was hiding from the investigation outside of Russia, on Thursday, August 9, appeared for interrogation at the RF IC. (2) This was reported on the agency's website. (3) The necessary investigative measures are being taken with him. (4) Kaplun is being held as a suspect in a “gambling case.” (5) In March 2011, a criminal case was opened against the former prosecutor under paragraphs a and d of part 4 of Article 290 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (taking a bribe). (6) Kaplun, who left Russia, was put on the international wanted list. (7) In addition to him, the most high-ranking person involved in the "gambling case" was hiding outside the country - the former first deputy prosecutor of the Moscow Region, Alexander Ignatenko. (8) In January 2012, he was arrested in Poland , who a few months later agreed to extradite Ignatenko to Russia. (9) Kaplun and Ignatenko were among the employees of the prosecutor's office who were dismissed because of the case on the patronage of underground casinos in the Moscow region. (10) They, like the prosecutors of the Moscow region cities of Odints Ovo, Noginsk, Serpukhov and others are suspected of patronizing the gambling business. (11) In addition, businessman Ivan Nazarov is a suspect in this case. (12) He was arrested by the first of the defendants - in February 2011, but in June of the same year he was released on recognizance not to leave. (13) At the moment, only Ignatenko and the former prosecutor of the city of Odintsov, Roman Nishchemenko, remain in custody. (14) According to media reports, the latter will soon be released. "
\"(1) В интернете появилось видеообращен: "(1) A video message appeared on the Internet on behalf of journalist Ankhar Kochneva, who disappeared in Syria in early October. (2) In particular, on November 7, the video was uploaded by one of the YouTube users from Ukraine. (3) The woman on the video speaks Arabic:" My name is Anhar. (4) I am in the city of Homs. (5) I ask the Ukrainian and Russian embassies, as well as the Syrian government, to comply with the kidnappers 'demands. "(6) The video is only 15 seconds long. (7) The video does not contain any information about the content of the kidnappers' demands, nor was it reported in the media (8) Who kidnapped the journalist is also unknown. (9) According to the assumption of Kochneva's acquaintances, she is being held by Syrian rebels, as she has repeatedly appeared on local television in defense of the government of Bashar al-Assad. (10) Kochneva has previously contacted her relatives - On October 14, the journalist's ex-husband received a message from Kochneva's mobile phone number, which said: (11) “I hope everything will be fine soon. Don't write. "(12) Let us remind you that Kochneva left her last entry on her blog on October 8, writing: (13)" Don't look for a couple of days. I'm leaving. ”(14) According to her acquaintances, the journalist was last seen in the city of Tartus, from where she was supposed to leave for Homs. (15) Kochneva is a citizen of Ukraine, but she cooperates with many Russian media, including the NTV and REN TV channels TV and Russia Today, RIA Novosti reminds. (16) She was also involved in escorting Russian journalists visiting Syria. "
(1) Американец разыграл перед женой собс: (1) The American played his own kidnapping in front of his wife in order to go to the bachelor party. (2) The incident took place in Edinburgh, Texas. (3) This was reported by the Metro newspaper on Wednesday 9 October. (4) Rogelio Andaverde persuaded his friends to break into his house, stage a kidnapping and take him with him to a party. (5) Friends, putting on masks on their faces, with weapons in their hands (it is not specified whether it was real or fake), grabbed Rogelio in front of his wife and pushed him into the luggage compartment of the van. (6) The wife called the police, but the "criminals" managed to escape before the arrival of the lawmen. (7) Returning home in the morning, Rogelio Andaverde explained to his wife that the abductors had released him. (8) However, the police did not believe the man's story and charged him with perjury. (9) “The situation is anecdotal, but this is all very serious,” the district sheriff told Guadalupe Trevino. (10) - We have people who gave false testimony to the police, and they are all in jail. (11) Although, of course, no one did it for the sake of a party with friends. " (12) How Rogelio Andaverde's wife reacted to the truth about his adventures is not specified. (13) This is not the first time when, not daring to tell the truth to their beloved, men go to stage their own abduction. (14) In May 2013, New Yorker Ramell Pettaway orchestrated his kidnapping after staying out of his girlfriend's eyes for two weeks. (15) He was charged with perjury.
\"(1) Канцлер Германии Ангела Меркель за: "(1) German Chancellor Angela Merkel launched a new online project on the future of Germany on February 1. (2) On a website called" Discussion about Germany ", the head of government is going to discuss with the population key issues about the country's development for the next ten years. (3 ) According to Merkel, citizens' proposals will become the subject of discussion at the federal level, writes Spiegel. (4) Three main topics are proposed for discussion: "How do we want to live?", "How do we want to live?" And "How do we want to learn? new? ". (5) All Internet users can leave their suggestions on the site. (6) Following the discussion, the authors of the ten best comments will be invited to a personal conversation with Merkel. (7) About 120 experts from various fields will evaluate the proposals. ( 8) In addition, during the project, Merkel will hold three meetings with a hundred citizens selected by experts from the project participants. (9) In the Chancellor's administration, this project is called a political experiment. (10) Meanwhile, the opposition is high dissatisfaction with such an initiative arose. (11) The head of the SPD faction, Thomas Oppermann, said in an interview with the Esslinger Zeitung that the party will make sure that this government project does not turn into a campaign for the CDU ahead of parliamentary elections, on which taxpayer money is spent. (12) Angela Merkel is the leader of the CDU, which, along with the CSU and the FDP, is part of the ruling coalition. (13) In 2013, elections to the Bundestag will be held in Germany. "

\"(1) Глава Microsoft Стив Балмер призна: "(1) Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer admitted that he has his own microblogging on Twitter. (2) This was reported in the tech blog TechCrunch. (1) Эля не унывает и решает заняться про: (1) Elya is not discouraged and decides to start producing ink. \"(1) Заместитель начальника одного из о: "(1) Deputy head of one of the departments of the Criminal Investigation Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia Dmitry Maksimov was found guilty of complicity in the murder of lawyer Sergei Biryukov. (1) Итальянский журналист Доменико Кирик: (1) Italian journalist Domenico Quirico, kidnapped in Syria in April, released. (2) On September 8, Reuters reports with reference to the Italian authorities. (3) The Belgian teacher and writer Pierre Piccinin, who was abducted with Chirico, was also released. (4) Both men, according to Agence France-Presse, have already flown to Rome. (5) Chiriko and Pichinin, who came to Syria together, were abducted in early April. (6) In June, Chiriko, according to BBC News, was able to contact his wife by phone and report that he was alive. (7) No group has yet claimed responsibility for the kidnapping. (8) For 62-year-old Domenico Chirico, a well-known Italian military journalist for the newspaper La Stampa, this was not the first kidnapping. (9) Last time he was abducted along with three other Italian journalists in Libya in August 2011. (10) Then the abducted persons spent about a day in an apartment in Tripoli, after which they were released. (11) Who exactly was behind the abduction was also not reported. (12) According to the Committee to Protect Journalists, Syria has recently become the most dangerous place for media workers in the world. (13) So, in 2012 alone, 39 correspondents were killed in the country and 21 journalists were kidnapped. (14) At the same time, both government forces and insurgents are behind the attacks. (15) The Syrian civil war has been ongoing since March 2011. (16) During this time, during the confrontation between supporters and opponents of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, more than 100 thousand people were killed in the country.
(1) На официальном сайте Крымского моста: (1) A blog appeared on the official website of the Crimean Bridge, in which the first post, published on Tuesday, March 1, talks about six cats and a fox living at a construction site. (12) All construction work is planned to be completed by the end of 2018. (13) Commissioning of the bridge is scheduled for June 2019.
(1)Я знала замечательную писательницу. (: (1) I knew a wonderful writer. (2) Her name was Tamara Grigorievna Gabbe. (3) She once said to me: - There are many trials in life, you cannot list them. (4) But here are three, they are common. (5) The first is the test of need. (6) Second - prosperity, glory. (7) And the third test is fear. (8) And not only by the fear that a person recognizes in war, but the fear that overtakes him in ordinary, peaceful life. (9) What kind of fear is this that does not threaten death or injury? (10) Is he not an invention? (11) No, not fiction: fear has many faces, sometimes it strikes the fearless. (12) "It's an amazing thing," wrote the Decembrist poet Ryleev, "we are not afraid to die on the battlefields, but we are afraid to say a word in favor of justice." (13) Many years have passed since these words were written, but there are persistent diseases of the soul. (14) A man went through the war as a hero: he went to reconnaissance, where every step threatened him with death, fought in the air and under water, did not run from danger, and fearlessly walked towards it. (15) And now the war is over, the man returned home, to his family, to his peaceful work, worked as well as he fought: passionately giving all his strength, not sparing his health. (16) But when, through a libel, his friend was dismissed from his job, a man whom he knew as himself, in whose innocence he was convinced, as in his own, he did not intervene ... (17) Courage is one thing. (18) It requires that a person be able to overcome the monkey in himself always: in battle, on the street, at a meeting. (19) After all, the word "courage" has no plural. (20) It is one in any conditions. (According to F.A.Vigdorova)

(1) Французскую копию Статуи Свободы пер: (1) The French copy of the Statue of Liberty was moved to the Musée d'Orsay in Paris. (2) The statue, which has stood in the Luxembourg Gardens for over a hundred years, moves to a new location for the first time. (3) AFP reports. (4) The Statue of Liberty was polished and a new torch was returned to replace the old one stolen in 2011. (5) According to the management of the museum, the restored sculpture will be better preserved in the museum. (6) A copy of the American Statue of Liberty was created in 1889 by the French sculptor Frederic Auguste Bartholdi. (7) He also made the original sculpture three years earlier, donated to the USA by France. (8) The bronze French statue about three meters high is a reduced copy of the original, which is 46 meters high. (9) Since the statue was erected in the Luxembourg Gardens, the Musée d'Orsay in Paris has fought for the right to include it in its collection. (10) However, the Senate did not agree to move the sculpture for many years. (11) It was only after the torch was stolen from the statue in September 2011 that the Senate allowed the Musée d'Orsay to include it in its collection. (12) There are four copies of the Statue of Liberty in Paris. (13) The second, larger copy is located on Swan Island near the Eiffel Tower. (14) The third copy is kept in the Museum of Arts and Crafts, and another is located on a barge on the right bank of the Seine.
(1) С Леонардом произошло кое-что странн: (1) Something strange happened to Leonard. (2) Jimmy Speckerman, the guy who teased and bullied Leonard at school, texted him and wants to meet. (3) Leonard is seriously considering whether to date him, but still decides to go and tell Jimmy everything that has accumulated over the years of humiliation and bullying. (4) The others go with Leonard to support him. (5) Meanwhile Amy, Bernadette and Penny reminisce about their high school days. (6) It turns out that Amy and Bernadette were bullied at school too, but Penny, on the contrary, was the one who bullied nerds and nerds. (7) Penny becomes ashamed of her behavior at school, she tries to call everyone she offended and apologize, but no one wants to listen to her. (8) Then Amy invites her to donate part of her clothes to charity and thereby atone for her guilt. (9) And Leonard gathers up the courage and expresses everything to his school abuser, handing him a whole list of hurtful things that he did with Leonard.
(1) Группа поддержки собирается в подвал: (1) The support group meets in the basement of the city's Episcopal Church with a cruciform foundation. (2) The cancer patients visiting her sit in the center of the cross — right in the heart of Jesus, as the group leader likes to say. (3) These gatherings oppress Hazel. (4) In the group, she communicates only with Isaac, who has a rare form of the disease - eye cancer. (5) He had already lost one eye, now the second is under threat. (6) Hazel continues to attend the group just for the sake of her parents. (7) There is only one thing worse than being a teenager with cancer: being a child with cancer. (8) At one of the meetings, Hazel meets seventeen-year-old Augustus Waters. (9) Several years ago, he was diagnosed with osteosarcoma and had his leg taken away, after which he was declared bipolar disorder (no signs of cancer). (10) Throughout the meeting, this handsome guy does not take his eyes off Hazel, and the girl thinks about her cheeks and ankles, which are fat from the constant use of steroids. (11) Gus admits to the group that he fears oblivion the most. (12) To this, Hazel replies that oblivion is for all humanity, so this fear must be ignored. (13) The girl read this idea in the book "The Tsar's Illness", the only novel of her favorite author - the Dutchman Peter van Hooten.

\"(1) Издательство Viking Press совместн: "(1) Viking Press and TradeMobile will release a mobile app dedicated to Anne Frank, The Daily Telegraph reports. (2) The program will include fragments from Anne's diary, voiced by British actress Helena Bonham Carter. (3) In addition, The app will include photographs and videos, documents from the Anne Frank Foundation archives, a plan of the building in Amsterdam where Anna and her family were hiding from the Nazis, and facsimile copies of the pages of the diary. (4) The application, which will be called Anne Frank App, will be released on October 18. ( 5) The interface of the program will be in English. (6) What platforms the Anne Frank App will be available on is not specified. Anne Frank was born in Germany in 1929. (7) When the persecution of Jews began in the country, Anna and her family moved to the Netherlands. ( 8) Since 1942, members of the Frank family and several other people hid from the Nazis in secret rooms in a house in Amsterdam, which was occupied by the company of Anna's father. (9) In 1944, a denunciation group was discovered by stapovites. (10) The inhabitants of the "Shelter" (as Anna called the house in her diary) were sent to concentration camps; only the girl's father, Otto Frank, managed to survive. (11) While in the "Shelter", Anna kept a diary in which she described her life and the lives of her loved ones. (12) After the arrest, the book with the notes was kept by a friend of the Frank family and subsequently passed on to Anna's father. (13) The diary was first published in 1947. (14) It has now been translated into over 60 languages. "
(1) На полках лаборатории Лоуренс-Беркли: (1) On the shelves of the Lawrence-Berkeley laboratory, test tubes with moon dust were found forgotten in 1970. (2) Three grams of lunar dust distributed over 20 test tubes were considered lost during the experiments. (3) The Washington Post details this story. (4) The tubes were found in a closet in April 2013. (5) They had the date "July 24, 1970" and next to them lay a scientific work devoted to the properties of lunar dust. (6) Earlier, in 1969, the dust was collected and delivered by the Apollo 11 crew, after which some of it was sent for analysis to the laboratory of the 1961 Nobel laureate in chemistry Malvin Calvin. (7) Out of 68 grams of dust, NASA returned 50, and 18, as it was assumed until recently, was irretrievably used up in the course of experiments to search for carbon compounds. (8) It is already difficult to reconstruct the events of 1970, however, researchers suggest that there was no malicious intent in the actions of Calvin and his colleagues. (9) The valuable material was not hidden from other scientific groups, but simply forgotten. (10) Karen Nelson, an employee of the archive, who discovered the test tubes, has already transferred them to NASA, and there the find was recognized as still interesting for science. (11) The dust found on the pantry shelves consists of lunar breccias: only 25 percent of the Apollo 11 samples. (12) Geologists call breccia a rock formed by cemented rock debris. (13) Most of the lunar dust that the astronauts have collected is finely ground basalt. (14) In the framework of the entire Apollo program, more than three centners of lunar rocks were delivered to Earth.
\"(1) Группировка наемных убийц в состав: "(1) A group of hired killers consisting of three perpetrators and two intermediaries were neutralized by law enforcement officers of the Moscow region. (7) Their names were not disclosed, since they came under the witness protection program. (8) The investigators came to the members of the group after the murder of an authoritative businessman Maksim Belyshev, nicknamed “Bely.” (9) He was shot dead on December 25, 2009 in the courtyard of his own house in the Balashikha district. (10) According to operational data, the deceased was a so-called "overseer" in the town of Zheleznodorozhny near Moscow and was engaged in racketeering with the help of local officials. (11) At the same time, the investigators who carried out the arrest of the group of hired killers believe that they were connected with the Zheleznodorozhny administration. (12) A certain Vladimir Kalashnikov is believed to have ordered the murder of Belyshev. (13) He is on the federal wanted list. (14) The police believe that the crime was committed on the basis of the division of spheres of influence. "

(1) Опять я лежу в постели… опять мне не: (1) Again I am lying in bed ... again I cannot sleep. (2) The same summer early morning engulfs me on all sides; and again a blackbird sings under my window - and the same wound burns in my heart. (3) But the song of the bird does not bring me relief - and I do not think about my wound. (4) I am plagued by other, innumerable, gaping wounds; from them dear, dear blood pours in crimson streams, it pours uselessly, senselessly, like rainwater from high roofs onto the dirt and abomination of the street. (5) Thousands of my brothers and sisters are now perishing there, in the distance, under the impregnable walls of fortresses; thousands of brothers thrown into the gaping mouth of death by inept leaders. (6) They perish without murmuring; they are destroyed without remorse; they do not regret themselves; those inept leaders do not regret them either. (7) There are neither the right, nor the guilty: then the thresher flutters the sheaves of ears, whether empty, with grain - time will tell. (8) What do my wounds mean? (9) What does my suffering mean? (10) I dare not even cry. (11) But the head burns and the soul freezes - and I, like a criminal, hide my head in hateful pillows. (12) Hot, heavy drops make their way, slide down my cheeks ... slide onto my lips ... What is it? (13) Tears ... or blood?
\"(1) Сын Джулиана Ассанжа, основателя с: "(1) The son of Julian Assange, founder of WikiLeaks, has demanded a fair and apolitical trial against his father. (2) He tweeted this under the pseudonym somnidea. (3) Programmer Daniel Assange hoped that his father's arrest in the UK - "not a step towards extradition to the United States." (4) According to Assange Jr., he has not seen his father for several years, but now he is forced to demand a fair trial when he was "finally" arrested. (5) Daniel was born when Juliana Assange was 18. (6) In 1991, his wife (her name was never mentioned in the press) left him with her son. (7) According to Julian Assange's mother, her son distanced himself from the family for their own safety. (8) ) Lawyers for the founder of WikiLeaks say his son received death threats. (9) Julian Assange was arrested in the UK on December 7. (10) Sweden is seeking his extradition on suspicions of rape and sexual harassment. (11) The court must decide on extradition within the next three weeks. (12) The Australian Foreign Ministry, as reported by the Associated Press, has promised to help Assange. (13) Assange himself denies all charges, claiming that his persecution is related to the publication of classified materials on WikiLeaks. (14) WikiLeaks published a quarter of a million letters from American diplomats, as well as materials on the armed conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan. (15) For this, he was repeatedly criticized by the American authorities. "
(1) Начальник метрополитена Алма-Аты Кау: (1) The head of the Alma-Ata metro, Kaut Musabekov, resigned of his own free will. (2) Tengrinews reports.
